title: Bad vibes / Tired
text:
Decided to stay at this hotel with my daughter for her 10 year birthday day trip. We have stayed here as a family over the years a few times the last decade.  However - all was different.  Rooms, carpet and bathrooms dated and tired.  But worst of all cleaning missed a huge plastic dildo from the last guest between nightstand and bed.  I discretely told concierge to go remove before my daughter finds it / would have expected an apology from
Management at a minimum.  But never heard back.  We are hotel owners ourselves - and was very disappointed in the overall vibe.  In the future we will go back to our other tried and true ritz at Central Park.  Would  still come for a meal at Villard.

title: The best place to stay in NYC, even for a 2-day getaway
text:
While I made my own reservation for Lotte New York Palace online, Marie of the Reservations Department had emailed me a few days prior to my arrival to learn more about my brief trip with my daughter to see some Broadway show in NYC.  (I thought it was a nice touch to greet us even before we boarded the plane.)  Marie acted like a goodwill ambassador on behalf of the hotel and wished us a great stay in advance of our arrival.

On arrival day, Nana helped us with our luggage as we exited the taxi, but since my daughter and I only had one carry-on each, we needed no further assistance and thanked him for his time.

As we entered the hotel through the revolving door, Captain, Mike Murray welcomed us back, remembering we had just been at the property 5 months prior.  Mike commented on how nice my daughter’s luggage looked.  (She was using luggage that was colorfully decorated in the “Yellow Submarine” characters made famous by the Beatles movie of the same name.)  Mike briefly chatted with my daughter about the Beatles and Paul McCartney, which instantly put a smile on my daughter’s face.

Anne-Marie, at the Front Desk welcomed us back and checked us into our room—a beautiful corner suite in the Towers.

My daughter and I ordered In-Room Dining several times and were greeted on the phone by Leslie, who was very polite and courteous while answering my questions.  Denzel and Maxine delivered our food and asked how our stay was going as they moved the food from the cart to the living room table, per my requests.  (The food was as it’s always been—fantastic.  Their chocolate crème brûlée is my personal favorite.)  

On our last day, Lincy check-out the room for us and thanked us for staying at the property.  The Doorman, George, noticed my daughter’s luggage and struck up a conversation with her about musical groups, concerts and his favorite performers, all while hailing a cab for us.  He was very energetic, very entertaining and very enthusiastic about his job—again, leaving a smile on my daughter’s face.

It was only a two-day trip, but the elegant hotel, it’s perfect location (across the street from St. Patrick’s Cathedral and walking distance to many NYC sights) along with world-class service of the hotel employees, made it a trip I will always remember…

title: Great stay
text: We had the most amazing 4 days in NY at the Lotte Palace.  All the staff is delightful.  The concierge did a fantastic job helping us navigate all our meals. We ate so many delicious foods because of their help.  We were a challenging group with lots of family.  Diego and Christian will make your NY stay all that you dreamed of.  I can't say enough wonderful things about them.  My family of 7 loved celebrating my big birthday in the big apple!

title: Amazing trip to NYC - Thanks to the Lotte NY Hotel Palace and Miles Gomez
text: Our trip to NYC was amazing and the Lotte New York Palace is definitely the best place to stay! I can’t say enough about the incredible service we received, especially from Miles Gomez! He went above and beyond, his attention to detail was impeccable and his kind/compassionate attitude was completely customer centric! He made our trip extra special and we can’t think Miles enough for showing the true heart of NYC! We can’t wait to come back!

title: Enjoy the Tower
text: It was my first time in NY and after much consideration I decided to book the Tower. I made the most of the American Express benefits. When I told the doorman that I was staying at the Tower, he opened the heavy door on the left as I entered the hotel. Thanks to the American Express desk, I was able to see the Hudson River from my room on the church side of the high floor. The layout of the bed and sofa was also good. I was surprised that I had to pay to move the refrigerator, but everything else was perfect. I will book again next time.

title: Well positioned hotel.
text: Great service and well positioned hotel. Big shout out to Josie who cleaned our room. Only downside, no tea/ coffee facilities in your room. Bring a travel kettle. Staff personable and friendly. Nothing too much trouble. Rooms are large with well stocked bathroom.

title: Lovely
text:
Lovely spot, great staff especially Marc-Marie and Mile.
They were so friendly and attentive, made great drinks...  the food was good, had the korean wings . There are many lovely options for drinks with alot od high end liqour choices.... def would come back again

title: 2nd Visit Here with My Family
text:
This was our 2nd time staying here. The first time we were in a Tower room, and this time we had a regular room. The Tower room was definitely nicer - more posh, larger and seemed updated. The regular room was fine but did have some signs of wear in the bathroom and the curtains seemed old. 

We love the location of the hotel, the size of the room, and the friendly staff. They are always ready to help - notably Clara at the front desk and Nana at the bellhop station. 

It would be really nice to have a mini fridge (that wasn't just for the mini bar) to keep drinks and leftover snacks.

title: Great hotel in great location
text: This is a great hotel in a great location. Very clean. Staff were very friendly. The scent as you walk into the lobby was amazing!!! The cafe/bakery was great for a take away breakfast, although we didn’t eat anything else at the hotel. Very close to Rockefeller. Various subway stations nearby.

title: Elegant Stay and Exceptional Service at Lotte: A Highlighted Tour with Samir
text:
My husband and I experienced the Lotte Hotel for the first time in 2024, adding it to our list of five-star accommodations. The hotel exudes a refined elegance, especially in its common areas. Our memorable journey began on the first night when we expressed our interest in exploring the hotel to the concierge. Promptly, they introduced us to Samir, the Maitre D, who graciously offered us an extensive tour, unveiling the hotel's splendid beauty. Despite the late hour, Samir's enthusiasm and kindness enriched our experience.

Highlighting our stay, on the third day, Samir extended an exclusive invitation to visit the presidential suite within The Towers, famously known for hosting dignitaries like Obama. This unexpected opportunity was thrilling and showcased the suite's exceptional allure, contrasting with the classic charm of our accommodation in the palace side of the hotel. Samir’s attentiveness and dedication to providing extraordinary guest experiences significantly enhanced our stay, making it unforgettable.

title: We selected this hotel with high expectations due to its reputation and because we had stayed here several years ago,
text: One would expect that for the reputation, location and name of this hotel, they would be updated in ambiance, interior design, and have the ability to connect various devices that are typically used. Additionally, it was very complicated to turn the lights on or off unless all the lights in the room were turned on or off at once. The positive aspect is that the room size is good and everything is impeccable, except for the air conditioning, which is old and noisy. It was listed as one of the recommended hotels for the New York Half Marathon, and yet the staff had no idea about it, and there was nothing available to eat or drink early in the morning on March 17th before the race.

title: 5 star service
text:
We have booked the superior two double bedroom  at the palace,which was certainly big for NY standards and very clean, a little dated though
The good experience started at the check in with Stacey being very helpful trying to accommodate my request for high floor room
Last, I cannot say enough about the help of one of the concierge staff Karl Naim
I have sent an email before we arrived at the  hotel, and he helped me with all the “ impossible” New York reservations!
Thank you Kal, you made our dream dinners come true!

title: The Lotte Team is AMAZING!
text: Beth S., Danielle G., and the team at the Lotte were phenomenal in planning and organizing our quarterly board meeting.  Beth and Danielle were exceptionally amazing and surpassed our every need; to the point that all board members highly praised the location, the meeting room space/setup and personal arrangements needed.  They went above and beyond and it was by far the best meeting arranged due their expertise and flexibility!   We will continue to reserve the Lotte for all our future needs in NYC!

title: Lotte New York Palace- a bucket list experience
text: From the moment I made the reservation, I was treated with great respect and care. Christian and the entire Concierge Team are, simply, the BEST. I highly recommend the Lotte New York Palace and am look forward to a return visit. Our family  thanks your family LNYP!!

title: Beautiful
text: The staff is helpful and Friendly .  Safe and nice area. Beautiful and clean hotel with big rooms and comfortable beds.  Beautiful views of the Saint Patrick's Cathedral.  Close to Radio city music hall and prime shopping!

title: Not what I expected...
text: Based on the website when my friends and I booked our stay, I was under the impression that we were staying at a hotel with a modern clean room design. When I got into the room, I did not get that design. In fact, the room was very outdated - it clearly needs to be renovated. A few issues I encountered: lights of the room were malfunctioning (I would turn off the bathroom light and it was connected to the rest of the room, the light to the hallway turns off the light in the bathroom if you turn it on), the "private" button on the lamp would turn off randomly, the pillows were incredibly flat, we never received robes in the closet, and the floor lamps would not work, I could not get them to turn off. I went to the restaurant for a late breakfast at approximately 11:57 AM. They told us they would let us come and sit down, and did inform us that the kitchen was closing in 2 minutes. Although I appreciate the dining staff allowing us to come in and eat when closing time was coming up, but in hindsight and on my experience however, I would've rather them to tell us they were closed and not sat us. I felt entirely too rushed - the waiter was extremely impatient with me and friend. The food (the turkey bacon to be exact) was cold, service workers were restocking and cleaning things as we were trying to eat, making loud noises. To the point where the experience was ruined. And lastly, the prices for the food was extremely high for such mediocre food and experience. The French toast was about $30 and it was only 2-3 small pieces and the turkey bacon was about $14 and like I said, it was ice cold. I normally would speak to the server and ask for assistance but based on his urgency to rush us out - I knew he wouldn't be receptive and helpful. The staff seemed more interested in getting us out of the restaurant than ensuring we had a good restaurant experience. Based on the price, the description, and the photos, I was expecting a high class hotel with luxury amenities and I feel like my experience here was average. In fact, I feel confident that I would've gotten a better experience at a more affordable hotel. I'm disappointed because based on the hotel's website, I was very excited to stay here but it did not meet my expectations or meet the standard based on the costs it took to stay here.

title: Fun Trip in NYC
text: This was an another amazing trip! So appreciate the concierge, Kal, for making our trip magical. Our room was amazing. Also appreciate the kindness of  Francesca, the director, for help secure reservations! Overall great trip in New York City!

title: Stay here and thank me later!
text:
Stay here…you’ll be glad you did! 

Is the location great? Absolutely. Are you in the middle of all the action, but still in a quiet enough spot to sleep? You bet. Rooms and bedding comfy? Oh yes! 
What makes this the absolute best place? It’s the people!!! 

If you need anything, they’ve got you. I’d especially like to thank Francesca, Director of Reservations and Kal Naim, concierge extraordinaire. They were both exceeding helpful in making this long weekend trip wonderful. Thank you everyone, and especially Francesca and Kal!!

title: Great weekend.
text: Beautiful hotel.  Our cleaning lady was so friendly!  We took the free historical tour they offered which was well presented and very interesting.   Definitely recommend this tour.  Location of the hotel worked really well as easy walking distance to tourist spots.   Great wifi.

title: Lotte Hotel - NYC
text:
This is an incredible Hotel, perfect location. rooms were overlooking St. Patricks Cathedral.
All personnel in the hotel make you feel at home and the concierge recommendations for food, attractions were so helpful!!

we will be back for sure!!!

title: A great stay
text:
This is a great place to stay as its location is superb, the rooms are spacious and the staff on the doors and in the lobby were cheerful and welcoming. 
The bathrooms and decor are in need of an update , but totally understand this as we are only coming out the far side of Covid.
We have to praise the cleanliness and superb standard of house keeping for our room  - a special shout out to Patricia Frasier.  The room was spotless, our beds,linens and pillows so comfortable. 
Thank you .

title: Worst visit during a huge conference. Don’t book this week
text:
We are currently staying at the hotel until Saturday. 
Firstly we stayed here pre Covid and had the most amazing experience, which is why we booked to come back while we were in New York.  We thought we had booked the Tower, which was our mistake not the hotels. We tried to upgrade to stay there but they were fully booked.  The WHOLE hotel is fully booked for a conference. 
Upon arriving we were greeted with a lobby full of people attending.  Trying to get through was an experience. We were taken to our room which let me say was tired, no view, and small. (We’ve just had 4 days at the Four Seasons in Philadelphia). So we paid to “upgrade”. Apart from a slightly larger room it’s not an upgrade. The decor is tired, the carpet fraying and the bed is probably one of the most uncomfortable I’ve ever slept in. Seriously killing my back. 

We’ve decided not to eat breakfast at the hotel as we have no idea how chaotic it will be.  Getting up to your room (30th floor) is bad enough as it stops at every floor with business people.  Yesterday we had to queue for 15 minutes just to use the lift.  Then we were packed in like sardines. 
I’m woken up at 6:30 two days in a row with people having room service or banging doors.  

I just want to warn anyone coming this week what to expect.  Sadly it’s not the wonderful holiday i imagined.  If I could check out and go elsewhere I would. As I know by Saturday my back is going to be in a bad state 

I’m not sure I’ll stay here again.  The hotel should Pre warn guests if there is such a big conference.  As those of us not attending the conference are not having the best time. It’s truly ruined my stay.

title: Great hotel for business travelers
text: I stayed at this hotel for a business meeting in New York City. Upon arrival, the location alone is hustling perfect, right off Park Avenue. As I stepped into the hotel i could feel the luxury beaming from the lobby .I was graciously greeted by the staff members and did not have to wait long at the front desk to get served. I encountered Anna-Marie at the front  desk who was absolutely amazing!! She was so kind and attentive even though she had just worked several double shifts in a row. She was incredibly professional and even though she must’ve been exhausted, she didn’t show it. My room wasn’t ready upon arrival however, Anna-Marie  took care of me in the right way and when I did get up to my room, I enchanted housekeeper Antoinette who was also amazing. She was worried that I was upset due to the wait time before I could get to my room,  but I assured her I was not and I thanked her for all that she did to service my room. Throughout my entire stay at the hotel, I had lovely encounters with many staff members. I will definitely be staying at the hotel again in the future in fact, I have shared with my work colleagues that the Lotte Hotel should now be our preferred hotel for our company moving forward..

title: Mother and daughters trip
text: The rooms at this hotel were definitely not 5 star. The lobby was beautiful and the cathedral is right out the door. The hotel is located very close to Rockefeller Center. The rooms were very run down, the bathroom had mold in the shower, the table in the room was dirty, the carpet was coming up, the cord for the curtains was pulled out of the wall and there was hole, our bedding had a tear in it and the beds were not overly comfortable. The front desk was very friendly and the bellman were friendly, there was one lady that was standing in the front lobby and she was not very friendly. The bakery did have good coffee and sandwiches. Definitely would not stay again.

title: Great Hotel’
text: My new favorite NY Hotel! Everything from the Doorman, location, room, Bar and daily Housekeeping was fantastic. It will be my choice again! The only negative, they need to Elim the 20% auto gratuity in the Bar, the Waiters noticeably knew and thus didn’t try to earn it.

title: Fantastic Manhattan Location & Attentive Staff
text:
We had a great stay at the Lotte New York Palace.  It's well-located for a Manhattan-centric trip, since it's walkable to several subway stations, as well as Rockefeller Center.  The property is lovely, and the rooms are a great size.  You can tell that the rooms are due for a technical upgrade; outlets seem old, and the room overall isn't set up for how we live our lives now (with multiple devices that need to charge).  But all of that is a small issue.

The staff was very professional for the entire stay.  A highlight was in one of the hotel bars, the Gold Room.  One evening, we received exceptional service and jotted down the staff names that evening--Jose, Nicola, and Ben.

title: Recommend
text: The Lotte New York Palace exceeded all expectations! The luxurious accommodations, impeccable service, and prime location made our stay unforgettable. From the breathtaking views of the city to the opulent decor, every detail was top-notch. The staff went above and beyond to ensure our comfort and satisfaction. We can't wait to return to this gem of a hotel!

title: Excellent Stay
text: The Lotte Palace was extremely nice. Rooms are large and in good shape, and the somewhat dated interiors actually work. The grounds of the hotel are amazing, especially for NYC. There are multiple bars and restaurants, and the Gold Room and the Mansion are both incredible. I would highly recommend.

title: A great hotel
text: I came here on a staycation with my friends and loved the hotel. The staff is so accommodating and the rooms were modern and very clean! The hotel is also close to a lot and it was easy to get places from there. I highly recommend staying here if you are either visiting or doing a staycation!

title: Wonderful Weekend in New York
text:
We traveled to New York for a long weekend full of delicious food and Broadway shows. This was our first stay at the Lotte Palace Hotel, and we could not have been happier with the entire experience from start to finish.  The front desk staff was welcoming and friendly, quickly accommodating our special room request.  The room was spacious, quiet, and very comfortable.  The housekeeping staff was attentive throughout our stay.  

The absolute highlight of the experience was The Gold Room  (the beautiful cocktail bar in the hotel.)  Nicola took wonderful care of us for two nights, making us feel right at home while swapping delightful stories on topics ranging from Italian history to wine.  At the end of our last night at the hotel, Jose took us on an amazing impromptu tour of the Villard Mansion.  It was a highlight of our entire trip. He delighted in enthusiastically sharing the historical details of the grounds, which we loved hearing.  It was an absolutely fascinating experience.  I was even able to sit at a piano played by Stevie Nicks, which (for this absolute fan) was a pinnacle experience.  The manager Ben has done a wonderful job of creating the perfect atmosphere at the Gold Room. The staff there is the reason we will certainly return to the Lotte New York Palace for our next visit to the city.

title: Amazing experience!
text:
Absolutely the best experience! From the moment my son and I arrived the hotel, we were greeted with the most impeccable service.
We were able to check in early- which was fantastic! The bellman that brought our luggage to the room, inspected all the lighting, tv, ac/heat ... making sure everything was properly working. The room itself was extremely spacious! One of the largest hotel rooms l've ever experienced!
After settling in, I needed to run pick up an item at the Nordstrom several blocks from the hotel.
When we stepped out front to call an Uber, the doorman arranged for us to use the hotel car service instead. What an unexpected and luxurious surprise!
The hotel itself is absolutely breathtaking. We enjoyed having cocktails each evening in Trouble's Trust and the Gold Room. Both were EXQUISITE!
The macaroons and other pastries from Pomme Palais (located in the lobby area) were also amazing.
On our day of departure, the hotel was extremely accommodating by storing our luggage until we were ready to leave for the airport. Our flight wasn't until 8pm so we were able to squeeze more adventures on our final day.
We are ready to book our next trip! This hotel definitely made the experience a magical one!

title: Bravo, Lotte
text: Kudos for Outstanding guest experience: hospitality, cleanliness, room comfort, towels! (this property - towels specifically - was, after all, Leona Helmsley's legacy, besides leaving her dog what amounted to a lotto winning. I think the dog might even be buried here), dining & bar - though their dinner options can't/don't compete, proximity to anything you can walk or ride a subway to - mind you, check with the concierge to make sure the MTA stop you need is up and running. Oh. couple more things. Go here and order Ess-a Bagels online to skip the block-long line. Pretty good bagels. And the concierge Ani gave me a great off-the-cuff tip about the best slice of greasy pizza slice served on a paper plate. Swoon. This was the best gd slice I've had. Ever. And I lived in NYC. I'm very grateful for all the reviews I get on this website: good, bad, and ugly ones.

title: Excellent and well located hotel
text:
Hotel very well located in midtown. Daily rate with all fees around $400

Large room with comfortable work desk.

The lobby decor (marbles and chandeliers) is very beautiful.

The hotel has a place to grab breakfast and take it away. Excellent value for money

I recommend

title: Not a 5-star experience
text:
I was very disappointed in my stay and my expectations were not met. This was not a five star hotel experience.  The hotel lobby was the only nice place I saw in this hotel. 

I stayed on the 51st floor of the Towers for four nights and did not have a single good nights rest.  After a full day of traveling, I wanted to sleep in the next morning but was awoken by a 6am alarm that they forgot to turn off when the last guest left. Also, for the first couple of nights I woke up at 230am and thought I heard some loud music. It was very brief but kept happening each night around the same time. I thought I could have been dreaming but finally on my last night, I set up my camera and right at 230am something in the room played a loud musical sound. I have no idea what it could have been since everything was turned off. 

My first morning, my black out blinds would not open so I couldn’t enjoy the sunshine and view. 

On my third day there, the water pump in the Towers broke and I could not shower in my room. Since I had just been at the spa, I decided to go back down there to shower. Later in the afternoon I needed to shower again but the water was still out. For the second time I had to gather some things and shower in another room. By the way, the non-Towers room that I showered in had a better view and looked cleaner/newer.   I didn’t have time to pack all of my things to do my after shower care and get dressed so I had to walk through the lobby in my robe and hair towel the both times I had to shower elsewhere.  They didn’t even offer to change me to another room but kept telling me to wait because the water would be back on, although they didn’t know when it would be back on.  

There is nothing VIP about staying in the Towers. Their website boasts “spacious marble baths” and “nightly turndown service.”  I had an old outdated walk-in shower with no bath and no one came by any of the nights to do a turndown service.  Save your money and stay on the less expensive side. I wish I had after seeing that those rooms were like.

I am giving this hotel two stars only because the bellmen were very nice and the manager calmly listened to my complaints when I checked out.

title: A wonderful anniversary experience!
text:
We originally had booked a room in the palace. Then when we came to check in Michael at the front desk offered us an upgrade to the Towers which was a one bedroom suite with a truly amazing view.

This was our second stay here and it did not disappoint! Room was clean and spacious. All staff from the doormen to concierge to housekeeping were polite and fantastic.

We would pick to stay here any time we are in New York. A truly wonderful experience that made our anniversary special.  

Location, ambience, size of rooms etc cant be beaten!

title: The Best Luxury Hotel in the Best Location
text: this hotel is my home away from home in New York City from the moment you arrive the staff greet you and makes you feel welcome at home from the bottom of the top. There’s no better place to stay in Manhattan for location, for service , for the excellence of everything that you expect from a trip to being in New York. the concierge, the check-in staff, the dhousekeeping staff every level of this hotel is every bit of New York, luxury that you would hope to expect. I cannot recommend this hotel high enough

title: A ruined family tradition
text: In February 2024, my wife and two adult children flew to NYC.  I rented two rooms at the Lotte NY Palace - one for the children in the main hotel, and one in the Towers for my wife and me.  Our family has been coming to NYC and staying at the Lotte for many years; it has been a family tradition.  We will no longer be staying at the Lotte.  There are three main complaints.  First, when my son checked into his room, the water from the room's plumbing was brown.  Second, the service at the Gold Room restaurant was horrible all three days.  But by far my biggest complaint was that on a busy President's weekend, the Tower's two elevators were BOTH out of service.  Everyone staying in the Towers had to use a single freight elevator.  As a result, on the first morning of our stay, it took me 35 minutes to get from the floor my room was on to the lobby, making me 30 minutes late for a breakfast meeting.  From that point on, I had to use the main elevators in the hotel (not the Towers elevators), take them to the 39th floor, and then take the stairs up to the 45th floor.  I am 70 years old with a very bad back.  I had just had one ablation performed a week  or so prior to arriving at the Lotte and I have a second ablation schedule the day after leaving NYC.  To pay the rates this hotel charges for the Tower and then be forced to walk steps to my room with a back in my condition is just completely unacceptable.

title: Thank you Marie and Michael - you made it great!
text: We had a great stay here - the building and various bars are stunning. The staff is the kind, warm, and very attentive. Marie was the most wonderful, bubbly bartender - I would go back to the Gold Room just to see her. And Michael from the front desk was a highlight with his friendliness and fantastic purple glasses. If I have the chance, I would stay here again and again.

title: Grandeur, graciousness, awe and affection.
text:
My family and I adore Lotte. Its jaw-dropping beauty and grandeur are matched by incredible warmth and attention. We consider it a home away from home. Last trip, we were met with a room upgrade as our little girl was greeted “Welcome, Princess.” She was swept into her latest fairytale stay by George K., who surprised her with a tiara while she was twirling at the center of the marble lobby. From then on, every day, she would ask at the desk when he would be in, and every time he saw her, he would say “I have something for you.” A Lotte teddy bear, a story about the mansion, or an umbrella on a misty day, most treasured was his time and interest. He knows and deeply cares about all, both Lotte and the guests drawn to it.

Our experience as a family was of the utmost importance, and that was made abundantly clear when working with Ruth in the front office, who deftly handled changes in our reservation due to an unexpected dignitary’s arrival. She gave us the same level of attention as she did every effort to accommodate incoming VIP requests. Her decision-making led to staying in a lofty Tower suite—after giving our little one the key card to approve—keeping the same view we originally had of St. Patrick’s, now 20 floors higher. Nothing compares to starting and ending the day gazing at one iconic building from the perch of another, and thanks to Ruth’s thoughtfulness.

Coming and going means cheery greetings along the way. Seeing a nod and a smile from Rebecca in the Towers lobby let us know that she was keenly aware and personally appreciative of our delight, as much as we were in awe of her talent in paying particular attention to everything, all at once. Our checkout with her was that of a gracious host, when saying goodbye means only looking forward to the next time. 

We cannot wait for upcoming stays, sweeping through the front entrance, strolling across the courtyard, taking portraits on the grand staircase, and happily settling in after our mad dashes through the city. That we all look forward to going “home” as much as going out and about is absolute joy.

title: 25th wedding anniversary
text:
First time in the USA; excellent location and a very professional welcome from the moment we got off  the taxi. Excellent spacious room at the Towers and very rapid service when requested. 
We got a "City View" room and we were mesmerised by the city at night. 
Perfect location to explore the usual NY sites, close to a subway station.

title: Elegant hotel
text: Elegant vintage hotel, excellent location. Check in was friendly and efficient. Cocktails at the bar were very tasty. Rooms are big and clean but outdated (it is the only reason I do not give a 5). If you have a chance to be there on a Saturday, they do a tour of the Villard house. Kevin is the guide, he is very knowledgeable and super interesting and the tour is free !

title: Great place to stay
text: The hotel was clean and inviting. They have a great gift shop with a variety of gifts in different price range that anyone can get something. George the Greek was amazing ! He was very informative and helpful. He is definitely the reason we will be coming back.

title: Cousin time in NYC!
text: A great location!  Check in was a bit chaotic as there were too few registration people to help you.  The Bellman service was terrific!  We especially liked the service Charles Yang provided!  The concierge service was very good!  The rooms were good except the toilets were too low to the floor!

title: Steps Away From NYC's Finest Attractions.
text:
The Lotte New York Palace is a grande dame Madison Avenue property dubbed both a landmark & a luxury retreat, and steps from flagship boutiques and fashionable 5th Avenue. My Palace Corner King suite with large windows features abundant natural light and spectacular views of St. Patrick's Cathedral. Wall to wall carpeting, bespoke furnishings, an upholstered headboard and marbleized bath provided spiffy accommodations; The hotel has a bevy of restaurants and lounges. The Villard serves a powerful breakfast with the likes of Avocado Toast, Lemon Mascarpone Pancakes and much more....while I opted for a filling American Breakfast. The Gold Room is a glamourous Gilded Age facility where classic cocktails and shared plates are the order of the day while Rarities is an upscale cocktail salon and the Palais is a coffee & house-baked pastries shop. An ila Only Spa, yoga studio and spacious gym complete the hotel's wellness focus as well as provides plentiful event space and sterling personalized service.
So, if you seek a luxe Midtown East hotel adorned in layers of embellishment and detail...............then try the...........Lotte New York Palace ........steps away from NYC's finest attractions.

title: Great stay at a beautiful hotel
text: A top hotel in a great location. Our room on the 30th floor was quiet and peaceful and provided a respite from our busy days and nights in the city. Shared areas were beautiful and staff were uniformly helpful. We especially appreciated the front desk staff and the door people. Highly recommended!

title: Disappointing
text: Honestly don't know how this hotel is considered 5 star.  Booked a 2 bed cathedral room in the palace, on arrival was asked if I wanted to pay for an upgrade for a room in the towers, I said does it have a view of the cathedral and was told it has a view of everything.  When we got to room it was actually a view of the other side of the hotel.  It was also on a very high floor.  My husband suffers terrible vertigo and was shaking.   I went down to where we checked in and said we can't stay in that room it's too high and my husband is suffering with bad vertigo.   I was then given the room I originally booked. The room has beautiful views but that was it.  There were wet patches on floor don't know if it had been cleaned just prior, the blockout blind was broken, the beds were terrible, no coffee or tea making facilities.   The bathroom is in desperate need of a makeover.  We were woken by the alarm in the room next door, could hear everything in the next room.   Just felt unclean, was suppose to stay two nights but checked out that morning, obviously the view is what you pay for.  I don't know whether we got the worst room in the hotel, as I have seen so many good reviews.

title: Friendly staff but hotel is just average.
text:
The Palace is in a good location-just a short walk to Rockefeller Plaza. There is a Starbuck’s across the street and a Walgreens nearby (very limited snack selection). 
Check in was easy and the children were given Lotte teddy bears as we waited. Caroline, at the front desk was very knowledgeable and friendly. The housekeeper on our floor, Fazila, was very nice and did a great job of getting the room ready while we were out. 

There is very little seating in the lobby and there is access for anyone to use the elevators. The elevators are very small and there is often a wait for them. If you are on a high floor then you might have to stop at every floor going down and if you are on a lower floor, the elevators will be full! 

The rooms were nothing special. There are no refrigerators or coffee makers. I know you can request a refrigerator and it’s a good sized one. I assume you could request a coffee maker as well. Ice has to be delivered to your room.  

I would not stay here again but it is no reflection on the staff- they were very accommodating and friendly.

title: Outstanding
text: The Lotte was the perfect location for our visit, with most attractions within walking distance.  Staff was the friendliest we have ever encountered.  The hotel is lovely and quite comfortable with spacious rooms.

title: Excellent staff
text: I highly recommend this hotel. Their customer service is excellent. I was completely impressed with their concierge Ani. She provided us with great dinner recommendations and had an exceedingly kind attitude.

title: Thank you Kal!
text: Our concierge Kal came in clutch and helped us get in to Stardust diner without waiting for hours in the freezing weather. Definitely highlight of our trip for our theater loving kids!!!   He went above and beyond and texted us updates as we confirmed the plans. So appreciated!!!

title: Fond memories but not the same any more
text:
We stayed here in 2005 for our honeymoon, having stayed at the Regent Beverley Wiltshire for our wedding, both hotels were exceptional.

Sadly The Palace is no longer what it used to be. Bellmen and concierge all excellent but the hotel is looking a bit shabby, with wall sockets loose and some staff not giving 5 star service. 

On arrival one queen bed was too soft so we asked for it to be replaced. They replaced the wrong one, so now we had too soft mattresses! Eventually resolved but beds are less comfortable than lesser hotel chains like Marriott and Westin.

We were woken by the room alarm clock, still set by the previous guest. Even 4 star hotels take care of details like this.

On the final morning we were woken up by housekeeping at 7am as they had been told there was laundry to pick up! We didn’t call and the attendant was unapologetic and just stated he was given the room number and it was somehow my mistake!

On checkout at midday there were 2 receptionists and a line of 6 guests. 15 minute wait, unacceptable for a prestige hotel.

Sorry would love to have been glowing about this place but a big disappointment.

title: Midt i smørøyet
text:
Hotellet ligger midt på Manhattan og et perfekt utgangspunkt for alle severdigheter i New York. 
Som nordmenn flest, liker vi å gå og det kan du absolutt gjøre herfra. Du lærer fort at det STORE avstander i NY og at Metroen er et super alternativ. Kort vei til stasjonen og det tar 10 min til Wall Street. 
Du kan fint gå til Central Park og til Time Square fra hotellet.
Lotte er et stort hotell med mange gjester. Men de er ganske gode i resepsjonen og det var lite å utsette på velkomsten😊
Frokost voucher ble best brukt i kaffebaren og ikke i restauranten. Det var veldig dyrt med frokost i The Goldroom, og absolutt ikke verd pengene!
Rommene var store og lyse og fine med god utsikt over NY.

title: O star hotel Service
text:
My family and Stayed @ Lotte in the towers from 12/18-12/20.
This is a 3 star Hotel with a 5 star location with O star Customer service! We have stayed in various Hotels throughout NYC during the Christmas season for the last 18 years. We arrived around 3pm and waited at the check in desk for over 30 mins and were told room would not be ready for at least another hour. We dropped our bags then attempted to find a restroom in the lobby First 2 we went to were not open and the 3rd ones we found on the 4th floor were filthy. Finally around 6:30 I received a call from Anna Marie stating the room was finally ready and she would credit me 300 dollars for the inconvenience, This was never done. Tuesday morning called to get a reservation for Breakfast was supposed to be included in our stay because we booked with Amex and was told not taking any more reservations or walk ins for the day because they were so busy. Tuesday night starting around 11:30 we called the front desk because their were people parting in the hallway. After 3 calls nothing was ever done this went on till after 2am. Wednesday 4:30 am wake up to Head to JFK requested my car from Valet. Came down and no car asked the door man and he laughed stating they do not get in till 6am and I need to read the signs. We could not wait until 6am since we would have missed our fight to London. Now we were forced to Uber to JFK and leave our car for 10 day's @ $115 per day. The Uber to JFK was $160 there and $270 and 2-1/2 hours back into the city to Pick up my car after and 8 hour flight back from Paris. When I talked to manager on duty he offered me no help. Do yourself a favor avoid this place there are much better hotels in NYC were you can get a good nights sleep, your car, the credit you were told you were going to get and Breakfast.

title: Great Experience with my family
text:
Great acomodations, the room and beds are very comfortable and have a very good service. 
Remember to book your breakfast table, otherwise you will not be able to have it on their restaurant.
The location of the hotel is perfect and near all the best stores in Manhattan.

title: Superior nothing!
text:
Where to start, arrived to check in and no staff with a line stretching into the lobby after around ten minutes staff finally arrived, after getting to the front of the line I was charged again for my stay however that was rectified quickly and cancelled off.

After finally getting to our room and this where the disappointment really starts, we booked a superior room and I can say with all honesty there is nothing superior about the room it is dated, old and worn, wallpaper peeling, dirty lampshades, broken picture frames, dirty headboard, black dust on the sheets, two bottles of water just plonked on the side like a motel with no coffee or tea facilities, to say the Lotte palace portrays itself as a 5* hotel there is nothing I have seen in the room to justify this.

The only upside is the lobby and exterior are decorated for Christmas beautifully such a shame they didn’t pay such attention to the rooms.

To put it into context how bad the room was we checked out after the first night and moved hotels and this was our 7th time in NYC and this was the worst room we have ever stayed in.

I did post this before but edited as the GM reached out via Trip advisor asking to get in touch I have emailed my concerns to them on the 29/12/23 and not had any response don't be fooled into thinking they where actually interested but more of putting on a show!

title: Beautiful on the surface, underlying experience not as nice
text: The Lotte was the nicest hotel our family has stayed at from an aesthetic standpoint.   Unfortunately our stay was not as memorable.   The infrastructure for so many rooms is inadequate.  We were unable to get a drink due to unreasonable wait time until the 2nd bar opened only Thurs - Sat.   We were able to get a breakfast reservation, only to be told after being seated for 50 minutes that the next reservation was waiting and would we mind leaving .. $250 bill for party of 4 doesn't even get you an hour at a table.

title: Very nice
text: Lovely hotel well situated on 50th street. Stayed here on a 4 day new year package with BA. The rooms are large and very clean and the service excellent. We didn’t eat here at all - too expensive - but used local restaurants and bars and there are plenty within a few minutes walk

title: The Lotte Palace - DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!
text:
We planned on a holiday stay at the Lotte as a family and broke a room with queen beds for us and our 2 kids. We arrived at 11:30 PM and were informed that the room was given away. We were instead given a room with 1 king and a roll away. I asked nicely to give us an accommodation that could fit our family(.my 13 yr old is 5'7 and my 15 yr old is 5'9) 
The manage came out and said there was nothing he could do. I was upset so he offered two rooms separating us from our kids. The hotel never offered an upgrade. The did not offer anything not even an apology. they were clearly understaffed and overwhelmed, the manager and the front desk was inept

title: Annual Trip
text: We stay here every year during the holidays - The staff is welcoming and attentive the decor is spot on a wonderful Christmas display throughout the hotel.  Perfectly located behind St. Patrick’s Cathedral - near everything yet off the main drag.  Couldn’t ask for more -

title: Not a 5 star experience
text:
In my opinion, this hotel does not provide 5 star level service. Experience provided is 4 stars at their best moments. Checkin (even in the Tower portion) is a chaotic experience with long lines. My room was not ready at 3pm check in. Only after a confrontation with management were they able to find another alternative room. I give Jimm (front desk clerk) props for trying to speed the process along despite management lackluster interest. Once a fellow clerk found the room, the manager Ruth was able to quickly make the swap. I do appreciate it but at a five star hotel upsetting guest at the first encounter does not set the proper tone. 

I could go on and on about the rest of my visit but I will leave the reader with one question. Have you visited any other five star hotel that does not have a in room refrigerator with drinks, minibar, snacks, coffee/tea maker? 

Lotte, at this advertised level and price point you need to do better.

title: This is not a five star hotel!!!!
text: Let’s begin with my room not being ready until 8pm at night. Next our room looked like it had not been updated since the 1980s. While waiting for our room, no one could tell us where a public bathroom could be found and the ones we found on our own were all out of service. When we attempted to go breakfast we were very rudely told there was no space available for the rest of the day. And the best part was the people down the hall partying until 2am. We have been going to New York for the past 15 years and this is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at.

title: Disappointing
text:
Firstly this hotel is perfect for ONLY location. However there are many drawbacks… and it is not a 5 star hotel.
1. Surely you would know this is the busiest time of the year.  We stayed Dec 22-26. The check in wait time is terribly long and inconvenient.
2. The courtyard is picturesque but the swarms of ppl taking pictures and sitting on the steps and taking pictures is simply ridiculous. There almost seems to be no security and a free for all. There is no card required for the elevators and anyone can walk off the road and come up to any floor. This should be urgently attended to. Nothing classy or welcoming about this and truly disappointing. For a family
Hotel, there are too many people aimlessly looming in the foyer.
3. Don’t even bother to go to the gold room or restaurants to eat. It is a zoo and the service is horrible. Pomme palais is ordinary but convenient. 
4. The concierge told my husband, it would take 10mins on Christmas Eve in a cab to go to le bernadin. No booking required. Boy was he wrong. After nearly 20 mins going no where in standstill traffic and honking horns, the roads were closed and we had to walk it. Needless to say I was very annoyed. Unacceptable concierge service.
5. Steps from the st Patrick’s cathedral and we enjoyed the midnight mass.
6. The rooms are tired and we have plumbing issues with our bathroom.

title: The Lotte's Palace & Norma exceeded expectations!
text: I took my family to visit New York City at the most perfect time of the year, Christmas! It was a crazy time of year, but the hotel stay at the Lotte New York Palace exceeded all expectations. The service provided by all the staff was stellar, especially Norma who works the front desk. Despite the craziness of the season, and impatient hotel guest, Norma was always available and helpful to assist us with any request. Always very welcoming and always making sure our stay was perfect!  I would give our stay at the Lotte Palace a 5 stary rating!

title: Not worth the visit.
text:
Stayed in the tower suite. Team members are unfriendly and clearly unwilling to assist with any requests - upon arrival, no assistance with bags were offered, check in was quick cold and unwilling to help or check if we could get a roll away bed or upgrade the suite. We called three times over the course of almost three hours requesting a set of sheets for the pull out couch where my daughter was trying to sleep.  

This is the second stop of our vacation and our previous hotel which was amazing and accommodating.  It's unfortunate this is the ending to our vacation.

title: Nice place but no place for a pre dinner drink
text:
We have been coming to this hotel for decades - since the days Le Cirque was the restaurant .

The location is excellent and it is priced reasonably. 

The rooms are generally nice and larger than many NY hotels .

One negative trend we have noticed is the Golf Room bar. This has gotten quite popular recently . Beware as a hotel guest - even in a Towers suite - you’ll receive no priority at all - and if you want a hotel where you can enjoy a drink before going out - this is not the hotel for you. Also the staff has gotten a bit full of themselves as of late at the Gold bar. 

Just a shame it’s a nice property but they don’t staff the lounge bar or downstairs bar so you have limited options.

title: Don’t bother!
text:
We booked this hotel for a 2 nights stay as it’s a place our girls have always wanted to stay close to Christmas. 
We arrived at 1.30pm to check in. The process was relatively quick and we were pleased to hear our superior double rooms had been upgraded. The lady at the desk told us how lucky we were and that it wasn’t down to British Airways it was the hotel and we should be very grateful. I left my phone number and was told as soon the rooms were ready we’d be contact. 

At 4pm I returned to the lobby ( no call received) to queue again for 30 mins. 
Room keys in hand we excitedly worked our way through the packed lobby to the lifts, queued again for 10 mins. 

On entering the room there was a closet on the left with safe box and ample hanging space, robes and slippers. The bathroom was opposite. This was very dated and only a bath with shower overhead. Really disappointing and similar to a Hampton Inn (which we don’t mind staying in for $150 per night). 
The room was large but tired and tatty. 
With a desk, small round table and a couple of chairs. 
This to note: there was no fridge or mini bar but more importantly for us no coffee or tea making facilities. For a 5 star hotel this is poor! We were exhausted after leaving the UK at 5am and had no energy to complain. 
This morning we woke at 4am to no coffee! Called guest services and were informed there is no where to get a coffee/refreshments until 6.30am. No room service. Only option to find somewhere on the street. 

This hotel has been great disappointment. If you plan on coming here for the Christmas period don’t bother, pop in to check out the lobby and the beautiful decorations however don’t bother trying to get a seat in the bar as it’s packed. Not an enjoyable experience at all. For the price we paid we would have been better off at the Langham to enjoy their pure luxury and wonderful care.

title: Croweded
text:
We have had 3 nights at the Hotel, and must admit that even the location is certainly great, however for a so called 5 star hotel this place was crowded with non-guests  just looking around, bringibg their own food and drinks a spend time at the hotel lobby. We have managrd only 2 times to get a seat at the Lobby. Same applied for the bars at the Hotel where it was extremly difficult to get a seat. 
Howeveg the staf was nice and helpfull.
Our room on 25 tj floor was ok, however only 1 chair! We called for one more just to get a rest in the room…. No response!
So , as a final conclusion: 
Price / performance relatiön was not at all ok.

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: We had such a wonderful experience here in The Towers at The Palace! Great location, great views, great room! Everyone was so accommodating, kind and helpful and our trip was made especially wonderful by Rebecca Villasenor - Rebecca, thank you for everything! You are a gem! -Katie and Alex

title: Gorgeous Decor. Average at everything else.
text: Gorgeous decor, nice bellman, and most average customer service ever. I understand that December is a busy month. The check in time was 3pm. The line wrapped through the lobby and patrons waited several hours to stand and talk with a front desk person who blankly stared at us and told us "it's like this until New Year's" - - I think we got a room around 4 and our bags maybe 4:45. We tried to get a drink one night and were turned away and told that bar was full. Sorry. No room. It just seemed that the employees were overwhelmed and did not care. It's not the luxury service you would expect given that their room rates match Ritz and Four Seasons.

title: Beautiful Hotel In Great Location
text:
We stayed here from Monday until Friday.  Check in was very fast and easy. The hotel is gorgeous and beautifully decorated for Christmas.  The famous tree outside attracts many tourists for beautiful photos. 

We stayed in a lovely room on the 25th floor that overlooked the cathedral.  It was a very nice size and the bed was super comfortable.  We were disappointed there was no free wi-fi. 

The elevators ran perfectly and were not hard to get BUT I think that was due to the fact we were there during the week.  As we checked out the check-in line was very long. Concierge was very helpful responding to my questions etc. 

Overall a great stay.  Complimentary Wifi and coffee machine in room would have made it perfect !

title: Gran hotel clásico de New York, y muy bien decorado para las fiestas de navidad
text:
Todo perfecto, hotel fantástico , es la tercera vez que lo hospedamos .
Resaltar el servicio de conserjería , y en especial a  Cristian Ribeiro,el qual nos ayudó en todas las dudas y nos recomendó , lo mejor de Ney York.gran hotel

title: So disappointed
text: The inside of the facility is lovely. Inside the room were the problems. My sheets were ripped, the TV is old not smart, no decent channels, below what we expected. On our second day housekeeper never even showed up! I thought we would experience a much higher level of service. Disappointed

title: Beautiful hotel .... with some negative niggles
text:
This is a difficult hotel to review, because whilst it has many positives, there are some basic amenities missing that I think should be in every 5 star property.
PROS:  Location on Madison and 50th - right in the heart of midtown Manhattan. Large rooms, very comfortable beds and pillows.  
Good temperature controls. 
Excellent soundproofing - we slept great. 
The staff are wonderful and so helpful and friendly. A credit to the hotel.  I know he gets mentioned a lot but Ray the doorman is the best!  I must also mention Christian the concierge, who arranged a dinner for us Saturday night at a local italian.  He was so helpful and professional and wanted feedback the next day, which we happily gave him.  
We loved the Pomme Palais coffee shop inside the lobby lounge.  Drinks were very reasonably priced, cakes and sandwiches pricey but a lovely treat. Yes there is a Starbucks opposite the hotel but I can go there any time at home. 
The Christmas tree in the courtyard and the decorations in the lobby are SPECTACULAR! A tourist attraction all by themselves.  My Mum and sister adored the hotel and we felt lucky to be staying at the Lotte.  HOWEVER. 
CONS:  the room had no fridge/mini-bar, no kettle or coffee facilities and NO SAFE. We spoke to reception, and housekeeping sent up a huge fridge, kettle with cups etc which we really appreciated, but told us some safes were being refurbished/replaced and we were welcome to open a security deposit box in their office.  We took them up on this for our valuables, money etc, but it was so annoying to have to go to the front desk, and meet a member of staff in the office and complete paperwork everytime we needed to get something out.   On the last day at check-out, I had to wait a while for a member of staff to close the box.  Just so unnecessary and disappointing especially at this price point. 
Bathroom was dated, small and dark - not a good shower and couldn't adjust the water spray.  Curtain rail was hanging off the wall.  
We had no maid service on the first day at all, and had to call Housekeeping to replenish some items.  

Overall, we had a really lovely and memorable stay, the positives did outweigh the negative niggles but I don't think I would stay here again.  However my Mum and sister absolutely would!

title: The perfect midtown Manhattan location!
text:
I can now see why The Lotte New York Palace made the Conde Nast top list for hotels in New York City. It is simply superb.

Location:
The hotel is on Madison Avenue between 50th and 51st streets. The 6 line subway entrance is 2 blocks east and the E and F lines are two blocks away north at the 53st street station. Using the subway or walking, any part of Manhattan was reachable; even going to Brooklyn Heights and DUMBO in Brooklyn was fairly direct.

Room:
We had a room with two double beds even though it was just two of us. We did inquire for a King room instead but I had booked a double room originally as there were no king room options at the time of booking. One huge plus was getting the Cathedral view, in other words, overlooking St. Patrick’s Cathedral next door. We were on the 33rd floor, so it was also possible to see how crowded Rockefeller Center and Fifth avenue were from the room.

Closet and Storage space:
The room had a very generously sized lighted closet which also had a large in-room safe, umbrella, robes, and slippers. There were also an ample number of dressers to store clothes and other belongings. Overall, there was space to walk around. Some rooms in the city are so cramped that even walking in the room can be challenging but not this place.

Bathroom:
The bathroom had both a shower and bathtub. The toilet was the quietest I have ever heard when flushed. There was also a hairdryer and lighted makeup mirror to get ready for a new day.

Climate control:
To adjust the temperature of the room, there was a center console on the night stand beside the bed. The console had both a thermostat to set the temperature in Fahrenheit as well as 3 fan settings, including turning off the fan entirely. For a cold December night in New York, the heating worked without any problems.

Exterior noise:
The hotel was well insulated against noise. There was hardly any noise from the hallway or the adjoining room. The only thing heard was whenever the blinds for the windows were being raised or lowered.

Wi-Fi and TV
Wi-fi was complementary (you get the password once you check in) and there were many channels available on the TV. There are also HDMI ports on the TV to watch your own content on your device as long as you bring an HDMI cable with you.

Elevators:
Ask for a high floor when checking in. There were times when the elevator got full going down that anyone in the middle or lower floors could not get on and would have to wait for the next one. The wait for an elevator was not too long but having to wait for one with free space repeatedly can be challenge and requires patience.

Check in and check out
Luckily, check in was only a 10 minute wait before our turn. However, I did notice the lobby heavily crowded during my stay for people waiting to check in. Check out can be done by texting the hotel at the designated phone number when it comes time to leave. Should you need to go directly to the airport after checking out, there is a taxi stand right outside the 50st entrance. Inform the hotel doorman you need a taxi, who will then take you to the first available taxi.

Lobby:
The lobby was vast and beautiful with a historic touch, featuring entrances on 50th and 51st streets, as well as Madison Avenue. The 51st entrance also allowed access to the on site coffee shop as well as the gift shop. 

Concierge:
Mr. Christian Ribeiro provided us with exemplary service, signing us up for a complementary tour of the hotel and the historic Villard mansion that is on site by Kevin Draper, who was very knowledgeable about New York’s history.

December extras:
The Madison Avenue courtyard was filled with lovely Christmas decorations featuring a wonderful tree, which some people admit was more attractive than the larger one in Rockefeller Center. The courtyard also featured a bar of hot drinks to celebrate the season.

The Radio City Rockettes also visited the hotel, who were more than happy to pose for photos with any interested guests.

Overall:
The Lotte New York Palace is a very large hotel. It isn’t perfect but it gets a lot of things right versus some of the criticisms other reviewers have left. This is my eighth visit to the city in 15 years. This hotel is tied for the number 1 spot overall in my book and is the champ for Midtown (the other hotel that tied with it is downtown). Lotte is a South Korean company; if you don’t already know, Koreans take hospitality of their guests seriously which is definitely evident here at the New York Palace.

title: Disappointed
text:
I was here years ago and I had a good opinion.
Now i’m leaving really disappointed: incredibly crowded, long queues for the elevators (waiting up to 10 minutes to descend), long queues at reception and people sitting everywhere in the lobby with a lot of luggages at the entrance like an airport deposit.
The whole hotel urgently need a renovation. Old style bathroom, modest furniture for a five star, no frigo, glasses, kettle and Nespresso in the room. 30 minutes waiting time for room service.
Only positive points, reason for the second stars, the strategic position and the size of the room with a nice view.
Anyway I will never come back.

title: Great Time at the Lotte
text:
Just arrived home after a seven day stay at Lotte New York Palace.

It’s amazing, how much joy I get from the greeting I receive at the Lotte. 
It begins when I step out of the car and continues in every contact I have with the staff. I feel like it is my home away from home.

Louis, both Georges, Edmark and Fran are always ready to say welcome back and it is so charming that they really know who I am.

My travel group is always impressed with the style and beauty of the decor for the holiday season as well as the efficiency of the check in process. Michael Frick and Alexandra are the best. 

The speed and quality of response by all staff is impressive as well. 
Lily Cohen and Anita Yang are a pleasure to work with in setting up rooms etc. for the needs of my group. 

Diego Chinigo and Ani are always a great source of restaurants, shows and what to do in New York. Joan was helpful when I had trouble with theater tickets by printing them and delivering to my room quickly.

Great place to stay in New York!

title: A pre -Christmas holiday with my daughter
text: The Lotte is a unique hotel and quite glorious during the holidays. The Christmas decorations are unparalleled... highlighting it's exquisite architecture. One is surrounded by beauty and elegance everywhere. To have breakfast in the dining room , or dinner in the gold room. Or to spend an hour in the Salon ,Rarities. There one is transported in time, sitting on a velvet sofa, admiring one of the old masters paintings  while sipping on a rare aged whisky. The location is splendid; across the street is St Patrick's Cathedral and the window dressings of Saks Fifth Ave. [It's a short walk to Rockefeller Center or Central Park] But what sets the Lotte apart from other hotels is the staff; friendly , gracious and helpful, especially Rebecca Villasenor. It's pure joy to stay here!

title: Lotte Hotel - You can't beat the location
text: The location is great and the rooms are a nice size.  The service was the most disappointing part was the service.  Check-in was a nightmare.  They had two people checking in 10 guests.  Multiple people asked for a manager, but Ruth would not come out and help.  The poor Bell Boys were just standing there doing their best to keep the guests calm, but honestly, it wasn't working.  The other issue was that the coffee shop didn't open until 8am.  That didn't make sense.  When you're trying to get an early start or get to the airport early, it would have been nice to be able to get a cup of coffee first.

title: NYC'S PERECT HOTEL!
text: The Lotte is the greatest hotel in NYC! We frequent the city each year. Ever since the Waldorf closed, I have been in search of another hotel with the class, charm and luxury equal to the Waldorf. Lotte is it! Rebecca was the most gracious and courteous employee I have encountered at a hotel. The attention and care she showed my family our entire stay was commendable. The hotel itself is like a dream. You enter and feel like you are in another world. The size of the rooms available are nowhere else in NYC! The amenities at this hotel are beyond what you will find elsewhere. As are the staff. From the bell service staff to housekeeping to the wonderful Rebecca, every part of our stay was beyond amazing. THANK YOU LOTTE!!!!!!

title: I’d try somewhere else
text:
Arriving at the Lotte in December is everything you’d hope for if you’d booked based on the website images. The decorations throughout the lobby like up to expectations. In addition, the rooms are surprisingly roomy by NYC standards and the location works very well. Views from the room (Cathedral view) were above average too.

But there’s a lot to cause disappointment which seems to be reflected in other recent reviews. My own observations;
- while large, the rooms are very sparse. Furniture is on a par with a bog standard Marriott
- if you like the idea of the Gold Room, note it is smaller than it appears on the website (although just as well appointed) and they don’t take reservations. A fair few people on the waiting list are non-guests so you’re hanging around quite a bit to get a table. Other common areas similarly busy.
- the lifts are a real problem. On some days only one of six seemed to be in action, big queues in the lobby, then lifts are fully occupied when you try to come down meaning I had to use the fire escape stairs on a few occasions. Not an option if you’ve limited mobility. While many hotels experience a morning and afternoon ‘rush hour’ I’ve never seen it cause problems like this.
- Staff are a mixed bag. At best they’re indifferent, at worst they’re downright rude. Generally, it’s all a robotic, a bit like the copy/paste response I see the Manager has left by way of reply on all the poor reviews.

Aside from the lobby, which anyone can visit (and they do - see other reviewer comments on Instagram influencers spoiling it for paying guests) there’s really nothing to justify the $1.200 per night for a regular room. Will try somewhere else next time.

title: Lovely Old Hotel with Great Service
text:
Had a great time at the Lotte to kick off the holiday season. We were welcomed by a friendly bellhop who gave us a tour of the common areas and was very kind and knowledgeable. The room was larger than expected and roll away for our teen was comfortable. The finishes are a little dated but still nice. The view from our room was amazing with the cathedral and other buildings. Easy to get most places we wanted to go on foot. Parking was exorbitant, but expected. The only major drawback was the elevators. They might be possessed. It would take upwards of 20 minutes to get an elevator and then you might go up instead of down. Our friends got stuck in one for an hour and they had to call the fire
department. Major elevator maintenance/refurbishment is needed. Back on the positives, the courtyard and lobby were decorated beautifully for Christmas and the hotel had fun special things planned all weekend like a Santa visit and photos with 2 Rockettes. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip.

title: Great position for exploring New York
text:
The Lotte hotel is in a very central position for exploring New York.  It is beautifully decorated for Christmas with iconic trees at the side entrance and in the lobby area with a stunning ginger bread mansion to admire.

The rooms are old style large with enormous bed which was very comfortable.  And everything was cleaned well every day.

My only disappointment was the service in the bar downstairs … which took forever. Totally distracted waiter… but totally swamped by the number of guests.

No tea and coffee in the room… as a European … we expect that in all hotels.  

Good coffee shop in the lobby to buy your morning caffeine.  

Also, the spa looked quite nice. I only used the steam and sauna.  The men’s steam room was broken.

Some problem with the lifts and queues of people waiting to get to their rooms?!

Anyway, it was fine but not 5 star.

title: Great return visit to New York
text: Lovely hotel, rooms a little dated especially the bathrooms, lifts really slow but had an excellent stay and well located, check out did take a while as the hotel was super busy.  Doormen really helpful and kept track of our drivers arrival time

title: Exceptional became ordinary and painful.
text: I’ve been staying here for 23 years- we come to NYC most every year.  It’s a beautiful hotel which arguably has the best Christmas decorations of any hotel in NYC. It is luxurious in the lobby but the rooms are average- for the price point, they are excessive and not in line with their competition.   We stay primarily for the location which is excellent, but the elevators are constantly broken forcing wait times of 5-15 minutes to reach your room or the lobby.  A 4 night stay exceeded $5000 for an average room with downgraded appointments.  The safe in our room was removed. The umbrellas which are normally furnished were absent- it rained 2 of the 4 days, and they supplied only 1 bathrobe. I’ll choose another hotel next year.

title: This is not a Christmas Experience
text:
My husband daughter and I came here on 11/30/23 around 3pm only to be greeted by a long line of extremely angry people to be waiting in line for their rooms only to be told their rooms were not available. We had our daughter write a letter to Santa to kill time. 
After 45 minutes we were finally able to check in to not only wait for 30 minutes to get to our room as the elevators were TERRIBLE. 
Our room was nice and what was expected luxury but from the early 90s. The rooms were impressively big for NYC standards. The housekeeping was 5 stars. I feel bad for them as they had to deal with guests who were clearly pissed off by the elevator wait time. It didn’t get better. 
On night 2, we saw there was no response letter from Santa to our daughter. We went to the front desk to remind them. Nothing. Same again on night 3.  
The Christmas  experience was the only reason we chose this hotel. 
We did not realize the hotel was open to the public at all hours. We arrived Saturday evening to sit in the lounge to find the instagram homeless community sleeping on the couches. SERIOUSLY.  
Don’t waste your money to stay here where you can just walk in take photos of all the amenities and holiday experience. They do not treat their paying guests any better than the instagram influencers who just want to take a photo and fall asleep on the couch.  No wonder the Plaza Has strict security and doesn’t allow non guests. 
Disappointment overall.

title: Not getting a five star experience for the five star price!
text: We booked the Lotte Palace based on a lovely visit in early January approximately five years ago,  During that visit we had a beautiful fresh-looking room with a great view, an in-room coffee maker and minibar, and a very friendly staff.  Our current stay so far has been far from a five star experience.  We stood in line forever to check in.  At first there were only two check in staff members.  After quite a while,  a third arrived.  None seemed interested in speeding the process check-in process along. After each check-in, it seemed to take forever for the next prospective guest to be invited to the desk.  The check in line became longer and longer snaking throughout the hotel entrance area.  One guest in line before us approached the desk without being invited and was quickly chastised and told to wait to be called.  Another guest clearly had lost her patience with the long wait by the time called, but understandably so.  Despite our wait, we approached with a cheery attitude and yet were met with a chilly robotic response from our receptionist.  During the entire check-in process, the only staff member who truly made us feel welcomed at the hotel was a bellman named Matt who brought out an arm full of waters to offer to the long line of guests waiting to check in.  Our room was not ready, despite an early check-in request made long ago, but  grace is given for that due to the season.  As instructed, we checked our bags with the bellman.  However, there was no seat was to be found in the hotel.  It was cold outside causing me to realize I needed access to my bags for an additional coat and gloves.  That involved a trip with a bellman to the 9th floor to retrieve an additional coat and gloves.  After securing additional clothing layers, we ventured forth.  Eventually we received word that our room was ready.  However, rather than having our bags in our room upon our return, we had to go through an additional check in process for keys and then take a blue card to the bellmen station.  Thereafter, it took forever for our bags to be delivered to our room, the eventual and untimely delivery which interrupted our attempt to rest.  Our room is spacious by New York standards but our decor looks tired and worn. One light does not work in our room and another only intermittently.  The bathroom lighting is  dim.  The housekeeping staff failed to leave robes or a coffee maker in our room, which required a front desk request.  Our robes and a coffee maker were eventually delivered, but long after our request. So far, we are paying five star rates but not receiving a five star experience.  Hope our experience improves during the next three days.  Will report back.

title: Family of 5 loves The Lotte Palace
text: What an amazing family experience we had at the Palace leading up to Thanksgiving (2 adults, 3 kids).   It’s not our first stay or last!   We stayed in the tower suites which I can’t recommend enough.  Beautiful views, spacious room and any amenity you could need.   The staff is so friendly and helpful, but George O, the doorman is such a special human.  Daily, my kids could not wait to greet him.   He absolutely made our stay memorable.

title: Great location. Wonderful view. Spacious rooms.
text: When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by the front desk. The check-in process was easy and quick. Everyone was friendly from the doorman all the way to the front desk. Very accommodating to us and even crowned my sons. Unfortunately, we did want to have a late check out, but were unable to get it, but we certainly didn’t ask for early enough.

title: Incredible front desk staff!
text: Melody and Norma went above and beyond to help me check in, told my kids about all the Christmas activities at the hotel and were exceptionally friendly and kind. Incredible location for radio city and Rockefeller center. Most beautiful Christmas hotel in the city! Thank you Melody and Norma!!!!!!

title: Far below the expectations raised by the wesbite
text:
We stayed at the Lotte Palace Towers for two nights in late November 2023.  The rate was approximately U$D1000 per night.  The hotel occupies a handy, mid-town position near all the department stores, Radio City and the Rockefeller Centre.  It’s about 10 blocks south of Central Park.

The website naturally makes much of the handsome, 19th century villa that fronts onto Madison Avenue.  The hotel, however, only has access to a very small part of this building and none of the guest rooms are contained within.  Rooms are in the nondescript, black (ex-office?) building that rises behind.  Guests are able to visit the villa by appointment on Saturday mornings.

Superlatives swirl like winter storms on the website but the reality is far removed from the description which runs:
 . . . . Towers at Lotte New York Palace is among the most sought-after luxury hotels in Midtown Manhattan. Regularly ranked among the world’s premier hotels, the Towers is a glamorous collection of bespoke guest rooms . . . 

The common areas enjoy customary high ceilings and sweeping marble staircases but the impression once this is left behind is one of faded grandeur and a reputation that is far removed from the shabby fixtures and fittings.  More specifically:

•	Advertised services including the butler, packing and unpacking, complimentary pressing and Maybach car service were never offered.  Perhaps you have to ask, but then what’s the point of advertising them?
•	Pre-arrival, the ‘concierge service’ failed to respond to my two queries, despite two separate prompts
•	Although our room was huge, there was no separate sitting area, so it felt empty and unwelcoming
•	The room lighting had no overhead lights (except the hallway and bathroom) or recesses to create atmosphere
•	There were two closets – one a vast walk-in that no guest could ever utilise and the other of average size.  I’m not complaining about too much closet space but it highlighted the size of the room rather than its utility or design touches
•	The TV was so old it didn’t have Bluetooth and there was no other way to play music (not even a bedside alarm clock)
•	There was one USB socket in the entire room
•	The minibar had been removed and boarded shut
•	There was no turn-down service or bottled water
•	There were no in-room tea or coffee making facilities
•	The bathroom was a three-piece – i.e. no his ‘n’ hers basins and no bidet or bath
•	The ‘finest amenities’ were Molton Brown 
•	There was no extractor fan in the bathroom
•	The ‘entirely private’ Towers involve no more a separate check in desk and a separate lift (that runs next to the main lift) and rooms on higher floors.  There is no ‘club floor’ for breakfast / work / coffees and no other benefits that I could discern (see above)
•	The public areas on our floor were tatty with the walls marked with the passage of countless housekeeping trollies.

We very much enjoyed the Gold Bar (in the villa) and the hotel is conveniently situated but, overall, it was desperately underwhelming compared to, say, the St. Regis where we stayed on our last visit.

To balance the feedback, perhaps U$D1000 is just what you pay these days for a room in Midtown New York but the Lotte Palace struck us as appalling value and nowhere near deserving of its 5* rating.

title: Wonderful family holiday stay
text: The family suite was amazing- the view of St Patrick’s cathedral was spectacular.   The staff was exceptional and they gave our two children each a stuffed teddy bear which was such a sweet touch. We had drinks in the Gold Room one evening and the staff again was exceptional.  I’ve stayed at many hotels in NYC over the years and this is the best hotel by far.  From now on this will be my go to hotel when visiting NYC.  Also the Xmas tree and decorations were enchanting!

title: 5 estrellas ny palace con DALMACI a la cabeza.
text:
