Siempre ny palace como venir a mi casa con las súper atenciones de DALMACI.  

TODOS muy simpáticos y siempre queridísimos. 

Hotel muy bien localizado en el corazón de Manhattan y cerca de todo.  

Central park , Bryan park y los mejores restaurantes.

title: Lotte shines at the Holidays
text: Our family trip for Thanksgiving was bliss. Everyone at the Lotte was friendly and eager to please. George, the ever welcoming doorman, Joyce from housekeeping, and Rebecca at the checkin desk to the Towers all went above and beyond! Our room was clean and spacious with a view of the Chrysler building and the location was convenient to all things holiday. The Winter Palace is one of the most beautiful holiday spots ever. We walked to Bryant Park, Central Park, Grand Central, Times Square and Rockefeller Center as well as easy cabs and subway access throughout the city. This was by far our favorite New York hotel experience and we will be back!

title: Superb
text: Superb rooms and service, great value and  great location, tower suites were the largest suites I’ve ever seen in a hotel anywhere let alone NYC. Will be staying again on next trip to NYC.  Perfect for families.

title: Thank you for great service Anna-Marie!
text: After a long trip from the West Coast, it was really great to be greated by Anna-Marie. She was so welcoming and did her best to get us checked in quickly and set up with place to eat and hang out. We had a few hiccups with the room, but she was very communicative and helpful. Made our trip so fun and memorable! Thanks Anna-Marie 5 stars *****

title: Luxury NYC hotel that makes you feel right at home!
text: My experience is always top notch. Thank you Michael who checked us in and went above and beyond even when the lobby was getting busy. Housekeeping was always very accommodating and kept our place tidy. The bellmen had us laughing while we waited for our ride, one guy even pulled out a harmonica and played a few beats!  I'll be coming back to stay again very soon!

title: Because of Eric S the Night Manager, we will be staying here every time we are in NY
text: What would have been the worst stay turned out to be one of the best, thanks to Eric  S. the Overnight Manager! We were staying at the hotel for our annual summer NY stay to see family but for two nights in a row, our rooms were not cleaned. Throughout the week, my husband and I called housekeeping several times to ask that they come and help clean the room. We were assured that someone would come and tidy up the room. On our third night, we were shocked to see that our room was still not made up when returned from dinner. The General Manager was nowhere in sight (shocking, given peak season during a weekend) and none of the staff at the front desk were able to offer any explanation on what was going on with our (dirty) room and quite frankly, was not the most pleasant. Thankfully, Eric came to the rescue and really turned our stay around. To the Owners/Asset Managers - this man needs to be promoted! Because of him, we will be staying with Lotte every time we're in town & recommend to our friends and family.

title: Great staff!!
text: We stayed at the Lotte Place in New York and what a great experience. Everyone from the front desk to the bellmen were totally great and friendly. It also in the middle of almost everything and a short walk to Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall.

title: 1 ply
text:
I chose the Palace as it's a great location and it's not often you go far wrong with 5*. It's hard to understand how it's earned the accolade and it definitely carries the price tag. The rooms are extremely dated, verging on tired. The bathroom reminds me of my walk up studio apartment as a student. 1 ply loo roll is indicative of the lack of luxury. You need to allow 15 minutes to get to your room if you're on the 30th floor as there is no express and you stop on every floor. There is no way of charging via USB, something you can do in any fast food joint. They can't/won't charge for you at reception. I am writing this from my room as the bar doesn't open until 5pm and the foyer is full (and hot as an oven). This is a small blessing as a martini goes for $35 inc tip. Sadly I can't have a coffee as there are no facilities. I'd happily settle for a beer but there isn't a mini bar.

I wouldn't be writing this if the Palace was billed as a 3* hotel. I really don't understand it.

title: Dalmasi la mejor
text: Dalmasi una gran empleada del hotel dispuesta a ayudarme en todo lo q se le pedia ! Gracias  tuve problemas con mis paquetes q me mandaron y ella estuvo dispuesta ayudarne hasta q se soluciono todo gracias

title: Wonderful experience!
text: Best hotel in NYC. Jimm was the kindest and most helpful during our stay. He took care of everything we needed and was so nice. I wanted thank the Lotte hotel for taking care of us. I visited last year with my family and Jimm helped us and went above and beyond. Jimm is the reason I booked Lotte this year for my girls trip. He again went above and beyond for us. Thank you Jimm. Have a wonderful Christmas!

title: Excellent and comfortable
text: The Hotel Lotte Palace has a wonderful location, my room had a excellent view, amenities are excellent, bed so comfortable, pillows amazing, the size room was excellent, bathroom too, roomservice was excellent too

title: Grande Dame With Management Issues
text:
This is my third stay at the Lotte, and I had hoped that it had improved since last year, but I encountered a number of problems. We stayed in a two room suite for nine nights, and here is a recap.  

First, the many good points. The location in midtown is terrific, especially if you are going to the theater. The view from our suite was outstanding!  Easy walking distance to Broadway, but far enough away you aren't in constant crowds. Even better access to the luxury shopping on 5th Avenue, and a pleasant walk to the park. Champagne on arrival! The hotel is housed in a glorious, historic building, with great dining and cocktail options. I especially like the Gold Bar, and the bartender was terrific! Our suite was very large, with comfy beds, and good Moulton Brown toiletries. We encountered many nice staff.

The not-so-good. It is very clear that the hotel suffers from management and communication issues, and a lack of attention to detail. The rooms are looking a bit aged. I certainly would not consider it a 5 star hotel. Our suite had peeling wall paper, plumbing issues, the door bell did not work, and it appeared that some of the furniture featured in the advertising had been removed from the suite. The suite was also very barren - especially for a room that costs over $2000 per day. No glasses or cups. It did have a wine cooler and microwave, but the refrigerator had been removed, leaving a gaping hole in the cabinet with wires coming out. There is not mini-bar. I remembered from my last visit that they do not put coffee makers in the room (very bizarre for a hotel that bills itself the way they do), so I called in advance and asked they have one in the room. I was told they could not guarantee that (in my $2000 plus room) - and to ask when I checked in. (Ridiculous.) I did, and they delivered a nice Nespresso maker and two cups. However, for some reason every day they would remove the coffee cups and the sugar service, and we had to call down to get it replaced. Every day they would strip the room of cups, glasses, and coffee - and we later learned that room service and housekeeping do not communicate. We were instructed to deal with each separately. On our final night we hosted a party, ordering a couple thousand dollars worth of room service, and later that night when we returned they provided turn down, but had not cleaned the room. Housekeeping informed us that they do not communicate with room service, and it was our responsibility to deal with each on our own. We asked to discuss the situation with the manager in the morning, and were assured they would contact us, but we never heard from them.

None of this would be acceptable in a 5 star hotel. Every staff member should be trained to work together to ensure a great experience for the guest. Management should be accessible and strive to provide the best possible experience.  Bottom line - this is a beautiful hotel that need updating and love, and management committed to delivering a superlative experience.

title: An amazing experience at a one of a kind hotel!
text: We had the absolute best experience for our girls weekend here! Dan went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. He made our weekend trip a trip  of a lifetime, with the best accommodations and recommendations for things in the area.

title: Amazing experience!
text: We had the most amazing stay for our weekend trip! Dan was so helpful, and made sure we had everything we needed to have the best experience- would definitely recommend staying here- and can’t wait to go back in the future!

title: Superficially 5 star, totally classless
text:
Pros
The location
View from the room
Size of the room

Cons
The cost is insanity. Such poor value for money, even taking into account being in NY.
The rooms are so dated. Given the revenue, would an update hurt. The room looked like it hadn't been touched up in 35 years.
No fridge or coffee making facilities in the room, and apparently we had one of the best suites. I'd hate to think what a standard room was like.
The soft furnishings were filthy. In a 5 star hotel, I should have to think twice before sitting down. I chose not to during the whole stay.
The elevators are old and use an ancient system, so the wait time is extremely long.
The length the receptionist went to trying to get a tip was insane. Totally without class.
Breakfast service was poor on our second day, to the point items were forgotten and not delivered. How is this possible given the staff count and price?
We had a nasty incident at checkout with one of the staff. She made a mistake and made out like it was our fault. No apology. Fortunately, Miles the manager sorted it out. But it took an age to get him and the reception staff were all throwing us dirty looks. Probably one of the worst customer experiences I've ever had. All this in a supposedly 5 star hotel. Certainly not international standard.

Overall, my recommendation would be to avoid this hotel. There must be better options at that price point.

title: Great Experience
text: The staff at this hotel are exceptional.  From the Doormen to the Catering staff to the Bartenders.  I had a dinner for 32 and the catering staff was impeccable.  Friendly and so accommodating to all my needs.  Don't hesitate to book here!

title: Probably the worst hotel in Manhattan
text:
Where to start with this sad excuse for a hotel. The middling bad:
The rooms are extremely tatty and tired and poorly provisioned, no fridge or coffee machine
The restaurant is badly run with rude staff and extremely over priced food
The lifts don’t work on the second floor, no explanation

The worse
The staff are extremely rude, to the point that they will lie to your face and then call you a liar, especially reception staff.

The criminal
We pre paid our reservation and they took the money again at check in (with no receipt) and then again multiple times at check out (again no receipt) . Once they took the money when we expressly asked them to stop taking it and investigate. As it stands they have $3400 of our money and we have no recourse to get it back. 

Avoid this place like the plague, honestly you’d be better off sleeping on the subway - at least they’d only make off with your handbag rather than the entire content of your bank account.

title: Unforgettable Summer Wedding Block
text:
I meant to write this review months ago- but am just now getting around to it. I had my wedding block at Lotte New York Palace back in June and it was an absolute dream.

The service was exceptional- shout out to Randee, Danielle and Miles for ensuring that everything was seamless and dealing with my crazy self when I was stressed to the max. My experience with Randee from the initial planning process was absolutely incredible- so warm and calming when I’m sure I was not the most calm person to deal with. Danielle also ensured that everything was in order the week of the wedding and Miles dealt with us all so professionally and graciously when we were checking in with our carts and carts of stuff.

The rooms were lovely, the service was so special in every way. Truly felt like part of a large family and right at home. We cannot wait to return in the future!

Thank you again, Randee, Danielle, Miles and team for making my wedding week soooo very special. We will be back.

title: Fantastic Hotel - Fantastic Staff
text: I had the pleasure of staying at the Lotte New York Palace recently.   The hotel is absolutely wonderful, the food is great and the location is perfect.  Miles Gomez a front desk manager was particularly helpful and extremely professional.

title: Historic hotel but needs a bit of updating
text:
The Lotte Palace is a nice hotel and I enjoyed all the history of the original building (if you’re staying the history tour and magic shows are really good to do). The Gold Room bar is  very impressive, and all the staff there were amazing.   The rooms are pretty big and have some nice views of the city and cathedral next door. The gym is a decent size with Peloton bikes, although does get busy in the morning. The location is also really good for shopping with Radio City, the Rockefeller Centre and Central Park close by.

But given it’s a 5 star hotel there are a couple of negatives - there is no minibar or coffee maker in the room (although randomly there is a space seemingly made for a fridge). There’s a coffee shop in the hotel and Starbucks over the road but still would be nice to have stuff easily available in the room. 

This is especially an issue since the lifts are horrendously busy so you couldn’t go anywhere quickly. I am not sure if some were out of order but for my whole stay on a high floor it was an ordeal to get anywhere since the lift would stop on almost every floor even after having filled up. This seemed to happen all day so doesn’t seem enough capacity for the amount of rooms.

The rooms are also a little dated and not a huge amount of wardrobe space.

title: My Favorite NYC Hotel
text:
The Lotte New York Palace is amazing! This is the only hotel that I ever stay at in the City. The Lotte has been my number 1 spot for many years. The Palace gets it right on so many different levels. The Midtown location makes you feel like you are at the center of the universe. The rooms in the Tower are elegant and comfortable. The facilities are elegant - and the first floor lounge is a great place to take a break or get ready for your next adventure in the City. The entire staff is exceedingly professional. The doormen, restaurant staff, maids, and front desk staff are friendly and helpful. And they always make me feel right at home. Here Jorge Cruz and Miles Pena deserve loud and enthusiastic shoutouts. They consistently deliver customer service excellence. And are truly committed to making sure one's hotel experience is memorable. 

I just left the Palace - and can't wait to return next month.

title: Fine Hotel but Not Luxury
text:
My husband and I booked this hotel for a mini 'babymoon'.  We frequent NYC several times a year and have stayed at all sorts of hotels in all areas, but as it was a special occasion, we wanted to splurge on something a little special and did so thinking this hotel would be a bit more high end than our usual stays.  However, the hotel did not hold up to our expectations.  

Outside of the grand lobby, beautiful hotel bars/restaurants and spacious sized rooms (especially by nyc standards) there is not much I'd consider "luxury".  The hotel itself is clean and centrally located, but feels incredibly dated, especially for the price point.  The robes and towels were stiff and scratchy.  There was a bit of peeling wall paper and a musty scent when we first got there.  The thermostat was temperamental and the lights system was weird and dated and there was no fridge or mini bar.  We found the linens nice enough but the bed a little too soft and even after requesting pillows 2x we only were able to get down pillows (not foam- though I was given a choice on the phone).  Room service options were also pretty limited and we found the concierge services by text a super helpful feature, but the brunch spot they suggested was lackluster.   I can also say that we did not experience any of the top notch customer service that everyone else seems to boast about. Everyone we encountered was nice enough and perhaps it is because we booked through a third party or were not staying in the fancy section (the towers) but all interactions were very brief and nothing like described in the other reviews.  This was fine with us (we are pretty self sufficient in the city) but we felt worth mentioning in case that was the basis on which someone might book this hotel.

Lastly, our final morning was what really cemented our feelings on Lotte. To begin with, we woke up and no longer had cell service in our room (and Wi-Fi is a laughable $15/day). I'm not sure if this was some kind of tactic to get us to leave or pure coincidence but it was incredibly frustrating to not be able to look up train schedules and breakfast options etc.  Additionally, around 11am the fire alarm went off roughly a dozen times.  At first we instinctually started throwing on clothes and grabbing our stuff, thinking we needed to evacuate (we actually have been in a hotel that caught on fire, so we take alarms seriously).  After the alarm stopped and re-started several times we called the front desk to see what was going on and found out they were testing the alarms.  We were relieved but also, why not alert your guests- especially considering you have the communication via text feature?  Would it have  been that hard to send out a text alert??  Maybe it was just our PTSD but it did not leave us with a good taste in our mouth regarding an already borderline experience here.  

TLDR: Hotel is clean, spacious and in a great, central, location especially if you're coming in via Grand Central.  However, I would not consider this a "luxury" hotel and wish we stayed at one of our usual spots for considerably less money.  I wouldn't tell anyone they necessarily shouldn't stay here but I would advise looking into other options, especially given how many there are in the area.  (Also, hope they aren't doing a fire alarm test during your stay!)

title: Nice but dated.
text: The Palace is a nice hotel in a good location. Walking distance to shopping, restaurants, theatre  district and Times Square. The rooms are nice and good sized, but ours did not include a refrigerator or a mini-bar, was extremely difficult to regulate AC in, and was dated.

title: Well done and so helpful
text: We celebrated our daughter and son-in-law after they did a private courthouse wedding. We had 8 in our party and the rooms were beautiful and clean. The entire concierge staff, especially Christian, were so helpful helping us find great restaurants, breakfast seating and scheduling the mansion tour. Great job!

title: Lovely hotel and rooms disappointed with wet bedding!
text:
We have given it 4 because the hotel is lovely, the rooms are great and we were given an upgrade after complaining.  
However our major disappointment was wet bedding and the time taken to resolve it!
In our first room we sat on the beds to rest on arrival and realised all the bedding - sheets and duvets were wet, not damp, wet!  
So we were asked to go and check out another room which was an upgrade. However the bedding was all wet in this room. 
We tried a further 2 rooms and insisted a manger came with us to the fourth room as we thought we were going bonkers! 
He agreed bedding was wet. We agreed to keep our original upgrade room and housekeeping ( who were lovely) came and put clean dry bedding on both our beds . 
They told us they keep telling management that  the bedding is coming back from the cleaners wet but  nothing seems to be done . 
So problem was resolved and we did get an upgrade but all of the above took 3 hours and lots of phone calls. Not the best start.  But good to know all bedding including duvets are washed ! However I bet they wouldn’t put wet bedding on beds in the tower suits!

title: Lovely stay
text: I loved my stay at Lotte. It was recommended from a friend. I was by myself and felt very safe. I saw two broadway shows and walked back to the hotel afterwards. Everyone was so nice and I felt very taken care of. I slept so well. The bed was so comfortable. Thank you for a lovely stay.

title: The Best Hotel in NYC
text: This is my second time back to NYC this year and I just knew I had to stay at the Lotte! Where to even begin, the hotel is perfection and so iconic. I was traveling in with two other couples and both Miles and Paul at the front office made sure to give us the most exceptional hospitality and an absolutely beautiful room upgrade! We had an incredible 4 nights stay. The Lotte is the perfect mix of luxury, sophistication, warmth, and truly best in class customer service in NYC. The suite we stayed in was huge, beautifully decorated, the best views in nyc, and extremely clean! All the staff was so thoughtful and made it feel like home. Not to mention you can’t beat the location of this hotel, it is so convenient and in the best part of the city.  Thank you Miles and Paul truly for always providing world class service and for taking the best care of us, your hospitality is so appreciated and truly the very best. I look forward to my next New York trip so I can plan my stay at the Lotte!!

title: Wonderful stay in NYC
text: The folks at Lotte NY go above and beyond to make guests feel welcome and seen. From when you're greeted at the door to the front desk, the restaurants and housekeeping, everyone is smiling and upbeat. We celebrated my mom's 80th birthday there and they made it feel special for all of us, especially Miles, John and Saleem were so kind - and funny. Thank you for a great visit - we'll be back :)

title: A+++ Concierge Service
text: Ani from the concierge team was able to secure us one of NYC's most difficult  and coveted reservation. Her professionalism and connections are above and beyond what you would expect, even for a five star hotel.

title: Birthday weekend in NYC
text:
From check in to check out my experience was beyond my expectations. The Towers treat you like family and make you feel like a VIP. My room was upgraded on arrival and I’m still dreaming of being there.  It was absolutely gorgeous. Everyone from front desk to the doormen were so friendly and considerate that there is no question I would stay there again. It is impossible for me to give a review without mentioning Jimm Kalinka at the front desk. Jimm goes above and beyond and his knowledge of what is happening in the city is outstanding. He is always such a pleasure.  Wholeheartedly give them a ten out of ten!

Be sure to try Rarities, a lovely experience for after dinner drinks.

title: Miles goes above and beyond - absolutely amazing service
text: My family and I have stayed at the Palace for years and we keep coming back for one reason – the service.  Miles has helped us several times and he could not be more welcoming, attentive to all details, professional, kind and caring. To say he goes above and beyond would be a huge understatement. He is the reason we keep coming back to this hotel in particular during all of our New York visits. My family and I travel often, and we like to try new hotels in the cities that we visit, but that is not the case with the Palace. It is rare in a large city like this to receive such personalized attention with such a graceful welcome every single time. Miles does this seamlessly and does not miss a thing.  It’s a wonderful visit every time.

title: Concierge staff is the best in the city
text: This review is dedicated to the wonderful staff at the Palace. I have never before experienced a hotel staffed by such amazing people. In particular, I would like to publicly thank the concierge Christian, who went above and beyond to assist me. Christian is an incredible employee and we are entirely in his debt for helping us with any issue that came up during our stay. If you have a problem, go see Christian! He is a miracle worker.

title: Upmarket hotel in great location
text: Stayed here for business meetings. Superior room on 34th floor was large and comfortable. Working breakfast buffet good , decent cafe for snacks and smart lounge areas. Convenient for E subway line for express journey to JFK changing to air train

title: Central location in NYC
text:
This is a really nice hotel and close to all the big attractions in NYC a few minutes walk from Times Square,  Central Park and very close to the rockafella centre and FAO Schwarz. The rooms are modern with all that you need for a great stay in the big apple.
The lifts are fast and smooth so don't worry how high up you are, we had an amazing view looking towards Times Square and loved it.

title: Like a movie.
text: The staff was so attentive and friendly. It felt like we were part of a movie. The hotel is beautiful and historic. We had a beautiful view. Harbor breakfast was excellent and the location cannot be beat.

title: Avoid if you can...hellish stay
text:
During a recent long weekend, we decided to try out the Lotte New York Palace and stayed in the Towers. Despite the hotel billing itself as a luxury destination, I vehemently disagree. 

Positives: room size is excellent and the location is convenient to a number of tourist destinations. Also when I needed a recommendation for alternatives to a restaurant we had originally wanted to go to, but decided to forego, the Towers' concierge was helpful in providing a few good suggestions and helped us make the reservation. 

Negatives: Housekeeping was pathetic as we had asked for our room to be cleaned when we went out for the afternoon and after 5+ hours, nothing had been done. We then asked for towels, and it took them ~3 hours to get us those towels, after calling multiple times. Most breakfast items at the Villard restaurant were not only sub-standard, they also were unbelievably overpriced for what we received. It felt nothing short of daylight robbery... for example, $12 for a few rubbery and tough chicken sausages! The main hotel concierge was incredibly misleading. We signed up for the St Patrick's private tour for $500, which ended up being only semi-private. When booking with the concierge, I had also asked if the tour included the Catacombs, and the concierge gave me a resounding "Yes"! And lo and behold...no Catacombs tour...that takes place at the old St Patrick's location and is completely separate. On our day of departure, I asked how long it would take for us to take a cab to Moynihan Train station. The bellman said 30 minutes would be plenty. When we came back 30 minutes later with more than 50 minutes until our train departed, another bellman (who did not even approach us, although we were standing outside for a good 10+ minutes) said it would take us at least 30 minutes to even get a cab (due to the Columbus Day parade). The misleading advice from the first bellman and the inattention from the second one meant we missed our train ride and had to rent a car to get home instead. Overall an incredibly unsatisfactory and unacceptable stay. This is no 5-star hotel and should be ashamed to call itself as such.

title: Systemic Problems
text: During the visit, we had a continued disastrous time trying to get breakfast. One morning we made a reservation and still wasn’t seated until 45 mins later, which made us late for an appointment. The next morning we ordered room service hoping it would be better. It was supposed to take 40 mins and over 2 hrs later we finally got it— only after calling and offering to go pick it up.  This breakfast of yogurt, granola, avocado toast and a bagel with fixings cost $173.  The room was also in poor shape — dirty carpet and paint chips.

title: Nice Hotel That Doesn't Live up to Its Price
text:
The hotel is in a great location and has some incredible views from the towers. If it were price around 30-40% lower, I would give it a much higher review. However, given that it is one of the most expensive hotels in the city, it has to be live up to that level of quality and it doesn't meet the mark. 

Check in took over 20 mins due to some confusion about getting the reservations on the same floor. Management was very nice about it, it shouldn't have taken so long and required management's intervention. The desk staff should have more autonomy to solve problems.

The rooms are clean and the fixtures and furniture are decent, but they aren't super high quality like you'll find at other luxury hotels. The room lacked sufficient power outlets for charging phones. E.g. there was a power block on one side of the bed, but not both. The mini fridge was not stocked and there was a second fridge in a corner of the room that made it feel more like a college dorm room than a luxury hotel room. They did have a nice creston system for controlling the lights and the shades, but it didn't control all of the lights, so you had to get up and shut them all off using a switch by the door.  

The Goldroom has an incredible ornate ceiling. Unfortunately, we couldn't enjoy it because there is not enough bar space for hotel guests. We were told that our best bet was to take our drinks to go and find a place to sit in a room way off the lobby. The staff complained that they were suffering from not having enough resources to staff the bar properly "since the pandemic". The pandemic ended a long time ago and the property is charging $30 for a basic cocktail. If you can't find talent to work for tips on that kind of tab, you're probably doing something wrong. 

We had breakfast twice in Villard. The food was very good both times. The service was inconsistent - a bit rough around the edges at times. In general, some of the staff seemed experienced and others needed better training. E.g., set the coffee down on the table next vs handing it over from across the entire table.  That's not a big deal at all, but it just doesn't fit when you're paying $80 per person for breakfast. 

Overall, I think that the hotel is pretty good and if the price were lowered to align with the value, it could be great.

title: Frank Sinatra and smoking squirrels
text:
This place is no palace.  I do not understand the rating on this one at all.  Set the scene: l arrive to a lobby that is elbow to elbow with tourist and baggage.  I’m told a cruise ship just came in and check in will take 45 minutes.   I check in and am told “don’t expect to get breakfast it will be too busy”.   Gee thanks.  I go to the elevator.   It takes 30 minutes to get to my room.   Kinda what you expect from a cruise hotel.  Takes me another 30 minutes in the morning to get down to the lobby.

About that room.   The first thing i notice is the smell.  I have a sensitive nose—it’s a curse.   I couldn’t place the odor.  My mind starts racing, the room looks like it was last touched in the 1960s.   I’m thinking Frank Sinatra stayed there and partied and smoked cigarettes with a band of squirrels.   He checked out, but the squirrels stayed behind, smoking until their tragic death.   That’s what is smells like.

Owners:  spend some money on this place or tear it down.   Staff was ok, could have been much more understanding.   If you pay $150 per night, that would be about right

title: Exquisite in every way!
text:
I love this hotel! We come annually to celebrate my Dad’s birthday.   The hotel, staff, & attention to detail is Exquisite.  
Angela is our housekeeper this trip.   She is friendly, efficient, accommodating and a real joy.  Her spirit & disposition are delightful! She definitely added warmth & welcoming energy to our trip

title: Good service but expensive
text:
The hotel staff were very helpful and polite throughout providing excellent service whilst not overcharging customers.  It was the best bed I have ever slept on in a hotel room. 

The bathrooms were very tired and not typical of a 5 star hotel. Need improvement. 

New York is a very expensive city and the expectation of a 20 per cent tip everywhere is systemic. Perhaps if people were paid properly they wouldn’t need a tip to simply do their job adequately.

title: Consistent service from friendly staff
text:
I have been staying at the Palace for more than 20 years and the staff are consistently friendly on the front desk, the bell desk and the front door. 

The only shortcoming of note is the requirement for the length of these comments, that's just dumb as are the impositions of TripAdvisor to gather data rather than focusing on rating the hotel.

title: Lovely hotel
text: This hotel has Spacious rooms, nice staff, and a great location! We will stay here again on our next trip to New York City. By NYC standards, our room was large. It even had a sofa. We were leaving on a 2 week cruise and had lots of luggage and there was plenty of room to navigate around and not feel crowded.

title: Nice Staff but Not 5 Star
text: This hotel markets itself as five star but it is not.  Stayed in The Towers and check in with the lovely Rebecca was great (except her efforts to upsell me). But room was extremely disappointing. Very dated and under furnished with what felt like a dirty carpet. Had an empty refrigerator in the corner no minibar and no coffee. No turndown service. Scratchy sheets. Terrible internet service. Villard breakfast was terrible. Well intentioned staff in Towers are the best part but this hotel felt very three star. I moved to the St Regis is which is a true five star!

title: Front Desk Excelente
text: Ótima localização e atendimento! No térreo tem uma ótima cafeteria. Quarto amplo e confortável !Equipe extremamente gentil !cheguei cedo e como havia disponibilidade meu check in foi antecipado. Sofri um acidente na rua e fui otimamente bem atendida pelo concierge e por LINCY no front desk ! parabéns a todos pelo atendimento

title: Queen Mary 2 Transatlantic Crossing 2023
text: A truly beautiful Hotel don't let the outside fool you. Inside is just magnificent. with a large open foyer through to the staircase to the 2nd floor and lobby bar. The rooms are huge and clean with plenty of room for your suitcases. Our room had a great view looking down East 50th street. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the staff were very polite and helpful. A truly lovely hotel in a great location. I will have no hesitation in booking this hotel again.

title: Not worth the price
text:
Came here with my two kids.  I stayed at the hotel a few years ago.  This is not even the shadow of what it was before.  Rooms are outdated and in desperate need of a renewal.  Had breakfast at the restaurant and the experience was awful, limited options, and really overpriced bad food, expect $14 USD for a glass of juice the size of a tequila shot!

They moved the reception where we checked in, to a different place, the line is huge, like what you would expect in the cheapest hotel in NY!  Lady at this new reception was probably new at the job, she tried to charge my credit card with 3 different amounts which was detected as fraudulent charge, it added 30 more minutes to my checkout process! 

My experience was not terrible, but not what I would expect for this price point.

Will be looking for a different hotel an the same price but that actually delivers.  

Don't be fooled this hotel is not worth what they charge for it.

title: Unfortunately is no longer the same
text: The rooms in the hotel no longer have a minibar, do not have a coffee maker or similar and the hotel charges for interntet (more than US$15 a day). Business travelers expect more for their money! Staff is still very helpfull.

title: Customer Service
text:
From the moment I walked in. Anna-Marie greeted us with a warm smile & made us feel very comfortable after a long day of traveling. 

Not only did she ensure that we were well taken care of upon arrival, but went the extra mile and helped accommodate us with anything that we needed during our stay. It’s customer service like that, that will ensure we stay there again.

title: Lotte great location and nice amenities
text:
We stayed here in October.
It was prior to going on a fall color cruise.  
It was a Nice room . Very nice staff . Very comfortable 
Had drinks and ate in the Gold Room. 
Really enjoyed it. 
Great location

title: Palace Hotel - favorite midtown family luxury stay
text: The service was exceptional-management really cared about making our stay special.  Christine in food & beverage and Miles at the front desk addressed some problems (Villard wait time and last-minute need to extend stay when hotel already overbooked) with spectacular customer service. Awesome!

title: Our Favourite place to stay in New York
text: The Lotte New York Palace is our favorite place to stay in New York. The location is great the rooms are clean and spacious but most of all the staff at the hotel make you feel like it’s your home away from home. A big thank you to Ani Bedrossian the concierge she made our stay extra special and went above and beyond to help us with everything from restaurant reservations to play tickets etc…. She made the impossible possible. Her extra efforts warmth and kindness made all the difference. Ani your amazing!!!! Dalmasi Rivera at the information desk A big thank you to you as well you give customer service A whole new meaning. It is with heartfelt appreciation and A big thank you till next time.

title: Exceptional Service and Attention to Detail
text: I am writing to express my sincere appreciation and heartfelt gratitude for the exceptional service and remarkable experience we had during our recent meeting at Lotte Palace NYC. I wanted to take a moment to acknowledge the outstanding efforts of your staff in ensuring the success of our event. From the moment we arrived, your team went above and beyond to accommodate our needs and create a welcoming environment for our guests. Their dedication, professionalism, and attention to detail made a significant impact on our overall experience. I am particularly impressed by the level of personalized attention we received. The staff members were attentive, proactive, and always willing to go the extra mile to ensure our comfort and satisfaction. Their warm and friendly demeanor created a positive atmosphere, which greatly contributed to the success of our meetings. Furthermore, I am delighted to inform you that we have received overwhelmingly positive feedback from our attendees. Please extend our gratitude to your staff and the Encore team for their exceptional service. Once again, thank you for making our meeting a resounding success. We are grateful for the extraordinary efforts of your team and look forward to the opportunity to work with Lotte NY Palace in the future.

title: Weird policies
text:
I would say that the only really good thing about this hotel is that the lobby/common areas are very nice. However, the service is where this hotel really falls apart excluding the reception desk, they were very nice.

We stayed 4 nights in the family room and while the room itself was quite large and had a fantastic view of St Patrick, it is extremely dated. Furthermore, it just seemed messy and the room wasn't thought out very well. Our room had a bidet sprayer next to the toilet which is much appreciated as most hotels don't have this, but no spray holder?? So it was just dangling on the floor, leaking water.

Furthermore, a coffee maker and refrigerator weren't in the room and we had to request them. When they came, the guy bringing it looked at me as he finished installing it like he was expecting a tip?? Like really?? For something that should've been there in the first place????

Guest services were awful. Requests for water, towels, etc came in a minimum of 20 minutes or sometimes they would not come at all. Housekeeping would sometimes clean the drinking glasses in your room and sometimes they did not. Bed linens were often messy and crumpled despite asking for linens to be changed by putting the card on the bed. Housekeeping may be a known problem since the first thing the bellman said to us as he delivered the bags was "Put on slippers, the carpets aren't clean" since we had our shoes off.

Also, a final thing is that they have these palace tours every Saturday. When we joined, there were a few guests which we found out weren't hotel guests. I don't think that's fair for the hotel guests. They should have a check of some sort.

Everyone in the hotel seemed to be hoping for a tip. Not impressed.

title: Luxury meets Comfort
text:
This review is long overdue as we have been going to Lotte for many, many years, but I have just returned again from a stay and needed to share my amazing experiences finally! The Lotte has always felt like a special place for my family and I. From the moment you exit your car, you are greeted with warmth and hospitality. Everyone is interested to know where you came from, what your plans are during your stay, and most importantly trying to make the first leg (entering the hotel) a pleasurable one. George is always smiling when people enter! The hotel feels majestic upon entering with its marble floors and grand staircase beyond the entryway (which allows for great photo shoots), yet it also feels comfortable and relaxing. 

What we love about this hotel is that it does not matter whether you are staying in the Palace section or the Towers section to dictate how you will be treated. We have had most of our experiences in the Towers and are beyond grateful to have had the pleasure of working with staff that go above and beyond to please their clients. Namely, Miles Gomez, the front office manager, has always made us feel like true royalty. He greets you with the warmest smile and quickly offered my daughter a teddy bear and struck up a conversation with her. This was so refreshing to witness, as in some other fine  establishments we have stayed at, staff have completely ignored our children. Not Miles, he goes out of his way to engage all people in your company in conversation. We have also had so many positive experiences with Melody and Anne-Marie at the front desk at the Towers. If you need anything, just ask them and they will try everything to help you out! 

Now, onto the rooms.... The rooms are beyond spacious for NYC hotel spaces. They again evoke a feeling of old world charm meets modern. The bathroom marble gives you the old world, understated charm, and the modern amenities like the electric shades, lights etc. offers you the modern amenities that are always greatly appreciated. As noted, standard rooms are generous in size and comfortable. Bedding is luxurious and you will get a wonderful sleep! If you are able to upgrade a bit to one of their luxury suites you will not regret it! I implore you to treat yourself to it. They are beautiful and perfect for a night to hang in and order room service or just to offer up more space. The larger suites such as the triplex suites and specialty suites are so expansive and luxurious it is hard to even justify leaving them to go out for dinner. We love walking around the hotel in slippers and just enjoying looking around. 

As far as food, you cannot go wrong with any of the dining choices at the hotel. Room service arrives hot and beautifully presented each time. The food at the Gold Room is fresh and what an exquisite place to enjoy a cocktail and have a bite with all of that gilded work around you. Nicola was fantastic as a server, and made sure that all of our needs were met, and again made conversation with us as we had known each other for years but just met. Villard also offers a fantastic breakfast. We were also excited to see Trouble's Trust open again for a cocktail!! If you have time the Chamber of Magic show is beyond incredible and is hosted at the Lotte on Friday and Saturday evenings. 

I can go on for pages about our experience here, but in sum, I would say I would highly recommend staying at the Lotte New York Palace for a quick getaway, an extended stay, or just a quick visit for a cocktail or bite. I hope you will enjoy it as much as we have enjoyed our home away from home.

title: The Lotte Palace is worth the stay
text:
I am visiting from out of state. New York is a new city for me. I must say, the level of hospitality at this hotel is A1!

Christian Ribeiro(concierge) gave such a great recommendation for good dining! The hotel must keep Christian! He’s great!

title: Lotte NY Palace's Tower Suite wowed us!
text: The suite's luxury and the breathtaking city views left us in awe! What truly set this experience apart was Sudha Sharma, Director of Housekeeping, at the hotel. Sudha's exceptional service and attention to detail made our stay memorable. She anticipated our needs and ensured our comfort throughout. This Hotel is where luxury meets exceptional service. Sudha Sharma and the entire team made our stay magical. We can't wait to return!

title: Fabulous Customer relations from the Guest Service Agents
text: Rebecca and Norma, the Guest Service Agents at Lotte New York Palace are fabulous at what they do, which is ensure that each guest feels special, even in difficult situations.  We had a snafu with a confirmed upgrade and the supervising manager had to rescind the offer.  However, Rebecca and Norma were able to step up and make sure an alternative was found and my trip was fabulous. The restaurants, spa, and rooms are classic NYC and made for an incredible weekend.

title: A True 5 Star Hotel
text:
I will keep it simple:
*Property is well maintained, world class standard
*Guest services are very knowledgeable, very personable, and provided great customer services. Rebecca served above and beyond expectations, truly an asset to Lotte!
* Location is excellent
* Food serve in the property is top notch

title: Not worth it
text:
This hotel is not worth the value we paid which was approximately $1036 for 2 nights. Let’s be clear, I’m not a tourist and so I am rooted in the reality that I live in one of the most expensive cities. That aside, had I known this was the rebranded Leona Helmsley hotel, it would have been a hard pass. 

We arrived close to 11PM and the porters stood in a huddle conversing while we struggled to get our things out of the car and locate a cart to get our things to the frontdesk. Checking in with as a nightmare as a large tour bus of Asian students in town for some team activities were checking in. Finally in our room, we greeted by the stained carpet with mismatched wall paper that looked like a knock off designer print. The room had a king bed and a printed couch that didn’t match either the drapes, carpet or the wall paper. It looked liked something someone dragged out of a thrift shop or Salvation Army. There was an odor we couldn’t quite get used to and outside our windows was loud. 

Getting assistance from hotel staff was a fight. We called up for more toiletries because they gave us one tiny bottle of shower gel. The order didn’t come up for another 40 mins. The next morning we asked for orange juice, same thing. We left the area and went to Harlem for brunch. Later that day we had dinner at Nobu Downtown and returned. We wanted to have some wine but needed glasses and that was a struggle. The very next morning was my partners bday. I attempted to order room service but that seemed to be a struggle too so against my wishes, I went to a nearby restaurant (The Smith’) that has a great reputation and brought back brunch. I stopped by the front desk and ask for a plate service and cart to be brought to the room so that I could surprise him with breakfast in bed that wasn’t being served in foil containers. I had balloons and cupcakes and was really trying. The attendant at the back desk let me know that she didn’t think they could assist with that. After about 20 mins the order finally arrived, struggling to get all the things into the room, I left one bag at the door to return for it. 1 min later I get back to the door and the bag is missing. I frantically go up and down the hallways only to see a cleaning lady with the bag. I was beyond frustrated. 

Overall, you’re paying for the location- in essence to be close to Rockerfeller Center and everything that neighborhood comes with, not for the actual property or it’s sub par service.

title: MILES WAS AMAZING
text: Spent my moms 50th birthday weekend here. Miles truly went above and beyond, we felt very well taken care of and enjoyed the interactions we had with all staff immensely. Room was beautiful and had an amazing view of the cathedral. I still dream about the bath robe LOL! 10/10 experience, can’t wait to come back!

title: A unique Manhatten expirience
text:
This hotel is truly exceptional. From the moment I booked with Brian, who exceeded my expectations with a budget-friendly proposal, to the warm welcome upon arrival, I knew I was in for a treat.

Impeccably clean rooms with breathtaking views and an outstanding restaurant led by made our stay unforgettable. The attentive staff and overall experience were top-notch. 

This exceptional hotel could further enhance its eco-friendliness by transitioning to refillable shower amenities, reducing plastic waste. Additionally, while our stay was wonderful, we had hoped to utilize the chauffeur service for a Manhattan ride, but it was unavailable. Nonetheless, we look forward to returning!

title: Ultimate in hotel luxury!!
text: I usually don’t do reviews but I had to share my incredible experience at Lotte NY Palace! Hotel manager, Francesca  was incredibly hospitable with our king bed room booking! This is not your typical  king bed hotel room, not even close. The room had the incredible floor 41 city viewing with St. Patrick at the forefront!  Beautiful, immaculately clean  and accommodating room with all the luxurious bells and whistles,  lush Bath robes,  slippers and towels! Shout out to all the staff from the parking to the concierge to the cleaning staff, all were gracious and you can tell were proud to be staff at this breathtaking hotel! Breakfast was delicious especially the marscapone pancakes! Cappuccinos from the coffee bar was delicious as well!   I’d most definitely come again and again As it’s my new favourite hotel in Manhattan!! Xo

title: High praise!
text: I recently had the most wonderful experience at the palace hotel. The service and hospitality were outstanding. Francesca Fiorianti really stood out. She made our experience even more special with her added care. Can’t wait to return!!!

title: We came back and we’ll be back again!
text:
Third time in as many years and this place never fails to deliver less than the exceptional.  The Palace is perfect in location,  the rooms are way above your average NY size, the standard of everything in this hotel is impeccable!

However, the best part of this property is the staff… cannot fault, the most friendly, welcoming and pleasant people you can wish to encounter.  George and Nana on the door remembered us from a visit a year ago and it absolutely made my little girls visit.  We shouldn’t have favourites but they were hers :-)

Wonderful place, exceptional staff…. We WILL be back 100%!

title: Iconic hotel that lives up to its name
text: Wonderful hotel with amazing room view of St Patrick’s Cathedral. Staff were brilliant and nothing was too much trouble for them. Lovely spacious room with the comfiest bed I’ve ever slept in. Enjoyed our morning coffee and pastry from the hotel cafe. Now spoiled to stay anywhere else in NYC. Can’t wait to book our next trip.

title: Extraordinary hotel experience!
text:
This is a special place, and my fourth visit here.  The Lotte Palace is comprised of the top 10 floors of the hotel, with a different layout of rooms and suites.  The front desk is set away from the general checkin for the lower floors, giving the whole process a lovely sense of exclusivity and charm.  Checkin was quick and easy, and Jim at the front desk is wonderful and welcoming.

I stayed in a one bedroom Tower Corner Suite ... very spacious and elegant, with a large comfy bedroom, and an expansive living room with sweeping views of the city, 1-1/2 marble bathrooms, and a kitchenette (microwave and fridge and sink, but no utensils or plates or even wine glasses, so not wildly useful).

There is a large work desk in the bedroom with plenty of plugs, and the internet is free and works well.  The interior furnishings are comfortable and traditional, and solidly built.  Lighting is controlled by a series of panels that offer different moods, and it works well.  There is a large in-room safe, and fully towels and robes.

The bathroom is large and clad in marble (and there is a guest powder room as well), with a separate shower stall and bathtub, two sinks, and acres of counter space.  Spotlessly clean!

Newspapers are available in the lobby in the morning, and over the weekend complimentary champagne was served  in the lobby as well.

What makes this property unique?  Extraordinary views.  Solid traditional furnishings.  Lots of space.  A feeling of elegance and grace.  Most of all the friendly and cheerful staff ... from the morning cafe crew, to checkin, to the housekeeping staff I felt welcome at every turn.

Thank you!!!

title: Fantastic reception and guest service
text: Norma has been absolutely amazing. We arrived late evening after a flight delay. Norma was very efficient with checking us in. We were pleasantly surprised with the accommodation, and the suite that Norma had place us in was very spacious with an amazing view of the city. Norma made us feel very welcome and always has a pleasant smile whenever we see her. Norma is one of the main reasons that we have been enjoying our stay!!!!

title: Excelente servicio y atención, en especial Dalmasi muy atenta hizo nuestra estadía extraordinaria. Ubicación excelente..
text:
Excelente servicio y atención, en especial Dalmasi muy atenta haciendo nuestra estadía extraordinaria. Excelente ubicación y los servicio de desayuno bar y room service de excelente calidad.
La recamaras amplias y limpias, Baños muy cómodos.

title: Great location, clean and great staff!!!
text: Great experience and great location!! Shout out to Eddie and Maurice who made sure me and my kiddos were taken care of. It’s far enough away from the crazy, but close enough if that makes sense. Would love to stay here again! Kids will remember this one forever!

title: Service
text: the hair dryer in my room didn't work and I was traveling for work.  I called once and they said they would be up in 5 minutes.  I called back after 15 minutes, and they said they were on their way up.  I called after 30 minutes, and they stopped answering my call.  it was over 40 minutes and if you are traveling for business, it's important you get ready on time to meet meeting deadlines and I was late due to this.  The second day I ordered room service, and the food was not the best.

title: Exploitative, unhelpful, tired, dated and one to avoid
text: Tired, dated, inflexible, exploitative. Do not stay here. We stayed August 2023, after long flights we waited half an hour in line to check in to one poor soul in reception. Whilst other colleagues in the area ignored our (and others) repeated requests to give her help. We the following morning we were amazed to find an empty place where the coffee machine should be and discovered that a) it has to be requested and b) there is a €35 installation charge as it’s a room service offering - in a 5*, $500 a night room! A croissant at the patisserie is 6.50, the peloton in the gym doesn’t work. Water, a beer and a cocktail at the bar is $55. The rooms are old, scuffed, tired and dated, not even a place to rest your dirty suitcase other than on your bed. I only placed 1* as zero isn’t an option. Stay elsewhere… the W, Omni, Peninsula, you’ll have a considerably better time in better surroundings.

title: So much choice in NYC…so don’t chose this
text: It’s 2023. Everything about this hotel experience is 1973. Unhelpful desk. Simple asks including can we have a coffee machine in room, or a late check out met with resistance. The  gym is ok, but the bikes needed toe straps and simple maintenance that betrays a lack of care. The Gold bar is striking but over priced and - as a resident French person - the idea of paying $6.5 for a croissant in the lobby bakery is ridiculous. That is more than you pay in Paris. In short. This hotel needs a new Executive team. A whole bunch of money spent to update it and a new front desk team that are inspired to serve. Look for another hotel…

title: Great Experience at Lotte NY Palace
text:
The whole experience was wonderful. Starting with the check-in, Lincy was patient and took the time to work with us. I feel she went over and beyond accommodating our early check in requirements. The room was wonderful with a great view and Charles the Bellman was super helpful with many suggestions on things to see in NYC. Really likes the Roosevelt Island experience which he recommended. 
Lotte is a great place to stay at. Staffs were kind and helpful. Recommend staying there when visiting NYC.

title: Amazing stay
text: My stay was very comfortable. The service was great, attentive staff, the room was clean and so cozy. What I love the most about my stay in this hotel is that it's so accessible and safe. Had a great time!

title: Great Service
text:
My stay at the Lotte was an exquisite blend of luxury, comfort, and exceptional service. The hotel's commitment to providing an unparalleled guest experience is truly commendable. I left with cherished memories and a genuine longing to return. If you're looking for a hotel that offers a seamless fusion of elegance, convenience, and top-notch service, I wholeheartedly recommend the Lotte. It's a true gem that promises a stay beyond compare. Vacations like this creates memories that last a lifetime thanks to the entire staff at The Lotte especially Miles & Alexandra… 
They made our trip extraordinary & we can’t wait to come back!

title: A Staple for a Reason
text:
Arriving at the Lotte New York Palace is like arriving at home.  A sense of calm settles in.  

Mari Doyle, the reservation agent, went out of her way to make sure my requests were fulfilled.  She was a super star.  

I received an email from Francesca Fiorianti, Director of Reservation, checking on me!!

Even before I arrived the Concierge Staff were assisting me.  Concierge Deigo Chinigo made transportation arrangements upon my request.  And he sent a second email to make sure everything was perfect!!

Concierge Ani Bedrossian offered several excellent suggestions.  He got me into a reservation in a "hard to get" restaurant to eat.  He checked on me several times before the meal.  It was a perfect event!

The housekeeping staff was incredible.  The hotel was full but every time I entered my room it "sparkled!"  

The doorman George made my trip super.  He took my cell phone and fixed an issue.  George has been getting me cabs for over 30 years.  Another reason to keep coming back.  

The doorman, Fran,  made sure the cab driver knew exactly where I wanted to go.  

I always feel safe when a doorman looks after you personally. 

The entire concierge was always willing to assist. 

I am sure I have forgotten people who made my visit perfect.  From the cashier who assisted with coffee in the morning to the doorman who offered me an umberlla.

It was a perfect trip.  I can't wait to return.

title: WAY OVERPRICED & DAMAGED VEHICLE
text: My family & I stayed at the Lotte for a few nights and had no choice but to use their valet for around $100 a night. When we checked out it took 45 minutes to get our vehicle which seemed very strange (The bell men agreed). We packed up the car and went on our way. We stopped about an hour after for a break and noticed a lot of deep yellow scratches on the front side corner of our BMW SUV. We called the hotel immediately to report it, however, it was so difficult to get in touch with the front desk. In fact, someone who answered at the hotel said good luck they will probably deny it. We finally got a hold of the General Manager after an hour of trying. At first he seemed very professional but after 3 weeks of back and forth he has completely brushed it under the rug. The valet clearly banged the side of the SUV on the yellow cement post in the tiny NYC garage where they parked my vehicle and that explains why he took 45 min to bring our SUV to us... We will have no choice but to take legal action against the hotel & the valet garage. So unfortunate and such a turn off. For a so called 5 star hotel to act so classless is disgusting.  We spent so much money at the Lotte (SO OVERPRICED) and to be treated this way it unacceptable. The garage is clearly dishonest and the Lotte clearly do not care about their customers. Stay away, there are so many better options!!!

title: Never Again!
text:
My wife and I have stayed at the Lotte Palace several times in the past (when it was just "The Palace).  We booked a month in advance through American Express Platinum, asking for a room with twin beds.
An expected upgrade was of no use, since they did not have any twin rooms available.  The room we were checked into had a view of a "wall.,"  directly across from our room, with almost no sunlight.  The first evening it was chilly in the room and the thermostat would not turn on the heat.  The hotel sent up a employee to check things out and told us that there was no heat available, as this was summer.  He said he would talk to the manager about changing our room to one on the sunny side of the hotel, and guess what -- we never heard back.  Finally, we had to have the sheet changed because there was a black stain on it from a prior guest.  For $500 a night, the room was nothing special.

title: Fantabulous Lux Hotel stay!
text:
We booked a two bedroom and 2 bathrooms suite 
The manager Miles Gomez was amazing. The hotel, the plush suite, the views…
Amazing! 
It’s hotel for celebrities, for dignitaries and for a fab vacation 

Miles made HS feel at home away from home (Lux  home).

title: A great choice for a hotel in mid-town Manhattan
text: A very good hotel in mid-town Manhattan. Friendly staff, starting with the front desk (we were well looked after by Lincy).  spacious rooms, excellent fitness center and spa. We keep coming back and find it good value.

title: Luxury at the Towers; perfect location, spacious rooms and great views.
text: We stayed in The Towers, the top 14 floors of the Lotte New York Palace.  This was an excellent place to stay in our opinion.  It is a beautiful, timeless hotel. The rooms were very spacious with great views.  It isn't new, but we had every amenity we needed, and it was extremely clean and well maintained.  You just know when you have stayed at a classy, 5-star hotel, as it is miles above the rest.  The staff was very attentive, and took care of everything we needed, from water to complimentary evening champagne, and made great dinner reservations.  It is a perfect location, close to shows and shopping, one block removed from the bustle.  Great bar and coffee shop onside.  Room service including late night offerings.  We stayed in room 4616.  You cannot put a price on luxury accommodations, comfort, space and excellent customer service.  This will be our go-to hotel when we return to NYC.

title: Great value for a higher end, hotel, fantastic Location and great staff
text:
The hotel is our go to Hotel every year when we are in New York, the room, so beautiful and clean if you were spectacular and the staff is exceptional

Arlene in the coffee shop is the best thing about waking up early and getting a cup of coffee, unbelievable attitude, huge smile, friendly, and fun. Michele at the spa is incredibly attentive, customer service oriented, and makes working out a pleasure.

The elevators are a bit slow, they were a few times during our weeks day that it took over five minutes to get an elevator, they should find a way to increase the speed or use additional elevators to help lighten the load?

title: Great place, family friendly environment, great food
text:
This was my first time in this hotel; my expectation was exceeded.
Positive experience in the room clean, customer service, room service, great view, check-in, and check-out. 
Close to the main places I wanted to visit.

title: The Best in Town
text:
J'ai récemment séjourné au Lotte New York Palace et globalement, j'ai eu une expérience très positive. Le personnel était formidable, en particulier Isabella Concierge et Michael à la réception, qui ont été extrêmement serviables et professionnels et qui ont su gérer les quelques lacunes avec un professionnalisme unique !

Cependant, j'ai remarqué quelques lacunes concernant le nettoyage de ma chambre et la préparation pour la nuit. Certaines zones semblaient avoir été négligées, ce qui était un peu décevant.

Malgré cela, je dois dire que l'hôtel en lui-même est magnifique, avec une ambiance luxueuse et élégante. La situation centrale de l'établissement est également un avantage considérable pour explorer la ville.

En résumé, mon séjour au Lotte New York Palace a été agréable, surtout grâce au personnel amical et attentionné. Je recommanderais cet hôtel à d'autres voyageurs, en gardant à l'esprit de vérifier les détails du nettoyage lors de leur séjour.

title: Another outstanding stay
text: We just returned from a wonderful stay in a corner suite in the Towers at the Lotte New York Palace.  I have been staying at the best NYC hotels for over 35 years and the Tower corner suites are among my favorite accommodations.  They are huge, well furnished and exceptionally quiet from both the city traffic below and any hotel noise.  The hotel itself is perfectly situated in midtown in close proximity to shopping, restaurants,  art galleries, businesses and Central Park. As usual, the staff was consistently attentive and responded to all requests.  In particular, Anna-Marie—who was working the Tower front desk when we checked in—was outstanding.  She quickly resolved an unavoidable hiccup that arose upon check-in and, for the rest of our stay, made us feel at home by always greeting us by name and checking to see if we needed any additional assistance.  Anna-Marie provided exemplary service.  Overall, another outstanding experience at this hotel.

title: Bad aftertaste not improving.
text:
After my stay I left an overall fairly ok review. However, one item left a bad aftertaste, one item “stolen” from me. 
Mrs. Becky Hubbard responded to my review, stating that I would be contacted direct on this matter. This has not happened until today. Makes you wonder what their real level of customer service is or if the message was merely window dressing to the benefit of TripAdvisor readers …..

title: Excellent stay; wonderful location; exceptional customer service
text: Our Lotte Hotel was stay was exceptional in a multiplicity of ways. First, the room was commodious, comfortable, and convenient. That is to say, the lighting system was easy to use; the blackout shades keep the room dark at night; the shower had excellent water pressure. Second, but, more importantly, all staff members were solicitous to all our needs, especially Michael at the front desk and Sophia the cleaner. We know where we will stay the next time we come to NYC.

title: Great stay at Lotte New York Palace
text: Another great stay at Lotte New York Palace.  I started coming here about 10 years ago when I started bringing my family in the summertime and this hotel continues to be great for so many different reasons. Miles and Clara went above and beyond to welcome us from the moment we arrived.  The rooms are really comfortable and pomme palace is perfect for morning coffee and breakfast.  Centrally located to all the best shops and restaurants, your close to everything. Saks and St. Patrick’s Cathedral are across the street.  A new Starbucks and cool art gallery as well.  Rockefeller center is a block away.  Great location!

title: Marc-Marie brought the gold room vibes !!!
text: It was my fiancés birthday and we went to the gold room bar for a little night cap. Marc-Marie was our FABULOUS bartender. She was incredible. A+++++ made the perfect ending to our night. Give 👏🏻 her👏🏻 a 👏🏻raise !!!

title: Hands down, iconic location and top notch staff
text: I had my wedding here and I must tell you it was top notch!  It was more than I could have dreamed of.  We brought close friends and had our ceremony in the Penthouse Suite!  The Suite is a multi level, stunning room and decorated beautifully.  I worked with Beth and Danielle for this special event and they did not disappoint.  They both respond in a timely manner and pay attention to every detail......always one step ahead of me with ways to make our weekend spectacular.  Beth and Danielle were so professional, but so warm.  It was easy working with them and I did not have one worry as the date of my wedding was getting closer.  They both greeted all of our guests and were available during our event.  I have stayed at The Palace for many years, it is a wonderful experience.....but to have Beth and Danielle and The Palace all part of this special day was just perfection!

title: Sustained its High Standards...as always
text: We visit NYC at least twice a year, always staying at the Palace because of the high standards it sets for elegance and good service. Once again, immaculately clean and well-furnished rooms with a bright decor in general. Our room, a cathedral room view with king bed, was very pleasing and comfortable. Got FREE WiFi this time, a big plus. Didn't dine at restaurant--Villard/Gold Room--on this visit, but was glad to see that the atmospheric downstair's bar, the Trouble's Trust, had reopened, and had tasty drinks there. The Pomme Palais this time, and always, has been a good spot to pick up breakfast sandwiches and pastries and good coffee. Cannot overemphasize that every aspect of service is outstanding: from those greeting you at your car or cab, helping with your luggage, attending to your rooms, and meeting you when checking in or out. Super friendly and super helpful. A special shout-out to Natsuko, who always goes above and beyond to make a great experience even better.

title: Exceptional Stay @ Lotte Palace
text: My stay at the Lotte Palace was exceptional! The property was elegant and clean however the exceptional service is what made my stay even better. Miles Gomez the front office manager was outstanding and extremely accommodating. He ensured my room requests were met and even called after I checked in to ensure everything was to my liking. The entire staff offered first class service and I’d be remiss if I didn’t mention Norma the guest service agent who was just outstanding! She was attentive and thoughtful and even gave me a teddy bear for my niece who would be visiting. I travel to NY quite often for work and Lotte Palace without a doubt is now my preferred hotel. Huge thank you to Miles and Norma for exemplifying first class service in a first class way! See you soon

title: The only place I will stay in the city.
text: The Lotte is the only place I will stay when I'm in the city. It is always so clean, professional, and elegant. The staff goes above and beyond to make my stays perfect. From the moment I walk in the door I am treated like royalty. The bellmen are amazing, especially Henry, they took great care of my bags from the moment I walked in the door. Maurice, in the lobby, gives the best Gossip Girl Tour and is so friendly. Miles, The Front Office Manager went above and beyond to make our stay amazing. I would recommend this hotel to everyone looking for a welcoming place in the city.

title: Great experience. The only place I will stay.
text: I absolutely love coming here. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. Henry was so sweet taking our things up to our room! Our last day Maurice gave me the best gossip girl tour and showed me all the spots they filmed here! Lastly, Miles was incredible! He greeted us and helped us with our rooms. He makes sure that you have the best experience there! This place wouldn’t be the same without them!

title: Family Wedding weekend
text: I am writing to give a glowing review of the service we recently received at the NY Lotte.   The staff that met us at the entrance and the bellmen who brought our belongings to our room were incredibly friendly and helpful as were the wonderful staff cleaning the rooms, and supplying towels, etc.. to meet our needs.   However, most notably, both Anita Yang and Erica Shea, who worked with us for the better part of a year, figuring out the best solution to our wedding weekend needs were incredible patient and polite in answering our questions and providing information about what we were booking relative to the web site images, etc..  I could reach out to them at any time and they were very responsive, answering the phones and getting back to us with answers to all of our questions.   As you can imagine, planning to be in midtown Manhattan for our son's wedding took some doing from other parts of the country.  They were incredible and I cannot imagine staying anyplace else just due to their considerate and responsive demeanor every time we spoke to them.   Kudos to the Lotte for hiring such professionals!   Thank you!

title: Lotte New York plaza is the best place to stay in New York!
text: We just stayed at the Lotte New York palace for 4 great nights. I want to give a shout out to Miles Gomez for making our stay so special. Staying for a long weekend with my daughter he couldn’t have been more accommodating to us and making us feel special! Highly recommend this hotel, the rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated. The service and staff are exceptional!

title: Family Vacation
text:
Hola,
I was vacationing with my family. We arrived late night. As I was waiting to be seen, we noticed a team checking in and was greeted by bell staff member named Angel who assisted us with information as well as to our room. He also had a good sense of humor which I love because we are a family that likes jokes. He told us that we are VIPs at the Lotte Palace. My family and I felt very special. We went to him for most of our needs during our stay. He was extremely helpful!

title: Having the most amazing time at The Lotte for our 36th anniversary
text: Having a wonderful time at this beautiful hotel. They have made our 36th anniversary so special. Can’t thank Miles, Ani, Eddie and everyone enough for truly going the extra mile to make it special. We hate to be leaving and can’t wait until our next visit.

title: Excellent Hotel and service!!!
text: Hotel was fabulous!!!! Visited NY for my husbands birthday. First time staying here. Will use this hotel in the future. Thankful for our honest maid, Utra. My husband left his wedding band in the room and we were so grateful when we returned it was there where he left it. Great cafe in lobby!!! Perfect stay!

title: Wonderful Hotel soon to be even better
text: Our family of 4 (all 18+) stayed in a Tower Suite in July. Staff were excellent, especially housekeeping and the very helpful concierge (Diego!). My son and I loved "Rarities", a bar serving rare (but always expensive) libations that had the vibe of your English great uncle's country manor house. We missed Le Cirque, but the courtyard is undergoing renovation that is nearly finished and the hotel will be even better when that is done. Our room was large and comfortable, although approaching that point in its lifespan where renovation will be appropriate. Pricing was not cheap but compared to other hotels in the City where you could get two bathrooms behind a single door it was quite competitive. Location was great for our itinerary; would definitely stay again.

title: Best Experience!
text: We had the most amazing experience at the Lotte New York Palace. I was traveling with a friend and our daughters for prom dress shopping. We were extremely surprised when we checked into the hotel and were upgraded to a luxurious suite. The suite was beautiful, luxurious and huge - nothing we have ever experienced before. We had so much fun. The service at the hotel was amazing! Miles, the front office manager, was always checking in on us to make sure we had everything we needed. We have the best memories from this trip!

title: Perfect Location
text:
We asked our travel advisor to book a nice hotel that's well located and reasonably priced as don't expect to be spending much time there due to exploring. 

We knew were were going to be awake due to travel overnight so contacted Lotte New York Palace to ask if we are able to check in earlier than 3pm as we needed to get some rest before starting to explore. Diego responded advising he would inform reception of our request but couldn't guarantee a room would be ready which we understood.

On arrival doormen helped us in with our bags and showed us to check in. The entrance was grand and looked beautiful with a large staircase.

Teresa on the check in desk asked for our names and a contact number to text when our rooms ready. Our phones weren't working without data roaming. We explained the conversation we had with Diego and Terasa advised again there's no rooms ready so to go out for a bit, we explained we were far too tired so may have to find a quiet corner of the lobby to sit down and get some rest, on saying this Teresa suddenly found a room that was ready, i'm not sure why this wasn't offered to start with. It came across very much we weren't the clientele they wanted sitting in reception. 

We went to our room, it was very basic and dated however did what we needed for the stay. Teresa didn't explain to us any of the amenities of the hotel or even which way to go to find the elevators to our room. We therefore contacted concierge to find out what if any restaurants the hotel has and how to connect to the Wi-Fi so we could plan each day over breakfast before leaving the hotel. 

Concierge were exceptionally helpful explaining the amenities, we were informed if we wanted to use Wi-Fi its $16 day which although isn't a huge amount we were frustrated this was something being charged when just about every shop / restaurant / hotel now days offer free Wi-Fi. We ended up going to Starbucks each morning to plan the day across the road.

The hotels location is perfect, its next to St Patricks Cathedral, walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. 

Unfortunately I left a pair of earrings on the sideboard when going out and when coming back one was gone so we think the cleaner accidentally discarded this when cleaning, we searched the room thoroughly incase she had dropped it elsewhere, however no trace, we found lots of dust though when starting to move things around on the bedside tables. 

Overall, ideal location and the comfiest of beds,

title: The Palace lives up to its name
text: Great hotel in fantastic location. As a woman traveling alone I felt very safe and welcome here. Huge rooms with great views. Appreciated the slippers. The bathroom was dark and I found it hard to apply makeup. Nevertheless, I will be back. Hotel lives up to its name.
