title: Wedding Weekend Room Block
text:
I cannot find enough kind words to describe the Group Sales Department at the Lotte New York Palace. I coordinated the room block for our out-of-town guests for my son and daughter in law’s wedding several weeks ago. I am still on Cloud 9 thinking about the professionalism, attentiveness and warmth exhibited to our families and guests during the planning process and the wedding weekend. The hotel where your guests stay during a wedding weekend is very important to the entire event and the Lotte exceeded all our expectations. When looking up the word hospitality in the dictionary, the names, Anita Yang, Erica Shea, Randee Beyhan, Emily O’Halloran, and Danielle Gilman appear. I was so lucky to work with each of them, from working on the contract, to getting room reservation updates throughout to helping with all the special arrangements that come up even on the last day. Their responsiveness and graciousness were amazing even in the tension filled, demanding last days before the wedding.
The hotel is beautiful and spotless, and the rooms are very large especially for New York City. From the time we entered the hotel for the weekend, we truly felt as though we were in a Palace. The door staff, bell staff and front desk were excellent introductions to the hotel and made the start of the wedding weekend terrific. Security, needed when locked out of our room, was prompt and courteous and the housekeeping staff was friendly and wanted to take care of our every need. Our guests’ welcome bags were delivered on time and correctly. A special thank you also to Ruthie, the front desk manager during our weekend. She made us feel as if we were in a hotel in a small town, not in New York City. She met us once only upon check-in and was on duty as we came in from the wedding reception. She greeted us by name and asked how the wedding was…that sums up our feelings about the Lotte New York Palace. 
I cannot recommend a hotel more highly.

title: Most accommodating hotel in NYC!
text: We absolutely love everything about this hotel. The location is excellent and the views 😍😍 We enjoyed a wonderful breakfast there each morning and Dalmasi always takes the absolute BEST care of us while we are there! We can’t wait to return in December!

title: Nice reception!
text: Very welcoming. Big thanks to Peter who gave us a very warm welcome after a long journey and was super helpful during our stay! Nice rooms in a great part of Manhattan with great employees like Peter! Highly recommend!

title: POMME PALAIS
text: If you are looking for the best COLD BREW and staff in NYC, look no further than the POMME PALAIS!!!!!!!  I have getting coffee there for the past 7 years, it is HANDS DOWN THE BEST staff in the UNITED STATES.  Arleni, Sam, Carlos, Deborah, Andrew, and Mark are the best in the business!!!!!!!! If you want a fresh coffee and a friendly staff, LOOK no further!!!!

title: Flawless Service Execution
text: From the bellman to the bartenders, service was exceptional. Truly loved our stay. The property offered a convenient location, elevated amenities and a personal touch. Highly recommend to those seeking a traditional NYC luxury experience with modern flair.

title: Great stay!
text:
Wonderful stay! We were greeted so graciously by Norma at the front desk who checked us in and couldn’t have been nicer! 

The hotel lobby and lobby lounges were great and clean and the room was clean and serviced daily. The coffee shop downstairs was perfect for a morning jolt without having to go outside on a particularly hot week in nyc. Wish we could have tried more of the amenities and spa. 

Would definitely rebook!

title: Excellent. Staff super friendly
text: The hotel is very good. the perfect location. The service of the staff is excellent, super friendly. The restaurant is also super good and beautiful. They gave us a room in which the air conditioning did not work well and it felt very humid and hot, the staff immediately offered solutions in the kindest way of all. I would definitely recommend everyone to stay at this hotel.

title: Trapped in New York
text: We were stuck in New York due flight cancellation by JetBlue after taxiing on the runway for three hours. On top of this our flight from Ireland was delayed by 1.5 hrs so we had hard time catching the flight that never took off. Needless to say we were all exhausted after traveling since 2 AM and then the horrible service at JFK. Thanks a million for the absolutely wonderful service at the Lotte New York Palace as not only did they take in 9 people in two rooms late at night ( including my 88 yr old grandmother and my parents who were celebrating their 50th anniversary early this year), they were super sweet on top of it. I will definitely come to this hotel again and would recommend to my friends.

title: Perfect Stay
text: Our entire stay was absolutely perfect ! We were celebrating our anniversary in the city and stayed at the Palace for the night. All of the staff was very attentive during our stay. The hotel staff were all so polite and pleasant. The hospitality at this hotel went  above and beyond. Every staff member we encountered asked us how our stay was going and wanted to confirm that we were enjoying our stay at the hotel. The room was more  beautiful than I expected. We were very impressed with the room we stayed in. We had an amazing view. We saw the of the top of St. Patrick’s Cathedral out of our window and it was gorgeous. We cannot wait to stay at this hotel again. This is the first  hotel room that made us want to spend the the entire evening in and just relax in the room.

title: Best NYC Stay!
text: My stay at the Lotte New York Palace hotel was an epic one. Upon arriving at the hotel I was greeted by multiple bellmen. When I was ready to go up to the room a bellman by the name of Angel assisted my family and I up stairs with our luggage. It almost felt like I was talking to a family member or friend. He was so kind to us and gave us so many options for us to do while on vacation. Through out our stay, we would run into him and he would address me by my name. Made my family and I feel welcomed. Our room and stay was outstanding! I Would definitely recommend!!

title: Best Treatment!
text: I checked in last week , evening time , and I have to say the service was outstanding, a bellman by the name of Angel didn’t waste no time in greeting me and my family, told us all about the hotel and the wonders of NYC! He also helped us to our room and gave us detailed information of the room. His name fits him well and made our stay here one to remember. Will definitely recommend to friends and family!

title: Amazing Management and Views!
text:
I was visiting the Lotte for a business conference and had added an extra day so that my significant other could join me for her first time in NYC. The room I was originally assigned didn't have the greatest view. I dropped by the front desk and spoke with the evening manager, Noah. I explained my situation and he said he would do everything he could to help and that I should drop by the next day. I did so and Noah had arranged a different room with the most amazing view of any room I've had in any hotel.

I would absolutely stay here again, because the staff go the extra mile to make special occasions special. Thanks again Noah!

title: The BEST Manhattan in Manhattan!
text: Over the past 8-10 years, my girlfriend and I have met in NYC on many occasions throughout the year, and we always specifically like to attend The Metropolitan Museum to view the Met Gala Exhibit.  We also love to explore interesting and historic bars during our visits.  We always have a Manhattan (or two) in Manhattan.  Among the wonderful bars, all of whom have served us delicious Manhattans, are:  Bemelmans at The Carlyle, The Campbell, Sir Harry’s at the Waldorf, The Champagne Bar at The Plaza, The Pierre, The Blue Bar at The Algonquin, The Panorama Room at The Graduate, and The King Cole Bar at The St. Regis.  On our most recent trip, we were delighted that, between events, we were able to get to The Gold Bar at the Lotte New York Palace.  The hostess was lovely and gave us a little tour of the area surrounding upstairs and in the bar.  As usual, we ordered our Manhattans, mine on the rocks and hers straight up.  Well, after one tiny sip of our drinks made by Mile, our Bartender, our eyes widened and we turned to each other in amazement and delight!  So delicious!  Then and there, we declared it the best Manhattan we’d had in Manhattan!!!  We chatted with Mile and some guests sitting around us, then asked if the Manager of the hotel would speak with us.  He came down shortly, and we complimented him on the politeness and professionalism of Mile and the Hostess, and shared that we were enjoying the best Manhattan we’d had in New York.  He was delighted.  This is a ‘must do’ if you are of the same ilk as my friend and I are!

title: Not worth it!
text:
Forgot to review this last summer and someone recently Asked about it which reminded me to review. Got a decent rate through visa. $500 pn. Stayed 3 nights. Liked the location. Have been to Manhattan many times and stay in different areas. This hotel was oddly incompetent at the front desk in check in and check out. The room was dated and dingy. No usb ports and very few outlets. The bathroom was so so Small! And the tub had a plastic curtain 😭. I would not call
This a 5 star property. 

Hotel bar was nice but lacking atmosphere and underwhelming. Breakfast was included but they kept bringing us food of we didn’t want and then we were over our limit so paid for it! Each am breakfast was over $130!! It was crazy expensive to begin with but the included tipping was clearly motivating. Then I added more as I usually do. All of the bar and restaurant servers were men … why is that? These are the best paying jobs in a hotel service dept so lack
Of women is troubling. 

Door men were only There to hail cabs and get tips. Really Annoying. Not impressed at all and Would never stay here again.

title: A Stark Decline in Service and Comfort at Lotte New York Palace
text:
I am truly disappointed to report the substantial decline in quality and service at the Lotte New York Palace. What used to be a magnificent hotel now suffers from significant staffing issues that reflect negatively on the entire experience.

To start, the room amenities were subpar. The fridge in our room was not only turned off, but also blocked, rendering it unusable. Additionally, the lack of a coffee machine forced us to venture downstairs for our morning caffeine fix, which turned out to be an expensive endeavor. 

What was more disappointing was the seemingly careless approach to room maintenance. For instance, we spent an entire day without fresh towels. Also, the light switches were faulty and inconsistent in operation, making for an inconvenient stay.

Our breakfast experience only compounded our discontent. Although it was included in our booking, the execution left much to be desired. On the first day, a 30-minute wait forced us to forgo our breakfast. On receiving the advice to reserve a table, I attempted to do so the following day, only to be met with no response despite two phone calls.

When we finally arrived for our so-called "reservation", we were told that there would be an additional wait of 40 minutes. The reason given was, once again, the lack of staff - the same issue which apparently prevented them from answering the phone earlier.

In conclusion, our stay at the Lotte New York Palace was marked by numerous shortcomings. These ranged from poor room conditions to substandard service, both of which fell far below our expectations. The hotel needs to urgently address these issues to regain its status as a luxury destination.

title: No in-room coffee.
text: I travel frequently on business and cannot remember the last time I stayed in a four star hotel that did not have in-room coffee or coffee availability in the lobby. The Korean Lotte group does not know how to run a global hotel. Stick to the local Korean market.

title: Beware of toilets
text: Upon check in the  staff was gracious , but our room had a toilet that did not flush (admittedly by maintenance it’s a very old toilet that overflows .. solution is to call back when indeed the toilet overflows every time). I called twice for another room at 12:15am and guest services left me on hold after hearing the problem and then hung up on me twice. Sad as one should expect a working toilet for this price .

title: Disappointed
text: Could have been at the Peninsula for less!!! Wish we had done that. Because my last visit to Lotte was such  a disaster ( tv didn’t work toilet didn’t flush and we got locked out of our room) they upgraded me to the Towers. Larger room very nicely appointed. However the shower flooded the bathroom and created quite a mess for my husband and the maid.  The toilet is designed for a midget. Likewise the sink. BTW after you get this upgraded  room be prepared to spend another $5 or more for coffee in the morning!!!??? And if you finish work early and would like to chill at the bar, there isn’t one open until 5 pm!!! What kind of good hotel has no bar?

title: Luxury NYC experience!
text: My family and I stayed at this luxurious hotel this past week. From the moment we got there, we were treated with white glove service. Everyone was attentive, kind, and helpful to our every need. The front office manager, Miles went above and beyond for all of us. He truly rolled out a red carpet experience and made our visit a memorable one. I highly recommend this hotel if you’re looking for a top notch experience in NYC. You will not be disappointed!

title: 10/10 recommend! Thanks for your help Miles
text: I stayed at the Lotte New York Palace in the towers for a bachelorette weekend with six other women and we had the BEST time! Miles Gomez helped us tremendously during our time there! He recommended stores, restaurants near by and made sure we were comfortable through our stay. Our suite was absolutely gorgeous! We couldn't recommend this place enough.

title: Grateful to the incredibly kind staff
text: Wow. Customer service at its finest. We could not have imagined a better experience. I arrived with my family at 1:30 in the morning with no reservation. We had a very long day after missing a connection at JFK and had just been charged an exorbitant fee for the ride to the hotel. Jorge greeted us warmly. He provided us with a terrific room and extended our check out time to give us a chance to recuperate. Room service kindly brought us meals even though we called just minutes before closing at 2AM. Very grateful for encountering such nice people at a very comfortable and luxurious hotel. Thank you to all who made the experience so great!

title: A Wwekend to Remember
text: From the moment we stepped out of our car until the moment we drove away our experience at Lotte Palace was memorable. Check in took very little time and the adjoining rooms we requested were provided. The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated.  The service was impeccable and we were treated “royalty”. My grand-nephews were totally blown away by the whole experience, and were especially impressed with breakfast.

title: Lotte New York Palace
text: Recently I stayed at the tower section located at Lotte New York Palace on Friday June 16th, the service was great, room was spotless, Sudha Sharma was extremely helpful in accommodating us and making us feel extremely welcomed. We were very pleased with her especially with her attention to detail. This was one of the best nights in New York City. View was amazing and room was very spacious and well decorated. I would definitely be back soon.

title: Fabulous hotel, well situated in Central New York
text:
Absolutely fabulous. We had a upgraded huge bedroom overlooking the towers of the cathedral.

Large comfy bed, sofa and chairs and large ensuite. All well decorated and quiet.

The hotel does offer meals , but a cruise customers we had a separate breakfast, which was self service. We were told the hotel breakfast was about 50-60 dollars. There is a large entrance hall and seperate sitting area. Free WiFi 

It's well situated in terms of the metro and local restaurants.  The concierge was really helpful in terms of what to do and where to eat. The hotel offers a first come first served car and driver free within a 30 minute radius. We thought hotel service was excellent.  But it is very expensive.

title: Returning to NYC after so many years. My mother use to work at the Palace when Leona Hensley was the queen of the hotels. So gla
text: Huge thank you to the head of house keeping Mrs Suda for being so king and making sure our stay was a pleasant one.  All it took was 1 call and they had a shower chair and a fridge for my meds in under 10 minutes.  Most places I've stayed don't even have a shower chair to say the least a fridge for medical use. It was a great stay .

title: Everything was to perfection
text: Everything was perfect, from my interaction with Suda, to getting checked in with Sandy. The room was clean, the beds were sooo comfy. Definitely will be staying at Lotte New Palace next time in town. It is a must to stay at the Towers!!!

title: Wedding Block
text: We were there for our wedding block.   The hotel and staff were fabulous!!!   We couldn't have ask for more. From the rooms to the food to the service, we are thrilled.  The hotel seemed very busy but the service level remained stellar.

title: Excellent problem resolution. Highly recommend.
text: Initially, our check in was troublesome, including being checked into uncleaned rooms. When we brought this to the attention of the manager, Noah, he immediately redressed the problem, upgraded our room and made us feel special. Thereafter, Noah followed up with our family to ensure everything was as expected.

title: Amazing staff and rooms !!
text: The people here are so nice Haiti , Samir and Martha i really enjoyed my time in the hotel . They made our experience so good, the food was amazing , cleaning and laundry was on point , extraordinary !

title: Anticipating a Remarkable 36th Anniversary at Lotte New York Palace
text: My wife and I have explored numerous hotels in the city, but once we discovered the Lotte New York Palace, there was no turning back. We eagerly look forward to celebrating our 36th anniversary at this remarkable hotel, where the charm and unmatched service have won us over completely. From the warm welcome by Miles, Nancy, Ruth, Ani, Samir, Eddie, Papa, and Chris, to the breathtaking views of the city skyline from our suite, every moment spent at Lotte New York Palace has been a true delight. It is their dedication and genuine care that make our stay truly special. Lotte New York Palace has become our go-to destination, where we can escape, relax, and create cherished memories. Once you experience the magic created by the amazing staff, you'll understand why we never looked back.

title: They exude great customer service and beyond
text: Lotte New York Palace, welcoming accommodating, respectful, informative. Every employee truly enjoyed providing top notch service, hence the name of the hotel Lotte New York Palace. Royal SERVICE. PURE ELEGANCE!!!!!

title: Wonderful time at The Towers
text: This hotel stay was spectacular. I had my brother staying with me and I asked Sandy if it was possible to get a room with 2 beds due to my brother being a wounded veteran. She went above and beyond to accommodate us with no problem. Ms. Suda was very helpful. The room was in the Towers, and this was room was spacious, extremely clean. Definitely coming back to the Towers when I'm back in NYC.

title: MXF - Always a pleasure staying at NY PH (Business)
text:
Every year we stay at New York Palace for business, Tamara (ESM) always with great attention and service and of course all the Concierge Team EXCELENT!!!, I appreciate all you great help in our meetings.

 -Isabella
-Ani
-Diego
-Rene
-Kal
-Christian

title: Best property I’ve ever stayed at
text: Had a fantastic time at the Palace Hotel. I received the best service I have ever received at a hotel property.  I’ve stayed in many hotels in the city and the Palace by far has the best service, staff, amenities, and services.  Sudha Sharma, the Housekeeping director was very welcoming. Ensured that my stay was comfortable. That I had all the services I needed in my suite and that all of my needs were accommodated. Definitely made my birthday weekend one to remember.

title: The Unforgettable Lotte New York Palace
text: While I did not stay at the Lotte NY Palace, I thoroughly enjoyed drinks at The Gold Room.  The best Manhattan in Manhattan can be found here, made by the bartender extraordinaire, Mile.  We sat at the bar and chatted with the ever engaging bartender, Mile.  If you have never been to the Lotte New York Place, please go.  The public spaces at the hotel are stunning and The Gold Room transforms you back in time, to New York's golden era.  I hope to return to NYC and stay in this magnificent hotel.  Thank you Lotte New York Palace for an unforgettable visit.

title: LIVING IT UP IN NYC
text: We were in New York celebrating a family member's 16th birthday. We chose the Lotte New York Palace based on its location and reviews. We were not disappointed. In fact our stay at the Lotte was the highlight of our trip. We had a beautifully appointed suite on the 73 floor with a magnificent view of the Manhattan skyline. It was simply breathtaking. Not only were the accommodations superior in every respect but the service was top notch too. The next time we visit New York City, the Tower at the Lotte New York Palace will unquestionably be our choice.

title: Treated like Royalty at the Palace
text:
Stayed the weekend , had a wonderful experience from the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out. Upon arrival we were greeted by very welcoming doormen who immediately tended to our luggage. As I checked in I was warmly greeted by Denise at the front desk, I'm almost positive that was her name, a lovely woman with a beautiful accent. We arrived early and she explained very eloquently that our room would not be ready for a while and that we would receive a text message. All true!  The room was clean and very nice, with an incredible view of St Patrick's Cathedral. 
The location of this hotel is Prime ! Across the street from St Patrick's, to the left is Saks, 2 blocks forward is Rockefeller Center and Radio City. Great restaurants within walking distance , as well. 
I highly recommend brunch in the Villard Room , scrumptious! The wait staff and others are very well versed in customer service. Alain, our waiter, was top notch! A classy, elegant man who kept the delicious coffee coming.. along with a history lesson of the absolutely gorgeous dining room. It is stunning ...wow! 
I can't say enough about the staff from doormen to check in , room service and on our last day, the front desk manager Miles.  He was so helpful with check out time, offered information about the various tours the hotel provides: Gossip Girl Tour, History Tour and a new one that will be affiliated with St Patrick's Cathedral  which sounds amazing. You must be a guest of the hotel to sign up for that one... so , we will be checking in again in Dec. Looking forward to seeing the Palace decorated in all of it's gorgeous holiday splendor and signing up for all of the tours. 
To the hotel manager, thank you for hiring a terrific, well informed, elegant , classy staff. Sets you apart from the competition. Customer service is always a plus in my book.

title: The Best Hotel in NYC!
text: I cannot begin to describe how incredible this hotel is. Truly amazing experience celebrating my bachelorette party at the Lotte New York Palace! Paul and Miles at the front desk went above and beyond to make it the most unforgettable weekend for me and our entire group of 12! Everyone in our group had an exceptional stay in the Tower rooms. Rooms are spacious, luxurious, and the views are some of the best in the city. Additionally everyone working at the hotel was extremely warm and friendly and just so so helpful. I would get excited to return back to the hotel after a day out because it is so warm and inviting, they make you feel at home.  This hotel made my bachelorette one of the best weekends of my life, and Paul and Miles truly are incredible, with 5 star hospitality and customer care that is unparalleled. This is definitely the best hotel I have stayed in in NYC and I would highly recommend it for its fantastic staff, luxurious feel, and great location! This will be the hotel I stay at for all future trips to NYC moving forward. If you are going on a solo trip, a trip with family, or a big group trip, Lotte covers it all… I cannot think of a better hotel to stay at. Thank you Lotte for truly giving me a magical weekend! I am so excited to return!

title: Overall Good Experience!
text: I want to start off by giving rave reviews to the following employees: Salemamu Mohammed, Samir Saleh, Kan Lau, and Ahmed (his last name escaped me), for providing exceptional service and making my husband and I feel very welcome during our stay. A man whose name I did not get, who brought us room service breakfast, also was so wonderful. They are amazing and truly provided us with A++ service. On another note, I did want to point out a rather unpleasant experience we had during check-in with a front desk agent named Michael Frick. He was extremely rude and unpleasant. Firstly, he did not greet us properly. I told him hello and the name for my reservation and he said, “First off, we are going to start with some identification.” He asked both my husband and I to provide ID and then proceeded to give me a hard time because the reservation was under my married name and the ID I presented still has my maiden name. He questioned this and the validity of my marriage, even asking when we got married. He explained to me that IDs matching the name on the reservation was important to the Palace and then asked me to provide him the reservation email that my father sent me, which I did. During this ordeal, Michael was disrespectful and talked down to us. This was not the experience I expected from an establishment such as the Lotte Palace. I understand needing to follow protocol, but I did not appreciate his attitude toward us. Michael really needs to work on his customer service skills. My husband and I felt disrespected and it left a rather bitter taste in our mouths. If it weren’t for the amazing staff I mentioned above, this review could have been very different. Please make sure your front desk staff knows how to welcome and talk to guests with the same level of hospitality because it really sets the tone for a visit. Thank you.

title: Don’t go this hotel for a good glass of red wine
text:
I will start that the positive is that the hotel is beautiful and the room i stayed in on the 36th floor is roomy and well appointed. 
The room price is very expensive. I expect that. I stay often at the Trump Central Park, Conrad, Dominick. The hotel bar wine choices here  are abysmal at the Gold room. Wildly disappointing. If you’re a red wine drinker, the choices are terrible at $26 and up for a 5 oz pour.  I stay in high end hotels for the bars and the choices of wine at various prices. The choices here and the  ridiculous 5oz pour leave a bad taste in your mouth. Also if you’ve been there for awhile and have had two glasses maybe be tad more generous as well.  Most other high end hotels do this. Please vary up your wine choices to reflect $26 a glass

title: A Stellar Hotel! Home Away from Home
text:
I have been staying at the Lotte NY Palace Hotel for many years. Each time we visit NYC, my husband and I look forward to returning to the Palace because it feels like home! We are always warmly greeted by the front door personnel as though we are family. 
We like to stay in the section of the hotel known as the Towers. Upon entering, guests are directed to check in at a small private front desk rather than in the main lobby. Jim, at the front desk, is often there to welcome us and to fulfill each and every request we may have. He always goes above and beyond! Both Jim and the concierge staff are excellent at making recommendations for dining and things to do in and around Manhattan. 
On this visit, we were upgraded to a stunning and spacious king corner suite with magnificent views. The room was spotless, housekeeping was excellent, as was room service, and bellman assistance. Complimentary robes, slippers, and great bathroom products are also wonderful perks. The location of this hotel is perfect for shopping, great dining and simply for strolling along Madison and 5th Avenues as well as within close proximity to Central Park.
This property continues to draw me back again and again. With so many hotel options in NYC, the Towers at the Lotte NY Palace is truly a gem! I LOVE this hotel and cannot wait to return!

title: LOVE THIS HOTEL!
text: Once again had an amazing stay at the Lotte New York Palace hotel. My mother surprised me with Taylor Swift tickets for my birthday and the concierge, Kal, was the miracle worker who secured them. Kal also advised us how to quickly and affordably get to the concert. He made our stay so special, including sending chocolates and champagne to our room. The service at the hotel is always above and beyond, and that is why we continue coming back year after year. All the staff is lovely. The location is phenomenal. Just wonderful!

title: The best hotel in nyc
text: The hotel was very beautiful and the personal very nice with me. The location is just a step away from everything you need to know if it's your first time in nyc. Thank you so much to Maurice, Mo and Kal for the attention and for giving me the opportunity to have a gossip girl tour. I will definitely be back.

title: Home away from home
text: This hotel is always impeccable in their service, cleanliness and location. We have enjoyed their hotel many times and just had the best trip to the city for my son’s 13th birthday. Thank you to all that helped us while we were there and made our experience unforgettable! We will be back!

title: Thank you Anna Marie
text:
Super helpful front desk annaM made sure I knew about getting my work shirts pressed and made sure i had a room
Without a shower curtain.  She was a rocks star ! Made my travels a lot less hectic.  Hotel centrally located with a lively feel

title: Insgesamt ok
text:
Die Lage des Hotels ist für die Erkundung der Stadt sehr gut.

Der normale Übernachtungs-Preis ist zu teuer, aber es gibt immer wieder attraktive Angebote durch das Hotel selbst und durch Drittanbieter, die eine Buchung lohnen.

Der Service entspricht keinem 5-Sterne-Hotel, aber er ist ok.

Unser gebuchtes Zimmer zur Kathedrale in oberer Etage war sauber, groß und zweckmäßig.

Katastrophal sind die Wartezeiten zu Stoßzeiten am Aufzug - wir haben mehrfach zwischen 20-30 Minuten gewartet. Bei einem Zimmer in oberer Etage ist Treppensteigen aber (fast) nicht möglich.

Das Frühstück zu über 50 US$ plus Tax plus Tipp ist für die Leistung wesentlich zu hoch. Teuer ist ebenso der Coffee Shop mit beispielsweise über 6 US$ für ein Schoko-Croissant.

Für den von uns bezahlten Angebotspreis (3 Nächte zum Preis von 2) hat sich der Aufenthalt aber hier gelohnt.

title: Definitely not worth the money
text: Not sure why this place gets such high ratings.  My hotel room is definitely showing its age and there are no USBs or other modern plugs for phones etc. The heating/cooling system is quite loud.  Bathroom looks tired as well.  And for the price you don’t even get a coffee machine in the room which is standard everywhere these days.  You can request one for a fee of $35.  I also have a lovely view of an office building wall.  There are stains in the wall by the bed and the TV didn’t work when I arrived.  Won’t be staying here again.

title: Lotte pluses
text:
Spacious rooms meticulously designed and arranged. Very clean. Service was attentive.
We loved staying here! Views out the window of St Patrick’s. Parking available next door. Location near shopping gave easy access to many sought after stores

title: Terrible hotel
text:
Very poor hotel. Surly staff, no facilities in the rooms, no coffee/tea making, nothing in fridge, no snacks to buy. 

I had someone trying to get in my room in the middle of the night, as they had been checked into my room even though I was still in it. Reception even rang me and asked me called my a different name if my room key was now working. 

This is about as far away from 5 stars as it is possible to get. I’ve stayed in better 1star B&Bs.

Do not stay here

title: Lottle Palace was a great stay. Don’t overlook it.
text: Even though the Palace is currently undergoing a refurbishment, the service, cleanliness and comfort is definitely worth noting. Norma at the Front Desk for check in was so welcoming. She was able to check us in a little earlier which started our Mother’s Day on a great note. She remembered my name a few hours later as we walked through the lobby. Our superior double room was spacious. Desserts ordered from room service were delicious and delivered pretty quickly. A great experience for a midtown stay.

title: Amazing Experience
text:
My experience was nothing short of a dream, we arrived late and Norma checked us in. She was extremely warm and pleasant. She made us feel comfortable immediately.

Christopher Vasquez was easy to work with and made everything simple and hassle free, to say he over delivered would be an understatement. It was our anniversary and he went above and beyond to provide the room I requested as well as a he small personal touch that made my wife’s experience everything I dreamed it could be! Al of this culminated by Mr Gomez placing us in the room we dreamed of. Would definitely recommend!

title: Excellent stay great view
text: Excellent hotel courteous staff Mr Miles Gomez (Front Office Manager) was particularly very helpful when my flight was rescheduled and he accommodated with extended checkout. Will be visiting this property again

title: Wonderful rainy stay
text: The hotel was wonderful. The staff was very friendly. We went there for a family long weekend and even with the rain, we had a lovely time. Well located, we could move to and from the hotel with no fuzz. The valet guys were really helpful and nice. They lent us umbrellas so we could walk to Rockefeller center with the kids. After a long day, it was nice to get there, have a bath and a delicious room service meal. Will definitely go back!

title: Wonderful Experience!
text: Beth and Danielle coordinated a wonderful stay for my company in a room block. They were responsive, easy to work with, and kind throughout the whole process. From the initial booking to providing folios at the end, they made the process seamless and simple. I couldn't be happier with our stay! The staff at the hotel was equally wonderful: professional, helpful, and provided immediate service to our rooms whenever requested. Thank you Beth and Danielle!!

title: Another wonderful stay at Lotte New York Palace
text:
My adult daughters and I just returned from a long weekend in NYC and 
a stay at our favorite hotel.   This is the only hotel I will stay at in the city. The hotel itself is 
beautiful and luxurious and the Front Office Manager, Miles Gomez, could not be more helpful and accommodating.  Miles always makes sure everything goes smoothly...even
a last minute change to come in a night earlier than planned.  Miles follows through with answers to questions very quickly and strives to make sure our stay is
a happy and memorable one.   This last stay was every bit as perfect as all of
our many stays over the last 8 years.  Thank you, Miles!

title: This Hotel is Truly a Palace
text: This is an elegant hotel.  The front part of the hotel is a historic mansion with some beautiful and elegant rooms.  Very tastefully done.  You are centrally located  in midtown right behind the gothic St. Patrick's Cathedral.   Get  a room overlooking this landmark!  The Pomme Palais Café in the hotel with its elegant lounge is open from 6:30-5:00 and is great from a quick breakfast, lunch or pick-up during the day.   Rooms are spacious and quiet.  This is a no-miss hotel.  We came on a stay 2 night get a third night free offer - a great deal for this kind of  luxury hotel.  If you are there on Saturday, take the hotel tour.  The hotel staff is professional and they treat you with great respect.  Perhaps the best housekeeping that I have ever had in a hotel.

title: Like Staying in a Palace
text:
We stayed in an executive suite in the Tower. It is probably three times the size of any nice hotel room we've been. The bathroom was the size of a living room. The room came with a lot of very comfortable amenities, which we did not take enough advantage, like the plush bath robes.

Our window faced St. Patrick's. It is worth coming again and we would not be shy about taking advantage of the complimentary drinks and snacks in the lobby of the Tower. The service folks were friendly and helpful. They made sure you were enjoying your time there. They left a birthday cake and macaroons for when we came back after attending a Broadway show.

We ordered breakfast room service. New York bagel with lox, a mediterranean breakfast with shaksuka, greek yogurt, fresh fruit, amazing coffee, and Icelandic water. It was probably one of the best breakfast we had in NYC, better than some dinners at fancy 4 star restaurants.

title: Wonderful stay at the Lotte!
text: This gorgeous hotel is only overshadowed by it's staff. Any and every contact we had with staff from front desk to housekeeping was met wirh friendliness and kindness. This was our second stay at the Lotte Palace and now is our hotel of choice in NYC. The location and amenities are wonderful but the staff is the heart. Keep up the great work Lotte Palace!!!

title: Extraordinary care and attention of Kal Naim
text: The Towers at the New York Palace has been my preferred mid-town location since friends recommended this small boutique hotel inside the much larger New York Palace. Not only are the rooms spacious, they have vistas—literally, rooms with a view. But what always matters most are the people. The Concierges , Isabella and Kal Naim. Kal has gone out of his way with each of my visits, to make sure I get the best theatre tickets possible—even giving me his cell number in case there is some emergency and I need assistance. This kind of care for another person is what makes the experience of staying at the Towers stand out. Wins customer loyalty. With thanks!! Mary Haft

title: Gossip Girl Tour with Maurice
text: We didn’t stay in this beautiful hotel but we came along to visit during our stay to see this iconic Gossip Girl hotel. Maurice noticed us outside and offered to take us on a tour of the hotel to show us all of the filming locations. He was incredible and told us what each room was used for and even took photos of us in each room. If you are a fan of Gossip Girl I would definitely recommend popping by to see this stunning hotel and ask for Maurice for this unique Gossip Girl tour!

title: Excellent Staff and Location
text: Lotte New York Palace hotels is one of the best hotels in NYC based on location and convenience. Most touristic attractions and hot spots are of walking distance. The hotel ambiance is very relaxed and family friendly. There is a great bakery located in the lobby and plenty of restaurants near by. The staff are wonderful and friendly especially Mr Kal and Mr Samir. They were both truly helpful and made sure we got everything we need. They went above and beyond to make this a wonderful trip for my family  and for that i am grateful. Overall very clean and wonderful hotel highly recommend!

title: Disappointed
text: Wow. So always thrilled to stay here but what a different vibe. No more basics (ie turn down service, change of towels etc) and went to the bar for a drink after the theatre.  Definitely some companionship business transactions occurring at bar (yes you can assume!) and it was a bit uncomfortable for the others.  Second time I have seen this…Place was packed.  Bummed because for those of us that prefer to not engage it was a bit uncomfortable.  Perhaps other hotels not so obvious or sanctioned?

title: It was all about the employees
text: The palace hotel is beautiful, loaded with charm and atmosphere and above all  spotlessly clean.  The rooms are quite, well furnished and large.  The bathroom is adequate and well supplied. Can’t beat  location for, walking, shopping, restaurants and taxis.  But,  it’s all about the employees. They really want to make your stay comfortable.  Anything we asked for was immediately brought to our room - with a pleasurable attitude.  The room service is reasonable and the Gold Room restaurant is comfortable and is also loaded with atmosphere.  We will definitely be returning.  I recommend the Lotte  Palace and suggest you give it a try. ……oh  BTW make your reservations thru the hotel itself - you won’t be disappointed by them either

title: My amazing stay at the Lotte NYC.
text: I loved my stay at the Lorre Palace in nyc. The staff stood out to me and they were so friendly and kind. The hotel is so clean and the location could not be better. It’s a perfect hotel for a stay in NYC. Kal and Samir especially were so helpful, respectful and kind. They really helped us. I wish them all the best and I’m so glad I crossed passed with them.

title: Amazing hotel!
text: The lotte New York palace hotel is so amazing. It was my first time in New York and I’m so glad I picked them as my place to stay. The rooms are clean and well furnished. The location is great and a walk away from times square. The staff are so helpful and friendly. Especially Kal and Samir, they were both so so kind, friendly and went out of their way to help my aunt and I during our stay. They always helpful and lovely and positive. I loved talking to them. They make me want to come back for my next stay.

title: Location, location and a beautiful hotel
text: This is at least my 4th time staying at this hotel and I love it. The location is unbeatable, the staff is attentive and kind, if you get a room facing Saint Patrick it is the cherry on the cake, wonderful. The breakfast and lunch dinning room is amazing and show what a wonderful property this was. It is so quiet that you will not believe your are in the middle of Manhattan.

title: Lotte Palace has some hits and misses
text: The  Lotte hotel has its high marks.  The location and  views are excellent, especially facing Madison Ave. to overlook St Patrick's.  The room size is very large for NYC which come in handy.  Where they fall short is it decorations and overall feel reminds me of a Marriott Hotel and when you're paying $700+/night that stings the value meter.

title: It’s A Wonderful Palace!
text:
Fabulous! The whole adventure was fabulous. I stayed for four nights and took a room overlooking St. Patrick’s Cathedral. How did it begin? I needed a refrigerator to keep my meds cold and it was there within 20 minutes. The room service was really, ~really~ good. My sister goes into food bliss when she eats really good chicken with mashed potatoes. I had a steak, and it came rare AND hot. All the other meals were equally as good.
The bakery is fast and serves great coffee and opens at 5:30am so you can dash to a meeting. And lastly, I had to use the Concierge a few times, and tonight I met Christian who was training Dylan (Frankie ;O) ). Unless a trainee isn’t getting the concept of what the trainer is asking of them, I always allow the trainer to do their thing even if it takes a little longer. Otherwise, how can a new employee learn? Christian was clear, concise and direct with Dylan on how to proceed on my behalf, and Dylan did a great job. They were both great, and I felt like they cared.
Lastly, I have always wanted to stay at “The Queen’s Palace.” I had cleared my credit cards and my sis, cousin and I had a great time. I’d love to do it again.

title: Business
text: The hotel is a great place to do business and also relax and enjoy NYC. I would recommend for both! The rooms are spacious. The conferences rooms are iconic with a great mix of modern and old New York. Highly recommend working with Beth Strange and Danielle Gilman and team.

title: Lotte - A great place to stay in NYC
text: As the meeting planner, I stayed here recently on a business trip.  The room was comfortable and well appointed, with a great view of Saint Patrick's Cathedral. And the hotel staff Dan, Danielle and Elizabeth were great to work with.  We would choose this hotel again. Thank you so much!

title: Mixed Feelings
text:
This was not my first stay at the Lotte New York Palace. I had previously stayed in the hotel prior to the pandemic. My opinion of this hotel is mixed with a few pros and cons. 

PROS
The staff is wonderful! I have nothing but good things to say about the people at the Lotte New York Palace. EVERY staff member I interacted with was friendly, pleasant and helpful. They go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and accommodate   requests when possible. 
The location is great. One of the main reasons we chose this hotel was the central location. 

CONS 
The rooms are tired and dated. We were originally booked in a Cathedral View Room but, when we arrived at the room, it just wasn't clean. I suffer from severe allergies and requested a thorough cleaning before we arrived at the hotel. Even still, there was dust on the baseboards and other hard surfaces, multiple stains on the carpet and dirt in the bathroom. We looked at a second room and that one was just as bad. In the end, we were moved to the Towers. The room there was better but still didn't feel 100% clean. The other issue was the lack of electrical outlets in the room. Only two were free and reachable, one in the far corner near the window and the other on the wall by the television. This may seem like a small inconvenience but it is a pain not having easy access to an outlet to charge devices.
The second con is entirely my own fault. I had requested an "allergy friendly" room originally, but forgot to request the same when we switched rooms. Unfortunately, whatever detergent was used on the linens and towels made me break out in a terrible rash that covered my arms, torso, back, neck and face and required a trip to the dermatologist upon arriving home. **If you have sensitive skin and/or allergies I highly recommend you mention this ahead of time to avoid the discomfort I suffered.** 

Would I stay at the Lotte New York Palace again? The wonderful staff and convenient location makes me want to say yes, but it is unlikely I will return until the hotel has undergone some updating/renovations.

title: It’s the little things that count & The Lotte gets them right.
text: We had a fantastic long weekend break at the Palace.  Our room was fantastic, much larger than the usual rooms I have experienced with a very comfortable bed and lovely large fluffy towels.  The staff really made the experience 5 stars.  From the doormen, who couldn’t have been more helpful to the concierge who booked a couple of great restaurants for us.  We will be happily coming back to the palace on our next trip to NYC.

title: Excellent location and hotel
text: Just stayed at Lotte New York Palace and was so impressed every step of the way. I worked with the concierge Kal before hand and he was able to recommend and get reservations at some wonderful restaurants. We had a lovely room, great views of the cathedral and a spacious room with a very comfortable bed. We will definitely stay here again in the future and I would certainly recommend it.

title: Ok but not great!
text:
The rooms are very huge, very nice size but the hotel is so old, well maintained but old.
For a luxury hotel with that price, it doesn’t have tea or coffee facilities… nothing.
Let me tell you about the gym! Officially the gym opens at 7 which is ridiculous, I know but the gym is unofficially open from earlier or maybe even 24 hours and it was PACKED. I don’t think people going to the gym of the LOTTE are all hotel guests but I can be wrong, don’t know but it’s not big enough for the amount of people that are in the gym at 6am.
I wouldn’t stay here again at that rate, only if price is reasonable.

title: Great location, good service, & comfortable room perfect for work, relaxation, & sleep
text: The Lotte Palace is having some work done, but don’t let that stop you from visiting for business, drinks, dining, or relaxation.  Conveniently located near Fifth Avenue & Madison, Park shops, bars,  eateries, etc. & short distance to Times Square where you can see a show, Radio City, & Rockefeller are short distance away.  Easy to catch a taxi, uber, or black car services.  The hotel is still a great choice with good service.  Like all businesses in US & around the world it is tough to find enough help, but all staff I encountered here will go above & beyond when possible even when confronted by the elites with attitudes.  I saw a front desk staff member be chastised for things most people wouldn’t even consider an issue, but this staff member remained cool & controlled.  We will be returning next month & we hope to make this a home away from home when we visit NYC.  My thanks to all & keep it up.

title: Perfect NYC hotel for weekend getaway
text: Great location, clean, rooms good size, staff excellent, Christian at concierge was super helpful in recommending local eateries and bars, even made a reservation on the spot l, got me an umbrella and when I walked out the door and headed the wrong way, he called me to redirect me … now that’s service.

title: Lotte for the Win!
text:
The Lotte Palace was chosen for the location.  Wanted the proximity to St. Patrick's Cathedral and the NYC Easter Parade.  We will return due to their excellence.  

From check in - organized and efficient, to daily needs - never a "no", to exit - loving and caring, the staff far exceeded our expectations.

The room was fabulous.  A night cap in the bar was a delight. (Loved the truffle fries).  As an older, disabled couple, we need a little extra care.  Some would say we are high maintenance.  Staff at the Lotte always made us feel special and met our needs.  we never were made to feel as though we were intruding or over asking.

Extra special thanks goes to the Concierge, Christian.  You made our stay memorable.  Thank you so very much!

We look forward to returning to the Lotte soon!

title: A Wonderful 25th Wedding Anniversary Experience
text: We chose the Lotte New York Palace Hotel for our 25th Wedding Anniversary and could not have been happier with our stay. The room was beautiful with a spectacular view of the Cathedral. Christian, our Concierge, and the entire Lotte team exceeded our expectations for customer service. Even the weather was perfect! 😉 Thank you, thank you, thank you for a wonderful anniversary trip!

title: Surprising Shortcomings
text:
Spent a night at this hotel with my college-aged daughter. The hotel was aesthetically lovely, as expected. However, I was surprised and dismayed that there no in-room coffee/tea. Even budget hotels offer this amenity standard with the room. Coffee was likewise not complementary in the lobby (again a customary perk, even in moderate hotels). For the exorbitant price of the hotel, one would expect coffee!  The other interesting shortfall was the absence of USB ports to charge phones, etc. Again, in a hotel at this level, one would think these would be present in the rooms. 
The room was spacious with a nice view, comfortable beds, and an acceptable bathroom (nothing special). The hotel is convenient to theaters, etc. 
It definitely was not an exceptional experience for the price. Would I stay again? Let’s just say I would explore my options before booking here again.

title: хороший отель по разумной цене
text: хороший отель, есть все необходимое для отдыха с детьми, вкусный завтрак и близко к центру. Локация - один из главных плюсов, очень удобно добираться. я считаю, что отель полностью соответствует по цене и качеству, смело рекомендую здесь остановиться

title: Nice but due to an incident leaving a bad aftertaste.
text:
De rooms and overall atmosphere are very nice. Only thing is that the capacity of the elevators versus the number of guests is insufficient, leading to annoyingly long waiting times. 
The whole stay left me with one item that gave a bad aftertaste. Seems that I dropped a sweater in front of a friends room. A cleaning person offered it to my friend but he didn’t recognize it so declined. When I missed my sweater an hour later I contacted housekeeping, security, etc. But guess what, nothing was reported found. Since it was proven found and now gone I can only conclude it’s stolen! 
So a warning for potential guest, be careful, apparently housekeeping cannot be trusted. Sad but true and very annoying.

title: Overall, enjoyed our stay but couple of improvements wouldn't go amiss
text:
Spent 5 days at the Palace and overall, enjoyed our stay.  Positives first - We had a cathedral view room which was great, 4 of us (2 adults, 10 and 16 year old) sharing 2  comfortable double beds but we never felt short of space. Rooms are surprisingly quiet. Good location. Shower powerful, Molton Brown toiletries continually stocked and bottles of water delivered daily.  Large TV but we never switched it on, too tired! The hotel arranged airport transport for us which we really appreciated. All the staff are friendly, no complaints there.
Things I felt could be improved - We had pastries/coffee from Pomme Palais a couple of days but even that was over $60 a time. We went to Toasties/SpringBone across the road instead. We didn't bother with the bar area after looking at the prices. I don't really think the prices for food/drinks are justified for the hotel as certain things let it down from being 5 stars for us.
No USB sockets, which is pretty standard in hotels these days. Wish I had brought my own hairdryer as the supplied one was awful. No facilities to make tea or coffee either. There was an empty minibar but it had a really bad smell so never used it. I think the rooms just need a bit of updating to bring everything up to a modern 5 star rating.

title: A little underwhelmed
text:
We stayed here for a week as a family of 3 - 2 adults and a teen. We enjoyed the stay but have to say for a 5 star hotel, I was left underwhelmed. The bedroom was a little tired and dated and, when we arrived, one of the beds had ripped bed sheets. That said, our housekeeper was brilliant. She came every day and did a great job. 
The two interactions I had with bell services let the hotel down too. I approached the desk twice during our stay and, both times, the attendant was on a mobile device and I was not acknowledged. When leaving the bags on our departure day, I walked away with my ticket and my daughter told me the attendant was shaking his head as we left. However that being said, lots of interactions with staff in lifts and halls etc. were extremely pleasant and welcoming towards the whole family. 
The location was great and we loved the whole Gossip Girl connection - the staircase was beautiful. However, would I stay again? Probably not.

title: A warm welcome in NYC
text:
The Lotte has the friendliest staff and it genuinely felt like returning home each time we walked through the door. We arrived having lost a treasured teddy on the plane into New York and our little boy was distraught. We mentioned this to Sandy, the delightful receptionist checking us in, and she spirited up a hotel teddy bear for him that put a smile back on his face as we checked in. Sandy could not have been more welcoming or lovely.  
She was one of many staff members we interacted with who couldn't be warmer and kinder – a real surprise for a 'posh' hotel. 
Our room was spacious and clean. The bars were gorgeous and the mail desk a lovely feature for those of us who still send postcards.
The neighbourhood is great (try The Duke deli round the corner for everything) and you're easy walking distance from the park, 5th, the Rockefeller Center and the Empire State Building.
Would absolutely stay here again and recommend it highly.
Thank you, Sandy - you turned a trip around with your compassion and sweetness.

title: Palace great place
text: Amazing location service was over the top. The only issue I had with the mattresses we stayed on the towers. Amazing views, great size rooms. Just need better mattresses my family for plenty of room to little girls wife excellent will be back soon.

title: Incredible Staff !
text:
Yes, the location is great and the hotel itself is lovely. 
What sets the New York Palace apart from other hotels is its wonderful staff. Among all of these helpful and pleasant people, two men truly stand out: Christian (Conceirge) and Jorge (Front Desk). They went the extra ten miles to make our Easter  stay a great one!

title: Lotte Easter weekend!
text: We had a wonderful Easter weekend at my favorite hotel- Lotte Palace. Our visit was made even more special by #1 Concierge, Kal Naim. His dinner recommendations were handled flawlessly and he introduced us to several new dining experiences. There is no one more attentive or dedicated to exceptional service!

title: Awesome concierge
text: Kal Naim went over and above helping us with dinner reservations and making shopping recommendations. He followed us on every aspect to make sure we were happy with his recommendations. The nicest man ever!!!

title: They will damage your property then ignore you!
text:
I was unfortunate enough to have a business meeting at this hotel on March 22.   I left a bag checked at the Bell Desk, and when I picked it up only 2 hours later, it had been damaged to the point of being unusable by the Bell Desk personnel.  Photos of the damage are attached.   This isn't the kind of thing that I could've somehow missed while wheeling my bag through New York to the hotel -- there is literally a chunk of the handle missing that was there when I handed the bag to the Bell Desk.    I went to the Concierge Desk and they helped me fill out a form with security, but it is now 17 days later and I have not heard back about compensation for the damage, or anything else for that matter.

If you value your property, please take your business to another hotel.

title: Classy hotel
text:
On arrival after a real muck up from British Airways we were tired and a bit fed up but that changed at check in. 
The hotel staff check in was superb and on hearing our issues gave us a $100 credit to spend in the hotel, they didn’t have to do this but it was much appreciated. They also gave us free wifi for the week which was also brilliant of them. 
The hotel itself is beautiful, our room looked over St Patrick’s cathedral and i was pleasantly surprised how quiet it was as we’ve stayed in other NY hotels and at times the noise was bad, but not so this time.

We found the location great and although we didn’t eat at the hotel there was enough in the area within a short walk (I recommend the New York Luncheonette for breakfast ) 
We had drinks delivered once to our room and there were no issues at all, they have a nice coffee shop with a good selection of drinks and cakes etc and it’s expensive but it is NY.
 No problems at check out, they held our bags securely as we checked out at midday and our flights were at night so we went a walk and on our return the bell man got us a cab and our bags.
I wouldn’t hesitate in staying here again, I can’t complain about anything and we loved our stay here.

title: Great location and helpful staff
text: It’s a nine hotel in a very good location , very convenient for 5th avenue, Central Park, Times Square, Madison Avenue.  Good value for  such a central location. Christian on concierge was very helpful.

title: great
text: I love how the staff are all very down to Earth and kind. It feels like I'm part of a community. In terms of installations, it is all very well built and with good taste. The hotel is located in a key point in NY as it is very easy to reach certain places from there, and also very quick. Of course, it is very expensive, and I would recommend to go to a traditional NY diner instead of eating breakfast there, but nevertheless, the breakfast was delicious as well.

title: Great view and great Cocktails!
text:
Wow! What an amazing hotel with equally amazing views! We loved our stay here and the hotel is in a great location.
To be fair we were that busy we did not avail ourselves of all the facilities the hotel had to offer such as dining but what we did see and use was all fantastic.
As it was our 25th wedding anniversary we splurged a little bit and paid for a high room with views of the cathedral - it did not disappoint. The best thing was that when we went in to the roms the blinds were closed so we got to reveal the view for ourselves -as this was our first visit the view didn't seem real, almost as if we were on some film set and the view had been painted on a wall. It was great! The room itself was very spacious and the room while immaculate (for me) had a little bit of a retro feel to it but in no way is that detrimental to the room.
We had a cocktail in in the lovely bar one evening and while expensive...wow you certainly got your money's worth with the amount of alcohol i them. My wife couldn't drink hers so I took one for the team and had hers too which by the time i got up to leave after two cocktails I was swaying!
The staff were all very friendly and professional but as I mentioned we were not in the hotel that long as we were dashing about. My main regret is that we were not in NYC longer to really appreciate the hotel. 
This October we are returning back to NYC and unfortunately this hotel amazing as it is, is not out of our price range (£1000) more than the mid range hotel we have now booked, nothing the hotel has done wrong its just that for a second visit (something we had not planned on doing) I couldn't justify the expense, that said I certainly know where to go for a cocktail!!!

title: Great service provided by Concierge Team
text: Kal from Concierge night team is a very helpful staff, his efficiency and courtesy service for my short notice request was excellent. Highly recommend this hotel, and I hope I can stay at this hotel in the near future. Super!

title: The best authentic New York experience!
text:
Spent increible two days in this hotel and
loved every moment! Me and my family got
to enjoy traditional New York vibes in the
best Manhattan location with a beautiful
view of the city! This place intertwined
comfort and luxury and provided a home
away from home
The room was incredibly spacious for the
New York hotels, and the overall design of
the building was breathtaking!

title: Lotte Da Da Da!!!
text: It all began when Roxanne booked us a beautiful room . Upon arrival, we were warmly welcomed by Jimm and Anna Marie.  Omar escorted us to our tower room with an unforgettable view!  A special thank you to Maurice, little George, big George, Eddie, Louis and Lorenzo for their extraordinary hospitality.  Diego was a phone call away to book afternoon tea and anything to bring us glee!   We  three sisters knew The Palace was the PERFECT choice!

title: Overpriced not five star standard
text: The Palace has dated rooms since many years ago,  room hardware falling apart; but I put up with it because of the views. Unfortunately now they run an overpriced broke hotel, if you want something from the minibar a 35 dollar additional re stock charge. No wifi included. No beverage tea service at the main floor. Sad I hope they snap out of it soon not a proper 5 star hotel these days.

title: We wanted to stay for a week but left after two nights
text:
Unfortunately, we can only advise against staying in this hotel. 
Before our arrival, we spent an evening comparing hotels and then decided on the Lotte New York Palace - also because of many good reviews. So much elegance radiated from their pictures! There is also so much history in these walls. That's why we were willing to pay $600 per night. 

But the odyssey took its course after a short time. The toilet did not work properly, the water rose almost to the brim and I was afraid it would flood the room. A hotel employee then sent a plumber, but he told us there was nothing wrong with the toilet. Fortunately, the incident did not happen again. 

The next morning we noticed that the shower (with shower curtain) was blocked (see photos). 

In addition, the room had not been renovated for decades. It smells of dust, everything is old - super old! There is no possibility to make coffee or tea. There are hardly any sockets in the room! 
The only positive thing about the room is the size and the view. 

A hotel employee then offered us another room. We wanted to give the hotel one last chance. But already in the evening we noticed that the sink in this room was blocked (see photos). We then booked another hotel and cancelled our stay.

We were also very disappointed that none of the hotel staff apologised for the condition of the room. No one cared we left much earlier than originally planned. 

This is not a 5 star hotel. Even in a Premiere Inn you find working toilets, showers and sinks! It was a very disappointing experience and also sad, because this hotel could be amazing if someone only put some money into an extensive renovation.

title: Fine property, but probably no longer 5 stars
text: I've stayed here twice as it's near my office. The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable, though the rooms are definitely dated (the bathrooms in particular) and are in need of updating. No smart tv, the outlets don't all work, etc. The first room I was given was dark and dank and on a low floor, so request a room on a higher floor if you can. The restaurant is highway robbery and would not recommend dining there - stick with pomme palais, where the staff is wonderful and the prices are a bit more reasonable. The gym is great and has what you need to get a good sweat in. The service is hit or miss - I found that if you don't fit the mold of a customer here (older, white, ostentatious displays of wealth) you probably won't be treated as well (e.g., doormen don't acknowledge or greet you upon arrival and did not offer to assist with my luggage, a fellow hotel guest thought i was his doordash delivery person, the busboy at the gold bar told me the small container of nuts would come at a charge *after* he brought them out, when we had spent hundreds of dollars at that point on food and drinks, etc). I've heard the tower side is nicer (and the pricing would suggest that), but this is no longer a 5 star property and shouldn't be billed as such.

title: Weekend get away
text: We had a wonderful stay at The Palace in the towers. Dan N. assisted us in making our reservation and answered all the questions we had about the hotel. We received a warm welcome upon entering and were quickly assisted with our bags. The front desk staff helped us with a seamless check in and check out. The housekeeper on our floor greeted us each time we saw here making The Place feel like a home away from home. Our room was clean, comfortable and had outstanding views of ST Patrick’s Cathedral and Manhattan. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue shopping and Central Park. We are already looking forward to our next st at the Lotte New York Palace!

title: Racist and rude servers
text: I had brunch in the Villard Mansion  between 9am -10am today. The venue is so beautiful however the servers were extremely racist and rude. I think the servers didn’t think I understood English. One told a guest waiting to be seated very loudly that I was just ‘camping ‘at my table and he didn’t know when I will finish (when there were 3 empty tables around me). A female server asked if she can clear my table when I was clearly still finishing my food. I had to finish both mine and my friends’ dishes ( steak and salmon) cos he had to take a call but I did try to finish as fast as I can. I told another server that I was done eating and while he was clearing the table, that female server came over and said really rudely : oh I asked her if she was done and she said no so I didn’t clear the table, don’t blame me then stormed off..I’m just shocked with how rudely the servers treat the customers and each other. Maybe I just expected better service from such a beautiful venue. Very disappointed.

title: Amazing experience
text: Me and my husband were celebrating our anniversary and Chris Vasquez helped greatly with the reservations and Miles Gómez put us in a beautiful room. When we arrived to the hotel Olga checked us in and she was so nice.

title: Great hotel with amazing staff
text: Great hotel.  Great staff- incredibly attentive but special shout out to Miles.  He is the calmest manager I’ve ever met and handled any problem with a perfect t demeanor.  He makes the hotel feel like home. I’m here once a month and this hotel is always welcoming and a joy to return to.

title: Not worth the $ - drab, dusty, weird smells
text:
I would not stay here again. Reviews I read suggested you should stay in the towers and not the palace, however, I figured it could not be that bad. I was wrong. They had 1 person working for check in and check out, which took ages. After about 30 min, they finally allowed us to check out at the towers desk. 
The rooms were awful, desperate need of updating. Very dusty and drab. The light switches did not all work and what was odd is that you could not manually turn some of the lamps on or off. Therefore, if the switch on the wall did not work, that lamp was remaining on / off. 
The shower was awful. 
Hallways had a weird smell. 
One night, we decided to try the hotel bar / restaurant to save time, which was a joke. There were multiple servers, yet most of them stood around. For 2 drinks and 2 dinners, took about 3hrs, heavy price tag, horrible food. Husband's oysters were spoiled (actually spoiled / not sure how they served those), and my burger was worse than a fast food restaurant. 

This was not worth the $500+ a night. Go elsewhere

title: Beautiful hotel and overall amazing experience
text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for our anniversary this past weekend and the experience was unlike any hotel I have ever stayed at. when we first got there Olga checked us in. she was extremely friendly and accommodating and she personally went and checked if our room was ready which was very nice of her. Our room was extremely clean and very nice with gorgeous views of NYC. The staff was extremely quick whenever we needed something, more towels, ice, utensils etc., they would have it up to our room in just minutes. the hotel is also walking distance from many nearby places which was a plus.  Thank you to Anna Marie, miles, Olga, Dalmasi, Sandy and Samir for making our stay an amazing experience!!!! I would highly recommend this hotel if you are in NYC and looking for a beautiful hotel with an accommodating staff.

title: Super Stay
text: I was there for 10 days with my brilliant charming Chuck Basses!!! It was Superb!!! Lovin it~~~~ The room is spacious with spectacular view combines with the iconic St Patricks Church and impressive  midtown skyline super view!!! Truly love it!!!

title: The best drink I’ve ever had
text: Rarities bar in this hotel ask for rafa this man is the oracle of fine drinks and an amazing evening. Do NOT visit New York without experiencing this. The ambiance and personality given here is worth 10x the price

title: The stay at Lotte New York Palace was wonderful!
text: The hotel was amazing! Everything was top notch. I would love to give a big shout out to Louis and Ray, the doorman. They made our trip. They were super friendly and was there the moment we stepped out of the car. Louis even knew about out college team.

title: Underwhelmed
text: I was so excited to stay at this hotel after watching Gossip Girl and looking at the website and the location. Booked a high floor premium suite overlooking St Patrick’s Cathedral. $900 per night. So I was expecting a bit of luxury. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas. Staff was nice and helpful. When I got to my room I was so disappointed. It was just a plain room with 2 double beds. It wasn’t beautifully decorated. There was no minibar. No extras. Just a plan basic room. I guess I was just expecting a little more for the price. The room was a good size. The view was beautiful. Other than that, very basic and average. Like any other chain hotel really. Honestly, a Holiday Inn would have been an improvement. The room was tired. No personality. I really hope they do a makeover soon! The location was great but I would never pay that much to stay in such a tired hotel again. Disappointed in my choice.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: Highly recommend the Lotte New York Palace!  It has everything you could want: a great location, beautiful  super clean rooms, peaceful spa, delicious coffee/gift shop and incredible staff. I have to give a special mention to Jimm, who took incredible care of us during our stay! Many thanks to him for making our vacation so wonderful!

title: Mother/Daughter trip
text: Beautiful hotel, perfect location & outstanding service. Everyone was so friendly & helpful. Ultra, our housekeeper was A+, she went over & above to make sure we didn’t need a thing. My daughter and I loved it so much we didn’t want to leave. Can’t wait to return!

title: Fantastic hotel and location, slightly over priced.
text:
This is a grand hotel in a great location for the authentic New York experience, restaurants, shopping.  We had a cathedral skyline room (3215).  Stunning skyline view of St Patrick's cathedral, down past Radio City Hall and to the river.  We were really pleased with our room, with a "wow" when we walked in at the size of it.  It was large for New York, lovely classic decor and spotlessly clean.  Table/desk and two comfortable chairs by the window.  Very comfortable bed and crisp, white bed linen.  Pillows really comfortable too.  Good size closet with plenty of coat hangers for your clothes and space for shoes.  Large size safe in the closet that fit my handbag in and my husband's laptop plus other items of value we didn't wish to take out with us.  

The towels in the bathroom were lovely and fluffy, they all seemed brand new.  Molton Brown products were very nice.  There are new shower heads with a generous water pressure.  The shower is over the bath, as in many hotels.  The sink has plenty of space around it for storing your toiletries and also a shelf too which is great so nothing gets wet.    2 x bottles of water were replenished each day in the room.  The cleaning lady was very accommodating and friendly, even asking us what time we would like our room making up on one occasion. It was our 10th Wedding Anniversary, the hotel had noted this from our travel agent and delivered a plate of delicious macaroons and a congratulations card.  A nice gesture.  Wi-Fi was free with our reservation, don't know if this is the case for all as some reviews state a charge and we were expecting to pay.  So, a nice bonus.  Overall the room, 3215, was very quiet which was just what we wanted.

This hotel is comparatively over expensive (hence 4 not 5 star review).
There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room.  You can request it from housekeeping for $35.  $35 for every replenishment of coffee/tea too.
Drinks - glass of champagne $22.  Cheapest glass of wine $18.
American Breakfast for one: $49 plus $9 cup of coffee plus $8 glass of fresh orange
Pommes Palais - plastic cup of fruit (very fresh) $14
All the above prices are before tax and tips.

Reception staff - friendly.  Concierge - really helpful with restaurant recommendations. Bar tenders - warm and friendly too.

There is scaffolding around the hotel which makes the restaurant quite dark.  Apparently it's been there about a year.

Overall, a lovely hotel, interior decor sophisticated and grand with a real wow factor.  It's in a great location.  Our stay was memorable and we would return.  It would be a 5* rating from us if some adjustments to over pricing and provide hot refreshment facilities in room.

title: Beautiful and well located
text:
The Lotte was a really lovely place to stay. The hotel felt simply luxurious from check in to check out. I loved the room (king overlooking St Patrick's). It was huge and super comfortable and quiet.
The hotel is super well located.
The Gold bar is very nice and has a wonderfully nice manager that helped us be comfortable. The Rarities bar was less great. Just very expensive and some of the clientele was obnoxiously loud, but super wealthy so they were permitted to be so. I got a "rare" white wine for $40 and it was just fine, nothing remarkable. I wouldn't go to Rarities again.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Great location & amazing staff
text:
Amazing arrival experience. Staff & hotel are very nice!! Christian At concierge desk was so helpful w/ directions & places to dine!! 
It’s raining & hotel bellman gave us umbrellas. So sweet!! Thanks so much. Looking forward to spending the week here

title: More than a hotel
text: One important advantage of Lotte is its friendly, professional and responsive concierge team - a great tip is not to wait till you arrive but seek assistance beforehand (many restaurants are booked weeks in advance) . The team was able to make all bookings and it really takes the stress out of the trip! Great work guys!

title: Great customer service
text:
After a rocky start, Michael at the front desk made sure I had a great experience staying at Lotte New York Palace. 

Nancy the cleaner was flexible when I was in the room during her cleaning time and Lyndsay ensured I had a late check out.

title: Delusione totale
text: Posizione ottima. Camera vecchia e non in buone condizioni.Bagno vergognoso per un hotel 5 stelle. No caffè in camera e frigo bar vuoto. WiFi a pagamento dopo 2 giorni. Prezzo troppo alto per una struttura in queste condizioni. La struttura in generale è molto vecchia e necessita di ristrutturazione.

title: Spent the night in the city for our daughters birthday!
text: WE booked this hotel to spend the night in NYC to celebrate our daughters birthday. Once you walk in your greeted by the nicest friendliest people from the doorman to the bell staff. Front desk was so pleasant. The room was immaculate and so spacious for a NYC hotel. Everything smelled so clean and fresh. The restaurant in the hotel was absolutely delicious and the service was perfect. Couldn't as for a better stay. We will definitely being staying there again.

title: March 23 Stay at NY Lotte
text:
This was a booking to celebrate my wife's birthday, we were given a complimentary upgrade which was great to spend our time in the Towers side. We love the main hotel rooms as well the color scheme and open feel is excellent for a NYC hotel. 

You can really feel taken care of in this hotel as there is a lot of attention to detail. The housekeeping and room service are very fast and accommodating. This is an excellent option for a business trip hotel or for a special occasion like we had.
