Thank you very much Miles for looking after us this trip and offering an upgrade and amenities for my wife. This was our best trip to New York. Miles really knows what he is doing and is an asset to the hotel in terms of client service and managing the hotel.

title: very happy to recommend
text:
The hotel is excellently located and the rooms are spacious. The house keeping team are superb, with rooms being meticulously maintained.  The staff at the door always greet you and are extremely polite and ready to assist in any way. The decor is tired and needs updating, and it is disappointing that  24 hour room service is not available, especially for late after attending theatre shows.  But otherwise, we are very happy with this hotel. 
We have to add a special note of thanks to both Mohamed and Joan at the mail desk who went above and beyond in their assistance to us with a delayed package. Thank you sincerely.

title: Lotte Palace Hotel
text: This hotel does not care about customers. With strong storms, 300 thousand homes without out power and canceled flights… Lotte Palace Hotel refused to return my money or let me change my dates to stay in the hotel for circumstances out if my control. I will tell everyone of this poor service on any message board. 700.00 down the drain… horrible

title: Thank you Miles for a wonderful birthday trip!!
text:
Having been to multiple leading hotel brands - my husband and myself believe the Lotte is our favorite. The level of attention to detail and service in this hotel is outstanding. 

Miles from the beginning of our stay was so welcoming, and supportive in making our stay as memorable and special. It was my birthday trip to New York so a huge thank you to Miles for such a great stay and the lovely amenities to celebrate!! He does an excellent job at checking in on guests and presenting the hotel as a manager for the hotel - we got to have a tour of the hotel with him which was great. 

The level of care and detail makes the Lotte truly a home away from home and reassured we are in good hands.

We were offered a complimentary upgrade for my birthday to experience the towers side and both areas of the hotel are excellent. It was a wonderful stay.

We will definitely be using the Lotte New York as our hotel whenever coming to NYC. In our opinion it is better than the Park Hyatt/Pierre or the Plaza and in our opinion is the best hotel in NYC. The training is what you expect for a five star and there is a very luxurious feel to the hotel. Thanks again Miles! We look forward to coming back.

Celine

title: Comfortable, spacious, convenient and great staff
text:
Hotel is comfortable & spacious, both the room & lobby, with plenty of seating areas to catch up with people, look at things on your phone while having a coffee, or while waiting for someone. Location is great for business or time off, getting around town with proximity to subways & access to taxi or ride service. Although the style is historic & grand, it doesn't feel old school to stay there.

Staff was terrific - - Tammie in Housekeeping (27th floor) was particularly attentive, helpful, and friendly, being sure we had what we needed and greeting us with a smile and warm hello every time we saw her over our stay. Front desk, as well as  hostess & servers at the Gold Room were pleasant, welcoming and seemed to be proud to work in such a beautiful historic environment.

My only criticism of the hotel is that is would be nice to have a personal coffeemaker in each room for that first cup while you're starting your day. Had to get dressed & go down 27 stories to buy a cup and head back up before my early conference call, and again later in the day while working in the room.

title: Our “GO TO” Hotel in NYC
text:
We have stayed at The Lotte New York Palace many times over the course of many years. The Lotte Palace is the place to be for location, service and ambiance. The front door staff, the front desk personnel, and the 
housekeeping staff are all efficient, warm and friendly. The rooms are spacious, luxurious, with impressive views.
Recently, our experience with Miles Gomez, front desk manager, was
exceptional. He enhanced our stay with his personal attention to our specific needs. He is to be commended for his superb service.
We are looking forward to our next visit to this exquisite, historic hotel.
For us, it is always a 5 Star hotel!

Ava and Marc L.

title: A great hotel lovely Location was great.
text:
An iconic hotel in a great location wt St. Patrick s cathedral just opposite .

Dalmasi and Natsuko at front desk were the best staff ever at Front desk.They were so warm and went out of their way to make our stay memorable..

A special mention also to th very kind and helpful concierge staff..

Well done!

title: Amazing hotel, amazing staff
text: Our second stay at this wonderful hotel.  The rooms are incredible, service is top shelf, location is excellent. Above all - it's the friendly, caring and warm staff that just sets the Lotte NY Palace apart from all others.

title: Weekend at The Lotte Palace in New York !
text: We had a great time staying at The Lotte! The front office manager, Miles, was so kind to take us on a private tour of the hotel! That made our trip extra special!! He went above and beyond to help make our trip great!!

title: Perfection!
text:
If you are looking for an upscale, quiet Hotel with spacious accomadations for a family and walking distance to Rockafeller Center, Broadway and shopping, then look no further. The Palace Hotel is the pick for peace, luxury and convenience all in one stop.
We pulled into the parking garage adjacent to the Palace and were immediately greeted by George with a warm, friendly smile and welcoming greeting.  He ushered us to the check in where Melody was also friendly, warm and welcoming.  We then met Joe, who helped us with all our belongings and took us to the 35th floor where our 2 Bedroom Family suite was located.  Beautiful view of St. Patrick Cathedral and the Radio City Music hall sign.  
We booked a 2 bedroom suite to be guarenteed that our 17 and 21 year old sons would have their own rooms, connected to our King Bedded room.  It was a perfect, quiet Suite.  The only quirk was there are no charging ports for iphone.  So make sure you bring plenty of phone charges with the cube.  
There is a nice bakery in the lobby for coffee and treats.  A beautiful lounge for cocktails. 
In summary, this is a very upscale classic NYC hotel (similiar to the old Waldorf) just steps from all the major tourist attractions, while maintaining a reserved, elegance and respite form the noise and crowds.

title: I have come for years, it’s elegant and easy.
text: I love this hotel as a second home, and feel lucky every time I’m here. Thanks to Omar, Samir, and Kal  for treating me so kindly and hospitably. The rooms and upgrades as part of American Express are spectacular. The Gold Bar is a must. Get a Mrs Aster, Gossip Girl or the Boudreaux.

title: My birthday weeknd at the Palace!
text:
This was my birthday weekend and the experience from the time to the time we left was first class. 
Jimm at the check in desk expressed great courtesy and efficiency. 
The hotel was well equipped, first class service. The room was excellent and the staff was kind!

title: Arleni At Palm Palais Is A Gem!
text: Arleni at Palm Palais went out of her way to provide person assistance after my husband injured himself during our stay. I just mentioned it while I was picking up our morning coffee and she went above and beyond. Her caring and professionalism made all the difference during our stay!

title: Lack of curiosity.Service was not up to stander.Offer plastic cups.Not part of the hotel stander.Fail to answer phone.
text: Butler & Reception did not ask or offer me help with my big heavy luggage.First day bed sheets stain.Second day broken/chips edge glasses.Lips got injured.Manager no show.Security & Housekeeping show up.Inarticulate communications.

title: A Lotte to love at the Palace
text: Stayed here the first time for the great location, return  every year because of the staff.  My favorite concierge, Kal, helps me find the best theatre tickets and reservations. He remembers my family from year to year; I don’t know how he does it but it makes us feel special,. Kal also made planning this February getaway so easy with everything quickly handled by text!!  Appreciate the professionalism and warmth of Alexandra, the front desk manager. She went out of her way to assist us. They truly make you feel at home if your home was a 5 -star hotel in NYC!!  Stay here,  you won’t be disappointed

title: Best Hotel for A Girls Weekend!
text: My family comes back to this hotel every time we are in New York! We love the rooms, the view is unbelievable of St. Patrick’s Cathedral. The staff is beyond amazing. The concierge, Kal, is a miracle worker and was able to help secure us Polo Bar reservation with very short notice. The front office manager, Alexandra, was very helpful. The doormen are also wonderful! I love this hotel and can’t wait to come back soon. Overall a phenomenal experience!

title: Stayed for a week for business; There are better places.
text: Though quiet, and a hotel which caters to the business clientele, this is a hotel which has seen better days and is “dated.”  I stayed on the 24th floor and the room and carpet need a refurb in the worst way.  The price per room (weekdays) - and various hotel services - are not worth the expense; $49 for eggs and bacon!!!!  Hard pass…The location is central to everything however the building is undergoing structural repairs so there is scaffolding and locked entrances around the property.  Look elsewhere.

title: Avoid room 909!!!!
text:
The people are lovely and work hard but some of the rooms are embarrassing to be honest. Less than 1 foot from our window was a dozen industrial air conditioning units! When asked to switch to another room they said there was nothing available - Wednesday in mid-Feb our stay. I truly can’t believe they would make this a room. Room definitely dated, but was clean. 

It seems they are doing renovations so I would avoid until that is done. At all costs, avoid room 909!!! Sadly I will not be back Based on this experience

title: Slipping …
text:
We have been coming here for the past 20+ years as we love the perfect location and this wonderful view of the cathedral and the Rockefeller Center. The rooms are functional, but increasingly in not so perfect shape and status. At least not for a 5-Star hotel … which the Lotte still wants to be. No minibar service without additional stocking cost. No water kettle without additional cost. Not to even speak of a Nespresso machine. So not really up to the standards of a 5-Star. 
Staff was not overly professional and sometimes even rude to guests. There is clearly a lot of work to do to bring this property back to where it was and should be.

title: The absolute best
text: I can never say enough good things about the Lotte New York Palace. Being one of the best hotels near our offices, we use them for room blocks when business meetings are being held. Changes happen by the minute during these events, I can always count on them to accommodate those changes as best as possible. This last event required a few last minute late check-outs, Miles was very helpful and accommodated the requests that we made. The sales team is also amazing and handled our many requests quickly. Always look forward to working with this property.

title: Great stay!
text: My wife and I stayed here for our fifth wedding anniversary, as we were looking to get away for a weekend trip where we could enjoy NYC. The location was absolutely perfect, and our stay was one of the very best experiences that I have ever had at a hotel. The staff was incredibly accommodating and friendly, and the concierge allowed us to focus on our experience rather than worry about planning. Overall, it was everything we hoped for and more, and I cannot wait to go back!

title: Very relaxing and beautiful room with a view.
text: It was my first time visiting NYC alone for a vacation and I had an opportunity to stay at the Lotte New York Palace. It was very rustic and beautiful and not too far away from any fascinating sights.

title: Beyond Amazing!
text: Wow where do I begin!! We usually stay at the Pierre in NYC but we will always stay at the Palace now! Dan Nelson set us up with the most amazing view of Radio City Music Hall and the area has me considering moving to NYC!! Breakfast was incredible (try the avocado toast!) and everyone who works there is so nice and accommodating. Stay here!

title: Birthday getaway
text: As always the experience at the luxurious Lotte New York Palace was incredible -  the staff, the accommodations and the dining is all 5-star.  As a group celebrating a friend's special birthday, we felt like there was such amazing attention to detail and the team truly went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed and beyond. The Tower rooms were spotless and the decor is beautiful - and the view of the city was breathtaking!

title: Outstanding staff experience!
text:
I have never received such a high level of service that we received at Lotte New York Palace -the Towers. I have recently been seen at a local medical facility in NYC for a major surgery and medical appointments. Upon learning that we would be checking in one day after a trip for pleasure with our daughter Lincy at the Towers desk made sure to contact Miles the front office manager to secure us the same room in the Towers. Upon checking out from that stay Jimm at the Towers desk again arranged for myself my husband and my parents to be again in the same room at the Towers at a reduced rate. Miles called the day of our arrival to find out what time we would be arriving to ensure our room would be ready for an early check in. We spoke with him upon our arrival and were greeted with such warmth and kindness during an incredibly stressful
Time. I was able to overlook St Patrick’s Cathedral during all 3 recent stays and felt a sense of serenity. I was able to sleep
The night before a major surgery due to the quietness of the floor we were on as well as the luxurious linens and comfy beds. Gazing out at the NYC skyline as you fall asleep and wake up has no words  Upon walking into our room the day we checked in , we were greeted with the most beautiful bouquet of fresh flowers from Miles, Lincy and Jimm and the rest of the staff at the Palace along with a lovely note. They are still on my table at home and were one of the first things I saw when I woke up after surgery and put a smile on my face. We were treated with such kindness, compassionate and thoughtfulness during our stay. The staff truly went above and beyond to ensure that we had a wonderful stay. I will be needing more
Surgeries later in the year and will
Also be taking out 9 year old to celebrate when I am done with treatments and surgeries. We will be for sure booking at Lotte New York Palace and could not imagine staying anywhere else in NYC. 

And the coffee at Pomme Palis is delicious!

title: NO RECOMENDABLE
text: Practicamente voy a copiar la opinión que he leído de otro usuario que estuvo hace tres meses. Estuvimos tres noches en este hotel, el personal de recepción absolutamente desagradable, imposible conseguir una sonrisa o una palabra amable, no así las señoras de la limpieza que eran encantadoras. El lobby del hotel es correcto y la habitación también, pero el baño necesita urgentemente una actualización. El precio es claramente exagerado para el servicio que ofrecen. La mayor sorpresa fue que nos hicieron una retención en la tarjeta de crédito sin autorizarla de 2000$, y que aún estamos esperando que se anule dado que la estancia y todos los gastos los pagamos por adelantado. En resumen, un desastre de servicio. No recomiendo este hotel.

title: Terrific place to stay!
text: Beautiful hotel. Dan Nelson helped us book the suite of our dreams, with amazing views and amenities. The location was perfect for everything we wanted to do and see, and it was wonderful having the suite as our home away from home for our visit in NYC. I will likely be staying here for all our future trips!

title: Concierge service was on point
text: Kal from the concierge in the towers was of great help he always got what we needed and he he always got the reservations we desired. He is very friendly and kind and was nice to have a conversation with every now and then.

title: Great location
text: A beautiful historic hotel and perfectly located, staff go above and beyond,  breakfasts were delicious and drinks in the Rarity Room were a perfect ending to a busy day in NYC. Walking distance to Times Square!

title: Great Stay!
text: Great stay. The hotel rooms are very spacious. Great location and services. Our little boy got a teddy bear as a gift from the hotel and he was extremely happy. Thanks to Dalmasi Rivera , she’s an amazing host and made our stay really enjoyable.

title: Perfect Palace for a Girl's Getaway
text:
Our three night getaway to NYC was made magical because of our stay at The Lotte Palace! From our arrival to departure, every detail was perfect. Highlights included gorgeous decorations,  drinks in The Golden Room, and stunning views from our very comfortable room. We especially appreciated Randee and David's hospitality! 

We walked everywhere and found the Lotte to be a convenient location to Rockefeller Center and the Theatre District. 

We are already dreaming of our next trip to NYC and The Lotte!

title: Such a disappointment
text: I was very excited to return to the Palace. And the location remains terrific. But my suite in the Towers feels like it’s been uninhabited since the 90s. The minibar is completely empty which means if I want sparkling water or soda I have to rely on room service. Same with coffee and tea as there are no in room options. The wireless is spotty at best. The lounge is closed in the evening leaving only the ritzy wine bar or a restaurant as options for drinks. That doesn’t work well for someone wanting low key. No turn down service which I would frankly expect at this price point. Check in was bleh. My room is quiet, save for the people in the adjoining room whom I can hear. It’s just a lot of misses for me with nothing special except location to redeem it.

title: Like a fairytale. ………..
text:
After being a regular customer at the magnificent LOTTE New York Palace for over twenty years this was the top experience ever….Not only does The Palace provide every single need or want in a hotel, the experience is nothing short of perfect 👍.
Yes I have been a guest for over  twenty years and always treated with the utmost professionalism and class.. this time was different. My daughter always wanted to get married at The beautiful St. Patrick’s  Cathedral…located directly beside the hotel.. she wanted to have her wedding in New York and  to get ready in the gorgeous rooms they provide………

The New York Palace and their ENTIRE staff made the wedding experience the best anyone could wish for.. a very unexpected suite upgrade was made without us knowing. This was the best suite with a view of entire Manhattan.. her wedding party was able to get ready , enjoy wonderful meals in this paradise room. Thanking the master front desk Jimm…. who personally saw to making this entire event a dream by upgrading her room…. and Myles for this surprise to make a wedding day Perfect. I have personally worked with  Jimm ….the most efficient, and professional staff member  for over twenty years…. Being from out of town all guests were booked in the main hotel as well as the stately TOWERS. Seventy five guests had a perfect stay. What also made this trip seamless was the information and guidance from the best Concierge staff in the city… Isabella, Ani, Rene, Kal and Diego are just some of the superb concierge staff. We are daily greeted with warmth and welcoming from the entire doormen staff…  George, Ray, Gary, Louis, Fran , and Eddie. They all have become like family to all of us.  Thank you will never ever explain our heartfelt appreciation for making our daughter’s wedding a fairytale come true with everything that was done for us in this most perfect, wonderful, and professional  hotel in the heart of Manhattan THE LOTTE NEW YORK PALACE. 👏👏👏👏👏👏

title: 50th birthday celebration
text: Nicest staff I have ever met! Everyday they would welcome us back and help us with everything we needed. We had an amazing view of New York and St. Patrick’s cathedral. A great location centered in the middle of everywhere

title: Lotte Palace Special Anniversary Weekend
text: We stayed at the Lotte Palace NYC for our anniversary and it was wonderful. Diego, our stellar concierge, found us a beautiful dinner location overlooking Central Park which made it extra special. He also recommended the Magic Show, in the hotel for two nights only, and it was superb. We had a wonderful weekend and the Lotte staff was a huge part of it. Thanks!

title: A hotel that is defined as pure elegance
text: If there is one word to describe my experience with lotte it would be opulence. It was my wedding weekend and for many, it's one of the most important times in their life. As a native New Yorker, the Lotte screams NYC classy hotel. Truth be told my stay would not be what it was without Mrs. Tracy-Ann Hamilton. Anything I needed Tracy was ensuring my stay was nothing short of magical. With the intensity of the hospitality business, Tracy exudes a sense of professionalism, compassion, and a calm demeanor that is exactly what Lotte New York Palace brings other guests. She was able to coordinate the multiple rooms we had with the front desk and was simply nothing short of amazing. The Lotte is very lucky to have such an amazing employee. While there may be all the craziness in NYC, when you walk into Lotte you are treated like family. Every staff member was professional and tried the best they can to make my family happy. Reuben with room service brought me an amazing breakfast and his staff was able to accommodate my dietary restriction. Despite living 30 minutes from Lotte, if I could pick a hotel to stay in again I would choose Lotte in a heartbeat.

title: Recommend and will stay again.
text: New York can be overwhelming for a visitor. Staying in Lotte NYC palace was like having a home to come back to after a long day sightseeing. The rooms are spacious for NYC and the beds are dreamy. The doormen are the stars of the show, so welcoming, fun and always engaging the kids making them feel like the most important guests in the hotel. We went to the Golden Room one night, which was incredibly busy. We were grateful that the team welcomed a group of adults and two kids under these circumstances. Yes, the golden room had some service hiccups but I believe this must be down to post COVID staffing issues in the industry. I can certainly see myself staying here again on my next visit and recommend it to others. Thank you guys for a great stay.

title: Skip the Gold Room
text: Very disappointed in our visit to the Gold Room (bar). All I can say is check your bill - lots of hidden charges that no one can explain.  Our waiter literally said “the computer did it!!” When I asked the manager about it I got a blank stare since he didn’t have a clue. Go get your over priced drinks elsewhere.

title: Birthday Weekend
text:
I recently was planning a weekend at Lotte New York Palace.  Before my my arrival I was in contact with their concierge member DIego.  I cannot even begin to tell you the Exceptional Service I received from 
Diego . Professional helpful pleasant to work !!

Diego gets 5 stars as well as the rest of the staff 

Many many thanks for making my weekend one to remember 

Mary P
Boston, Ma

title: Magical Experience
text: I stay at hello today powers exceeded my expectations. The staff was friendly and courteous, and the room was immaculate with an incredible view. The on-site spa was luxurious and relaxing. 10/10 would recommend!

title: Great Girls Staycation!
text: Lotte New York Palace is the best hotel in the city- amazing location, friendly staff and comfortable rooms. Dan Nelson & Lily Cohen in sales were super helpful with making my reservation and taking care of ours needs ahead of time. We had drinks in Gold Room and it was a fabulous way to cap off our weekend. Will stay here again!

title: Luxury weekend in NYC with kiddos
text:
Came here 2 years ago while wife was pregnant to relax for the weekend.  It was great!
Back this weekend with all 3 kids for a weekend in the city. We were honestly nervous to come here with 3 little kids.
Happy to report the weekend has been a huge success so far!
Family suite is pretty big for NYC and accomodates the 5 of us perfectly. 
The entire staff was soo warm and welcoming when we arrived, paying extra special attention to our 3 kids that they treated like VIPs. 
Friday night, last minute looking for dinner for 5... no idea what to do and everywhere is booked... just ask Christian at the concierge! We were treated like celebrities,  whisked away in the Lotte's Maybach to a popular spot with a long line. No problem! Christian called ahead and had a VIP table waiting for us!
All this was only Friday! Can't wait to see what Christian has for us tonight!!

title: What a disappointment
text: Poor accommodations fir what it was supposed to be. Not luxurious at all. If it weren’t for the friendliness of the staff, we would have switched hotels. A great experience with the concierge staff though. Kal Naim was exceptional. His excellent service made up (almost) for the bad experience with the hotel room.

title: Amazing Stay…!
text: Everyone throughout the hotel were amazing, kind and professional people. All requirements were attended promptly and every question was helpfully answered. You will be our hotel every time we visit New York! Thank you so much to every single one of you for such an amazing stay…!

title: Employees
text: Excellent employees especially Maurice who gave us an exklusiv gossip girl tour and also the nicest concierge you’re ever going to meet Kal Naim help us with everything we needed and was always available for all questions we had

title: Magical Christmas Experience
text: Fabulous views of St Patricks Cathedral and the iconic Christmas tree. Our room was amazing super clean and comfortable in the Towers just steps away from Saks Fifth Ave and all of the wonderful Christmas experiences in NYC. We dined in the Gold Room and had impeccable service and cuisine and scrumptious treats from Pomme Palais. The hotel is fabulous, iconic wonderfully decorated and the dedicated and professional staff make it a truly magical experience. Thank you to Miles, Nancy, Ani, Eddie, Samir and all of the people who truly care to make everyones visit special. Can't wait too go back at Easter 2023

title: Buenísima experiencia y sobretodo el trato del concierge Christian Ribeiro.
text: Estuvimos 10 días incluidos el de acción de gracias. El hotel fantástico y maravillosamente engalanado para las fiestas de Navidad. Habitación muy espaciosa y limpia. Desde el piso 39 en el que estábamos, podíamos contemplar la bonita vista de la ciudad, incluida la parte trasera de la catedral de San Patricio. Una atención, en la recepción muy agradable, especialmente la del concierge Christian Ribeiro, con un trato exquisito. Muchas gracias por hacernos nuestra estancia tan agradable. Esperamos volver otra vez este año.

title: Let down by new ownership
text:
We stayed over Xmas in The Towers in 3 deluxe rooms. We stayed a few years ago before it was owned by Lotte and it was wonderful. This time was a completely different experience. 
So busy , not enough staff, long queue at check in, rooms not ready for hours, no tea and coffee making facilities in rooms, no mini bar, rooms not cleaned on returning late afternoon. 
We paid over £11,000 for three rooms and I can honestly say it was like an upmarket premier inn. Don’t waste your money. What was a truly beautiful hotel is being totally ruined by Lotte - hotel chain that has taken ownership. We will definitely not be returning.

title: Comfortable, But Needs Updating
text:
Spent two nights at the Lotte Palace for a quick business trip. Front desk check in experience was ok - not super friendly but fine. Room was a king on the 26th floor. Lovely view, big spacious room with comfortable bed, and very quiet. But bathroom in dire need of an update. All phones next to the toilet need to go! Seemed very Trump 80’s. Shower and tub felt like it could have been a Holiday Inn. Overall room felt 4 star, bathroom felt 2 star. 

I also thought it was super odd that there was a mini fridge in the room but no beverages or food. Most hotels are back to pre Covid minibar service - the Palace should catch up. To their credit they left two complimentary bottles of water in the room at all times.

I would definitely return as it was super convenient for work - but wouldn’t choose to stay here if it weren’t a business trip.

title: Southern hospitality in Ny
text: I spent the week here on business, experiencing the city was great but having a bartender like Marc Marie to give me that hometown feeling was the difference maker. Many Ny places and cops even made it feel unwelcome but her great drinks and jokes made me feel at home. I laughed more tonight than I have in years, this type of service you can’t put a price tag on. Hotel- A-, service A+++. Bellmen were awesome too.

title: Concierge was a huge help!
text: Our Concierge Christian was the best! We were visiting NYC for the first time and seeing my daughters first Broadway show!  And he helped find the best restaurants and made sure we were all set. It was a holiday weekend and we had a mixed group of teens and older folks and it all worked out great.

title: Family Vacation!
text: We had a wonderful trip to the Palace for the holiday. The hotel was beautiful. The service was great. The doormen were super friendly. We appreciated Eddie and Gary and the other guys up front too. The first night we arrived we were treated exceptionally by Samir and MaryAnn at the front desk who called over and got us a table at a nearby Italian restaurant. Anytime we needed anything we were taken care of politely and quickly during our stay. We loved the location in mid town. We will come back next time we are in New York. Thanks!

title: Great location and historic location
text: I really liked the hotel and its location. I was expecting an even better service for the price. The room was very comfortable but lacked personal touch. It is a very convenient location in NYC. Certainly a place to recommend.

title: Central iconic hotel
text: Nice and very central hotel. Large rooms, but very impractical with no shower and only bathtub. No coffee machine nor kettle available in the room. Excellent laundry service. There are signs everywhere about being mindful and that only towels on the floor will be changed: you take the time to do so but then they just change everything in any case... Large gym area and Spa located on the 8th floor. Sauna also available on the 8th floor. Two iconic bars are located inside the hotel on floor 2. Breakfast available on floor 2 but not included in room rate and generally fairly high prices for relatively small dishes, not sure I'd recommend having breakfast there.

title: Needs improvement
text: We just spent 2 nights at the Lotte hotel and cannot believe it’s considered 5 star worthy. From taking the rickety elevator up to the 39th floor to walking into a room where the carpet looked like something from the 70’s and not even installed correctly we were immediately disappointed. The light plate fell off the wall and the bed bounced with every movement.  We didn’t try the cafe or use the concierge so I can’t speak to that but the room needs to be updated. The upside is location and Molton Brown amenities.

title: Absolutely Superb hotel!
text:
I've been wanting to visit New York for over 20 years.  I knew that when I eventually did go, I wanted to stay in a luxurious hotel.  Lotte Palace exceeded my expectations on every level. 
I stayed for 5 nights over New Year with my two teenage children.  Our room was a cathedral view room and was huge with two double beds, a table and chair area by the window to enjoy the view, a granite and marble bathroom with Molton brown products, fluffy towels, guest bathrobes and Slippers.  
The bedding was of superb quality, so lovely to slip into after a long day walking 20,000 steps sightseeing around Manhattan.
The gym was superb and is used by NFL and NBA players when they stay in New York for matches.  My son loved it in there and visited daily.
The concierge, reception staff and housekeeping were all so friendly and professional. 
The patisserie on the ground floor does superb take out coffee, breakfasts and lunch but it is very expensive.  There is a starbucks directly opposite the hotel, I got breakfasts from here daily and we had it in the room.
The hotel is ideally located so close to Rockerfella Centre, 5th Avenue, Times Square, Central Park.  
I booked with British Airways holidays.  There was a card deposit of 100 on arrival which was refunded a few days later.  No resort fees or extras were payable on departure.  
This hotel is an absolute gem.  We will never forget our stay here.

title: Exceptional service
text: Awesome hotel and the best attention ever to every single detail! Worth staying on big room w nice views and the best team! Even room service bringing hot water for my much needed lemon honey tea  to the room when everything Was already closed!

title: Fantastic stays at Lotte hotel with awesome staff!
text: This is our second stay with Lotte Palace and we will definitely be back. Our first visit was last summer, 2022 to celebrate our daughter's 16th birthday and everyone celebrated her! We decided to come back to NYC to see all the Christmas decorations. This hotel is absolutely beautiful and all the employees are super helpful and super friendly! Christian, our concierge, was especially helpful on this trip offering several restaurant recommendations, reservations and providing great tips for our vacation. We were also able to get photos with the Rockettes and our daughter absolutely loved this!

title: Family holiday
text: We came for a family holiday,  2 adults & 2 teenagers 17 & 15. The holiday was booked through virgin holidays and we’d selected a quad family room which was 2x double beds.  Unfortunately when we arrived the 2 so called double beds were not much bigger than 2 single beds. There was literally one pillow on each bed.  My husband is 6 ft 2 and my daughters are not exactly kids at 17 & 15! There was no way we could have stayed in that room for 9 nights. After speaking to reception The fabulous Roxanna managed to sort a much better room with 2 kingsize beds and amazing views in the Towers.  We did have to pay a surcharge but well worth it, we had the most amazing holiday in NYC. Thanks so much to Roxanna the Lotte New York Palace for an amazing time 🤩

title: Great location, but mediocre food and service
text: I have stayed in this hotel when it was the Helmsley and the New York Palace before becoming the Lotte New York Palace, and in this time it’s gone from an exceptional hotel, to a good hotel and now something which is very mediocre. They don’t even provide complimentary coffee and tea in the room as standard ( when it was the Helmsley you had a nespresso machine and kettle with a selection of different coffees and teas in every room, a complimentary bowl of fruit and fresh flowers)  you now have to ask for it. The food is very mediocre- cold “breakfast potatoes” both in room service and the main restaurant- and the sausage was awful. Had better cooked breakfast at a roadside cafe - and at 50 dollars it’s not cheap. They also don’t have enough housekeeping staff - so big delays on getting the room and getting beds made etc. I wouldn’t stay here again - particularly considering the prices they are charging . Small bathrooms

title: Christmas at Lotte Palace
text: Just returned from family Christmas at the Lotte Palace.  Rooms overlooking the Cathedral definitely worth booking and the location in general is fantastic.  Cocktails in the Gold Room not to be missed.  Whilst housekeeping can be erratic the team on the floors always really helpful.  Concierge team, and Christian in particular, are 5 star - lots of excellent recommendations for dinner etc. After some issues with our transfer back to JFK even had a call from Christian on your return to ensure we’d had a good trip home.  George the doorman is another star of a great team.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would certainly look forward to a return visit.

title: Lotte New York Palace
text: Thankful for the kindness & great care shown from booking, arrival & during our entire stay. Always grateful for Tamara, Executive Office, and now we’ll add Yohenny, Tower Front Desk and Christian, Concierge. This is one of the most beautiful and best location in NYC, especially during the holidays!  Never disappoints!

title: Excellent experience
text: This is our second time staying at the Lotte - both times at or near Christmas. Staff was incredibly warm and inviting with Stacy being the most hospitable of everyone we encountered. She made us feel special when we checked in. Our flight was delayed by 10 hours (the Southwest debacle) - we called the Lotte to let them know we would be arriving much later than anticipated. They had no problem holding our room for us. Needless to say, we got in at 2am happy to be in New York and ready to get in bed. Stacy was absolutely lovely, welcoming and accommodating. She checked us in swiftly and has us on our way. Additionally, when we got to our room we found that Stacy had upgraded us to a room with a view - extremely unexpected. Later our departing flight was cancelled and all flights were booked so we had to extend our trip another day. The front desk staff was able to extend our stay, in our same room, for an additional night. Keep in mind we were there just days before NYE so I know they were probably close to capacity. Overall I highly recommend staying at the Lotte not only because of it’s central location to everything but more importantly due to the cleanliness of the hotel, the staff, and the overall experience.

title: Biggest disappointment of our wedding
text:
Honestly, absolutely devasted by the service from this hotel. 
We were due to get married in NY Dec 2020 and couldn't think of a better hotel to stay at for 1. an extended stay of 10 nights 2. Our full wedding experience  3. Christmas! 
The hotel looked beautiful on every photo and I honestly could not wait. I emailed the hotel ahead to let them know that we would be getting married whilst there and also spending Christmas with them and how excited we were. Thanks to Covid the wedding/ trip got cancelled. We rebooked again for 2021, again i emailed to let them know that we were not given up hope on staying with them. Covid cancelled again. 
FINALLY 2022 was to be our year, we rebooked again, however the price for the hotel had increased substantially, but i wasnt about to let that stop me, we pulled all of our savings and reduced the stay from 10 nights to 8 nights (we still paid for a cathedral view though) and yet again emailed the hotel to express my excitement, I did also ask in my email if they had a laundry service as i'ld need to get my dress steamed on arrival and within 2 days, they responded a very basic response to ask the concierge upon check in.
 At check in, the lobby was a bit chaotic, just full of people and luggage and no real organisation. Once at the desk the woman made an exclamation about us being there for 8 nights, as i imagine not many guests stay in NY for that long, so we explained about getting married in 2 days and also asked about the laundry service, we received very basic service here but didn't mind as it was incredibly busy, but i had hoped that maybe there might be the offer of an upgrade, never mind though. The lifts were a nightmare, considering there were 6, we always found ourselves waiting a while. Finally got to our room and found it quite dated and tired looking, no basic amenities, you needed to phone down if you wanted to use the fridge, to borrow a kettle was an additional charge as well and not even as much as a "Congrats" note to be found in our room, which i found a little sad as even the most basic of B&B's back home make a special effort on someones birthday or anniversary, let alone their wedding! 
The view was lovely, could just about see the Rockefeller tree, and the skyline really was something, but that is as far as the good review goes. 

On the day of the wedding we came down in our wedding attire and had some photos with the Christmas decorations and then our limo picked us up at the lobby, the doorman Maurice was a treasure, a true gentleman and stopped traffic whilst i gathered my dress and ran to the limo. 

Upon returning after the wedding ceremony (still in my massive wedding dress), we had to ask the concierge for a spare key as we had of course left ours in the room in the rush of hte wedding chaos, again we had to stand and queue for a while in our wedding outfits to even get to the front desk. we quickly ran back in to get me out of my dress for the evening as it was too heavy. A this point, the hotel knew for sure i had gotten married and also knew my room number, so i was certain there would be at least a glass of prosecco waiting in the room for us, or maybe a compliment slip to wish us congrats, but there was absolutely nothing, not once did they make an effort to congratulate us on our wedding, which i find incredibly strange! 

All in all, the location was good, door staff good, christmas decorations beautiful, but that's really it. I really wish i had saved myself about £3,000 and booked the same hotel as my family as we visited there the night before the wedding and got chatting to the staff and they sent our table a complimentary bottle of prosecco to congratulate us! 

It really does look beautiful on the photos, but the general public all access the decs anyways so honestly, save yourself the money and book a much cheaper hotel (Park Central was lovely), and visit the decs for free.

title: Amazing New Year's at this lovely hotel! 🎉
text: Had an amazing stay to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday and the new year. Kal was our concierge and he took amazing care of us and set up an unforgettable breakfast experience at the gold room. Needless to say the room and the view were absolutelly stunning. 10 out of 10.

title: Beautiful Location
text: The location, staff, and rooms were superb and enhanced my stay greatly. I was entranced by the Christmas decorations at the hotel. The ease of access to 5th Avenue and the Rockefeller Center was a major selling point. The entire experience was phenomenal.

title: Christmas/New Year Stay
text: All staff very attentive. Excellent tour of the hotel by an experienced and knowledgeable guide, 10am on Saturdays. Beautiful festive decoration. We were able to secure a late checkout at no additional cost. Enjoyable stay overall.

title: Christian Concierge So Helpful
text: This review is for Christian at the Concierge desk. I was only there for 1 night, had a long day of work and needed a nearby restaurant recommendation for dinner. Christian asked what I preferred, called the restaurant to make sure I could walk in with no wait time. It was the perfect recommendation of an Italian restaurant near by and was exactly what I was looking for. I felt really taken care of and his hospitality was great. It was much appreciated Christian. Thank you so much!

title: Pretty poor experience
text:
I booked a 3 night stay for New Year’s Eve. I was expecting a luxurious experience but I didn’t get what I came for. Toilet broke twice. The room is very mediocre. Breakfast was supposed to be included but it wasn’t because there was an UI issue with Amex and apparently I didnt book correctly. On my last day they came knocking/ringing on my door 3 times and disturbed me from my sleep. Had to ask them a few times to clean up my room since they didn’t come after an hour.

I got an apology for it but nothing else, sorta expected a much better experience for the money I was paying.

title: What a marvellous hotel
text: We had a fantastic 5 day trip to New York and one of our main highlights was entering our room on the 27th floor to see St Patrick’s Cathedral and the Rockafella Centre right in front of us.  We felt the room was huge for the two of us and did not mind that it was a shower over a bath - it was still a lovely shower!  The hotel has so much charm especially during the holiday period.  Never any problem waiting for lifts either.  Good room service one evening too.

title: Almost 5 star
text:
Lovely hotel and location, but a few minor details stopped me from giving 5 stars.

1.) Check in was too long, taking almost 10 minutes per person. After 12 hours of travel not what you needed. Waited around 30 mins. Check out was a similar experience.
2.) No kettle in the room you have to pay extra for a coffee station. I have never stayed in. 5 star and paid the price of one to be charged extra for this. Also WIFI was being charged at 15usd per day extra. 
3.) Beds are only a small double so for a family of four it was a little tight. There is plenty of room in the bedrooms for larger beds. 

Great location hotel in all was great and staff very friendly.

If you don't want to pay the high prices for breakfast then I would recommend toasties on the corner.

title: All in all, a wonderful experience
text: After a little bit of a bumpy start, we ended up having a real good time. The hotel is everything you would expect from a 5 star luxury hotel un NYC: beautiful decorated rooms, breath taking views and great caracther. We had a bad start because the hotel was packed for new years and we ended waiting for more than 3 hours to get a rollaway bed. Prices are a tille stiff (like a USD$350 room service bill for 5 burgers), but you know that you are paying top dollars for top quality in a top city. The concierge team is AMAZING, Kal and Christian are wounderful, helpful and pollity to a fault, and they will go our of their way to provide you with all you need, DO follow their recommendations and advice.

title: A 5* hotel with a 3* finish.
text:
This is a really hard review to write and one I had hoped would not be required. 

I have just returned from 5 nights spent at the Lotte over the Christmas period. The hotel lobby is exactly as seen in all pictures online - absolutely stunning. The check in process was smooth and we were shown to our room on the 25th floor. 

The room although basic (which I had read in reviews) was initially clean and tidy and had a large king bed and bathroom. I did feel that the dated look and lack of consumables was lacking for a 5* establishment though. More inline with 3-4* resorts I’ve stayed in. 

The room was quiet and private and we slept very well over all 5 nights. 

However, the negatives. On 2 occasions we received no room service at all. Leaving at 0730 and returning at 2000 (after getting engaged) to find a room that had received no house keeping. I know this time of year can be busy so I assumed maybe it was just an accident. Housekeeping just continuously told me to wait and have no valid reasons for this incident. After 90 minutes of waiting I went and spoke with a member of the reception team. I was told “unfortunately we’re short staffed and things will just be missed”, which I thought was an awful way to provide an excuse. I was told someone would be sent up straight away. Another hour passed and still no member of the housekeeping team arrived. By this point I rang reception and told them we’d need to go to sleep. 30 minutes later a member of the cleaning team let themselves into our room (nearly 11pm). Apparently she had only just been asked to clean this room as it was empty…someone in the management set up was clearly struggling to communicate across departments. 

When we complained about this the following morning we were basically told to “get back in our box” and it became apparent the hotel was now prioritising guests for New Year and not their current incumbents. 

Overall, the hotel is stunning from a lobby/communal perspective, but the rooms are way below the standard expected of a 5* hotel and the customer service was shocking at times which ultimately did impact on our stay. 

If the hotel was to undergo a refurb of the rooms and the staff underwent a bit of customer service training this hotel would be superb! A great trip, spoilt by a few small things.

title: Amazing stay
text: The Lotte Palace is the perfect property for business travelers, couples and families alike. From the perfect location in midtown, to the exquisite architecture of the original buildings and elegant holiday decorations, to the beautiful and comfortable rooms, this is a hotel that does not disappoint. But perhaps the most notable quality is the superior customer service of each and every staff person we encountered. I cannot say enough about the Lotte Palace.

title: Thanks for all of your help
text:
Best wishes for to all of the staff at the Towers at the Lotte NY Palace for a happy holiday season and healthy new year.  

While the Palace has been our hotel of choice for our visits to NYC for many years, our recent visit was long and extraordinary, prompting me to write my first (and likely last) Trip Advisor thank you.  

Thanks to all of you for your gracious hospitality.  Special thanks to Laura and Roxanne in the extended stay and reservations departments for being so flexible and helpful as we booked our stay and then had to delay and extend it several times over many days and calls, as our travel plans changed (and without changing our room rate).  Special thanks also to Clara and the front office and room service teams for making us feel at home, for weeks.  We look forward to seeing you all on our next visit to the City.

title: Needs improvement
text: We stayed during a busy time (right before Christmas).  The hotel was overbooked and they could not keep up with their services.  Rooms were ready late.  Check-in was long.  Rooms are not that great.  This hotel needs an update.  We used to stay here regularly and would pick other hotels in the future.  The people working there have worked there a long time and all do their best.

title: Worst 5 star experience ever
text:
We had booked a palace suite and an additional king room, prior to arrival I called and requested that the rooms be on the same floor and also a roll away bed in the suite. The individual whom I spoke to OFFERED to have our rooms be adjoining but upon arrival we were told that they had made a mistake and that our rooms would be across from one another which we accepted as we had no other choice.

When we arrived in the suite, there were actually two bedrooms.  One king and one double all attached to a living room, with two adjoining doors wide open.  We then went to dinner and upon our return at 11:45pm, the adjoining room was locked with some of our items inside.  I had missed a call from the manager named Ruth at 11:00pm, SIX hours after we had checked in stating that they had made ANOTHER MISTAKE by having all three rooms open as our room was supposed to just be the living room and king bedroom.  No one was staying in the adjoining room on this evening yet they made us move our items out, eventhough it was their mistake and nearly midnight at this point.  We then requested a roll away bed to be sent to the suite and had to wait 1.5 hours and did not receive the bed until well after 1:00am after along and exhausting day of travel.   When we called the front desk to ask about the roll away bed the same manager named Ruth was incredibly rude and short with us, as if we had been the ones at fault for this nightmare.  The nightly rates here are not low certainly not for a suite and additional king room yet they purport to be a 5 star hotel, but the service is incredibly poor what I would expect at a holiday inn. DO NOT STAY HERE unless you want to be continually punished for the hotel’s mistakes.

title: Christmas 2022
text: We had a Signature Suite plus 2 rooms, everyone at Lotte was exceptional from the time we entered the hotel. Omar, Matos, Ray greeting and assisting us on check in and check out treated us like family. Ann Marie at the front desk was equally helpful as was Rachida on our floor. Thank you for making the weekend extra special

title: All window dressing, misses out on the details
text:
For this year's annual Manhattan Christmas trip, we decided to give Lotte NY Palace a try. Let me start by saying that the lobby of the hotel is exciting, luxurious, and spectacular, especially during the holidays. We were excited to stay at Lotte Palace based on the reviews we read, and things started off on a great foot when we were given an upgrade to a corner suite.

Given the upgrade, we were totally fine with not getting our room until later in the evening, especially since we had plans that would take us until after dinner. We were assured that the rollaways would be out and ready for our kids since they'd be pretty tired after a long day out, and all we needed to do was pick up the keys at the desk.

Well, Lotte Palace is clearly understaffed for the size of the hotel. There were quite a number of disgruntled guests waiting in line in front of me with rooms that weren't ready (currently 7pm). There were 4 people working reception, and it took about 20 minutes for my turn to be up (about 5 groups in front of me). 

Once we got up to our suite, we were very unimpressed. The decor was outdated. The kitchen had no utensils/plates/cups. There was no coffee machine of any kind. We had 2 bathrooms, and both of the toilets were runny (had to jostle with the handle to make them stop running). To top it all off, the rollaways weren't set up yet, and once we called down to request them, it took close to an hour for them to be brought up.

To compare, at either the Ritz or the Peninsula:
- Kitchen? Fully stocked.
- Coffee? Nespresso or Keurig.
- Bathrooms? Fully functional, luxurious, and updated.
- Extra beds? Not only were they ready when we were back from dinner, but there were slippers out for the kids and even personalized teddy bears when they were younger.

Upon checking out, it took over 40 minutes from the moment we handed our luggage ticket to bellhop to have them retrieved from storage. I do not blame the staff here at all. They were working their butts off and were clearly understaffed for the size of hotel. 

All that being said, it is unlikely that we'd stay at Lotte Palace again. The lobby and spa is spectacular, and the views of the city are incredible. Unfortunately, everything else just falls a bit short at the moment.

title: Something extra special
text: We absolutely love this hotel. We come here every Christmas with our 2 sons as a family tradition. The staff are fantastic and so friendly. The hotel is stunning but at Christmas it is spectacular and has such a wonderful feeling.our sons love mailing their letters to Santa and patiently wait for the reply which is very special. Next Christmas we are going to stay for Christmas Day. Highly recommend this hotel all year round but especially at Christmas, it has the most magical feeling.

title: Perfect in every way!
text: A beautiful hotel in a fantastic location! Highly recommend upgrading to a Cathedral view. Magical to wake up to every day! The service was impeccable from checking in to the doormen helping us on our last day. The Gold Room for breakfast is also stunning. Thank you for making our stay so special, we will be back!

title: Excellent!
text: Though I did not stay at the hotel my family did and loved it. Miles, one of the employees, was especially helpful to me over the phone getting champagne for the room.  He was extremely professional and helpful making sure their stay was excellent. Would highly recommend!

title: Pésima atención de Norma
text:
Un hotel increíble ubicación y amabilidad  por parte del personal en especial consejeria pero tienen una empleada llamada Norma que no está a la altura de la calidad del hotel 
Espero puedan solucionarlo para que el trato al cliente sea el correcto a los servicios del hotel 
Destacar la cafetería del lobbie para desayunar 
La ubicación es increíble

title: Christmas Trip to NYC from UK
text: We visited the hotel the week before Christmas for 6 nights leaving on 21/12. The hotel was excellent with the staff very attentive and kind. Special mention to  the concierge’s - Ani (who had looked after our requests prior to arrival and also when staying), Christian & Rene too who were excellent. Doormen George and Eddie and all the others and Chief Bellman, Mikey - all total stars. We had a room on the corner at 34th Floor with great views and a decent size with our 18 year plus kids next door. Decent sized rooms. One observation was that there was no heating in the bathroom (not even a heated  towel rail) which we found strange and the bathroom was quite chilly!! Room Service was excellent with the food delicious. The hotel is so convenient for upper Manhattan and we walked miles everyday but also used the Subway too. We would definitely stay again in the future. Thank you Lotte New York Palace and Happy Christmas to all the fantastic staff.

title: Lotte Palace
text: The hotel was beautiful and full of the holiday spirit. Room was amazing and the staff was great! One person thought stood out and I can’t even begin to thank this man for all his help and his simple smile. Miles Gomez,  the manager there greeted me with a smile and even helped carry all my luggage to my room as he said he was headed that way! He is a great asset to this hotel and just a wonderful man. It’s hard to find friendly people these days and willing to go out of their way just because! Thanks Miles, I will come back because of you!

title: Beautiful hotel! Will definitely return!
text: Loved the Palace! We stayed in the tower. Absolutely gorgeous hotel! Great location! Went to see the Rockettes and Christmas lights and trees. Friendly desk and doormen. Great menu for room service as well. Will definitely stay here the next time we want to stay in Midtown!

title: A good word for Isabella Ibragimov from the concierge desk..
text:
I want to give a good word for Isabella Ibragimov from the concierge desk for her professional & exquisite work she is doing daily at the desk & to put a shine on her beautiful personality as a human being.. 
Isabella took care of my requests with full attention & care all the way across the globe from Tel Aviv & organized all of them a month in advance till I got to the Lotte New York Palace 2 weeks ago.. 
My trip was perfect because of Isabella & her personal care & attention, & even after I’ve left & had a situation with the hotel- she personally took care of it for me & fixed it.
So next time when you are at the Lotte New York Palace- look for Isabella Ibragimov the wonderful concierge & you’ll know you are in good hands.. thank you Isabella ❤️
Maya from Israel..

title: The Palace treats you like royalty
text: The Lotte New York is a great hotel to stay in. The people are great and help you out a ton. The only thing I wanted more was a place you could go down stairs and eat breakfast and it comes with your hotel.

title: Just ok and not a 5 star hotel
text:
It’s a nice hotel, but the facilities are not 5 star. No coffee in the room, no all day bar apart from a coffee shop in the style of Starbucks. No mini bar or water in the room. There’s a lounge area but no table service etc and there’s cups left everywhere. 

The rooms are nice if not a little tired. I stayed as a group of 2 adults and 2 children so not having a drink available was irritating. The room service menu and subsequent drinks are absolutely extortionate. 

The location is the best part of the hotel as it allows you to escape the crazy of the city at Christmas. We had a cathedral view room which had an incredible view. I wouldn’t stay here again, although we had a nice time it wasn’t what we had hoped for “Christmas magic” wise.

title: Underwhelmed abd not good enough.
text: Seriously underwhelmed with this hotel. We booked a year ago and came for our daughters 18th birthdays. There are lots of little niggles that are made worse by the attitude of hotel staff that we spoke to. This is marketed as a 5 star property and falls far short. Our room had noisy air conditioning, a locked fridge, random days we got water and the first day the bath water was brown. Our daughters had the same issue and more worrying for 2 young women on their own someone walked into their looked room when they were asleep. We tried to complain on check out and nobody was interested and told us to write a review on trip advisor!!!!!! We booked a car to pick us up from the airport, quoted €326 and on check out charged us €407 with no explanation and a flippant response from concierge. The lifts are totally unacceptable, they can’t all be working, we waited an average of 20 minutes in a morning to get from the 12th floor. One morning we had enough of wasting our precious New York time stood in the hall waiting for a lift so complained, the manager came to see us and insisted the lifts are fine, that 20 minutes is the average wait and it’s acceptable!!!! We were staggered!!!!!  We stayed at the Surrey 6 years ago and regretted deeply not going back there.

title: Seriously lacking
text:
For a hotel that claims to be a 5 star hotel, they miss the mark on just about everything. Poor service, outdated, tired rooms and unhelpful concierge (literally do not answer the phone). My room had stained and fraying carpet. The bathroom had cracks and peeling paint on the ceiling. The bed was uncomfortable. The furniture was chipped and tired. It looked like an old Marriott. My hot water went out while there and that had to be fixed. I complained about the room and was met with "Oh yes that needs to be redone but we weren't able to do it. We hope to do it after your stay". And they wouldn't move me since they said they were full. I was not given any thing else to make my stay better. They just ignored me after that. 
It was also a constant 30 minute wait to go to the hotel bar - which is ridiculous. I am a guest. The lack of service and care here was astounding. This used to be a great place to stay. Not any more. For the money, you could go stay at a much nicer hotel with way better service.

title: Old New York Luxury and Modern Amenities
text: The Lotte Palace NY is located in the heart of business activity and provides the finest amenities and service available in NYC.  Within 10 minutes of arrival, the concierge on duty, Christian secured reservations for us at a nearby high end restaurant that turned down my request for seating without a reservation.  This is the type of service that has fallen away in most hotels and also represents The Palace's personal service that is almost impossible to find anywhere else these days.

title: You’re Paying for the Location
text: This hotel had luxury decor without luxury amenities. There was nothing wrong with the amenities per se, they just weren’t anything spectacular. Certainly nothing to justify the price. The rooms and bathrooms are your typical standard New York hotel. The lobby was constantly bustling with people, although I should note that we did stay during the height of the holiday season. The elevators were problematic. They worked fine, but did not seem capable of accommodating all of the guests. Luckily, we were on a higher floor, so it didn’t cause much of an interruption for us, but I felt awful for the people on floors 5 through 20, who had to wait quite a while for an opening in the elevator. The staff clearly seemed to be overwhelmed and it took quite a while to check out, as there was just one person at the reception area during the height of the day. The service wasn’t bad, but again, nothing to justify the price. The one great thing the hotel did have going for itself was the location. Close to all the NYC holiday must do’s. For that reason, our stay was pleasant, but I will likely pass on this hotel in the future.

title: Best Customer Service
text: This is my second year in a row staying there in December and it is by far the best customer service I have ever received. The entire staff is so friendly and Christian at the concierge desk was a huge help with printing show tickets and booking the car service to the airport.  Housekeeping is so friendly every morning and Ray out front is an absolute delight to talk too as well.

title: A Christmas/special occasion visit
text:
The reception plus the outside and inside Christmas decorations were everything we expected and had seen in photo's, we got really excited.

Reception staff were accommodating when we requested a room with a bath not a shower but, completely ignored the fact that not only was this our 3rd time of trying to get to the Lotte due to Covid but, it was also a special occasion (which we had previously been asked about via an email regarding the purpose of our visit).

When we arrived at the room on the 19th floor must admit that we were disappointed.  The room was dated  (and dusty) and not the luxury/standard' we expected.   Running the bath delivered brown water, we didn't phone reception as we had seen others had had this problem, so it was a quick in and out of the shower

Wifi was quite expensive, so we didn't purchase and used this around the area (where there was  free wifi).  

Another thing that we expect was a kettle in the room with coffee/tea making facilities,  When we queried this we were told to order from room service (at a charge).  

On returning from a show we thought we would have a nightcap.  We arrived at 23:00 to be told quite abruptly that the bar was closed and again to order room service as we were guests.  We have never had this is other hotels and again not what we expected. We wanted to sit in the bar and enjoy a drink not in our room like naughty children, after this we made a point of staying out.

We hope to return to New York again but, it is highly unlikely we will stay at the Lotte,

title: Amazing, joyful, busy, non-stop fun
text:
Year after year the Lotte New York Palace exceeds our expectations. The people who work here are the best and greet you with a smile and are always helpful. It is beautifully decorated and the rooms are perfectly clean. This is the only hotel we stay at in NYC and the location you cannot beat! 

Also, Christian, the concierge, is quick to help and plan whatever you might need.

title: Disappointing for our Anniversary
text: We're from Fl and I wanted to surprise my wife with a 5-star hotel. The exterior of the hotel and lobby was beautifully decorated and it looks gorgeous. The biggest disappointment was our room. We spent around one thousand dollars a night to stay here and when we got to the room it smelled like mildew and the paint on the bathroom ceiling was cracking. We've traveled all around the world and I understand that the allure of midtown Manhattan is the nostalgia of an older time but the room itself was lackluster. It was outdated and seemed like it had been let go. My wife was pretty disappointed, to say the least. The staff were very accommodating and friendly as were the people who cleaned our room. The location was great.

title: Excellent stay, will return!
text: We had an amazing experience at The Palace. From the fantastic view of St. Patrick’s Cathedral to the wonderful and helpful staff. The manager Miles was also extremely helpful in getting back an item we left in our room on accident during checkout. He went out of his way and was extremely helpful. Overall a wonderful stay and will return next year!

title: An experience!
text: Location, location, location! You can't get a much better starting spot to explore the city than Lotte Palace. Rooms are spacious with everything you could need. Amenities are great and enjoy utilizing the gym! I would absolutely recommend staying at the Lotte Palace when visiting NYC.

title: Very Impressive Midtown Hotel!
text:
My partner and I stayed at the Lotte Palace during December. We booked the Cathedral and City Skyline View which was absolutely stunning, well worth it!  

Upon arrival we were greeted by welcoming doormen under a nice heated entrance to the hotel. The concierge staff were quick to get you to your room, while being very courteous and polite.

The room was bigger than expected and had a good sized closet to hide all of our clothes etc. There was an iron and ironing board should we need it (also had an umbrella, dressing gown and slippers which was a really nice touch). The bathroom was simple but perfect for what we needed, there was a hairdryer and loads of Molten Brown toiletries too. We brought food to the room quite often and there was a decent sized table with two seats where you could enjoy your meal in front of the spectacular view.

Housekeeping were really nice and did a brilliant job. They were pleasant and thoughtful. They could see we were going through a lot of bottles of water, so they ended up giving us double. Genuinely the best housekeeping service that I’ve experienced.

The hotel itself, the lobby, the courtyard etc is lovely. It was elegantly decorated for the festive period and really got me in the Christmas spirit. It’s a very fancy lobby and has a grandeur staircase. The courtyard was under maintenance, but honestly the Christmas tree and decorations were still impressive and worth checking out. It seems like quite a lot of proposals happen there too! We were on the 31st floor and used the elevators every day. We read some reviews about them being slow, which I guess is quite subjective, but I don’t think they were at all. It took around 1 minute for an elevator to arrive and then reach the 31st floor. 

Overall, should I be lucky enough to return to NYC, I’d be looking at the Lotte without a doubt. It’s ideally located in the Midtown area and everything you need in a hotel (plus more). A 10/10 and I’ll be recommending it to anyone I know planning a trip to Manhattan.

title: The most beautiful hotel lobby staircase
text: The lobby is beautiful and the hotel is centrally located for great shopping. The hotel is also ideally located for dining and directly across the street from an amazing gallery. I thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

title: Amazing Experience
text: We Loved our stay at the Lotte Palace. The service, the views, and the food were excellent. We especially enjoyed room, service, and the Gold Room. The hotel is well appointed and was beautifully decorated for the holidays. We were steps away from everything that we wanted to see and experience. We will be back.

title: The Lotte with young children
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Lotte with our 3 young kids. Upon arrival the kids were greeted with teddy bears and the door men were all so lovely. The ChristmasDecor was gorgeous. It is very centrally located to many things on our TripAdvisor to do list. We would stay here gain next year. The only thing I was missing was a coffee maker in our room. Everything else was fabulous.

title: excelent location, we got a great room
text:
my wife and I were treated very nicely.
since we ariived the front desk (the Towers) gave us the warmest welcome.

since it was our aniversary we got also a VIP amenity (a bottle of sparkilng wine).

we want to come back

title: Most Amazing Time at the Lotte
text: First and foremost, a huge thank you to Jorge Cruz for getting us a room at the Lotte during the holiday season. He was so helpful and his level of customer service was amazing. Also, Diego at the Concierge was so accommodating and picked a perfect restaurant for us. And the hotel itself is amazing. We were in town for the Rockettes and low and behold, the Rockettes were at the Lotte to take pictures with guests. My niece loved it. I asked the woman if they go to all the hotels and she said "No, only this hotel." It made the experience even better, especially since the Rockettes don't do pictures at the show anymore due to COVID. It was overall the best hotel experience I have had and I've traveled a lot. You cannot go wrong with the amenities and very convenient location. I cannot say enough good things. My favorite NYC hotel by far, especially during the holidays.

title: Amazing hotel, service, amenities, and location
text: The Lotte was amazing. It is so well situated, convenient to Rockefeller Center, Radio City, etc. We were upgraded to a Tower room upon arrival, even though it was just noon and we did not expect anything to be available that early, especially on the day before Thanksgiving. The room was spacious, with a great bathroom and walk in closet plus a second closet. As others have noted there is no coffee maker so I brought my own although there is a cafe in the lobby, but the elevators--even the Towers Express-- were somewhat slow and usually packed so this avoided having to go down every morning, or use room service. That said, when we needed something staff were impeccable, from front desk to bellhops to doormen, including housekeeping, who were almost too efficient! We had drinks in the Gold Room, but the one negative was that the hostess at the Gold Room did not play up the second, more upscale bar, Rarities, so we unfortunately did not know about it and missed out on that opportunity. We only found out about it through an historical tour of the hotel that the hotel offered through Kevin Draper of New York Historical Tours, which was fantastic.

title: Mediocre
text: The hotel has lost its luster from the past. The price is high & the amenities are poor.  There was no coffee or tea service in the room so you'd have to go down to the cafe in the lobby, which had a line out the door.  Our fridge was broken. There were only 2 elevators working out of 6, making the wait lengthy & once in, extremely crowded. The elevator limit stated 4 maximum, but there were 8-10 on average crowding in.  Brunch was ok, nothing out of this world for the hefty price you pay. On the positive side, the hotel was beautifully decorated for the holiday, great location in midtown & the people were overall very nice.

title: Great desk help. Thanks Anna Marie!
text: Want to thank Anna Marie Rieber. We had a mix up with 2 rooms and were scheduled to check out Monday instead of Tuesday. My daughter was checked into the Tuesday check out room in error.  One employee told me to switch rooms with my daughter.  I was shocked and came back the next day and thankfully had Anna Marie. She was lovely and proactive enough to make us new room keys which I wouldn’t have thought about. She’s an asset! Thank you!

title: NYC at Christmas
text: The hotel had a very festive feel to it throughout our stay. In addition there seemed to be multiple weddings going on everyday. We used the gym which was excellent. Overall this is our favorite NYC hotel. The location is perfect. The only thing the hotel is missing are casual breakfast and lunch facilities. We’ve been staying here for more than 40 years.

title: Disappointing
text:
The hotel is old, it’s in need of a makeover asap for the prices that they are charging, no space at the bar, we where told to find something of the venue, the room service was awful, there is no minibar in the room and if you find one double check it’s clean!the views are one of the best!
A special thank you to the concierge team which does an amazing job and it’s top notch and thank you to the reception team which is doing a great job considering being the busiest team of the year!

title: Disappointing Visit
text:
2 elevators didn’t work which meant long waiting times.
Mens room off of lobby closed  for repairs.
Attempted to meet a guest at Gold Room for a drink -  ithey were full. suggested we go to the lounge off of the lobby - but they don’t serve drinks.

title: Nothing better than Christmas in the City at the New York Palace Hotel.
text: Our most recent stay in the city was made perfect by the staff at the beautiful and historic Lotte New York Palace Hotel.  From the start George and Mike( our doorman and Bell Cap) made us feel so welcome and as though we had visited them at home.  Clara in the towers attended to our needs and was so cheerful, helpful and professional.  Her warm smile made every greeting a special one.  Jimm at the Towers desk is an amazing staff member that will ensure every possible expectation will be met with ease, courtesy and professionalism.  His local knowledge and recommendations of where to go and do or see is only rivaled by his knowledge of local culinary spots that were sure to delight even the most discriminating tastes.  If you’re planning a family trip during Christmas then there is no better hotel in a better location to be had than the Lotte New York Palace.

title: Birthday Break
text:
We stayed here from the 1st to the 6th of December. Staff were very good and very helpful.
In our opinion there are a few things that need attention. Considering this is a 5 star hotel and quite expensive.
1. Coffee/ tea making facilities in the room.  Even a one star hotel in most other places have these.
2. The lifts are shocking. Even though there are 6 some days waited up to 15 mins for a lift car.
3. Rooms decor is tired. There was damaged tile work in our bathroom and the room carpet was in need.of renewal. See pictures.
4. When we originally booked we put in the special information box. Mentioning it was a special birthday.
Didn't see and special effort on the behalf of the hotel to make it seem so.

title: Wonderful Holiday Spot
text: Great place to stay for the holidays!  Perfect location with great ambiance and exceptional service!  Plenty of room for a family of four.  Short walk to Rockefeller Center and all of the shopping hot spots.

title: Best hotel in NYC. Great location.
text: The hotel staff was wonderful! I accidentally left a necklace that means a lot to me, and my housekeeper Altagracia Hernandez turned it in!  Then when I went back the next morning, I was helped by security Maurice Legere, Vicente Rosario and Raj Gopie because Altagracia was not there!  Truly an amazing experience!

title: Spectacular Christmas Holiday
text: The Lotte New York Palace is stunning! The service, location, and staff are all exceptional. Special recognition to the concierge, Christian, who not only suggested an excellent lunch recommendation but scheduled a reservation and ensured prompt seating. Christian  was always happily willing to assist with any questions, providing unparalleled service! The Palace in December is the epitome of Christmas and I cannot recommend it enough.

title: Luxury at it's finest
text: A stunning hotel!  Everything was exceptional, from the service at reception, to check out.    I always appreciate a Virtuoso recommended hotel...I know it will be excellent and this was no exception.  Breakfast was amazing too!

title: Bed/ comfort
text: Our suite was 5011, great room but the bed/ mattress was awful . Very uncomfortable where i now will think of not staying at this hotel . When was the lastt time they charged their mattresses? You cant pay $$$ and not have a good night sleep . Otherwise the staff at checkin was just wonderful and location was fabulous.
