title: Michael
text: We had an issue with our initial room but Michael at the front desk was fabulous at making our experience at the Lotte an excellent one. If it hadn't been for Michael, I don't think that I would have rated the Lotte so highly.  He's an asset to the Lotte

title: Wonderful holiday visit
text:
Beautiful hotel, 5 star service and a lovely view over St. Patricks to top it all off.  Everything about this visit was wonderful including the very accommodating early check in.  That said when it comes to these types of luxury hotels, details matter. 

It was surprising and unfortunate to see that the TV/cable setup was essentially basic cable with no accomodations for streaming services - a fairly standard experience at your most basic of hotels today.  There seemed to be a strong lack of direction and leadership in the gold room at brunch resulting in hostess/wait staff openly arguing with one another in the middle of the floor and guests wanting for refreshed beverages and additional condiments.

title: Perfect spot to be pampered
text: When you stay at the Lotte New York Palace, everything is at your fingertips. You are in walking distance of just about everywhere you want to go and then you get the come “home” to a beautiful hotel with customer service staff like Anna to make sure everything during your visit goes perfectly. I can’t say enough about Anna. She had a way that made you feel like an honored guest and friend. Thanks to Anna and the other lovely staff at the Palace, I will definitely be back.

title: Perfect spot for a visit
text:
We arrived on my 40th birthday, it was the middle of the night, but there were still staff actively working there. Concierge on the door, happily greeting us and welcoming us to the hotel. Reception staff with a happy smile on their face.
It was a beautiful hotel, with amazing views over the cathedral and towards the Rockefeller centre. It was the perfect base for our short trip. Walking distance to Times Square and Central Park.
I would book here again.

title: Wait a few months
text: Under reconstruction, the lobby is temporary and the grand entrance is closed. Our room had a lovely view of the back of St Patrick’s Cathedral. But it felt a bit overused and the bathroom was generic. We expected more and will check it again when they complete the remodel. The location is superb however.

title: Amazing Property with Top-Notch Staff
text: We came to Lotte Palace Hotel to spend a magical weekend of theatre, shopping and great food.  A major contributor of our wonderful trip was the location, comfort and fantastic staff at Lotte Palace.  Request for extra towels? DONE!  Room service? The absolute BEST chicken noodle soup you will ever eat, delivered at midnight in less than 30 minutes, with a smile!  The staff here anticipate your wishes and deliver every single time.  Conveniently located and worth every penny - we will be back again and again!

title: Family trip
text: Recently visited for thanksgiving with family. Michael at the front desk provided excellent service. He was able to upgrade my parents room to a suite and went above and beyond to make sure our accommodations were perfect.

title: The Gem of the Gold Room
text: On a recent trip to NYC we popped by the Palace for a cocktail at the historic Gold Room. Jose our fabulous bar tender not only made us delicious Margaritas after a long day of sight seeing, but also took us on an informative tour of the mansion, detailing the amazing architectural history & some fun Gossip Girl references. Jose was fantastic, defiantly five stars!. We can't wait to come back and stay at the hotel and enjoy the luxury of the gilded age, this iconic New York hotel provides.

title: Paying for location and convenience.
text:
The hotel has great ambiance.  The location can’t be beat. Was beautifully decorated for the holidays.  We stayed in a superior room.  The room was a good size and clean.  However, it is also in need up updating and a refresh.  The room felt very antiquated.   The carpet looked old and at a top tier hotel, there really should be coffee provided in the room.  
We had drinks and small plates at the Gold Room.   It has its pluses and minuses.  The Villard for breakfast was not only ridiculously pricy, but very disappointing.  Service and ambiance in both dining spots were great, but the food was average at best.

title: Great location great service
text: Location is great. Help is great. Rooms could use some sprucing they are bare minimum. Just some more Decor so it’s not so cold could do wonders and wouldn’t be that difficult. I will say, after paying for a 2 BR suite during thanksgiving which equates to thousands…having to pay $15.99 per day for internet was a new form of cheapskate and pretty pathetic. $70 per night hotels give free internet. It’s just the principal. Really….pitiful… not a good look Lotte P.

title: Great mid-town 5-star hotel
text: Amazing how small touches can make for a really enjoyable stay. Good-sized room, very good sized desk with enough space and light to work. Great bed. Spotless. Every staff person was friendly. I hinted that I wanted coffee in the room and magically a coffee maker showed up.

title: Not impressed
text:
Stayed two nights on business after many years away during Covid

Room was clean but very dated. No mini bar, no glasses to even drink water from and no meaningful amenities 

The room service only breakfast approach is a complete rip off - $45 for yoghurt and coffee

SPA massage was fine but price unreal!!

Service is not delivered in a friendly or helpful manner rather brusque at every level

I know New York is now unbelievably aggressive but the hotels should be somewhat of a sanctuary especially at these prices 

Not impressed

title: Great Luxury Hotel experience
text: Beautiful hotel, perfect location, great staff, clean rooms.  Exactly what you should expect from a luxury hotel.  We had stayed here previously, with only a marginal experience.  The hotel and management have stepped up their game, thankfully.

title: Expensive, bad and old!!!
text:
Many years ago this was the best option to stay in NY but, as for today is a very bad option, the staff of the front desk is bad, i ask for some ice and it never got it to my room the answer was that the hotel was so busy for the marathon, no coffee in the room called to asked why and they answer they don't offer coffee if I need need to ask to room service and is not open 24 hours, the ONLY GREAT STAFF of the hotel are the bell boys they are great people. 

Also i asked to clean my room and they told me they dont hage enough people to clean, so for a so high rate and a very bad service i will never suggest this hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel, no faults
text: 5 day trip to New York, first time visiting the city. Hotel was a recommendation and we were not disappointed. Stayed in The Towers and had a fantastic room. Staff were all super friendly and always happy to help. Special mention to Lincy (think that’s correctly spelt) and George (41 years in the job, the guy is a legend!) Excellent location and we walked pretty much everywhere, though could’ve easily jumped on the subway if we wanted to be lazy. Highly recommend & would stay there again for sure.

title: The best in Manhattan
text: This is my third time staying at the Lotte New York Palace.  I travel for business and the central mid-town location is so convenient to Central Park, Time Square, and so many other places in Manhattan.  The hotel staff is so friendly and well-trained.  Many have worked at the hotel for years and they act like family.  The hotel is clean and well-managed and the rooms are HUGE.

title: Great People and Location
text:
Pros: Excellent service! From Michael and Dalmasi to Rene to Arleni and Sam, everyone at this hotel aims to make your stay comfortable and pleasant. Everyone was so kind and had a great attitude and assisted with all requests! The location is unbeatable in midtown.

Cons: the rooms could use a little updating, especially the bathroom.

title: Very disappointing hotel!
text:
Visited for our honeymoon and was so disappointed in this hotel. We arrived and reception were not very friendly at all. As we travelled to our room the hall ways were very dated and tatty. From looking at the photos on the website we were so disappointed when we arrived at our room. It was luxuries like we expected it was just dated and tatty. 

The bedroom was a good size but the bathroom was dark and small. We had an issue with brown water coming through the taps and shower which someone had a look at but the lady on reception wasn’t very friendly again! 

For a 5star hotel I don’t think you should have to pay for Wi-Fi at all and $15 dollars a day was ridiculous! 

I wouldn’t return to this hotel there are much better 5star hotels in New York that give you all the little extras, good service and luxuries that this hotel lacks.

title: Miles Gomez is the best!!
text:
I had an AMAZING EXPERIENCE! 
The property is well kept. The staff was very polite and attentive and what can I say about Miles the Hotel Manager 😩‼️ He was such a pleasure!! He assisted me with a very important matter. It was time sensitive, and he handle us with great care & concern…and it really made my experience that much better!!

title: Score is 3.75 / 5
text:
It has been quite a few years since I last visited New York, and this time I wanted to get the position of a hotel just right.  The Lotte Palace is in a perfect spot, between 50th and 51st Street East, just off Maddison Avenue.  A short walk takes you to 5th Avenue, and there’s a subway on 51st Street which goes directly downtown.

We arrived at 10pm, and was checked in quickly, we were in The Towers, and our room was on the 48th floor.  It was a room with 2 double beds, and it had a view out to the east, and we could see right over to the river, and beyond.  

Maybe a view south or west would have been better.

The room was perfectly clean, a bit dated, and the mini bar, which would have once day been well stocked, was empty (a sign of the times).

The lobby area is open and busy, the bar (we went to the Gold Room) was a nice place for a cocktail, but it does get busy around 5pm.

We would probably stay here again, due to the location, but if you want more luxury there are better options in midtown.

I did email the concierge team a few times with queries prior to our arrival, but they did not answer any of them.

title: Excellent
text: The entire hotel staff was excellent.  The rooms and views were spectacular. Room service was just as good as any NY restaurant.  We always stay at Lotte New York Place because it’s just that great.  Can’t wait to return.

title: Stellar service from Patricia in Housekeeping ⭐️
text:
Fantastic service & lovely staff! We visited for a week for my daughter to have surgery and the staff was unbelievably helpful, especially Patricia in housekeeping and Matt & George the doormen. 
Patricia was an absolute angel- checked on us multiple times a day, brought us extra towels & pillows when needed. The hotel room itself is a bit dated but location is great, the cathedral view rooms have a beautiful view and although the built in minibar fridge is locked, they will bring you an oversized mini fridge and water bottles.
The coffee shop in lobby has great grab & go coffee & food items-pastries, fruit, salads.

title: Beautiful Hotel!  Excellent service, but beautiful accommodations.
text: Loved everything about our visit.  Made friends with Patricia in housekeeping.  She is absolutely lovely!  So helpful and kind. Evening Concierge gentleman was wonderful as well - excellent dinner suggestions!  Remembered us and inquired about our experience... Just an all around wonderful stay.

title: A big shout out to our concierge, Kal!
text:
Oh the Towers at Lotte Palace!  I don't think I would stay anywhere else.  This is the second time we have come to celebrate our anniversary.  The rooms are gorgeous, the service impeccable, and we had the most beautiful view of St. Patrick's Cathedral both times!

Of all the elements that combined to make our stay memorable this year, by far the most important was the care we received from the concierge, Kal!  New York is marvelous but also overwhelming, and Kal was like a brother who watched out for us and made sure we were well taken care of.  It was incredibly reassuring to have such a warm and friendly expert there to provide guidance and assistance with every detail, from the time we made reservations before arrival, to helping to ensure a smooth departure.  We will always be grateful for Kal!

title: A Lovely stay with a few annoying extras
text:
This is a lovely hotel. The location is fantastic and walkable to most places you want to visit. Our room had an amazing view of the cathedral and was comfortable and spacious. The hotel itself is classic and with many charms. Loved the curving staircase up to the 2 nd floor. We tried several times to go for a drink in the Gold room but it was packed.
I think for the price of this hotel there should be a coffee machine in the room…especially since room service coffee is an exorbitant $18. 
As a Canadian I resent a hold of $100 on my card for incidentals which when refunded causes me to lose money on exchange. Very annoying.

title: Grand Entrace. Lackluster Room.
text:
The Lobby, Spa, and personnel were the positive highlights. 

Room is large, but outdated. My bed needed an upgrade. Minibar is sealed and not working. When I called front desk and asked to unlock it, they brought another fridge. Even though the second fridge did solve the problem, it was kind of odd to have it in the middle of the room… Noise came in through the connecting room (closed) door. Could hear as much as a sneeze from my neighbors

And now the elevators - not sure if this is always the case, but the elevators were not enough to cater to all guests. Sometimes it would take as much as 15 minutes to get to the lobby. Good ol’ tricks I’ve picked up at the Subway durong rush hour came in handy to shave some of the waiting time.

title: Magic in NYC
text: We had a magical experience in NYC and the staff at Lotte Palace made us feel beyond welcome. From the first warm greeting by George and the bellmen Henry, Matt, and Ray.  It was probably the best hotel experience I’ve ever had. Thank you all!  It was our 3 teenage daughters first time in the city and they are already begging to come back again soon.

title: Amazingly Helpful Concierge Service!
text: The room and the amenities are all first class but this review is about Ani, a Concierge at the hotel. I don't think I can ever recall having a more helpful or knowledgeable person with respect to locating certain businesses or facilitiesm, providing detailed directions, timing to get there and times of opening and closing. It was like a one-stop shop for information and it saved me a lot of my time trying to find out this information myself.

title: Fabulous Staff!!  Great location. Large rooms.
text: We can’t wait to return. The entire staff was wonderful. Friendly. Helpful. Fun. Competent. Concierge,bellmen,doormen,bar tenders, Everyone was great. Everyone did the extra thing. Walking location for theaters,Central Park,and restaurants. The rooms were large with opening windows. Huge towels. Moulton Brown amenities.

title: Lovely
text: Beautiful, spacious, friendly and convenient to the museums and to Times Square. All in walking distance. Top of the Rock. Well run hotel, spent 6 nights with confidence that we were in good hands. I highly recommend.

title: Beautiful building
text: I was honestly expecting a bit more. I have stayed in fancier hotels around the world and this one was lacking the more personal experience that I’m used to. I let the hotel know about my birthday when checking in but it was not noticed.

title: Best Accommodations!!
text: My husband and I recently stayed at Lotte Palace and had an absolute best experience! We had the pleasure of dealing with Miles Gomez - front office manager, and he really went above and beyond  to ensure our stay was extremely satisfying and memorable (which it was)! We are so grateful to Miles for the A++++ service and accommodations. We stayed there as newlyweds and cannot wait to come back there again (anniversary maybe ;)  THANK YOU

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: Absolutely loved our stay at this hotel. It’s location is perfect and the staff are so helpful and friendly. Could not fault anything. Our room had a fabulous view and was spotless. Would recommend 100%

title: The gift of caring
text:
If it weren't for Anna-Marie Rieber, my stay in NYC would have been a disaster.  She works the front desk at the Lotte Palace and it well was worth standing in line to get her.  Our cruise ship docked ten hours late in a cold and rainy NYC. Getting to the hotel was no easy task and it was quite full when we got there.  There was a major issue, which I caused prior to arriving, and I was very fearful that we would be out in the cold.  

This woman took charge, was very comforting to me and my wheelchair-bound sister, and went to work.  She asked good questions of me, consulted with her manager, and was able to resolve the issue, clear up the record and provide us with room keys for our stay.  It was truly a delight to watch her work and resolve the situation with a comforting smile on her face.  I don't know what we would have done without her.  What an asset to the Lotte Palace.

title: Inattentive management
text: First two nights were fine, was splitting a week in NYC between two hotels.  The good:  location to the park, Broadway, etc, breakfast quality was good although not a huge selection compared to other hotels of this caliber.  The rooms are spacious compared to many NYC hotels.  The bad: the Lotte calls itself a non-smoking hotel but allows marijuana to stink up the hallways and permeate other rooms.  Calls to guest services were dismissed with a blasé attitude.   If you are in any way allergic to smoke or don’t want your clothes to smell from other guests’ smoke, I would suggest another hotel.    Lotte Palace was my favorite hotel pre-Covid, so I thought I’d give it a chance again, but there are better options with much better customer service if you are booking with Amex FHR.    Check-in experience was also unfriendly despite it being not busy.  It was very different than the other FHR hotel I had just come from on 5th Avenue.  The location sadly just doesn’t compensate for the negatives.

title: One night in Manhattan
text: My husband and I went to Manhattan for few days and stayed at the Lotte. We arrived early and our room was not ready, however, Denise at the check in desk graciously accommodated us by upgrading us to stay in a beautiful suite in the Tower. She made our stay at the Lotte!  Denise is an asset to the Lotte team and we can’t wait to stay there again. It was wonderful!

title: Weekend at The Palace
text:
We had a one of the best weekend of our life in the heart of New York, at the ever green, iconic and outstanding hotel of all times, New York Palace 
Special shout out for the staff , all highly  professional and trained, they made our stay so special
.
The hotel continues to shine with its  high standards of cleanliness and upkeep . Amazingly well kept
Compliments  to the leadership team of the hotel

title: Luxuriest Hotel with warmest services
text:
An experience that will be a memory forever 
From the arrival  and check in to departure , each moment brought to life the true spirit of hospitality. The hotel is beautiful, sparkling clean, chic and stylish, you can tell that the management is so well aligned, throughly professional and customer focused .This is an iconic luxury hotel  and you can really see the and feel the difference!!! Loved the entire experience, compelling enough to make you want to come back . Thank you

title: When in NYC the place to stay
text: Location! Friendly staff !!! Lovely !!! It was our 3 time at the Lotte and as always we had a wonderful stay! My daughter had to take a final exam and the provided her with private internet connection and a quiet space !!!! Only the best as always

title: Amazing stay!!
text: We recently stayed in a suite at the  The New York Palace Lotte to celebrate our moms 90th birthday. What an amazing experience . The suite was wonderful . All the little details were taken care of. Really enjoyed the spacious suite  was large enough for the 8 of us.

title: Great stay!
text: Recommend this place 100%. What a great hotel and exceptional service. Loved being here. The suite we stayed in was impeccable and beautiful.  The city views were awesome. I will definitely be back her for this charm. Kudos to the staff! Thanks.

title: Family visit
text: Our stay at the Jewel Suite on 53rd floor was a truly amazing experience, excellent services, sparkling clean! Rooms and friendly staff! I would highly recommend this hotel with beautiful suites for family visit!!

title: Amazing suites
text: 5 star hotel with 5 start service, thanks for the hospitality and the great suites with amazing views. We stayed in the top suite on the 53rd floor which had three stories within the suite and great views of the city including the Empire State Building, Chrysler building and more

title: First trip to NYC
text:
Our experience at the Lotte palace was wonderful ! The moment we arrived we greeted with smiles and kindness . Denise welcomed us to the hotel and placed us on the 39th floor with an amazing view of Saint Patrick’s cathedral . She was so kind and thoughtful to check in with us during our stay to make sure we were comfortable . Charles was so sweet , helpful , and attentive . The bellman were so friendly and made sure to arrange taxi service promptly . Our room was clean and the housekeeping staff made sure to replenish towels and toiletries consistently . Our meals at the hotel were delicious , especially the pancakes ! We enjoyed cocktails in the beautiful Gold Room after a day of sightseeing . 
The heartbeat of the Lotte Palace begins with each and every staff member and the exceptional guidance of General manager , Becky Hubbard . 
Thank you for making our first trip to NYC memorable !

Sincerely , Mr and Mrs Morgan

title: First time to NYC!
text:
The Lotte palace is wonderful !  
         
         Our stay was perfect from the moment we arrived . My husband and I were greeted with a smiles and a warm welcome by everyone in the lobby . Denise checked us in and made us feel special , she placed us on the 39th executive floor with an amazing view of Saint Patrick’s cathedral . She made sure that we were comfortable the entire week . Charles was attentive , helpful , and so kind ! 
We enjoyed drinks in the beautiful Gold Room after a long day of sightseeing . The hotel is beautiful , charming and the rooms are clean . The house keeping staff was always consistent in making sure towels , and toiletries were replaced as needed . The bellman were very friendly and arranged taxi service promptly . The Lotte palace is managed with care that shines through each and every staff member . We had the pleasure of meeting the General manager Becky Hubbard accidentally in the elevator ,she made us feel so welcomed and wanted to make sure that we were comfortable and enjoying the hotel . In this day and age it’s not easy to find a hotel that is managed with integrity and care as the Lotte palace ! 
FYI , the pancakes are amazing !!!

Sincerely , 

Mr and Mrs Morgan

title: A lot more pluses than minuses
text:
The Lotte is a very nice hotel although "Palace" is an overstatement.  The rooms are very nice ~ clean and we found the bed perfect and the views of NYC very nice.

The bellmen are super professional and really work hard to make your stay memorable.  

On the negative side, although glamorous, the lobby is a little small to comfortably hold the amount of people who are generally there.

I was here on business and I get up early and there is no coffee or water in the rooms.   I was up working at 4:30 AM and had to wait until room service woke up at 6:30 AM to get my morning coffee.

I've seen complaints about slow elevators and found no such issue.

To sum up my visit, a very nice room, too small of a lobby, exceptional bellmen and no coffee!   A B+ hotel.

title: Beautiful city views!
text:
We had an upgraded room with a beautiful city & cathedral view. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Lotte as much as possible.  NYC was still in the middle of Covid restrictions, so that took away a lot of the fun.  

Sad that the beautiful Christmas tree was not in the courtyard with the all of the lovely holiday decorations from years past.  Service was fine, but we did not eat or get drinks at the hotel, sky high prices!!

title: Very Good, but not best.
text: You are treated like royalty, my experience was amazing but I was hoping for a nicer room honestly. Beautiful view though. Breakfast was insanely expensive so I always ate out. It is a beautiful building in a good location. Would recommend.

title: 10 Stars to the greatest hotel and staff!
text:
We had an unforgettable stay at the Lotte New York Palace! We were in town awhile as we were helping our son fight cancer at one of the best hospitals near by. During our 2 month stay, the kindness we experienced was unmatched. Our cleaning ladies, Victoria and Gisele - were so sweet and always did an outstanding job with our room. They took their time to see how we were doing and helped us with whatever we needed as we cared for our son. 
The worlds best staff at the Lotte’s Pomme Palais - Arleni, Carlos, Deborah, Sam, Mark and Andrew greeted us daily with a smile and the warmest hospitality. The cafe has the most amazing coffee and treats but the staff made it extra sweeter and we will miss our daily visits. 
Dalmasi Rivera at the front desk was always so helpful and so kind to our family. It was so unexpected for these wonderful people to feel like family so quickly. 
Miles was so friendly and always made sure we were comfortable. 
The Lotte exceeded our expectations and made sure we had a wonderful stay. Thank you again to the best hotel staff there is - we are forever grateful!

title: A true fine hotel
text: What a wonderful hotel.  From the bell hop to the manager this is a 5 star hotel.  To add to the believability of this review I will tell you that we came on a day which was expected to be difficult, US open, Labor Day weekend and 2 weddings.  Our check in process was met with a long line which we were informed was compounded by a an issue with linens that day.  The staff did everything to accommodate those in line attempting to give champagne or water to settle nerves.  That was the only issue once we got settled in our room accommodations were amazing.  Service was top notch including cleanliness. The manager did everything he could to make sure that we were happy in our room and the service was up to the hotel name.  It exceeded expectations!!! We will be back for all our trips to NYC.

title: Mrs. Katherine Scarnici
text: Our stay at the Lotte NY Palace Hotel was memorable.  Your staff was efficient, friendly and professional.  This is our second stay and the hotel remains beautiful.  I hope at our next stay the Madison Avenue entrance will be finished, as we are looking forward to seeing it completed.  The location suited our needs perfectly

title: Birthday week
text: This hotel is absolutely amazing from the minute you step through the door you are treated like royalty , we had a problem checking in that was not the hotels fault but was quickly rectified and dealt with professionally , breakfast is amazing and the wine in bar was of a superior quality , the only reason I have given four stars is the fact we had no tea or coffee facilities in our room which we would have really appreciated and have things in every other hotel we stay at , it might sound silly but if we could have had that in our room I would have given five , we both like to just reflect and drink our tea and coffee in morning without having to ring room service and be charged so that would be all I asked for differently ! The staff here are superior to other hotels and so attentive, we had a top floor room with amazing views of the cathedral , absolutely stunning hotel and I do recommend as everything else is five star , rooms cleaned immaculately daily , toiletries refreshed it really is beautiful

title: Customer Service Was Impeccable
text: Every staff member I came in contact with was welcoming, efficient knowledgeable and professional. The customer service really couldn't be better. The restaurant and bars were full of character and the food and drink was delicious.

title: Lotte New York is great but the elevators are horrible
text: We recently stayed at Lotte New York Palace and had a great experience, the room was great, we ate at the Gold Room and that was excellent.  However, the next morning we found the elevator wait to get downstairs or upstairs was a 15-20 minute wait!!!!  No explanation was given but a $50 discount during checkout on our bill.  We don’t know if this is normal but beware!

title: Never again
text:
Stayed at the towers.

The bad: 700+ dollars a night gets you: endless wait to check-in, multiple mystery brown stains on the carpet, strange smells, and broken shower heads. Some old mini bar that was never stocked and made it difficult to store anything. Most staff seemed to be in a terrible mood. The room furnishings are old and not in a good state, some electric outlets didn't work. The blondish lady running reception at Gold Room/Villard was absolutely nasty to us and other people. Overall, ruined half our trip, we are never coming back to this or any Lotte properties.

The good: location is unbeatable, the housekeeping staff was always nice, the hispanic package room lady was wonderful to us and went above and beyond. Restaurants had good food depending on the chef of the day, but only because we had credit to spend there.

Conclusion: save your money and go to a hotel half the price that is newer, or spend more for a true 5 star hotel. Don't get fooled by the Forbes/Amex verified luxury badge, they don't deserve it, at least not for Tower rooms.

title: Wonderful New York Beauty
text: The staff was remarkable and helpful.  The hotel is beautiful and the location perfect.  Great for getting anywhere in the city.  The concierge was very helpful with planning any activity or making dinner reservations.  It was a perfect stay!

title: Is this the attitude for a 5-star hotel?
text:
Other than the concierge (bellboy), unfortunately the attitude has been snobbish, I hope it’s not because of my ethnicity - because there’s a clear difference in attitude in terms of how they treat other guests in other ethnicity.

The front desk gave me a hard time and basically kept mentioning how rooms are being sold out. I’m fine with that to be honest, but they show absolutely no help trying to accommodate a guest who flew redeye, and looking at the charges.

Pretty disappointed when this is a 5-star hotel. I was giving this hotel a try and now I found the reason why my friends prefer other hotels than this.

Will not revisit.

title: Awful for the price
text: Bathroom dirty (smelled, shower curtain moldy). Room seems from the 70s, with really old carpet and furniture. Curtains were damaged. Outlet on lamp (to charge phone) does not work (and no USB). All that for close to $800/night?!?!?

title: Not the wonderful hotel i’ve loved
text:
I arrived after 11 pm , cold , hungry & tired. I immediately ordered a bowl of soup & then called to ask they send up a robe as housekeeping clearly hadn’t replaced it . Over 30 minutes later neither had arrived . And Guest Services was not even remotely apologetic . 
I have stayed here multiple times a year for over a decade — sad to see the gracious hospitality gone .

title: Great Location
text:
Great location, nice big specious room, well equipped gym. 
Wasn’t advised there was a charge for the internet use, 5 star hotel should give guests free internet and at 15.99$ a day that’s a rip off ! 
The lifts weren’t great and only ever seemed to be 3 working, some mornings it was a long wait trying to get down from our room on floor 30 to the lobby. 
No tea and coffee making facilities in the room, again for 5 star hotel this is basic requirement, it’s all about making more money from guests. 
The reception welcome was not as we would have expected.

title: Unmodernised accommodation and bad room service
text:
While the feel of the public areas are clean and look upscale the fabric/infrastructure is outdated. 

Checkin was very slow; elevator service was very slow; too few USB points in the bedroom; an attempted modern shower head was no longer good enough. 

At least the bed was comfortable.

As to room service- we asked for two bowls of soup but after a long wait, the waiter arrived with a trolley on which there was an empty plate and knife plus just one bowl of soup. At 12.45 am this was hopeless but we had no choice but to wait longer for him to go back to the kitchen to bring the missing bowl that arrived with the missing bread rolls. To mess up such an uncomplicated order so late at night, when one is hoping to dine and go to bed, is, shall we say, disappointing. And to top it all, the bill/check was absurdly exorbitant for such modest fare and utter cluelessness.

Overall, this rating of Average is rather generous.

title: Best Birthday Getaway with Friends Ever
text:
Kal the concierge and the rest of the lovely men at the door and beyond were one of the main reasons why staying at the Lotte was the most wonderful experience ever. 

It truly was a palace and I plan on making it place I come back to again and again.

title: Making business a pleasure
text: The hotel room was just OK. The rug was worn and stained and the bathroom needed updating. For example, there was no walk-in shower. Only a shower head over the bathtub with an old-fashioned shower curtain arrangement. At those prices, a walk-in shower facility and separate bathtub are to be expected. However, the hotel staff services elevated my rating from 3 to 4 Stars. They were excellent, particularly the housekeeping and room service staff. They were prompt, thorough, and always friendly and gracious. And saved my bacon, when on the day of my departure the entire bank of guest elevators broke down just before I was scheduled to leave the hotel for the airport (with my luggage) from my room on the 33rd floor. Lucky for me, and my fellow guests, after waiting 20 minutes for what was a disabled elevator, a member of the Housekeeping staff witnessed our predicament and ushered us onto a service elevator. Without this staff person taking the initiative, I would have missed my flight home. Lastly, I also would particularly like to single out Ms. Salomey Boateng, from the Housekeeping staff, who every day kept my room immaculate throughout my entire 6-night stay.

title: wonderful!
text: I would stay again in a heartbeat.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was spacious and super clean.  We loved the breakfast (be sure to make reservations to avoid a wait).  It was pricey but worth it.

title: Best NYC hotel experience ever!
text: The hotel was beautiful, views were amazing but the absolute best part was the staff and service, especially Miles!! His friendliness, professionalism, and attention to detail was the cherry on top of a perfect trip and is the reason I will only be staying at the Lotte from now on.

title: An Amazing Experience
text: It was a very luxurious stay, especially being in the towers. The view was amazing. It made a fantastic location for attending the US Open. After attending the Open all day, I absolutely recommend in-room dining with more tennis and a fantastic view in the evening.

title: In the air
text: We were on the 51st floor of the towers with a beautiful view of part of New York City. The room was comfortable and clean.  The location was awesome as we were able to walk to a few places and especially a very good Italian restaurant recommended by the concierge. Service was always if and when you needed it but the staff made the difference. It’s a happy iconic hotel.

title: Spacious rooms, great location & lovely staff
text:
Upon our arrival, and throughout our stay the staff were very warm and welcoming. We were greeted by Michael at check-in. Our youngest is 10 yrs old and we requested adjoining rooms, or at the very least rooms next to each other. Michael managed to ensure we did get adjoining rooms. Charles then took our bags to our rooms. Whilst doing so he regaled us with the history of the hotel and the best places to go for sightseeing, eating and shopping. We had the pleasure of meeting Maurice in the lobby. He took us on his famous Gossip Girl tour. If your a fan of the program (which our 21 yr old is) I highly reccomend it! We got to see parts of the hotel we wouldn't have otherwise. 
The rooms were spacious, considering you're in a city hotel. We had a king size room. However, the bathroom in our room was quite small for the size of the room . Our girls had a superior double (2 x double beds) and their bathroom was a decent size. It seems most of the adjoining rooms are double superiors and a king. But check with the hotel to ensure they have them available.
There isn't a coffee machine in the room, but if you call room service they will bring one up for you.

title: Great hotel and service..!!
text:
Very pretty hotel, great location, very spacious rooms, great amenities and very good service. Anna Marie from the front desk was very helpful, she solved all of our needs, she is very efficient. 

100% recommended!!! We will return!!

Ana Arizona

title: AMAZING STAY !!!!
text: Took our little girl to visit New York ! Our room was amazing and so comfortable. I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay, during an amazing visit to New York City. The staff are professional and top-notch especially our late night housekeeper, she went above and beyond for our little girl !! We booked a King size bedroom and requested for a crib whom this lovely lady Mary delivered to our door promptly with this cute little bag full of goodies for our little girl ! Our princess wouldn’t stop talking about it , and how she wishes to come back !! The rooms and facilities are impeccable! We will definitely be back for the holiday xoxoxo

title: Carlos Nunez
text: The hotel provides exceptional service and accommodations and is a great location. The staff and management are equally exceptional delivering professional, and kind welcoming service. Their main bar is opulent but comfortable; serving great cocktails and delicious bar menu.

title: Fabulous Wedding Venue!
text: Service and quality of food and drinks was excellent!! From the minute we entered the hotel to the last drink of the night, we were treated like royalty! The food was delicious and the bar had top notch martinis! Highly recommend and hope to be back soon!

title: Incredible staff- especially Tom the bellman
text: I am a big gossip girl fan and Tom the bellman took me around to the locations where they filmed. it was so kind of him to take the time out of his day to take me around! It truly made my trip incredible!

title: Kal Naim was a great help
text: This is my second visit to New York, and Kal was one of the concierge there in the hotel. He helped me a lot to navigate and was always there to answer my questions. He  made my trip easy every time I go to New York City.

title: I felt like royalty
text: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and my room was amazing, but the thing that really made this hotel stand out was the staff.  I have never experienced customer service that was so incredible. They made me and my family feel so welcome and they all were so kind.  We also attended a wedding hosted at the Palace.  It was hands down the nicest wedding I have ever been to.  The food and drinks were top notch, and the wait staff was absolutely amazing. My daughter said she felt like she was in Beauty and the Beast.

title: Séjour au LOTTE
text:
Nous avons passé un très agréable séjour de 4 nuits en étage la vue est très appréciable . Bel emplacement à 2 pas de la 5eme, de Broadway avenue et l’excellent Steak House Gallagher. 
Le personnel de l’hôtel était parfait, je remercie Ani, l’une des concierges qui parle Français et qui nous a parfaitement guidé mais aussi Miles Gomez pour pour son accueil.
Je recommande.
Frédéric

title: A sub-standard experience with poor service
text:
Very unsatisfactory experience from the very start. We came for a 2 night stay, excited at the prospect of a 5 star hotel in New York. This was not a 5-star experience. We arrived late after a long flight. The check in was matter of fact with virtually no information given (not even details of Wifi) The first night we hardly slept - we were allocated a room with 2 beds which I would class as large singes - for 3 people- meaning that the two of us sharing one of the beds had a very uncomfortable night. Most of the electrics didn’t work, including the safe. The blind in the room also didn’t work properly. We reported this the following morning and were promptly moved to a room with a king size bed and a sofa bed which was much better. We were told the sofa would be made up later in the day. We then had to call FIVE times for the bed to be made up (we would have done it ourselves if the bedding had been available). By the time they came to sort it it was just before midnight. All 3 of us (including a child) were exhausted after a long day in Manhattan and had been waiting to go to bed for an hour and a half. 
All this and outdated features like shower curtains that don’t stop the shower leaking and meagre toiletries (one set for 3 people). Plus dusty surfaces. 
On the plus side the view was good and the porter who helped us move rooms was great.
We are so disappointed!

title: Incomparable location and property
text: Stayed for a recent wedding on site. Can’t say enough about the beautiful rooms, venue and service. We stayed for 4 nights and you are within walking distance of much of Manhattan. The staff was super professional and seasoned. The food was great. Honestly I’d recommend the Palace for a weekend getaway or a business trip, as the property is equally comfortable for both.

title: A tad disappointing
text:
The hotel is undeniably beautiful, the decor and lounges , very nice .
The rooms are tired , showers in the bath with curtain? Really ?
16,99 a day for Wi-Fi? I have had free Wi-Fi everywhere I have travelled for years now !! Sad that the Lotte considers that normal !
No fridges or coffee making facilities.. to be honest   We paid a lot of money for our room .. we left feeling a little ripped off ..

title: The Lotte New York Palace has the finest rooms and amazing service. It is the place to stay when visiting New York City.
text: Our room was amazing and so comfortable. I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay, during an amazing visit to New York City.  The staff are professional and top-notch, and the rooms and facilities are impeccable.

title: Budget quality at a luxury price
text: Not even close to five star hotel as claimed.  Staff acts like you don’t exist. I’ve had better service at budget hotels than here.  No valet service, so you drop you car off in the garage and enter through a side door.  No one bothered helping us as we struggled through the door with our luggage.  The hotel is beautiful and the room is fine in terms of decor.  Plumbing in the room is terrible, standing in two inches of water while taking a shower, son clogged the toilet and we had to wait two hours and call twice for service before someone came.  For over $1k per night I expected so much more.  Would not consider staying again with so many better choices nearby.

title: Incredible Wedding Celebration!
text: We were guests at the Palace for an incredible wedding. Not only is the venue absolutely beautiful, the food and service were superb. It was a wonderful evening. I look forward to returning with my husband for a romantic getaway in the future.

title: Absolutely the best stay that we have ever experienced!
text: The staff at the Lotte New York Palace were pleasant, professional, and warm, and they treated us like kings and queens during our stay. We stayed for four nights in the Champagne Suite, where we were treated to the most breathtaking views of the City, night and day. We felt well rested each morning after sleeping on the very comfortable beds. Room service quickly became our favorite breakfast choice, as it was prompt, pretty, and the menu included a wide variety of delicious food options (I highly recommend the homemade granola with yogurt). We attended a breathtaking wedding event at the hotel, where everything was absolutely gorgeous and flawless. It is clear that this hotel has superior management, as every aspect of our stay felt like my needs had been anticipated well in advance. I highly recommend a stay at this lovely hotel.

title: Amazing wedding venue
text: The space. The food. The experience. All incredible. One of my best friends got married here and, honestly, I want to get married here too when it's time. Book as soon as you can. The staff was top notch and everything felt comfortable and easy but done with care.

title: Disappointing
text: This was the first hotel I ever stayed at as a new lawyer in the mid-1980s, when it was the Helmsley Palace and glamorous. It is now the Lotte Palace and decidedly less  glamorous. The public areas have been reduced to a sliver of their former glory. The rooms are dated. The great view of St. Patrick's Cathedral from mine did not make up for the creaky and lumpy bed. Never did figure out how to use the ancient lighting and thermostat control box. There are much better options for true luxury in the area.

title: Incredible wedding weekend!
text: My husband and I just experienced the most amazing wedding celebration courtesy of the fabulous team at the Lotte New York Palace.  The iconic rooms were professionally set up and appointed to the highest standards, the food was delicious and the service was impeccable and timed perfectly.  Every detail from the professionals in the events, catering and administrative units was anticipated and executed flawlessly.  My friends and family all stayed in the Towers and the rooms were fantastic and pristine throughout our stay.  I cannot recommend the Lotte New Tork Palace enough, it is truly 5 stars!

title: Brilliant hotel. Great staff
text: Fantastic hotel. Stayed with my wife and two teenagers. Good sized room, great gym, sauna & steam room. Excellent location. Staff couldn’t have been more helpful and welcoming, in particular Tea (sorry if I spelt your name wrong!) in the Gym/Spa who was super kind and helpful to my teenagers and I. Great place to stay. Thanks guys

title: Charles is THE MAN!!!!
text: Similar to last time we stayed here 3 years go, the service from everyone  was amazing. Our man Charles, in particular went above and beyond the duty. From the moment we arrived, he was willing and able to do whatever we needed, up to and including getting us a mini fridge (we declined) to a luxury ride to JFK (we accepted) :) We can't wait to bring our 4th son here when he graduates in 2025.

title: Highly recommended, will return
text:
Fabulous location and hospitality by the team. Greg was incredibly welcoming when we checked in and helped us settle in really well. We like the comfortable beds in the room and the sizeable fitness center with direct views of the cathedral. Bottled water from housekeeping is available upon request.

Walking distance to MoMA and numerous attractions in NYC. Whole Foods Market is a 15 minutes walk away, which is not too bad. Enjoyed bagels along the way.

title: Beautiful View/Fabulous Location
text: Our 16-night stay last month at the Lotte New York Palace was fabulous. The service we received from Utra, who cleaned our room, was outstanding. She made us feel so welcome and went out of her way to assist us. The woman who checked us in was also friendly, as well as the bellmen. The location was perfect and our cathedral view was amazing.  We can't wait to return. Thank you Lotte New York Palace!

title: The Ultimate Romantic Getaway to the City ....... 35th Wedding Anniversary
text:
We won't stay anywhere else!!!  This is the absolute best hotel in NYC ! The hotel is absolutely beautiful, elegant and classic. Our corner towers suite was huge with breathtaking views of St Patricks Cathedral and the city. The cleanliness and the attention to detail in the room is 5 star. Perfect for families, a romantic getaway or a business trip the hotel will accommodate everyones preferences. 
The staff are truly what makes the experience magical.....all of them are very professional, courteous, and friendly. They truly make you feel special and work to make sure your stay is memorable. We have stayed here many times and love seeing familiar faces who are so kind and accommodating. Hats off to Miles, Ani, Nancy and all of the wonderful staff ❤️Can't wait to be back at the Lotte NY Palace

title: Month long reservation
text: There were four employees who gave exemplary service in Paul, Tom, Clara and Sandy.  Paul and Sandy who work at check-in were always there to greet me with pleasure when I had a question, concern or needed an accommodation.  Tom at the bell desk and Clara who greets guest at the Towers' section of the hotel were forever looking to see if there was anything that I needed and made sure that my request were immediately met.  I can't say enough about the four of them and the service they provided and how they took the enjoyment of staying at the Palace to another level.

title: excellent stay for milestone birthday celebrations
text:
We recently enjoyed two visits to the Palace twice over the past year for milestone birthday celebrations with our family.  We stayed in the Tower Corner Suites both times, which we found to be very spacious.  The large living room is the perfect gathering spot for our extended family. The large corner table was helpful for meals in the room, and the sectional was great for lounging and congregating.

The concierge was always helpful for arranging special dining reservations and also helping to order our cakes.  Room service was always amenable to bringing up extra plates and forks for our in room celebrations.  

I'd like to give a special mention to Clara, who has become a great friendly face for our past two visits to the Palace.  She always greets us in the lobby whenever she sees us and makes sure we are being well taken care of.  She consistently goes and above and beyond for us and even gifted two stuffed bears for my niece and nephew.

We look forward to coming back for all our future stays, as the Palace is now our "go-to" hotel for our trips to the city; the exceptional service and the extra-spacious suites cannot be beat.

title: Ottima posizione e servizio
text:
L’Hotel è una posizione strategica: al centro di Manhattan. La camera era molto grande con vista stupenda sulla cattedrale di San Patrizio. Il personale gentilissimo è disponibile (molto al di sopra della media). Le camere però avrebbero bisogno di un rinnovo: mancano usb, doccia con la tenda in plastica, assenza di cassaforte e minibar…
Nel complesso lo consiglio se non si e esigenti su questi dettagli.
Personalmente ringrazio lo staff che con noi è stato superlativo!

title: A special place to stay!
text:
Lotte New York Palace is glamorous and iconic. Staying here made our trip to NYC feel extra special. The hotel lobby with its stunning staircase and the beautiful outdoor courtyard with tables and trees are both amazing places to relax. Those who appreciate history will enjoy the complimentary tour of the Palace with its grand spaces. We highly recommend upgrading to a room with a cathedral view so you can enjoy incredible sights of St Patrick’s Cathedral and Rockefeller Center both day and night. Its an experience within itself! The rooms are light and clean, the beds are comfortable, and the impeccable service feels so personal.  Staff is polite and friendly and sincerely wants to make your stay the very best. The Palace’s central location near Rockefeller Center is excellent. It is an easy walk to Central Station, Times Square, Central Park, and Broadway, yet the area feels just a bit quieter, and we loved getting out early in the morning to wander outdoors around the Rockefeller complex before the crowds came in. 
We are grateful for our stay at Lotte New York Palace and hope to visit again someday!

title: Outdated and overpriced
text: The hotel hallways and rooms feel like stepping back into the 1990s. The rooms also do not have espresso machines (or any coffee machine for that matter), a basic amenity in any luxury hotel. The room service is uninspiring and vastly overpriced, even among luxury hotels in the city. Lastly, the service is lacking. As an example, I requested turndown and when returning to the room a few hours later had not received it.

title: Hospitality is not their strong suit
text:
So we stayed for 4 nights at this establishment-  the hotel itself is impressive, especially if u like old historical structures, but in retrospect I could have enjoyed that by just visiting the place and enjoying drinks in the Gold room. The front desk staff - pretty much ignore ur existence, forget a friendly greeting, they act like they don’t see you at all. Housekeeping was ABYSMAL! either they didn’t show up- or when they did  come they did such a poor job that even amenities were never replaced. I had to call to ask for shampoo and shower gel - not sure if they expected that a singular bottle should last both of us for four days? Housekeeping would argue loudly in the hallways - loud enough for me to stick my head out and ask if everything was Al right?
Overall- this was as far away from a five star experience as I have ever had in a hotel. I’ve given them two stars, one for the speed at which room service delivered coffee- they told me 15 minutes or less the first time I ever called and I was skeptical- but it was always 15 minutes or less- the second is for the view and the spacious room. Will not be going back though…

title: Great staff, rooms, and location
text: From the beginning of our stay, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  My wife and I were travelling with our 6yo. Without asking, Michael upgraded us to a corner room with a great view of St Patricks and a pull out couch.  Better view and saved us money on paying for a cot.  Staff continued to be helpful to our requests throughout our stay.  Location right by Rockefeller Center.  Would highly recommend and stay again.

title: Bof
text: A part sa situation, je ne trouve rien de positif à dire sur cet hôtel. La salle de bain est catastrophique. Une baignoire sans pommeau de douche. C est vieillot et sale. Le ménage est lamentable. Le petit déjeuner hors de prix et pas  bon. Quelle erreur de choix !

title: Great vacation
text: Like most Floridians whenever a tropical storm comes our way we escape. My first time at the Palace and was greeted by friendly staff and the location couldn’t  be better. Please have a drink at the gold room and rarities for a one of a kind experience you will remember

title: The best of NYC Timeless Luxury!
text: Fantastic property, offering the best modernized “NYC Classic Experience” in the city. The staff is Five Star along with the Concierge team. Rene at the concierge desk is the best of the best. Visiting both bars on property is a must and a real experience.

title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND EVERY TIME!
text: I’ve been coming to this hotel for years. Every time I’m in NYC it’s the first place i choose to stay. Staff provides top tier service, rooms are impecable, bedding/sheets top quality, the Food and beverage options are also highly recommended.

title: Went above and beyond
text: It goes without saying that this hotel has earned its five star rating with all that goes along with that distinction. What went above and beyond for my family and me was the outstanding staff.  Special thanks to Isabella for helping us cater a superb picnic meal in Central Park, which our family will not soon forget, and to Clara for making us and I daresay all guests who visit the lobby feel special.  Will certainly return. Thanks to all.

title: A Fading Classic That Needs Love & Management
text:
​This is my second visit to the hotel (the first was several years ago - and was a better experience). There is much to like about this hotel - but it has some problems that stop it from being a great hotel. The high points:

1. Great location in midtown, especially if you are shopping or going to the theater.

2. Glorious historic building. Make sure you visit the Gold Bar - and take a look around the original structure.

3. I had the Towers one bedroom suite, and it was huge! You could easily host a party for a dozen people comfortably. Great view, a comfy bed, and a big walk-in closet.

4. It feels very safe. There is a private entrance to the Towers rooms within the hotel, so a good choice for those seeking a bit more security.

5. Nice toiletries and linens.

6. Power shades and a Crestron light control system.

7. The staff was mostly friendly (but per the below - not very efficient).

And the downsides...

I arrived at 5:30 pm - anxious to shower and change clothes for an 8 pm dinner. Unfortunately my room was not ready - and I was told they would text me in 20 minutes when it would be done. They told me to go to the Gold Bar - and they would credit my room $200 for the inconvenience (which I thought was quite generous). I enjoyed the Gold Bar - but never received a text. Finally after an hour I went to the desk, and was told it was ready. They did not credit me $200 - but did pay for the drink I had.

The room does not come with a coffeemaker - which would be standard in any other luxury hotel. I called down and they sent a traditional 8 cup maker to the room, which is not ideal for one person but sufficed. The next day I called down for additional coffee since I had run out. It was not delivered. I asked again for it at the desk, was assured it would be delivered, but it never came. Called again - and the request was ignored. Asked at the desk again on my next trip ourt - and despite the promise my request was ignored.

The mini-bar has been shut down, all the glasses removed from the room, and a big ugly sign inserted on the front saying that due to covid it was not available. It is inconvenient - and greatly detracted from an otherwise pretty room.

No turn-down service. This is kind of a nice-to-have in these days - but I did expect it at this level of hotel.

Be prepared for really expensive room service for breakfast. Coffee is $18 (not a designer coffee - just coffee) - and perhaps that is why they don't want you to make it in the room. Most breakfast entrees are around $50, so with tip it is easy to spend $100 a person for breakfast.

The place is looking dated. Like most older hotels, there are not enough plugs, so they put an ugly extension cord out for the desk that made a nice desk look like a temporary work space.

So I was satisfied with the hotel, loved the location and the classic aura, but I think there are some management issues that could make it a much better experience. My suggestions:

Put in a single cup coffee maker.

Reconsider the mini-bar situation (there are safe ways to do it) - and at least stock the drinkware.

Spend a couple hundred dollars per room to install wall plugs in key locations that accomodate guests' different charging requirements.

Do some training with staff. Their followup is not good.

title: Excelente servicio
text:
We stayed at the hotel from July 24 to 28 . It was a great experience. All the staff , especially at front desk ( reception , concierge) were absolutely amazing and totally focused on the service .
Thanks !

title: Comfortable centrally located hotel.
text:
First time in New York and this was an excellent centrally located hotel with comfortable rooms and beds. Staff are very helpful and able to offer help on our visit. 
Couple of down sides. You have to pay extra for WiFi and any food is rather expensive so we ate out in the many restaurants in the area. 

Handy for Grand Central Station and Times Square

title: Location is amazing ! Really recommend this hotel .
text: Didn't realise what an amazing location this hotel was in until we arrived as have never visited nyc before. Its absolutely amazing and feels a really classy part of the city. So close to rockerfeller plaza and top of the rock. Go there for best views ! 5th avenue and central park so close.Also we got on and off the subway at grand Central Station which is close and such a lovely start and end to some of our days out. Times square is also close but you wouldn't know it ( a good thing ! ) we got a cathedral view room which took our breath away when we first arrived after our long flight from the UK. We were 2 adults and 2 young adult sons. We all shared a room with 2 Queen beds. Space was ample especially for new york. Everything was really comfortable. Goof ac and lovely hot showers. The public areas of the hotel feel really special and you'll sleep well in the comfortable beds but the location completes the package. Honestly would recommend this to everyone . I'd avoid times square hotels and stay here. Just loved the whole experience. Cocktails are expensive !  but worth one each as the gold room is really worth a nosey and some photos for the memory book.

title: Gossip Girl experience in a fabulous hotel!
text: We visited the Lotte New York Palace Hotel because we wanted the full Gossip Girl experience. Not only is it the most stunning place but it has the kindest staff. Service, interiors, quality is all fabulous. If you are out for a Gossip Girl (informal) tour ask for Maurice. And a big shout out to the wonderful Fran!

title: Amazing!!
text: I absolutely loved it here!! Everyone was very kind and helpful. The staff gave us so many recommendations of places to eat and go and they were very accommodating. Very quick service as well. The hotel itself is so beautiful and the rooms are very nice. It is a fantastic place to stay whether you are on a work trip or family vacation. The location is perfect and so close to Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall. Special thanks to Maurice, who was kind enough to give us a mini tour of the places where “Gossip Girl” was filmed in the hotel; Nana, who was so kind and helpful; and to George and Tom, who always welcomed us back with smiling faces. I hope to be back soon!

title: Perfect New York Location & Staff
text: A great base for a New York stay.  Their location on Madison & 5th makes getting around the city very easy and a lot of the 'must see' sights are within very easy reach.  Their staff went out of their way to make us welcome and were extremely helpful when fulfilling our requests. Special mention must go to Ahmed Badreddine, the Maitre d'Etage and the Head Doorman (George?) was a fount of local knowledge.

title: Great Hotel - and secret tour!
text:
Spent a few nights here and although quite expensive, the location and rooms make up for it.

Pros
- rooms are very large and clean
- good location, walking distance to loads of sights (Rockerfeller, Central Park, Grand Central Station, Times Square, 5th Ave, etc)
- Maurice - ask for the secret Gossip Girl tour - not just our highlight of the hotel but highlight of entire NY stay!!
- umbrellas/ adapter/ coffee shop

Cons
- no USB charging points (in 2022!) 
- no tea or coffee facilities in room
- courtyard under construction 

With Manhattan seemingly “under construction” and busier, smellier, and generally more run down, it was nice to return to a clean and comfortable hotel each day.

title: Terrible service
text: Despite knowing their check-in time is 3pm, they had multiple employees go on break at that time so we stood in line for 29 minutes waiting to be checked in to the hotel. Absolutely ridiculous. It made us miss the shuttle for the wedding we were attending. We probably spent an hour of our trip waiting for elevators, too, since they didn't have them all running. I would never stay here again.

title: Potencialize sua experiência em NY
text: Já tive a oportunidade de ficar em dois hotéis em região próxima ao Lotte hotel e com certeza este oferece maior conforto com  quartos amplos e impecável limpeza . Há opções de locais para as refeições no interior do hotel com serviços e valores variados mas, por se encontrar em uma das melhores localizações de Manhattan, vale a pena explorar as opções ao redor. Com seus mais de 50 andares (caso você esteja na primeira torre) vale a pena reservar um tempo de espera e por vezes fila para uso do elevador.

title: Lovely hotel and location
text: We stayed here as a family with 2 children as the first stop on a US trip. The hotel is very well located near the time square and other places to see. The hotel is lovely inside and the staff were really helpful and friendly. The rooms are of a big size and are very adequate for a family. Very much enjoyed our stay.

title: Excellent Service
text: Very attentive service. Starting with the checkin. Gregg and Sandy were very helpful. And Mr. Papa made all the difference. Funny and always ready To help. We were a family of four, loved the location, but the staff made all the difference. Keep doing an excellent job.

title: Would Not Stay Here
text:
There are several critical problems that make this property NOT the place to stay.

Pluses - good location depending on where you want to be, beautiful views, lovely well designed and furnished suite

Negatives - poorly designed lobby space, very high priced room service

Critical problems - there are only two elevators so you always wait ( and often for quite awhile ), the checkin entry is  right adjacent to the regular hotel so it is often over crowded ( very, very over crowded ) with doormen overwhelmed and they seem understaffed such that checkin took 30 plus minutes which is unacceptable for a 5 star property ( the individual behind me in line was also upset )

The staff was pleasant but unfortunately there are certain things that are just not acceptable to me.

title: I would pass on the Lotte NY Palace hotel...
text: I have stayed at The Palace  hotel many time prior to Covid and loved the hotel. It was not up to par this stay except for the bellmen and the valet guys....they were just awesome and the best thing about the hotel. To begin with the room is so dark and I cannot even see to put on my makeup...need lights in the bathrooms. I am a centurion card holder and our upgrade was not really an upgrade. I booked a room with a view of the cathedral thru centurion and that is just what I got. He said I got an upgrade but I do not agree. So breakfast in the Villard was slow and not  good service. Had to ask for water several times. When you pay over $100 for breakfast for 2....it should be good.  Room Service does not begin until 5 in the evening. Closed for part of the day. I feel like it was not up to what I am used to there.When you call the desk it rang 30 times before being answered and the desk manager was not available. No one ever answered the phones there for some reason.I hope you fix these things as it is not a great hotel at this time.  I know you must be aware of the issues. The people were friendly but just not a fine resort this stay.

title: Good except beginning and end
text: Rooms were nice and clean.  Elevators were a little small but reliable, at least on our trip.  Front desk was late with our check in and kept telling us to come back.  The lobby lounge is nice.  The Gold Room is a can't miss--definitely worth the visit.  After checkout, the doorman outside ordered us a sketchy cab (told us to specifically wait for his cabbie) who didn't use a meter (which I didn't realize until late in the trip) and tried to charge me an exorbitant amount for the distance traveled.  I don't know if the doorman was in cahoots with the cabbie but it looked like it.  Just beware and make sure the cabs always start the meter.  I called the hotel to tell them and they said they'd "keep an eye on it" (whatever that means).

title: Wonderful Stay/Kindest Staff
text: We have a long stay in New York City and The Towers at Lotte New York Palace has been incredibly enjoyable and relaxing. David Shenman has made sure that we are comfortable and we have a suite with the most gorgeous view of St. Patrick’s Cathedral. Miles Gomez and Dalmasi’s hospitality has exceeded our expectations. We will absolutely come back!

title: Spacious but slightly dated rooms
text:
Stayed here for a week on work trip - office is nearby so location was fantastic.

Rooms are definitely on the large end of things (given how small standard NY rooms are) - comfortable with a large work desk and chair to read papers/books but the bathroom is definitely showing its age. 

Staff are generally welcoming and the hotel was very busy throughout the week I was there. 

For those who are looking for a more spacious room this property is a good one to consider.

title: First trip to NY
text: This was our first trip to NY for my daughter’s 20th bday. Bell men at the hotel were great! Had to change rooms due to water leak. Not very good communication with hotel regarding an item left in room. We don’t have any follow up. Disappointing. Wanted to love the hotel but may stay elsewhere next time we visit

title: Unforgettable Experience!!
text:
We had three days to stay in New York before my husbands business trip started. My daughter suggested the Lotte Palace where Gossip Girl  filmed. We thought it would be fun so I booked a room. 
We arrived early in the morning after an overnight flight. 
From the minute we walked through the doors we were treated absolutely wonderfully! 

After our first day out we were asked if they could move our room because we were put on a floor that was reserved for a special event. We of course had to do it. 
We were upgraded to an incredible suite! This room was so lovely!!! My daughter couldn’t believe it! Wow!!!  
The service was 5 star!!  
We had a special tour where they personally took us around the hotel to all the areas where the television show Gossip Girl filmed. 
The room was absolutely luxurious!! My personal favorite was the bathtub! 
We would definitely return!! 
Thank you!!!
Was absolutely

title: Great hotel
text:
We chose to stay at this hotel as I am a huge gossip girl fan and we looked up the price of the holiday on a whim and just went ahead and booked it during the pandemic.  It was nice walking around and seeing all the different places that pop up in the show. Unfortunately the famous court yard was under construction so we didn’t get a chance for the photo ops but it still looked presentable and nothing like the scaffolding you come across in the UK. We stayed here for 4 nights 7-11th July as a young couple and I cannot fault the place. Upon arrival we were greeted and offered help with our bags. When checking in there were no resort fees which is a huge bonus as the last time we visited New York we stayed at the row which had a crazy $160 resort fee. You do pay a $100 for any additional charges you rack up but we didn’t so this was returned when we left. The room was absolutely huge on the 34th floor. The rooms are a tiny bit dated, however with the style of the hotel a modern upgrade wouldn’t fit. The room was made up every day to a great standard and was always clean and complimentary molton brown toiletries were provided! 

Overall we had a great trip and I highly recommend staying at the palace.

title: Top Lage
text:
Tolle Lage und ab der 30.Etage super Ausblick.
Hotel ist älter aber die Betten super sauber und bequem.
Alles was nach einem langen City Tour benötigt wird.

Vom Hotel aus kommt Mann sehr schnell überall hin. 
Central station 6 Minuten zu Fuß , 
Direkt Blick auf St. Patrick’s Cathedral.

Personal sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend

title: Great location, poor effort.
text: Great location, below than average offering for a $500+ a night hotel. We requested a triple room when booking through Virgin Holidays as I am travelling with my 18 and 16 year old sons, but there was no record of this at check in and no effort to accommodate us. I am now sharing a small double with my 16 year old son!! 🤦🏼‍♀️ There are no tea/coffee facilities in the room and room service coffee is $18!!! Plus no complimentary Wi-Fi, instead $16 per day!! Good location, but wouldn’t come back.

title: Not comfortable
text: The hotel looks nice, and it feels like 5-star... but it just isn't that comfortable. You can hear your neighbors clearly. The couch in our suite was very uncomfortable. The TVs don't allow streaming/bluetooth connection/casting. The WIFI blocks many common apps. Also, I could feel every time my spouse moved. It was miserable to sleep. We booked this hotel for a special few days away, but I will never come back. Total waste of a lot of money. Even the bell hops were bad. We had a delivery at the hotel and they wouldn't let the delivery person upstairs and didn't contact us when it was delivered. We went downstairs after getting a notification and the guys were all just sitting around talking or playing on their phones.

title: Maravillosa estancia
text: Hotel recomendable. Elegante, servicio impecable. Habitaciones muy amplias con unas vistas a St Patrick impresionantes. Maurice es uno de los mejores trabajadores. Pendiente al detalle y siempre con una sonrisa. Mis hijos han alucinado con el tour secreto de Gossip girl. Muchas gracias por todo. Volveremos

title: A nice hotel with great staff!
text:
Very nice hotel adjacent to St. Patrick’s Cathedral. 
Beautiful marble floors, clean,  well appointed rooms.  Our room on the 34th floor was very quiet. 
Pleasant staff offered a friendly greeting on every meeting.  Being so close to the magnificent St Patrick's Cathedral alone made it worth the cost, will be returning in weeks!

title: Beautiful NYC hotel
text: Stayed 2 nights, beautiful hotel- comfortable bed and pillows- wish we could have used the fridge to chill our water/ drinks but fridge was locked. Took 2 hours for a bucket of ice to be delivered! Convenient location- dinner was great as was breakfast- you do pay for it. Be aware bill includes 15% tip- I definitely would stay there again- beautiful rooms in hotel.

title: Charging for Wi-Fi?
text: Just checked in today, and the staff has been friendly. The room itself is fine, but it’s worn down in many spots. There’s a bunch of wiring hanging from our wall. But my reason for writing this review is to complain that a hotel selling itself as a luxury spot charges $15.99 PER DAY for Wi-Fi. Come on. Hampton Inn Wi-Fi is free. It’s 2022… you don’t charge for Wi-Fi.

title: DISAPPOINTING
text:
I LOVE The Palace and have stayed there many times over the last decade. This time there was very disappointing-there were many issues. I splurged on a large luxury suite for me and my kids. I was told it would be ready by 4-- it was not and at 5:30 we were still waiting. We needed to shower and get to ore-theater dinner- they offered us a "comfort room" which was a small regular room but that defeated the whole purpose of being able to get ready in luxury. Also we didn't want to unpack, shower, move rooms and not see the suite till midnight. The kids had to leave for dinner- by the time I got into the room after a lot of difficulties, it was covered in a layer of dust and there was trash in the cabinet. I called down and two lovely housekeepers came up to dust- completely great but I was paying a fortune and... at the point the front desk offered me half off. So then I had to head out and when I returned at midnight exhausted, the lights didn't work! I had to use the flashlight on my phone to call the front desk, an electrician came up and tripped the breaker and replaced light bulbs.  
Sigh.
Such a bummer!! 
The manager offered free breakfast for all the trouble and was very apologetic. 
That all said, I will give it one more try but I feel if you are charging this much $$ this was inexcusable. I do feel terrible giving a low rating because o love this hotel and have had many great stays there.

title: Fabulous
text: Fantastic hotel! loved my stay!  Friends of us want to stay there in December however the wife would like a room on the lower floor as she does not use elevators and would like to access her room by the stairs.  However, the reservation agent said they cannot guarantee they would get a room on the lower floor which has really disappointed them as they wanted to stay at Lotte after hearing our rave reviews.  Disappointing they cannot fulfil special requests.

title: Excellent Service
text:
Wonderful stay thanks to guest service agent Michael Frick, who gave us the best view ever. Thank you very much! He was very nice and attentive. 
In the heart of NY, the location us perfect, behind St Patricks Cathedral.

title: Kal Naim was fantastic 👏
text: It was our 1st time in New York. We really enjoyed this beautiful hotel. The room was nice and the mattress was comfortable. They even supplied free bottled water.. We approached the concierge, Kal,  for suggestions for dining around the hotel. The 2 restaurants he recommended were spot on and fabulous food!!!  George was a hilarious and very witty and wonderful door man. Ray was always spot on trying to get us a cab or direct us where to go. Kudos to having wonderful long term knowledgeable and friendly employees..

title: The Gilded Age lives on in the Gold Room
text:
What a lovely place to stay in NYC. The building is gorgeous, the staff is attentive and the views? Well, we were on the 25th floor with a flawless view of St Patrick’s.
I have to say, though, that the highlight was our visit to the stunning Gold Room. We were completely captivated and our bartender, Jose, was a wealth of information about its Gilded Age  history (not to mention he made inspired suggestions for our cocktail  choices which added to the grandness of the experience).

title: Beautiful Historic Hotel
text: We didn't plan to stay in this hotel, but had our original booking canceled because of an emergency.  We showed up and were given a beautiful room with a breathtaking view overlooking St. Patrick's Cathedral.  The room was great.  The lounge "The Gold Room" was spectacular as well.  Our only negative was that the refrigerator was part of the minibar and they posted a $35 "restocking" fee if we broke the seal on it, so we did not have a fridge.  Minor nuisance.

title: What a fabulous place!
text: Had a sweet "Mothers Day" weekend here with my daughters. We had a two room suite with a beautiful view of St. Patrick's Cathedral.  The staff was so accommodating and friendly, particularly one staff member who took my daughter on a tour of the hotel and mentioned some special spots that were in movies, etc. Was very nice he took the time to do that and speak with us.   They gave out nice umbrellas when it poured, the bell staff was fabulous.   Such a convenient location and we enjoyed the sites and shopping in the area.  Will definitely be back.

title: Still the best in NYC
text:
