Excellent as ever. It’s great to be back and lovely to see all the familiar faces, specially on the front door. It’s still kept it’s charm and as good as before. We love this hotel and wouldn’t stay anywhere else in NYC. It’s in a perfect location and we just keep coming back.

We arrived early and we had 2 rooms booked at The Towers. The  manager Miles Gomez was so brilliant and he got our rooms ready well before the check in time. He made sure that we were in beautiful rooms with exceptional views . Big shout out to Miles for being so efficient and customer focused. He couldn’t do enough to please the guests. 

Concierge team were excellent too, we dealt with Isabella and she was very knowledgeable and helpful. 

Well done to all the team at Lotte for being so wonderful.

title: FIVE NOT SO BRIGHT STARS
text: A quality hotel located across the street from St. Patrick’s Cathederal. Although many parts of the Lotte operate like a five star hotel many don’t. Check-in was chaotic, billing had to be corrected and breakfast was so expensive it was almost humorous.

title: Fabulous!
text:
The location can't be beat.  Central to Broadway, Museums, Central Park and Shopping. 

The staff, especially Michael Frick were professional and friendly.  He took great care of my daughter and I.  We were even upgraded  to a lovely room with a fabulous view of St. Patrick's Cathedral.

title: Not impressed
text:
Stayed 3 nights at the Palace as part of a business trip earlier in the week. I'm a very regular traveller to NY, always try to stay in the area of the Palace because is walking distance from the office of the company I work for.  My usual preferred hotel (Intercontinental Barclay) was fully booked, hence my Assistant booked the Palace.  

Check in was very fast and efficient. Arrived around 11:30AM, quite early for their check in time, but staff was very helpful and friendly and got me a room.  Very nice and client oriented staff at check in.

Room was really spacious for NY standards, clean and with a nice King size bed. I was on a high floor (32) hence had a great view from my room. I like the fact that you can open the window to let fresh air in. I'm not a big fan of Air-Con.

Now, some of negatives:
Wi-fi charge - as a standard, the hotel charges USD 15,99/day for wifi.  I was on a corporate rate and hence not charged, but the simple fact that a hotel where you pay hundreds of dollars as daily-rate charges for wifi is currently unacceptable.

Coffee machine - I travel all over the US and a coffee machine, kettle or espresso machine (depending on the hotel) it's a standard. You find this simply everywhere, even on the cheapest place in the middle of no-where.  When I asked at reception about this, they told me that they were happy to send one to me room but that they charge a Daily coffee-service fee for this.....REALLY ???....This is really a cheap attitude.  I was shocked when I heard this response.   I wake up very early (5AM) to work and like my morning coffee....so needed to wait until 6AM to walk across the street to the Starbucks and buy coffee......because refused to pay USD 18+gratuity+delivery charge for room service coffee.

Room clean - the room was properly cleaned everyday. Issue I had was that I never got replaced the same number of towels I used....so on day 3 I had literally 2 towels in the room.....

Sleep quality - bed was quite big and comfortable.  Being on a high floor also allows for a good sleep because is a bit less noisy.

Room & equipment - room definitely requires some renovation. Furniture with scratches and TV quite old. The work area is really bad. There is one large table but the chairs/mini-sofas are very, very low, hence uncomfortable to sit in front of my computer and work. I had to put one of the pillows from the bed on the sofa to sit a bit higher.  Room is not equipped according to today's tech needs, so no USB sockets nor chargers.  This is almost a standard on any 5-star hotel nowadays.  So make sure you bring your chargers.  

In summary, a hotel which is really behind the main competitors in the area, at least for a business traveller.  I will be back in NY in 6 weeks time, and really not sure if the Palace will be on the list of hotels I will consider for my next stay.

title: Wonderful property and staff
text:
Stayed at the Lotte Palace Towers while in New York to see a play.  The property is beautiful from reception to the wonderful view from our room.   Very well located to visit lots of sites in town and walk to Broadway. 

The staff was amazing including Fran at the front door and Jimm at reception.  Ahmed showed us to our room and Yriz kept the room impeccably clean.  Adam showed us the lounge in the Gold Room which was spectacular.  

Couldn't imagine a better stay.

title: Isabella at the concierge desk truly helpful
text:
Isabella at the concierge desk was really helpful, I had some issues with my managers who stayed at the hotel and she helped me a lot via telephone, until everything got sorted. 5 stars service. Thank you!
V.

title: ALL OUT
text: The hotel staff went all out in making our stay as memorable as possible. Starting with Michael upon arrival by giving us a wonderful upgrade to a tower room. The room was big and provided enough elbow room for 2 adults and 2 teenagers to stay comfortably. Kal and Rene at concierge service were very attentive and helpful. From choice of coffee to arranging a late delivery of pizza. We love this area and the hotel is well kept. Every day our room was neatly made and fresh towels and extra toiletries were provided upon request. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Used for Our Wedding Hotel
text: We used the Palace for our wedding for our out of town guests to stay at. We were absolutely blown away with the amazing service Valerie and the events team provided us in the lead up to our wedding weekend and during the weekend itself. All of staff at the hotel is absolutely top notch. I would absolutely recommend using the Palace for any events you may have. Overall, the team at the Palace was super easy and enjoyable to work with. Cannot recommend them enough.

title: Amazing stay at the New York Palace with Superb service
text:
Perfect location. Great hotel and amenities. Charming breakfast restaurant. 
The hotel service is second to none. Staff is very knowledgeable and kind.
Kal, the concierge, was amazing and highly professional and knowledgeable. All his recommendations were superb including the best restaurants in Manhattan. He made our journey in New York a very special one. Will certainly be coming back to the New York palace !

title: The concierge are more than the best
text: Khal has help me so so so much!!! Can’t thank him enough!!! Did everything posible to get my lost packages to me!!! So grateful!!! I can’t wait to be back in September and meet him again and thank him personally!! With out him I don’t know e would have done !!

title: Una vergüenza
text:
Llegamos el 12 de junio y la atención de la limpieza de la habitación mala.
Es más hoy 15 de junio salimos del room al mediodía y llámanos para decir q la habitación está lista para limpieza y sorpresa al volver a las. 17 hrs de la tarde y no han hecho nada. Hemos vuelto a llamar 2 veces sin resultados . Ah y estamos sector The Towers q debería haber mejor servicio. Una verguenza

title: Wonderful Hotel…Great Location
text: My stay at Lotte New York Palace was so enjoyable.  My room had a view of St Patricks Cathedral.  The staff was so pleasant…especially Isabella in the concierge desk.  Was pleasantly surprised at the size of my room…nice large desk, dresser, and king size bed.  Loved the location…easy to walk to Rockefeller Center and Broadway.

title: Amazing Lotte Palace
text:
Took our children to visit new York my husband and I had stayed at the Lotte in 2005 and we totally fell in love with it. The hotel is beautiful and so close to everything. You can walk everywhere from it. 
However upon arrival to our room at 22;30 we realised our family of 5 was sharing 1 kingsize bed ! 
Our tour operator had booked this for us . Not a fault of the hotel.  The hotel put us in touch with their manager .. the lovely Miles who very quickly sorted this out for us by upgrading us to a corner family suite . Not only this but he also added some money to our room tab as a sorry gesture. Miles went above and beyond to ensure we had a good stay.. even to the point of giving us a late checkout as our flight was not until late evening. I can’t praise miles enough ..not only miles but all the staff actually

title: Midtown gem with amazing service, coffee and pastries
text: Arleni is absolutely amazing and she made my experience so enjoyable. She has excellent customer service and because of staff like her I will come back. All of the coffee, teas, pastries are delicious. This is my favorite spot in midtown for a treat and for a coffee break.

title: Lovely Hotel - Away from the hustle and bustle
text:
As a family, we really enjoyed our stay at the Lotte New York Palace.  Elegance as soon as you walked in the door.

Rooms were large for New York, although a little dated, but clean.  We had a great view though of St Patrick’s Cathedral and The Rockefeller Centre from our room on the 9th Floor.

Staff were really friendly, especially the men at the door and the concierge.

Room service (didn’t do) because of the prices.  Prices within the Gold Room were expensive also.

Would definitely stay here again though, as location was great.

title: Bad Experience
text: Not 5 star - the bedrooms are tired and have chipped furniture. On arrival the reception staff didn’t even have our booking and when we eventually checked in they didn’t even offer to help with our luggage. We were staying on our honeymoon and our tour operator had made a note on the booking that it was a special occasion - absolutely nothing was mentioned by the hotel. Didn’t feel welcomed at all - felt as though the staff looked down their noses at us. God knows why. Avoid.

title: Ruined a wonderful weekend
text: Staff were useless, no assistance with luggage, HOURS wait for any room service. Multiple issues wrong in room including shower which causes us to miss wedding activities we were in town for. Horrible experience dealing with management who did nothing but lie and make up excuses for the failures instead of owning it and making it right. Would never again stay here even if offered for free, and I recommend no one does either.

title: Asombroso!!! Especialmente Kal- que buen servicio!
text:
Llegamos y nos saludaron y nos mostraron a nuestro habitación inmediatamente- que hermoso y espacioso! Estamos viajando para un vacación especial con nuestra familia, y la suite de conexión es asombroso. 
Y la más maravillosa parte de nuestra viaje- Kal Naim! Antes de llegar, Kal arregló nuestro itinerario- los mejores restaurantes y los mejores tiempos, sugerencias de que hacer- y cualquier queríamos durante el viaje. Gracias Kal, y gracias a Lotte Palace!!!

title: Our special trip
text: I planned a special trip for my extended family and the Lotte Palace Hotel delivered! We booked the 2 room family suite which was very (!!)spacious and beautiful.  All the details of our trip were handled to perfection by Kal Naim, ‘concierge extraordinaire’! Every dinner reservation was a wonderful choice- and within walking distance of the hotel. One Italian restaurant in particular was his choice for us and he took the extra step to request a round table to facilitate our conversation! We enjoyed drinks in the Gold Room  and our waiter offered us a peek into some of the iconic rooms of this historic hotel. If your travels bring you to NYC, there is no better place than the Lotte!

title: La peor experiencia de mi vida
text: Hotel de Lujo, muy impresionante, pero el servicio y la atención del personal es la peor que he experimentado en mi vida. Mal de principio a fin. Y para ser un hotel tan lujoso y de 5 Estrellas, las habitaciones son muy sencillas y reducidas. En general decepcionante

title: Good location but sadly some staff made us feel less than welcome.
text:
The location is great and check in was friendly and helpful. 
However, it is a huge and very busy hotel. Though it had a cosy lobby lounge the only coffee available was from the in-hotel concession in paper cups! Our room was huge with an amazing view. 
Drinks are expensive though we realise this is NYC. We had cocktails in the Gold Room which cost $100 for 1 cocktail, a whisky, a small beer and a 750ml bottle of San Pelligrino. Including the automatically added 20% tip! Not especially friendly either and I’d rather pay the same or more for a nicer location ....no view in this narrow bar. 
Checkout was not at all friendly -although we had been staying on the executive level and had been given the Wi-Fi password for use in the lobby before our room was ready, the check out lady refused to give it to me for a different device as I realised I needed to download something. She told me to log in on the hotel free Wi-Fi which entailed registering. I was very disappointed with her surly attitude and left immediately, not having the time or inclination to register all my personal details for a few minutes of WiFi. I then asked a doorman the way to the station and he offered me a taxi - I said I wanted to walk and he had no idea which way to head! 
Will stay somewhere else on my next visit to NYC.

title: Big rooms, great location, elegant common areas
text: We enjoyed our weekend stay - great location to nearby wedding venue, as well as shopping and Central Park. Rooms are a great size for NYC - a bit dated but clean. Service requests could take a while. Elevators and line in lobby can get long. Would like to experience the Towers next time.

title: Awesomeness
text: I really found the total experience overwhelming.  Everyone from the front desk to the housekeepers, doormen, security and the coffee shop were nice and went out of their way to smile and say good morning or good evening..... awesome

title: 5 star - truly wonderful
text:
Our second time staying here and can honestly say it’s one of the best hotels we’ve ever stayed in.  The location is perfect, rooms are big (especially for NYC rooms!), the hotel is immaculate, feels super luxury and the staff just out of this world.  They couldn’t do enough for us and really made a fuss of my 4 year old daughter on arrival and every time they saw her after that… absolutely made her day!  Nana and Papa were her favourite doormen and she looked forward to greeting them each day.
Also a massive special thanks for Mary Gomez in housekeeping.  My daughter was sick in the middle of the night one night and Mary couldn’t do enough to help us getting all new bedding sorted for us then came back and knocked on the door a little later with a teddy in a bag for her and personalised note, what an absolute superstar, made my daughters day when she woke up to that.   A wonderful caring lady and a credit to the hotel.
I just could write all day about how wonderful this hotel was, we stayed for 5 nights and wish we’d booked longer.  NYC already has our hearts and Lotte palace does now also.

title: Comfortable but lacking
text:
Lovely hotel in a superb location.
Many positives - quiet, excellent staff, large room. We were even given an impromptu "behind the scenes" tour. Fantastic!!
A few negatives - double bed was too small to be comfortable for two people who are accustomed to a king bed; no bathroom fan (we had to open the windows to exhaust shower steam and odor); not enough lounge area (the lounge area was nearly always occupied by conference attendees).
I would stay here again but being aware that it has some drawbacks.

title: Would come again
text:
Lotte New York Palace Hotel 
Location very good 10 min walk from tome square, lots of close breakfast area around central park is close as well , high end brands is around the corner , several coffee shops around the corner as well as starbucks  
Not bad experience ,entrance not so fancy  the staff at the entrance very friendly , crowded, the coffee area regular the higher the room the less is the nose , the room is quite good for 3  room aminities no slippers nor body cream supplys are from moltin  brown , i was on hold calling the reception from my room for over 15 min yet they didn’t pick up ,reception is rude very rude
Check in process good 
Double bed room wide 
Check out process mot bad
Again the guys at the entrance are very friendly
Price high

title: Amazing stay
text: I came to New York for my brother's graduation and we stayed here for one night with my husband and 2 kids. Upon arrival, we were warmly welcomed by Michael Frick. I could not be more impressed by his professionalism and hospitality. He saw both of my kids and gave them 2 teddy bears. They were SO excited. It felt like home. I have been to a lot of hotels but the staff is AMAZING. Thank you Michael for all your help- what a difference he makes! I will be coming back here.

title: Omar & Samir are the Best
text:
We stayed at the Palace 4 days and the experience was a dream.  We were greeted by Omar and Samir who helped us with our bags and throughout our visit, guided us with our daily activities.  The Palace in itself was a fantastic experience and these 2 guys made it over the top great.

Thanks Omar and Samir!
We’ll be back soon

title: Me volvería a quedar en este hotel mil veces más!
text: El servicio de concierge lo mejor! Diego y rene siempre fueron súper atentos. No tenía nada planeado y día a día me daban un itinerario para hacer cosas con mi hijo y donde cenar y comer . La ubicación perfecta . Me volvería a quedar en este hotel mil veces más

title: Another magnificent stay ..PERFECTION in Manhattan
text:
Hotel beautiful and immaculate.. the staff is the heart of this wonderful hotel…I have stayed at the Lotte Palace dozens of times.  I leave thinking the  my stay was the best…. but the hotel and staff continue to to amaze me each and every time .. straight from arrival greetings from the doormen make you feel at home.. the absolute BEST CONCIERGE STAFF in the world. Any of your needs are dealt with so professional..
Thank you Isabella, Ani, Diego, Rene, Cal, for always taking such good care of  everyone, including my friend that was not  feeling well… The Towers is a piece of heaven. Checking in such personal care from Jim fulfilling every request immediately. The new magical SPA is unbelievable, the massage took away my migraine, and reflexology melts away your every ache.. thank you Albert…... Ms Hubbard  ….congratulations on running such a beautiful PERFECT LOTTE NEW YORK PALACE HOTEL in the heart of Manhattan. Such special staff are like family most working there several years.

title: clean, but services are weak
text: The hotel was very clean and the people were nice.  Services were spotty.  Very disappointed that there was no coffee in the room...so i actually mentioned this.  they promised to bring me a coffee maker - it never showed up.  temperature and fan gauge in the room was either broken or meant to give an appearance that it could be changed.  no matter what control i moved, the temperature never changed, and the fan never went on.  Had no shampoo the first two days of my 3 day stay...my days were too long and busy to stop and ask about this.

title: Great hotel ruined by wifi
text: I am amazed that a 5 star hotel in 2022 still charges its guests for wifi. It has great rooms and a great location, but I feel ripped off paying this amount per night only to have to pay more for internet.

title: New York hotel
text:
The Lotte New York Palace was an incredible experience. Michael Frick was key to our memorable stay.
Professional and courteous, Michael took care of our needs and questions and even upgraded us in our accommodations.
The hospitality industry needs more stalwart people like Michael.
Thank you.

title: Amazing
text:
The Palace was beautiful . Michael Frick treated us very professionally and went out of his way to make sure we got the best room available and even upgraded us to a beautiful suite ! He made sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. The breakfast was delicious with a very creative menu.
Highly recommend!

title: Lotte NY Palace is unique. Staff is impressive
text: I always stay at the Palace when in NYC but never wrote a review. I come to this hotel for business and pleasure. most of the time alone, but some with my family. There is no better hotel and location in the city.  After 15 years coming to this hotel with everything being perfect, I have to write a review at this time. Particularly because this time I needed support and they where here to assist me. I simply forgot my mobile in the cab after a 13 hours flight, customs and traffic (but is NYC and we know). Hotel staff (bell mans, concierge and all others that joined forces to help me) was impressive. Immediately stopping everything to attend me. Particularly Isabella, a fantastic woman that saved me. She immediately took the situation and resolved, calling the cab Co, picking information and finding the driver. He finally came back to the hotel and I got he mobile back. I felt good, with a genuine and kind attention. Isabella just make me understand how to always learn and raise the bar to treat with others. I'm still in the hotel but already can’t wait to be back!

title: Amazing service great hotel
text: I am always making sure I write a review every time I go to the Palace. There is no better hotel and location in the city. Few blocks away from Central Park, super close to the Rockefeller, 5th avenue and so on.  I write these reviews mainly because of the staff that now are more friends than staff. I have to start with Samir who no matter what he is doing he stops to help. He is genuine and kind and we absolutely love him. Then Miles who cannot be more attentive to details and efficient . Clara who is always helping, smiling and providing amazing service . Then we have Teresa, Rene, Diego, Ani, Karl, Maurice, Nancy, Olga, Delmarva and Sandy. Amazing crew that I love and respect with all of my heart. I did not forget you Becky and Natsuko❤️You are amazing too. Can’t wait to be back!

title: Great business stay!
text: Lovely property, super comfy beds, great location. Check-in was easy, check-out was quick. Internet worked great. Toiletries were very nice. Rooms were large, especially by NYC standards. Would absolutely stay there again -- both for business and pleasure travel.

title: Terrible Service
text:
We loved this hotel for their great views of the city. This was our second stay at this location.  Upon booking I was asked if there was any special occasion we were celebrating & I informed them that it was my mothers 87th birthday.  What did they do for her. Nothing . They gave her a terrible room in the back . When she asked to be moved the next day it was such a disaster it cost us 3 hours of valuable time. As we kept calling to get her new key . No one would help us. I called the front desk 4 times & was always just told to wait. Then an Asian lady brought us a key that was to the same room we were trying to get out of. When I tried to explain this she actually raised her voice to me & yelled that I did not understand. The front desk did not know what room number my mom had first.
The staff seem so mad & unfriendly. That same Asian lady acted as a greeter in the Towers section & did not even say hello when we walked in.Very sad we loved this hotel but The staff are so indifferent it’s a joke. No complimentary water. I ordered coffee service for 3 & 3 bottles of water. $75. Just a ripoff. 5 star hotel with 1 star service.

title: Very average
text:
Hotel is nicely located and that’s what it has in its favor.  Service is just ok but not to be compared with real 5 stars . Rooms are out dated and a/c is very old fashioned and noisy.  
It is one of the few (if not the only one?) that still charges a flat rate of 15.99 $ for access to internet per day- what?????  Can you believe it !!! That’s really ridiculous when you already pay the room about 450$ per night. That little but important detail will make me reconsider my decision for next time.

title: Fabulous, beautiful, perfect location
text:
Beautiful hotel, room very spacious, cathedral view lovely. Great coffee shop, with pastries and sandwiches. Gold room great for pre dinner drinks. Milan the bar man was fantastic. 

Only downside to hotel is the Villiard room is closed together with the courtyard, as has scaffolding all around, and it will be there for all year. Therefore never tried the restaurant. Never had breakfast as $30 for a croissant is outrageous!

title: What a GREAT Hotel
text: You could not ask for a better location, room was very spacious with a wonderful view of the cathedral. Concierge was very helpful and the Gold room is a lovely lovely cocktail bar and Jose was an exceptional barman and went out of his way to make our stay so enjoyable x I would come back in a heartbeat

title: In need of updating
text: We stayed for 2 nights. It was ok, rooms large for NYC but very dated and tired. Unfortunately we had an interconnecting room and the doorway let in a lot of noise. We were woken up first night at 2am by the noise and had to phone reception to complain. Location good. I’d try a different hotel though when we go back.

title: City break
text: We visited New York for my daughter 16th birthday treat. We stayed at lotte palace for 4 nights the hotel was lovely staff very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely and the view was fantastic my only grumble was there was no tea or coffee facilities in the room and Wi-Fi was extremely expensive I would stay here again so give it a try

title: Great staff
text: The property and location are fantastic at this hotel, everybody knows that.  What is really outstanding is the staff. I spent one week with my family and found both the front desk staff, especially Michael Frick and also the concierge Rene Moran made my stay memorable.  These two individuals got involved and solved real problems with empathy and great professionalism.

title: By far the best hotel I’ve experienced NYC. It’s a huge place but staff are exceptional.  The room was an absolute j
text: Staff exceptional.  Room was a joy to stay in.  Fantastic views.  Lovely part of town.  I can’t praise this hotel enough.  Sitting by the window overlooking the New York skyline sipping coffee (room service terrific) was the best possible start to the day.   Thoroughly enjoyable stay.

title: Very poor and indifferent service . such a service cannot cost such money that they Charged
text: we stayed there for two days and received Very poor and indifferent service . And this apathetical kind of service should not cost such money that they Charged . this time in New York we didn't feel comfortable , we feel disappointed

title: Perfect Stay
text: My sister and I stayed at the Lotte New York Palace in Sept 2021 for a wedding. We had a wonderful time. The service was exceptional, the rooms were spacious and the hotel itself is gorgeous. One staff member did mention to be aware when booking of UN General Assembly since security is heightened at times and can take much longer to get in and out of the hotel. We were there just a few days prior, so it did not impact our stay. A good tip for booking though.

title: A magical, Gilded Age inspired Easter weekend
text:
Will definitely stay here again. This is a beautiful hotel and everyone we encountered was so pleasant and made sure we had everything we needed. We had two rooms and they were right next to each other on the 20th floor. The views of the Cathedral were breathtaking. The room was quite large for NYC, with two queen beds. My only quibble was that one of the beds was fluffier and more comfortable than the other which was more firm than I would have liked. 

We had drinks the night we arrived in the Gold Room--an absolute must. The room is stunning and part of the original Gilded Age mansion with high ceilings and gilded ceilings. My sister and niece had the Mrs. Astor cocktail--which my sister loved and my other niece had one that had smoky tequila and a rhubarb twist--she was planning ahead as we were going to a Mexican restaurant for dinner. I had a glass of one of the most delicious whites I've ever had, a silky smooth Pouilly Fouisse. A nice touch is that we were brought some complimentary nibbles, salty sweet warm nuts and a crispy lavash bread with olive tapenade. If we didn't have dinner reservations I would have had a second glass of wine. 

We had brunch reservations at a nearby restaurant the next morning, so I ran down to the lobby for coffee and two tropical fruit cups, which were good and very fresh. We are gluten free, but if not I would have been tempted by the many pastries--croissants looked amazing. After our coffee, we met with Maurice, one of the security guards for a Gossip Girl tour. This was a highlight of our visit. I'm currently working on a novel set in the Gilded Age--and even if you are not a fan of the TV show Gossip Girl, you might enjoy this short tour--about 10-15 minutes. It goes into some of the historical rooms where scenes from the show were set--but these are also the original rooms from the Gilded Age mansion and they are stunning. Maurice took photos for us in some of the rooms and he has been with the hotel for many years. We enjoyed meeting him and loved the tour. 

We left our bags with the bellmen while we had brunch and went shopping and that concluded our fabulous NYC visit. This is a lovely hotel and a great location.

title: Good location
text:
Location ***** Just off Madison Avenue very good location, subway near by, walkable uptown, to Central Park and lower Manhattan
Staff **** OK, efficient and pleasant but lacking anything else.  Typical of a large hotel.
Room **** Large room with a view of the Cathedral.  Room itself fairly basic, somewhat bland.  Old style 1970's bathroom with tub not a walk in shower.  Lots of light in both room and bathroom. No coffee maker but room service was available for $18 for coffee.  Had to go downstairs across the street to Starbucks for morning coffee.  Room very clean.  I heard a little noise coming from the next room including the sound of the blinds being closed (you pull a chain to close the blinds and they make a loud noise)
Technology * Small TV on a stand, no WIFI detected in room.  No USB ports but there was an ethernet connection, useful 5 years ago.  A bedside box so you could control the room lights, likely hi tech in 1970.
Overall *** 1/2 pleasant stay - not the Four Seasons nor a Hampton Inn - but nice.

title: Pampering During Challenging Times
text: Despite the backdrop of a pandemic, my need to travel was met with pampering and care at the Lotte New York Palace. All the safety precautions did not distract from the courteous service, exquisite accommodations, and great food.

title: Great location; that's about it
text:
Ridiculous hotel.  No coffee machine in the room, but if you want coffee service it's $18 + 19% service charge + $14 delivery fee.  So $40 for coffee and they deliver you a coffee machine.    Bagel + lox = $45, plus all the fees. 

Had to wait in line for 30-40 minutes just to get a key at check-in time. Understaffed.  Rooms are in dire need of renovation. No USB ports. Uncomfortable beds.

This hotel is way past its prime. Definitely not staying here ever again.  One and done.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text:
Loved the customer service at this Hotel. Miles at the front desk was amazing and very helpful.

Kal at the concierge made the best recommendations and helped so much with our reservations.

The rooms are spacious and family friendly.

title: Not worth the cost, long waits
text:
Booked a room at the Tower because of the location - close to shopping and subway - and because I thought there extra service would be nice to have during our trip. 

But we experienced lots of issues - were told our room would be ready at 3 but when we arrived it wasn't ready and we had to wait another hour with a lot of other people, meaning nowhere to sit. At check in time on all days I noted there was only one person working the Tower check in desk so lines were long. This became an issue when our room key didn't work after a long day out and about and I had to wait in a long line to get a working key, thus making us rushed for dinner plans. The air down restaurant - The Villard - was also disorganized. We waited 10 min past our reservation time for a hostess to appear in the morning. 

Nice staff, great location, but disorganized and not worth the money.

title: Spring break vacay
text:
I visited New York City during my kids spring break. It was my first time being here. That being said, it  was a bit difficult to navigate however, Kal Naim one of the concierge here in the hotel made it very easy , he was so patient, thorough, and detailed. Kal answered all my questions with appreciation and explained how to get to many places in easy and simple way. 
I will definitely come back here to this hotel. 
Than you Kal !

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
I visited with my daughter for her a 21st birthday. We loved the hotel and can’t wait to come back. The staff were great in concierge and the coffee shop too! Great location for visiting Times Square and we had an amazing view of the cathedral. The Gold Room was amazing for cocktails! 
We will definitely be back next year.

title: 4.?? But not a 5
text:
Bare with me there is quite a bit to say about this place. 

Let's start

We were on an anniversary trip and since we hadn't been able to do anything for our tenth year we went all out. 
When I researched New York trips, this seemed to be the more neutral location to stay at. Noise level, business, proximity to activities, and whatnot. ( to be fair it was ) 

Our taxi driver from the airport wasn't bad 27 dollars and it was a semi-quick drive from La Guardia. ( Taxi is probably the easiest way to leave the airport ) 

When we arrived service was on point. Was greeted at the door and directed to the front desk. We were offered help with our rooms but we didn't have a lot with us. 

When we opened the door to the room I was a little underwhelmed. You can tell the age of the hotel in the room. Yet it is kept clean and you can tell they take pride in the location. I can't begin to imagine what kind of undertaking a remodel would be. Yet the reason why I gave it a lower score in value is, that for what I paid I would expect a lot more. 
The bathroom was stocked well. Our mini fridge was empty. We had recently stayed at a hotel where the mini-fridge was full and was expecting this one to have at least the basics. Some of the lights were not controlled by the master control ( a system they have similar to Siri but it's a button instead of a command) 
The bed was very comfortable. 
Tv is still old-style tv. Doesn't support phone mirroring.
The outside noise level was very minimal.
The view we had was nice but not worth the extra $$$ to have it. I do prefer a room on the outer part of the hotel versus the center of it so don't mind it as much. Yet if I stayed here again I probably wouldn't spend it again. 
The room service was really good. Friendly and fast. Yet food was nothing spectacular. For a hotel of this level, I would expect warm buns, evenly cooked French fries, and more tender meat. Our buns were cold, French fries some overcooked and some okay. The seasoning was okay. Overall for the price of room service, you might be better off door dashing.

Room service was inconsistent. One day they did leave us our hung towels and the other days they took and put all new ones. On two days they gave us water bottles but the other days they didn't. ( mind you no mini-fridge either ). The cleaning was good. 
Throughout the stay everyone we interacted with was awesome. The location was PERFECT close to everything and easy to get around. Perfect for 1st trip to NY

title: Best views
text:
I stayed here for hour nights with my daughter for her thirteenth birthday. The view from our room was staggering! The room size was very big for NYC. There was a strange noise coming from hallway, but it was a draft and putting a towel down stopped it! Hardly any noise from street level.
On checking in, my daughter was given a teddy which was a cute gesture. The doormen were always so helpful. The room was so clean and comfortable.
I had a drink one evening in the bar area which was nice and we had breakfast as part of our deal. I would not have paid those prices though otherwise! I’d say, although the breakfast was lovely, it seemed to cater towards more external business types meeting. This was a shame, as I think the guests should have priority (it was fully booked our first morning, we had not been advised to reserve).
As far as location goes, it was really good- not too near to places like Tomes Square, but near to lots of shops, museums etc.

title: Great location.  Rooms a little "tired"
text: The Tower rooms are very spacious by NY standards.  The lobby area is nice but very busy.  Feels a lot like Penn Station. The food is average and very expensive even by NY standards.  Bagel with lox via room service almost $90 by the time they add everything in.  Parking for a.mid size car aporx $90 day.   Took apprx 30 mins for car to arrive. They charge more if you take the car out and return it a few hours later.  The location is fantastic and the hotel emplyees were very friendly and courteous.

title: Great service
text: David Shenman and his team are incredible. Extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Hotel was perfection, big rooms (for NY), clean and room service was quick and easy. Along with being in a great location. Won't be staying anywhere else.

title: Nice hotel!
text:
188 / 5.000
Resultados de traducción
Lotte The Palace is a great option in NY. It has an excellent location in Manhattan, along with very good service. Very comfortable rooms with everything you need to have a good stay, with a spectacular view of St. Patrick's Cathedral

title: Every detail was taken into consideration
text: I stayed for 6 nights and had an excellent visit. Every employee was incredibly kind and helpful, from security to the front desk to the doormen. The room was spacious and clean. The gym was excellent, although everyone wanted to use the Peloton, so I wish they’d get more! The bathroom products were nice, and the bed was extremely comfortable. I had an excellent view of the St Patrick’s cathedral. My only gripe is that the gym and coffee shop don’t open until sort of late, which is not convenient for business travelers that have to be at meetings early. They were nice enough to allow early access to the gym on request but as they get busier I would recommend they consider opening it earlier for everyone. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Excellent stay!
text: All the employees were extremely helpful and kind, we didn’t have any problems at all in the hotel. The room we had was great and was kept to a high standard. Couldn’t have asked for a better experience

title: Great stay
text: Staff was very friendly and even offered a room upgrade that was available when we checked in. Rooms are spacious and have amazing views of St. Patrick's. Drinks at the Gold Room are a must. If you have any questions the concierge staff is extraordinarily helpful and go above and beyond to make sure you have a perfect stay

title: Five Star Service and Gorgeous Views
text: Great stay! The staff made a big difference!! UTRA from housekeeping took such good care of us each day. We had two rooms, 2618/19. She checked in every day as we were leaving for coffee. I’ve never had such kind and caring housekeeping! Bartenders- Mila and Jose, two more examples of five star service. The doorman were so so good and I wish I remembered their names, greeted us with humor and kindness each morning. Thank you Lotte staff! The hotel is gorgeous and in a great location. The rooms are in need of some updates but on the plus side they are very spacious for NYC. Gorgeous views of St. Patrick’s Cathedral.

title: Amazing family vacation
text:
We recently returned from a 5 day family vacation to NYC.  Absolutely loved our stay.  Spacious room for a prime midtown location with a beautiful view.  The room clearly had a recent facelift and was not dated.  The staff were so friendly and attentive to our needs.

The hotel was renovated from an a 1880's mansion.  One night our server offered to give us a tour of the mansion.  You could see how proud the employees are of their hotel.

We would highly recommend a stay at this property.

title: We ❤️ NY
text:
We just got back from the trip of our lives! Had an amazing week in New York! Stayed at the Lotte Plaza in Manhattan and I have to say this place is incredible. The architecture, staff, room, view, cocktails, food and location all amazing... I give this place a 10 out of 10!
Special thanks to Maurice for the great Gossip Girl Tour and his hospitable nature 😎.
Also had wonderful interactions with George, Tom, Henri, Nicola and Ray!
Thank you soooooo much for making us feel at home. It’s the people in NY that made this trip so memorable. 
To the entire staff at The Lotte NY Plaza, we will be talking about you and our incredible stay for a very, very long time 🥯🍎🇺🇸🗽🥃.
Can’t wait to come back and do it all over again and again 😉

title: Lovely staff with a great location
text:
We enjoyed our stay at the Lotte. Very nice room and quiet. Elevators were fast and not too full. Thanks to Anna Marie and Matt for making us feel welcome at the hotel. Just a nice group of people working there.
The location was convenient for everything we did in the city, too.

title: Competetn and Calm Hotel Staff
text: My purpose in writing this review is to highlight two hotel employees, Frances and Tom who enhanced our stay.  Frances was a most helpful doorman who spotted our car and guided me to a spot to unload.  He greeted us warmly and got us from car to front desk in the most calm and friendly way.  After checking in, Tom accompanied us to the room and got us oriented also in a way that put us in a relaxed frame of mind, ready to take on NYC.

title: Outstanding in every way
text: I arranged a Wedding block of rooms for guests to attend our daughter’s wedding at a nearby venue and couldn’t have been more thrilled with the decision. The hotel is beautiful - old school elegance  with very clean ,modern accommodations We had to postpone twice due to the pandemic and they were so accommodating  and helpful . The rooms and suites are comfortable, extremely spacious , many with incredible views of St Patrick’s. The breakfast and lunch platters for the bridal suite were delicious.  Huge shout out and thank you to May who patiently and kindly  answered all my questions and requests . Dan and Peter were extremely helpful as well .  All our guests loved their stay as well . I highly recommend this hotel for your NYC stay .

title: PERSONAL AMABLE PERO SERVICIO DEFICIENTE PARA LA CATEGORÍA
text:
Hemos estado 4 dias / 3 noches en una habitación de la zona de The Tower con la familia y la verdad es que salimos un poco decepcionados de servicio del hotel.
A destacar como positivo:  Habitación amplia, desayuno impecable (pero muy caro) y personal muy amable en general (especialmente los camareros del desayuno y el personal de portería).
A Mejorar:  Mantenimiento de la habitación muy deficiente. La persiana eléctrica  de la habitación no subía bien y al llegar nos encontramos el lavabo atascado lo que nos ocasionó una pequeña inundación. 
El segundo día llegamos a las 6:00PM al hotel después de pasar todo el día en la cuidad y nos encontramos la habitación sin limpiar. En recepción nos dijeron que tenían problemas con el personal de limpieza de habitaciones, pero que nos lo solucionaban (como así fue) Creo que es un error muy grave en un hotel de esta categoría y además nadie se disculpó por ello.
Le daría una segunda oportunidad ya que la ubicación es excelente y el personal amable, pero deben mejorar en mantenimiento y organización.

title: Clean and convenient
text: Very clean, and large rooms for the USA, and the beds were v comfy.  The staff were all helpful and friendly.  We got given room 910 on the first night which overlooked some big machinery so not a great view, and even with earplugs could be heard. But they were happy to move us the next day. The one thing I didn't like is the $15.99 daily charge for WiFi in the room. Ok you can then have 10 devices connected but I was surprised they charge at all these days. The Starbucks down the road is free, as were most places we visited so come on Lotte, make it free!  Location wise, it is good, walkable to Central Park and also Times Sq.

title: Hotel that prioritizes external guests instead of looking after their own. Sad.
text: I am a paying guest at the Lotte and tried to get breakfast at the restaurant this morning at 8 am. I was told to wait for 20 minutes whilst outside guests were given tables - I presume were booked. How can a hotel who has guests paying premiums for their rooms not able to have breakfast when they want to. I travel alot and good hotels prioritize their hotel guests above external bookings. This is the last time I stay here. This is obviously a poor hotel.

title: Fabulous suite and service
text: A few friends enjoyed the most fabulous suite to watch the Oscars. The city views were stunning! The suite was among the nicest I've stayed in. And the hotel team -- Francesca, Diego, Samir, Salim, and Oscar -- took the best care of us and didn't miss a beat. I'll definitely stay here again!

title: Just impeccable
text: Not my first stay at the Lotte NY Palace and definitely will not be my last. I have traveled the world and stayed in some of the best properties in gateway cities everywhere. The Palace delivers a seamless and impeccable experience every time I visit. The property is historic and beautifully maintained. It is located in the perfect place. I walked to my my Broadway show and to world-class shopping and restaurants. Just all perfect. Impeccable!

title: 5-Star Customer Service!
text: My family booked a last minute trip to New York to seek medical treatment.  Prior to their arrival, the rest of our family wanted to send flowers to make the stay more comfortable.  Miles from the Front Office helped get this done by choosing a perfect room and helping with the delivery of flowers to the room before arrival.  This helped us make the stay at the hotel even better!

title: There’s a Lotte to Love
text: Wonderful stay! I usually bring my family a few times a year and wondered with the two-year covid hiatus how things would be.  The Lotte Palace hotel and staff are back and better than ever.  My favorite concierge, Kal Naim, helped me arrange Broadway tickets and dinner reservations before I arrived so when I landed, vacation began. The tickets to Moulin Rouge were FANTASTIC. Thank you, Kal!

title: Great Hotel
text: Awesome room with a view of St. Patrick Cathedral, large, confortable with a desk, chairs, large bath and a nice closet. Definitely a good room and one now ine of my favorites. The only thing the reception desk staff with negative attitude and gives a very bad service, that was the only think I disapprove.

title: A Quick Trip to NYC with a Stay at the Lovely New York Palace
text:
As I said before, everything about this hotel is impeccable and it always feels like a fantasy to stay here.  The manager Becky does a fantastic job helping with arrangements as well as the rest of the Palace staff. The last time we were here was before the pandemic and we were of course concerned about how the hotel and New York may have changed over the past two years.  We were delighted to find that the New York Palace is as incredible as always. The employees of the Lotte New York Palace continue to be so nice and accommodating and returning to see them (and to have them remember us) makes the stay feel so personable. All of our needs were addressed during our stay at this property with a view and we cannot wait to stay here again some day soon.

Our only suggestion would be to upgrade the paper goods in the bathroom. Otherwise, everything was luxurious.

title: Lotte new York palace
text: Awesome place! Nice fitness room, fantastic location and helpful staff! Will for sure stay here the next time we go to the unites states. Never felt neglected while staying at this amazing hotel! Choose this!

title: Incredible service
text:
We landed in NYC earlier in the morning than scheduled, and once we hailed a taxi to transport us to the hotel it was around 7AM on Friday 3/11. The front desk was able to check me and my wife in but said the room was not yet available, so they would contact me by phone when it became ready. Understandable as far as early check-in goes which isn't always guaranteed. Luckily we were able to leave our luggage with the bell staff as we had no idea where we would spend our time in midtown Manhattan and did not feel like lugging around 90 lbs worth of stuff. Killed some time at a nearby Starbucks and at their lobby lounge area, but 4 hours later around 11am we were still waiting for a room. I went to inquire with the front desk again and a very nice lady named Clara said that she will check to see if they had another one available. A few minutes later she came to meet us at the lobby lounge and said fortunately they did have a room. She went with us to the room to confirm it was acceptable for us and we said we would take it. We did not have to go back down to the lobby and was allowed to stay in the room to finish the check-in, and she also had the bell staff bring our luggage upstairs.

Thank you again to Clara and her manager Miles for your efforts in accommodating us as an early check-in and comfortable after a long plane trip! This is a place we would definitely stay in again the next time we visit NYC.

title: Bellissimo soggiorno. Prezioso il Concierge Diego
text:
Ho soggiornato presso la struttura dal 3 all'8 marzo 2022; è stato il mio terzo soggiorno lì e ci torno sempre volentieri. Molto bella la grande camera con ampia parete a vetri sulla città; letto king comodissimo e confortevole. I prodotti da bagno di ottima marca. La posizione eccezionale. Carina l'idea di un piccolo, esclusivo e fornito bar all'interno dell'hotel (alternativa valida alla colazione nel ristorante).  Prezioso e insostituibile il Concierge Diego che, con grande gentilezza e disponibilità (adattandosi anche alla mia lingua), mi ha dato validissimi consigli per l'organizzazione delle serate, proponendo una vasta scelta di alternative e prenotando, anche all'ultimo minuto, cene in ottimi ristoranti  di recente apertura. La precisione e tempestività dei suoi consigli hanno contribuito al successo della mia vacanza.
Se posso permettermi un piccolo suggerimento all'hotel, eliminerei la moquette.

title: Outstanding experience as always
text:
I have been in and out of NYC on business for years and I always stay at the Palace . The quality of the architecture and creativity of the interior designs are classic examples of the great NY families of the Guilded Age of the late 1800's  the likes of the Astor's, Vanderbilt's, Roosevelt's and Livingston's. I often just roam around late at night when dealing with jet lag and marvel  at  the classic and well maintained examples of that era. The view of the Cathedral are breathtaking and a bonus when your room is facing West. Equally as breathtaking are the views to the East with the  can reserve a room on the West side of the hotel. The views t o the East are equally as stunning with the Grace building and Empire State building in the not so distant view. 
The guest services i and employees  are second to none and testament to their llong careers at the Palice. I've grown to know many of them by name and consider them to be my friends in NY.  The rooms are always spotless and well maintained and supplied. the housekeeping staff are always accommodating both day and night.  I can honestly say that the All around service of the Lotte Palace is superior and my home in NYC.

title: Nice Location But Underwhelming Amenities
text: Overall the hotel room we booked (towers suite) was very spacious.  However, some of the tech didn't work (lamps connected to smart control didn't work, some electric shades didn't work, and we had a bathroom outlet flashing red.)  It was clean and the cleaning staff were friendly.  There is no mini bar, even though there is a mini-bar fridge.  This was blamed on COVID, although I don't see how stocking a mini-bar spreads COVID.  We traveled with children and needed a roll away bed.  We requested one in the evening, but were called by the staff saying they were short staffed and it would not be delivered until the night crew clocked in (after 11 pm).  So, we had to wait until 11:30 pm to put our kids to bed.   The king bed was also very firm and springy.  The location was nice.  Overall though I am hesitant to book this property again based on low value with limited amenities for a luxury hotel.

title: Brilliant stay with my daughter
text: This was the perfect hotel for my 19 year old daughter and I when visiting New York. From the minute we arrived, we were greeted by Michael on reception who made the check in process efficient and even fun. He made us feel really welcome and special. The location can’t be beaten and the rooms are spacious, clean and have great amenities. The cleaning was the best I’ve had in a hotel during Covid and was also done quickly and efficiently.

title: Where Old Meets New (York); Our Transcendent Gilded Age Wedding
text: From our initial walk through to scout the venue up to and including relinquishing our keys at checkout, our wedding experience at The Palace was nothing short of a dream! The team's warm yet professional demeanor, accomodating bedside manner, impeccable attention to detail and precision, decorum, prompt correspondence, and overall hospitality catapults this hotel to the forefront of the industry. No stone was left unturned in the team's (notably Rachel, Peter, and Tracy-Ann a.k.a. "The Wedding Whisperers") flawless execution of every moment. They realized our wedding vision to a T and enabled our perfect wedding to come to fruition. My husband and I just celebrated our 5 month anniversary and are already waxing nostalgic about our fairytale wedding that was made possible at the hands of this immaculate team. The hotel's aesthetic regal resplendence matched, if not exceeded that of its personnel. "No" is a foreign word in the team's vernacular, as every inquiry and request were met with a solution and a smile. In succinctness, sterling service, bar none!

title: Great stay awesome staff
text: The staff were great. Tracy-Ann organized everything. The doorman Joe was very helpful ans pleaseant as were the xleanomg staff. The rooms and suite had everything we need. Alo the conference facility was great.

title: Good hotel, with reactive service
text:
Excellent hotel, very well located.
Service was very reactive: coffee makers and bottles of water were missing in the room which was disappointing for a hotel of this category, even during the pandemic; we called the manager and everything was brought up immediately! 
(I hope I did not just spoil the manager's life in writing this review)

title: Outstanding Heroic Personal Service In A Stunning Setting
text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Lotte Palace in NYC. A stunningly beautiful midtown NYC hotel. However what knocked my socks off was an example of outstanding personal service that transformed a big problem into a success. An important Fedex package was delivered in my name to the hotel containing documents that needed to be reviewed and signed early the next morning. Expecting the package at checkin, I was told that they were securely locked up and would be delivered the next morning. That was a problem. Alfred, Guest Service Agent, was approached and with the support and assistance of Assistant Front Office Manager Nancy, retrieved the package from the secure lockup and it was delivered immediately to my room. They used common sense, a can do "solve the problem" approach and made it happen. They were ably supported by Charlotte in Guest Experience who kept me advised on the progress. All this tremendous personal leadership and service in a stunning hotel that is a visual feast for any guest. Thank you and well done.

title: Fantastic staff!
text: This is a beautiful hotel and well maintained.  The true stars of the hotel are their wonderful, helpful, warm and friendly staff.  This was our second stay there, and we were welcomed back (which really surprised me!). As I have mobility issues and use a scooter, everyone was so helpful, especially the door staff.  My only disappointment is the lack of a room coffee maker and floor ice machine (items considered regular features at lower price hotels).  All in all we really enjoyed our long weekend at the Lotte New York Palace.

title: New York Palace Stay February 2022
text:
Our stay at The Palace was a very enjoyable experience.  The staff was very helpful and responsive to our needs.  The location of the hotel suited us very well. It was close enough to walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, and St. Patrick's Cathedral as well as other well known sights.  At the same time, we were not in the midst of all the traffic associated with the Times Square area.  
Rooms were great and the beds were very comfortable.  
The one negative I felt was the cost of breakfast which was very expensive prices for basic breakfast menu items.  
Overall, it is an excellent hotel and should be a top choice to stay when visiting New York City.

title: 5 star for staff
text:
This 5 star is purely  for the front end staff.
I hope this hotel knows how wonderful the staff are.. 
From the moment we got out of the taxi.. to the moment we left.. one member of staff or the other made us feel special and welcomed. 

George was an absolute delight, he welcomed us with big smiles (even with a face mask you could tell) and jokes! 
Tom A helped us with our baggage and throughout our stay, did that little extra, each time he saw us!
He said "you are on holiday, so you don't need to do anything" 

I have to say the hotel has the most definitely  the best  concierge, Kal Naim !! We have never met anyone as helpful and generous as he is .. he was so helpful with great tips, directions and advice.. nothing  was to much trouble.. he clearly went the extra mile!! 

I could carry on name dropping.... but will stop.. they were all lovely.. Thank you. 

This trip would have been one of the best, if not for the issue of daily charges on my card!! 
We love a bit of luxury, so we always save and plan a good holiday; this holiday was all booked and paid for, so we won't  have to worry about money , well,  just spending money.
We checked in and it was confirmed that we paid already.. unfortunately the next morning and the rest of the mornings there was a charge on my card.. apparently  they was an issue with the supplier's card (Bonotel. Although we booked via Virgin holidays). 

This is very unfair to be charged twice as we have paid in full already. and that was our spending money they were holding on to!
The money has been refunded but I believe the hotel dealt with this badly and as much as I would like to return to the hotel to see the staff.. I certainly will not! This cause me unnecessary stress, anxiety and fear of booking holiday packages.

title: Just your average hotel.
text: I thought  we would be walking in through the beautiful courtyard into that beautiful entrance that I have passed by so many times and wondered what it would be like to stay there. Well, now I know. That entrance was closed and we entered through a turnstile just like every other hotel. The lobby was also typical and the person that checked us in was not very friendly. I was most disappointed in our room. We were supposed to have a cathedral view, but instead faced the side of a building and a roof. The beds were comfortable and the decor was pretty drab. The bathroom need to be updated. I am not a fan of stepping into a tub to take a shower but that was what I had to do. The in room dining is one page, and if you want a $36 hamburger, you are in luck. All in all, it was not what I was expecting, but at least I finally know what it is like to stay there.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: From the moment we walked in, everything was just perfect. The hotel is beautiful, the common areas are beautiful and the room was perfect. Everything was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the view was gorgeous. Thank you New York Palace! We’ll be back!

title: Thank you so much to Isabella and the rest of the staff!
text: I'd like to thank the staff of Lotte, and particularly concierge Isabella, for making my stay that much more enjoyable. I had some issues with my room, and she was kind enough to find me another room with a fantastic view - thank you very much for that!

title: Come for Drinks at the Gold Room, Stay for the Tour with Jose
text: The Lotte Palace is built on the site of the former Villard Mansion. This means that the hotel is full of nooks and crannies and secret doors and meandering hallways that always seem just out of reach. This creates a spectacularly mysterious and moody atmosphere - there is no shortage of inscriptions to read and rooms to explore. I came with my daughter and we had a wonderful time exploring the various rooms. I thought we’d made pretty good work of the place until I met Jose - the best bartender in New York. In addition to making wonderful drinks at the Gold Room, he gave me a tour of the hotel that made it clear that I had only seen a fraction of the hotel. He knows the whole history of the hotel and explains all the artistic and architectural details that you would never notice otherwise. It has made my stay spectacular and, more importantly, it will make my daughter super jealous!  If you like places with history and charm and mystery, come to the Lotte Palace and stop by the Gold Room and ask for Jose.

title: Gold room
text: Your bartender Julio was the best thing I’ve ever experienced in NYC, thank you so much - the extra tour made the entire trip, I’ve never experienced anything like it - I learned so much about the history of the hotel and couldn’t be more thrilled

title: Fabulous Caring Staff -
text:
Found this gem in Oct ‘21 - returned in December with friends - no disappointment.  The staff, from arrival thru departure, greeted and treated as though we were their only responsibility.   

Contacted Reservations Dept.(Brian Becker) prior to arrival to reconfirm.  He not only offered assurance all requests were noted but obviously cared as nothing was missed.  

Without fail, all door service staff displayed Brian’s  same interest in being of assistance.  

Concierge Staff is wonderful in helping you organize your days with their suggestions & reservation assistance…specifically Isabella, Diego & Rene.  

It’s a great place to treat yourself - over & over!!

title: Great stay as always
text:
We went on a girls trip for my second stay at this hotel. The old school New York charm always attracts me back here. The hotel staff are always friendly and welcoming. The doorman Ray and his colleagues are out the front all day looking after you in the cold and do a fantastic job. Michael on reception dealt with our wifi issues really promptly. 

We had breakfast most mornings from Duke Eatery just round the corner and it was great with lots of choice. 

I fell in love with the Christmas decorations here on my first stay but on my second stay the courtyard was closed off which was quite disappointing. 

The Pomme Palais staff are really friendly and the lobby lounge is a nice place to chill with your purchases. 

The rooms are a good size. We were four ladies in a room with two double beds. The beds are a little in the small side in these rooms though. 

No tea facility in room but I think that is normal in NYC. 

Robes and slippers and more delivered if needed. 

If they don’t have what you need just ask, the hotel are very accommodating. 

Location is brilliant and central without too much noise. 

Looking forward to my next visit!

title: Excellent Concierge!
text: Diego at the Concierge desk has been fantastic!  I've traveled many places around the world and he is the best I've interacted with.  Patient, kind, responsive, NEVER made me feel like I was asking him too many questions, his responses/recommendations were always "spot on".  This hotel has always been my favorite in NYC and all of my numerous interactions with Diego were outstanding - perfect.  Its people like him who make a difference after you've interacted with him.  I always felt great after each encounter.  Owners/Management: please consider promoting him, or at the least having him train others. By the end of the first day he remembered my name... impressive! Not only did I feel truly welcomed and wanted, I felt like I was "known" and that I mattered.

title: 5 Star Concierge
text: Lotte New York Palace has a 5 Star Concierge Staff.  I can  not say enough about Isabella, Ani, Diego, Rene and Kal for there over the top willingness to help make things go smoothly.  I had a group staying at the Lotte with lots of moving parts and the concierge staff was amazing and handle changes like a champ.  They were so flexible which is what I loved.  There communication was top notch from responding to emails, calling me or texting me to make sure everything was perfect.

title: Fantastic staff in just as fab hotel
text: I stayed at the Lotte over Christmas with my grown up daughter. Arriving at the hotel we were greeted by George one of the doormen and he was really friendly and helpful not just on arrival but throughout our stay. Booking in was really easy and we had a lovely room on the 27th floor overlooking St Patrick's cathedral. The room was nice and large and really clean. Really comfortable beds. The fridge unfortunately was sealed probably due to covid but no major issue. The shower wasn't the best one I've used but was good enough and remember this is an old hotel. Even though we were not bothered about room service as my daughter isn't the tidiest, Tammy that looked after our room did a fantastic job and she was lovely. Ani on concierge was often working when I needed any help and despite being on her own she was always really helpful and  helped me pick a better Xmas eve cruise than the one I'd originally planned to use. Truthfully every member of staff we met was so helpful and made you feel nothing was ever too much trouble. I wasn't a massive fan in the bar as a bit dark for me. My only gripe really was breakfast that they wouldn't let you book which when on a schedule to get somewhere you want to know you can sit at a time that suits. Feel this is something they could look at offering as other hotels were allowing booking. There is a small cafe inside that sold take out drinks, croissant etc which were really fresh and tasty. Another thing I felt they could offer was WiFi instead costing I think about 15 dollars a day. I know it only is about 11 pound a day but the lotte is more expensive than a lot of hotels so felt something they could look at offering. I was also disappointed they didn't put the big tree outside something I've seen when in new york before and walked past the lotte. I've given the hotel 4 stars due to a couple of things I've mentioned wasn't quite to my taste or a few things I felt could be done different so hard to give 5 when a few grumbles but nothing that would stop me staying here again and anywhere you stay I don't think any hotel would get everything hundred percent but this one comes close.

title: Great hotel in Manhattan
text:
Firstly what a hotel, great rooms, great staff, great stay, we stayed for 8 nights in December in a big room with a cathedral view and what a view, we didn’t try any of the restaurants as tried different breakfast joints every morning and there the obvious restaurants galore in Manhattan.

There is a little coffee shop on the ground floor and also a little shop which sell nearly everything.

The only gripe is they wanted something in the region of $15 a day for Wi-Fi, come on guys it’s 2022 and staying in a very expensive hotel, we should be given the wi-fi for free in this day and age, also there was no coffee making facilities in the room.

The room was really big and had everything you will need, great bath too.

Will definitely stay again if we come back to NYC, hopefully the wi fi might be free by then too.

title: A lovely visit to NYC
text: I had this hotel booked for a year, in preparation for my husbands 30th birthday and to celebrate New Year! The photos looked outstanding and I’m a huge fan of Gossip Girl so couldn’t wait to pull up outside the beautiful entrance and wow my husband (the whole trip was a surprise). Very disappointed when the courtyard was closed and covered in scaffolding, having spoken on the phone to the hotel several times, this was never mentioned and was a big let down. Also, I’d seen other reviews of people mentioning it was a special occasion and guests receiving goody bags or gifts, I mentioned each time it was my husbands 30th and when we arrived, it wasn’t brought up. Apart from that, the hotel staff are fabulous, the inside of the hotel is gorgeous, very quiet, amazing views, perfectly situated within the city. I would highly recommend. Decor in the rooms is slightly outdated, wires out behind the table, carpet coming up in the corners and we had a leaky tap which we had to wrap a towel around the whole trip as our belongings on the sink would end up wet. Overall could do with a little update, but you’re barely in your room anyway. I would go back again, 100%

title: Truly a Palace
text:
We, and a large number of our family and friends spent the weekend at the Lotte Palace in celebration of our daughters wedding. When my daughter and her new husband, chose the Palace for the venue, I was quite excited as I had had a number of excellent visits over the last several years but had never attended an event there. Suffice it to say, I do not believe there is a more beautiful, or well-run location in all of the New York area to hold a top-shelf wedding. Our guest’s experience, from their rooms, to the service personnel who are simply exceptional, to the wedding itself and the many excellent recommendations the hotel made was Incredibly memorable. Adam, the person who was directly coordinating event was beyond helpful. So was everyone else, including the spectacular bellmen, the maids, and everyone else with whom we came into contact. The wonderful thing was that as elegant as everything was, it was not the least bit pretentious, snooty, or uncomfortable even for our guest to do not generally frequent places as exceptional as this hotel is.
I have had a good fortune of traveling to all seven continents, stayed at some of the finest places on earth, and could not have been happier with this weekend’s experience.
Highly, highly recommended.

title: Lovely Stay
text: We had a lovely stay from the 1st to the 6th of January with our 17 year old daughter.  The staff were lovely, very professional, helpful and friendly.  The only complaint I would have would be the double beds, although comfortable, are a bit small.  We were also disappointed that the main door was closed and there was no christmas tree on the terrace as in previous years.

title: Lovely pre Christmas trip
text: I travelled with my 17 year old son just before Christmas. The location of the hotel is great and our room was big for New York standards although a basic 5 star standard wise in my view and as others have noted the bath ‘ shower is very old fashioned. We had excellent views from the room and whilst disappointed that the main courtyard was shut and no tree up the front of the hotel and reception / staircase were well decorated. We were lucky with the lift situation and had no issues that others have mentioned. The staff were all helpful,  although I had mentioned prior to arrival that the trip was for my sons 18th birthday and there was no reference made at all. The reason I have not given 5 stars is due to the lack of options re drinks / dining in the hotel itself. In the main this did not pose a problem apart from first thing on a morning and later at night. This was ok until our final night when I was charged 23 dollars for a tea and coffee in take away cups for in our room which I thought was ridiculous. Alcohol maybe yes but not tea and coffee had I known in advance we would not have bothered.  That aside we would stay in the hotel again and hopefully post COVID more options would be available including tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom room itself.

title: Sensational
text:
My family and I stayed at the Lotte New York Palace for six nights over Christmas 2021 (20th-26th). 
We stayed in a 2 Queen Bed room in The Towers for 3 nights. The room was of a good size with a good sized clean and well maintained bathroom.  The 2 Queen beds were extremely comfortable and daily cleaning services were in operation. The view from this room, on the 45 floor, was also very good overlooking St Patrick’s Cathedral and the Christmas tree at the Rockefeller Centre. 
We also stayed for 3 nights in a Corner Suite with Pantry in The Towers on the 52nd floor. Wow, what a room! Over 1,200sq of pure luxury living. Every single point was beyond our expectations. Each room within the suite was very well maintained, cleaned daily to a very high standard and the beds were probably the most comfortable we have slept in. Now for the real wow factor, the views! These were quite simply stunning, from the bedroom; the Empire State and the Chrysler Building and from the lounge area the Christmas Tree at the Rockefeller Centre and Radio City Music Hall. It really has to be seen to be believed! 
Oh, and the hotel is just yards from both 5th Ave and Madison Ave each with an abundance of shopping opportunities.
It is at this point of my review where I risk running out of superlatives. This is because the most impressive  quality this hotel has to offer, even more exceptional than the rooms, bars and other communal areas, are the staff!  Absolutely outstanding customer service oozed from every member of staff we had the pleasure of dealing with. Ani, Kal and Diego in the Concierge team were professional, efficient, knowledgeable, helpful, nothing was ever too much trouble. Clara from guest services, with her amazing smile and warm manner made our holiday extra special simply by greeting us by name every time we saw her. That is the kind of personal service on offer at this hotel. On top of that it was Clara who took the time to give us the most wonderful tour of the Gossip Girl suite, yet another highlight of our stay. It would be remiss of me not to say a huge thank you to Brian Becker in the reservations team, the savour of our holiday! I had made a genuine mistake with my reservation a few days prior to arrival and contacted Brian in a panic. I need not have worried as Brian resolved my mistake immediately with no fuss. Yet another example of the level of customer service you can expect and another reason to lavish praise on the staff working for this hotel.
Finally, the quality of this building and it’s location in the very heart of New York City speak for itself. However, it’s the current custodians of the building who bring it to life. I had the pleasure of dealing directly with both Natsuko, Director of Guest Services and Ms Hubbard, General Manager during our stay and in just the very short exchange we had it was abundantly clear that the importance of providing excellent customer service is driven from this level.
In conclusion, the whole experience my family and I had of the Lotte New York Palace will live long in the memory for all the right reasons. It was beyond our wildest expectations. Thank you so much!

title: Great stay!
text:
Great location - very convenient for going to major sites in NYC, 
Rooms were clean with a lot of space, great bed
Very friendly and supportive staff
All in all, really had a great stay during Christmas!!

title: Xmas 2021
text: There’s no better place than New York for Xmas! The hotel is in a great location for most tourist sites in Manhattan, the staff were helpful, friendly and made us very welcome. The coffee shop was great for our morning drinks and late afternoon cocktails in the Gold room was amazing. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to visit again!

title: Christmas at Lotte New York Palace
text:
A fantastic hotel, perfectly situated for exploring New York. Fantastic interior and 
Was decorated beautifully for Christmas. Room was clean and comfortable with an amazing view! Staff friendly and helpful.
Room service and bar prices quite pricey but you are in New York. Breakfast takeaway bar very convenient. Absolutely loved our stay here and would definitely stay again.

title: Beautiful hotel at Christmas time
text: We stayed at the Lotte for 3 nights right before Christmas and it was beautifully decorated. The staff was very friendly and the room had a great view of St. Patrick's Cathedral and midtown. Great location! Would definitely stay there again.

title: Bed Bugs
text:
The stars come off because of the bed bug bites I got while staying at the hotel the weekend before Christmas. I emailed the hotel and called but no one picked up the line listed on their website. Room 3022, if you stay in that room, please check the bed! 

The staff we interacted with was 5 stars. 

The room was huge especially for NYC standards but dated. We were in NY for a Christmas vacation so it felt like we were staying in hotel from Home Alone 2 (circa 1990s hotel furnishings) so we loved the nostalgia. Unfortunately we were disappointed that the big Christmas tree in front wasn’t there this year.

title: Christmas Vacation
text: From the Valet to the check in at Front Desk (Ann Marie) to the accommodations to the Bar to check out, it was a sensational experience. Confidence in the protocols and will definitely make it my choice to stay when in NYC.

title: Disappointing for 5 star
text: Sadly disappointing for a 5 star hotel in NY with such fabulous views. The views over St Patrick’s Cathedral were fantastic from the room but that is as far as it got. My room was huge for NYC but apart from a comfortable super king bed and a table there was nothing. No mini bar. No cups or glasses. No fridge that would open. No tea making facilities.  The major disappointment was the bathroom. It is a long time since I have been in a shower with a shower curtain with dribbling water from the shower. What you are not told before arrival, unless I didn’t notice, was that due to the pandemic there are very few hotel facilities open. All you get to spend the $100 credit per stay credit I was given is the coffee shop which always had long queues or ten Gold Room which was a very antiquated windowless room with a bar.  The location is great but modernisation is badly needed

title: Best Hotel Experience in NYC By Far!
text:
We have previously stayed in two other hotels in Manhattan and have always liked the look of the Lotte as we have walked past.

From the moment we walked into the lobby, the Lotte was everything we could wish for and more.  You get a real sense of being in a high-end and luxurious hotel, backed up by friendly first class service.
