We were staying in NYC on my wife's Birthday and she was touched to receive a gift bag on arrival.  The guy on reception (whose name escapes me unfortunately) was very welcoming and we were delighted to have our room upgraded to the top 39th floor, with a stunning view overlooking St Patrick's cathedral and the Rockefeller.  The room itself was extremely well appointed, roomy and spotlessly clean.  It is of course challenging to find any hotel room in NYC which is quiet, but ours seem to be the exception to this rule and we had no difficulty sleeping, no doubt helped by the queen sixed bed, luxurious Egyptian lined and wonderful pillows!  Other notable features included an exceptionally powerful double sized shower (and certainly the best shower we have experienced - supported by highly effective ventilation), along with ambient lighting (adjustable from a tablet device) and a great sized LG TV.  While one of the bedside lamps was not working on arrival, this was immediately fixed.  The safe in the wardrobe was well proportioned and provided plenty of space for passports, cash and other valuables.  Although not especially required in December, the air conditioning was very effective and quiet.

The Lotte benefits from a stunning, sweeping staircase (reminiscent of the main Disney hotel at Disneyland Paris), along with luxurious dining rooms and a bar.  We treated ourselves to breakfast on the morning of my wife's Birthday and, although very nice, my one and only criticism of the Lotte would be the price.  US$9 for a small glass of orange juice does seem excessive by any standard!

We would most definitely return to the Lotte for our future trips to NYC and can't recommend it highly enough.  Well done to all the staff involved in making it such a special place, especially in the run up to Christmas.

title: Loved it
text:
Big thanks to the team at the Lotte New York Palace hotel - very helpful, quick and efficient service, ultra clean, great location

The room was a great size - perfect for staying with the kids - two huge double beds - great shower - excellent view of New York City

title: Lovely stay, lovely hotel, perfect location.
text: My friend and I enjoyed four lovely nights in the Towers.  Although no suite was available as we had hoped, our 50th floor room was huge, well-appointed, and comfortable, and not just by NYC standards.  The staff, particularly the bellmen, doormen, wait staff, etc., are warm, personable, and helpful.  They really put the hotel experience into the 5-star category.  We had a couple of housekeeping issues, but they were resolved quickly.  In-hotel dining options other than breakfast are very limited, but the pandemic is likely to blame for that.  We enjoyed room service two times and the food was delicious, which helped us overcome sticker shock at the prices.  All in all, we had a lovely stay in a lovely hotel in a perfect Midtown location.  Have stayed here before and will again.

title: Superb Concierge Service
text:
We stayed in the Lotte New York Palace for two nights last week. On Sunday 12th December we had business committments but had Monday 13th free. We wanted to hear some good jazz and have a nice dinner beforehand, so we asked Isabella, the Concierge, for advice. She suggested an early booking at Hatsuhana Sushi Restaurant, followed by jazz at Birdland. Both were perfect. Not only did Isabella get it right but she had  factored in the slow-moving traffic in the area as people drove by the Rockefeller Plaza to enjoy the lights and huge Christmas Tree. We enjoyed them too, but on foot. 
Dinner was delicious, beautifully served by attentive staff members. The jazz was superb- Richard Sexton and his sextet played the American song book with verve, precision and fun. 
Left to our own devices we would never have packed so much into so little time. Thanks, Isabella for arranging our personal Fairytale of New York

title: Look elsewhere
text: We booked this hotel because we read about the wonderful Christmas decorations. The decorations were pretty standard. The main attraction was supposed to be the courtyard tree which they did not do this year. Housekeeping and the Bell service were exceptional. The rooms are very outdated. There are no charging ports. Late night dining isn't available at the hotel and there are extremely limited options nearby.

title: Amazing four days!!
text: We had a great time! Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful. Clara greeted us every day with a smile and went out of her way to see how we were doing. She even got the elevator for me, accompanied me to our room and let me in because my hands were full! We had a total of six people in two rooms and the accommodations were first rate - very clean. A fantastic stay!

title: Staff member goes the extra mile (TY Jerry in the Postal Room)!
text:
The Lotte was a fantastic home base for a Christmas trip to NYC.  The accommodations are comfortable, clean, & festive.  The location is also perfect...close to all the holiday festivities (Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Plaza, decorations at Saks, and walkable to Central Park, Empire State building, several subway stops, etc.).  

The differentiating factor, however, was the service provided by the Lotte staff.  From check-in to housekeeping to concierge, everyone I encountered was beyond pleasant and extremely helpful.  In particular, I would like to commend Jerry from the Postal Room.  He went above & beyond as Santa's helper!  I bought a Christmas gift for my son on our trip, but was unable to squeeze it into my suitcase.  Jerry came up to our floor & retrieved the box from the hallway where I had hidden it from my son.    When I went to the lobby to meet him to arrange payment and provide my shipping details, we realized the package might not make it to Texas before Christmas morning.  Jerry personally walked it to the UPS store right then on a Saturday evening to get it in UPS's hands in time so that I could return to the hotel room where my young son was waiting alone.  Jerry was an absolute lifesaver in helping make Christmas morning magical for my son!  It is rare to encounter employees who are willing to go above & beyond to assist customers in such an extraordinary way.

title: Thanks
text:
The best service I got from the concierge Ani Bedrossiam , she was extremely helpful and sorted a major issue I had , and got out of her way to help . This is what I call outstanding service 
This is alone convinced me to rate the hotel that High thanks Ani so much

title: Buisness Trip Experience after staying at Westin week before
text:
Pricing was horrible ...re no corporate discounts ..i was forced to attend because of a CDM Media
Other nicer hotels 40% less 
No shower......... just bathtub and shower curtain.. cleanliness was good service

title: Holidays at the Lotte NY Palace
text: For the past four years we have stayed at the Lotte before Christmas and it’s been wonderful even during covid. The NY Palace is beautiful and the staff members are all friendly & attentive, making the Lotte an excellent choice for a Manhattan getaway

title: Very Disappointing-dirty, dated, and poor service!
text: We typically stay at the Palace Hotel every year in Dec and often again in the summer. On a recent stay on Dec 1, my husband and I checked in to a corner suite in the tower.  After spending the day in the city we went back to the room to enjoy the view.  The room definitely looked dated and 'tired'.  I noticed the sofa cushions were turned the wrong way-- when I went to fix them I saw the sofa was dirty and stained (so they had just put them on the sofa with turned side ways to hide the stains. There was a large stain on the bedroom carpet, tape on the wall, a used face mask (not ours) in the corner, lamp shades were dented and crooked, floor base board were missing and had exposed wall behind them.  The next morning we realized that we had 1 bath towel.  So our $1500 suite was of no use, we couldn't sit on the sofa and enjoy the view or even take a shower with a dry towel.  We requested another room -which they accommodated (we had to move the luggage ourselves).  We asked at the desk that we be charged fro a regular room - not the suite since we could not enjoy it.  We were told the manager would call our cell phone- no call ever came.  When we checked out 4 days later the manager was still going to be calling us-- no call came and we were charged the full suite price for the stay.  The regular room was ok but nothing special at all for the price, shower curtains in the bathroom, no turn down service the entire stay (they said they were doing it and we requested it every night), light burnt out on make-up mirror, one of the power shades was inoperable. The hotel has not been kept up.  It was impossible to get a drink in the lounge-- no staff was ever working in there.  Very disappointing, this hotel had been our go to place in NYC.  I also wrote a review on the hotel survey that they sent and asked that someone contact me-- again no one did.   Clearly not customer service focused

title: Gorgeous hotel but the service is AMAZING
text: I was immediately impressed by the aesthetics of the hotel, but let's face it - there are a lot of gorgeous hotels out there. What sets this place apart is the service; it's the best I've encountered. From the moment we checked in until the door was opened for my Uber to the airport, the staff knew who we were, frequently asked my 9yo daughter about her trip, asked if we needed anything, brought her daily token gifts, etc. Ani at the concierge desk was particularly wonderful, giving my daughter hand written cards, asking after her grandfather and cousins (who had stayed there previously) and sending her home with a Christmas ornament for our tree. The bellmen are also particularly friendly and knowledgeable about the area. The rooms are nice and the cathedral room view will knock your socks off. Overall an excellent place to stay, a fantastic location and exceptional treatment of families. I look forward to returning!

title: Magical experience
text:
We booked the Lotte with Kleinfeld hotel blocks for our elopement ceremony. We had 10 guests with us and couldn't be happier with our stay. From the minute we entered the lobby we were overcome with Christmas decorations which was absolutely fantastic!! I was a little disappointed that the Christmas tree in the courtyard wasn't there, but I understand the safety concern while that area is being renovated. The service was exceptional, I never encountered a staff member without a smile or willing to help. Clara was fantastic and made a point to come and greet us whenever she had a chance. She also personally brought things to our rooms that we requested. The bellman Henri was extremely helpful. Ahmad (spelling) went out of his way as well to say hello and have conversations like we were family! My mother fell in Central Park and when I asked for an Ice pack be sent to her room, they were there within minutes! The day of our ceremony as I was getting dressed an eyelet broke and at the same time Bibi popped her head in to ask about cleaning the room. We asked if she had a sewing kit on her cart, which she did and she even sewed it back on while I was still standing in the dress!! I can't begin to tell you what a relief that was! She was a lifesaver at that moment, and I will never forget that gesture! 

I think my only complaint about our whole experience was the elevators, only 3 of the 6 worked and were quite full ALL the time. We waited 20 minutes or so just to get in it and then they would stop on every floor on the way down. We were almost late to our ceremony because of the elevators. 

Overall, what an amazing, magical stay that will always warm my heart! We will not hesitate to go back!

title: 2 star hotel with 5 star price
text: Have never been in 5 star hotel with shower curtains. Holiday inn bathroom. Usually stay in towers. At least 30 days this year alone (with all covid restrictions). Hotel could not accommodate me this trip. Switched me to suite in main building. Still significantly expensive. Bath rooms were the holiday inn type. Could have stayed at any hotel nearby for less than half the price for same accommodation

title: Classic and comfortable
text: We stayed in the tower and the view was spectacular.  If the weather had be bad, I would have been happy to stay in my room all weekend.  We were lucky to have good weather and the loacation was close to everything we wanted to see and do.

title: Not quite ready for the season
text: They don’t seem to be quite ready for full occupancy.  It is beautiful.   Our room and view was amazing.   Only 2 working elevators are a challenge. Wait times were a little ridiculous.  Only one bar open and doesn’t open until 5.  And if you don’t have a reservation… we’ll hang it up.   No restaurants open.  And lastly no mini bar.  The staff is super professional and hospitable. Given all the challenges they have to deal with they are top notch and very kind.  Bellmen are the best!

title: A great 3 star hotel
text:
I rarely write reviews. But this time I have to.

I travel mostly at 5 star hotels around the world. So take my word for this review.

I booked the hotel for 5 nights, as I was attending with my wife a congress in NY.
I will tell you the good part of the hotel: location is great. People working there were respectful, helpful and willing to help. Except one Asian lady at concierge or reception, that actually didn't give a f... about our small requests (some glasses in the room, beside the plastic ones, a kettle as I needed hot water for a medicine I take).
That is where good things end.

The bad side:
- room looks like crap. Old dirty floors, since the days Al Calpine was a regular customer
- nothing in the minibar. Actually it was sealed so you can not use it even if you need to cool something.
- if you want products in your minibar, there's a 35$ charge
- in 2021 you have to pay 16$ a day for internet? How miserable can you be as hotel and hotel manager to do that? When you pay 800$ per night. Why don't you charge extra for the elevators or for flushing the toilet?
- bathrooms look horrible. Cosmetic products are decent quality.
- breakfast is more expensive than Michellin restaurants and the bread served with Benedict eggs was old 2 days in a row (and I am talking about 175$ breakfast for 2, where we had 2 Benedict Eggs, 1 coffee, 1 tea, 1 bottle of water)
- in the room you have no glass, no forks, knives, bottle opener, a bottle of water, ZERO. Covid 19 they say. If you are an idiot, you might believe that. After checking out, we stayed at Mandarin Miami for 5 nights. We hav everything we needed in that room. Looks like in Florida Covid did not get there yet.
- gym is small and without proper equipment (again, for a 800$ per night hotel) 

Long story short, spend your money in a  different place. Maybe many years ago this was a 5 star hotel. Today, it lost at least 2 stars.

title: First and Last Stay
text: Visited this hotel on early December, choose it over other 5 stars hotels that we usually stay such as the Peninsula and Ritz. Good location but encounter a multitude of problems, that still surprise me for what it seemed a good hotel. Things such as rotten food in the minifridge upon arrival, malfunctioning AC, inconsistent service of housekeeping, dysfunctional concierge and front desk staff not responsing questions, or giving wrong answer or simple not caring to response. Hotel has 6 elevators, only 3 working everyday…lines to go up and lines to go down. A cafe store that only opens until 5 pm, a bar that closes at 11 pm, and room service only until 11 pm….dont go thristy here after 11 pm. Staff never greets you like other hotels and almost everyone has a long face there. Only nice staff are room service people or the door man….no COVID control…people without masks, empty antibacterial dispensers,  7 or 8 people in the elevadors, etc etc….feels like the hotel runs for its self….what a mistake staying here, expensive one. Beware, other better options in NYC, this hotel is not worth your money or problems it will give you.

title: Great for a weekend away!
text: I came here with my sisters for a much needed girls weekend. We chose Lotte because the rooms would accommodate us comfortably, the views were beautiful and we wanted something quieter, away from the downtown area. The hotel is large, however we were greeted quickly and were able to check in early. We mostly were in the room to get ready or sleep, so everything that we care about--quiet room and a comfortable bed, this hotel had! I did see that the in-room dining menu was pretty pricey, but you can easily go to a local market and grab wine if you need it.

title: Xmas in New York
text: For a Xmas hotel you couldn’t beat this hotel the lobby is filled with beautiful trees with a beautiful aroma of Xmas pines in the air the only negative would be breakfast is way to expensive and most hotels these days Wi-Fi is complimentary this being said still an amazing hotel to stay.

title: Good location, great staff
text:
Lotte hotel is centrally located in midtown one block from Saks. We were able to walk everywhere except when we went to Soho. Good sized rooms ( small bathrooms but it’s New York so that was expected).

The staff was exceptional, very nice! Only draw back is there is only one bar and it’s on the smaller side so difficult to grab a drink at times.

title: No safety measures; dirty carpets
text:
I stayed here last week and was actually amazed at the lack of basic safety measures any hotel should have! The bath tubs are slippery and there is no grab bar. So anyone who is not great at balancing on a slippery surface will have a great fall. They a very lovely staircase but it does not have adequate railings to hold when someone is taking the stairs unless you are looking at rolling down. 
This hotel is only for those who are not with frail heart and still has the ability to fall and rise!

title: Christmas-time at the Lotte
text: We traveled to NYC to see all the Christmas sights and to catch a couple of shows in early December. We stayed in a cathedral view skyline suite on the 32nd floor. Although the inside of the hotel was decorated beautifully, the famous courtyard Christmas tree is not up this year “due to construction”— there was no actual construction visibly taking place. At booking and check in I was told we would have a view of the Rockefeller Christmas Tree but that was not the case. We did have a great view of the Cathedral but were not high enough to see the tree. The room was clean but quite dated with stains, etc around the plumbing fixtures in the bathroom and all outlets in the room were loose causing electronics to come unplugged frequently throughout the stay. The mini-bar in our room was empty and the snack shop in the lobby closed in the early afternoon some days so it was difficult to get even a bottle of water without a hassle. The temperature controls for the room didn’t work so we left our windows open thought out the stay to get some airflow and to cool the room off. The staff was friendly and did their jobs adequately but for the price we paid to stay at the Lotte we expected a little “extra” and didn’t receive that.  A bellman snapped at us for hailing our own cab in front of the hotel while he was busy chatting with other hotel guests for several minutes and didn’t pay any attention to us being there. To top that off he gave the cab we waved down to those other guests. I received a welcome text when we arrived letting me know to text 24 hours a day if we needed anything. We requested extra pillows via text and never received a response. All in all, the location was great, the inside of the hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays, and my daughter was thrilled with their Santa mail, but I feel like I overpaid by hundreds of dollars per night considering the service and amenities that were actually available to us.

title: Best Location in Manhattan
text: Concierge Isabella is the BEST and most communicative travel advisor ever. Both Isabella and hotel manager Martin Mariano royally welcomed our family as we celebrated our 50th anniversary. Grazie Mille

title: Poor first impression
text: Arrived just after 11pm after a long flight. No water in room and mini bar empty “due to covid”. No room service menu. Room service closes at 11pm. Not a very adequate hotel at all - just glad it’s not me paying for it.

title: First visit to NYC
text:
My family and I (2 adults and 3 children ranging in ages 10-15) just stayed four nights at this hotel. None of us had ever been to NYC and I was overwhelmed with the lodging options. I struggled to find a place close to the “action” that could comfortably accommodate our family of older children. We didn’t want to book a place that would require us to have two rooms. A few options were found but I kept coming back to this one. I will say I’m a bit of a self proclaimed “hotel snob” so I tend to be rather picky. 

This hotel was located perfectly and as a first time trip to NYC we were so pleased to be so close to everything within walking distance or at least closely located to the subway. I’ve stayed in numerous hotels and this was honestly the cleanest one I’ve visited to date. I had zero concerns in this area and I could tell the housekeeping staff takes pride in their work. On that note, I’ve always stayed at places in which the housekeeping staff could be allusive after times, but the staff here were frequently nearby and very attentive to any needs we had. Each one would greet us and hold conversation each and every time we walked by. The little things do not go unnoticed.

Each staff member (front desk, bellman, housekeeping, food service, etc) was professional in every sense of the word and I have zero negative things to say about them. 

The only thing I would have liked to have seen was more lower priced meal and snack options for younger people (kids and teens) particularly for room service. There was no kid’s menu listed on the room service menu but I also didn’t inquire about it when I called so it may have been available. We only dined in the room one night and while it was rather pricey, everything was absolutely delicious. 

I’m not one to typically return to a place solely because although I often return to a location, I usually enjoy a bit of variety. However, this will likely be an exception for me when I return to NYC. I’m just not sure the Lotte could be topped!

title: Perfect location
text:
This was my third time staying at the Palace Towers and I’m sure not the last. Location could not be better; close to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Broadway, with great shopping and fine dining options within a 10 minute walk.
Special thanks to Rene and Annie, concierges, for their recommendations for restaurants.   and shows. Also want to thank Clara for her warm greetings in the lobby.

title: Excellent
text: Hotel location is excellent, service is awesome. Hotel provides you with all accessories and amenities so you can feel safe, rooms are spacious very clean, staff very friendly and happy to have guests back.

title: Wonderful Birthday celebration
text:
We had an amazing stay at the Lotte NY Palace hotel, the hotel is beautiful, with friendly staff and clean rooms.  We stayed at the Towers Corner Suite with Pantry with connecting bedroom.  The sweeping Manhattan skyline from the 45th floor was breathtaking, the suite and bedrooms were spacious and beautifully appointed.  But what made our stay extra-special was Clara who was instrumental in making our stay so enjoyable.

Our family of ten were in NYC to celebrate my 70th birthday, and even though reservation had noted the special occasion, and I was greeted at check in with birthday well wishes, however, the acknowledgement stopped there.  Clara whom we met on the second day of our 6 day stay, noted the special occasion and took the initiative and went above and beyond, attending to our every need.  When I mentioned there were no writing pads or pens in the rooms, and I needed more gift bags, she brought them up herself.  We were also celebrating my grandson’s 3rd birthday, and she had a customized chocolate cake top made.  She brought a teddy bear for him and also a crown and tiara to add to the festivity.  She was always in the lobby ready to greet us with a smile and inquire how else she could help.  When she saw my granddaughter, she brought another teddy bear just for her!  At check out she was ready to send us off with two bottles of water!  She is detailed, considerate and warm, though always professional.  Thank you Clara!  You are why we can't wait to return to the Lotte.

title: Service
text:
We booked this hotel for a VIP client and had a rough time connecting with the sales office. On the day of check-in, I was able to speak with Miles at the Front Desk who was AMAZING. He literally took care of everything we needed and even assisted with an upgrade and moving our clients things to the new room. 

He made it easy and stress free. 

The only negative note I would leave for this hotel is that Travel Agents regularly reach out to Sales to coordinate special requests / notes for the VIP clients (especially Entertainment) and it's getting harder and harder to get timely responses from Sales staff. Lot's of missed opportunities. 

Anyway, client had a great stay thanks to Miles!

title: Restful and delightful
text: The staff at the Lotte Palace truly goes above and beyond to make the guest feel welcome as is if we were visiting a second home.  Jimm Kalinka in particular is a example of stellar customer service and my wife and I would like to thank him personally and we look forward to visiting the Palace again the future.

title: Suzy Q
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my return to NYC at the perfectly located Lotte New York Palace.The staff and service are incredible. My experience started with phenomenal Jimm at reception. Always adept and gracious, Jimm ensures our stay will be wonderful by efficiently checking us in and answering all of our questions. The room service crew is great too. I thought housekeeping did a thorough job as well. I can’t wait to go back!

title: Service was remarkable!
text: The hotel is beautiful! The room is perfect as expected but what sets the Lotte apart was the service. Michael was exceptional at check in. He went above and beyond to ensure smooth checkin on arrival. Kal with concierge top notch, so kind and helpful made fabulous reservations every night at the best restaurants. Thank you Kal!

title: Wonderful Hotel & Staff
text: The Lotte Palace Hotel and it’s staff made my daughters 18th birthday trip  amazing.  The views from the rooms are spectacular and I was pleased with all the Covid precautions….I felt very safe having my family here.  Kal Naim, concierge extraordinaire, went above and beyond getting us wonderful theatre tickets, dinner reservations and generally just making us feel welcome!  Thank you, Kal.  The bellman, Henry, was also especially helpful.  A delightful weekend!

title: A Favorite Hotel in NYC!
text: I have stayed at the Lotte New York Place dozens of times and I feel at home.  The staff is excellent and the location is perfect for shopping, dining and work.  Some of the rooms do need remodeling but the beds are very comfortable and the hotel is very safe.   For a real treat, stay in the towers!

title: Once Again best hotel ever
text: I absolutely love the hotel! we stayed in a beatiful suite in the Towers. we always choose the towers because the suites are super spacious, clean and also is more exclusive. The view is also amazing. However the people here I love even more. I recommend staying at this hotel not only for the beauty but for the hospitality of the people who work there. People like Rene, Clara ( always so nice)Samir ( always helping in every way)Diego ( we are family), Olga, Ani, Kal, Becky, Natsuko and Miles ( thank you for everything). And from Pomme Palais Veronica, Arlene, and Mark are all wonderful. The hotel is super clean and everyone respects wearing masks. Couldn’t have asked for anything better. Absolutely love The Towers. We had massages at the Spa and Carah was very attentive. The hotel was super clean and followed all of covid protocols.  Thank you Becky for preparing such a nice celebration for my bday!!

title: Weekend in NY
text: Our friends invited us to join them in NY for the weekend.  They chose Lotte New York Palace, so it was our first time.  It was an elegant hotel but there was no bar nor a restaurant.  No mini bar in the room and no water bottles. Room service was limited hours and extremely expensive, I pot of coffee and 2 bagels came out to $80... The decor was dated and the mattress was lumpy.  The A/C seemed not to cool in the evening as well as during the day.

title: The Lotte New York Palace is the best!
text: I have been going to the Lotte New York Palace for over twenty years, and I would never dream staying anywhere else.  The personalized service by the concierges Diego, Ani, and Rene is exemplary.  The front desk manager, Miles, is fabulous too.  They make a beautiful hotel seem special each and every time I have been there.  We have celebrated birthdays, anniversaries, graduations, and holidays there.  My children now go with their families and cherish the wonderful memories made staying at this hotel.  It feels like home when I walk through those doors.  The newly renovated spa and workout room are so nicely done as well.  Last but least is the great location and beautiful courtyard.  We will be back!

title: BIRTHDAY OF A LIFETIME AT THE LOTTE NEW YORK PALACE HOTEL
text: Must compliment and acknowledge Patricia in Reservations and KAL at Concierge for their exemplary, dedicated efficiency in assuring my visit to The LOTTE be an extraordinary experience! You fulfilled my wildest dreams! Thank you! EILEEN

title: WONDERFUL! Maurice is AMAZING!
text: Everything was AMAZING! From the moment we stepped into the lobby to check in, Maurice saw me admiring the hotel because of my favorite show (gossip girl) and gave my boyfriend and I the full tour! He was so fun and took lots of pictures, just a great start to the weekend. The room was gorgeous with a wonderful view, and extremely clean. All the staff were pleasant. Overall great experience!

title: Wonderful Mananger
text: I stayed here in October and upon arrival, I had some trouble with my booking. Miles, the manger, was so wonderful and made the process so much easier. The hospitality outdid any hotel I’ve stated at. Will be coming back for sure.

title: Exemplary hotel
text: Stayed here for 2 nights with my teenage son on his first visit to NYC. We asked for and got a stunning view over St. Patrick's. I don't feel the need to use too many words here. It's clean and luxurious without being ridiculous. Plenty of staff. Helpful concierge. Only nitpick would be the prices of room service and cafe, but easy enough to avoid. Would stay again in a heartbeat. First-class.

title: Outstanding and Friendly Service
text: Everyone is friendly, helpful and goes out of their way to may your stay enjoyable. Great location, not far from there Theatre District, quiet and comfortable, easy walk to restaurants and the subway. Would definitely stay again.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Excellent service from the moment I checked in. Clara was amazing. Hotel is very attentive . I would highly recommend this as the place to stay in nyc. The rooms are nicely appointed . Spa and gym are excellent

title: E
text:
Wonderful to be back!! The Lotte New York Palace is the ONLY place I will stay in NYC! After being away for so long it was so nice to see Jimm, Claira, Miles and the smiling faces of everyone  at the Towers! 

Thank you all for making our short stay so perfect!
Just FYI - the rooms here are so much larger than a typical NYC room! (If you book using American Express you are entitled to extra perks that make things even better.) 
As always I enjoyed the short walk to Saks Fifth Avenue and the surrounding shops. I had coffee and bagels at the Cafe each morning and appreciated the friendly service from their staff.

The Lotte New York Palace is such a special place and Gossip Girls fans will recognize many of the amazing spots… the hotel has amazing interiors that are grande but welcoming!  Next time I can’t wait to try the new Spa!

title: A Wonderful Stay
text: I frequently travel to NYC, both for business and socially, and find the Lotte New York Palace an excellent choice.  The rooms are well-designed, spotless, and the hotel has been massively upgraded.  Service is friendly and helpful, the food is great and the location in midtown is excellent!

title: Recommended
text:
Excellent location, friendly efficient staff, clean, nicely appointed rooms, good amenities, great views from the room.
Lacking in a lounge/bar and a restaurant - apparently due to Covid.  Those additions will be welcome.

title: Excellent service and hotel
text: Stayed here in September and I cannot say enough about the service. Jim (front desk in the towers) and Matthew (bell captain) anticipated our every need and made our stay so special.  The hotel is amazing and the location is perfect for shopping, dining and sight seeing. We cannot wait to return and are already planning our stay in December.

title: Celebrating Daughter’s 21st Birthday
text: We had a great stay at the Lotte Hotel.  We were there the Oct 1st weekend and when we arrived we were greeted and the staff was very inviting and friendly. Greg checked us in and noted that we wanted adjoining room with our daughter. They accommodated our request and I was so delighted.   We had a fabulous room with a wonderful Cathedral sky line view!!  The rooms were Fabulous, clean and roomy!  We will definitely stay here again when we visit !

title: Lovely
text: 2nd visit to the Lotte Palace was better than the first.  Great location with great views of the city. We will definitely be back soon.  The took the disinfecting very seriously.  No complaints. Love the Pastiserre downstairs!

title: Thank you Lotte New York Palace
text:
Following a two year gap due to covid19 pandemic we had another most enjoyable stay in our favourate hotel in New York. We found the hotel met all our hygene requirements against covid19.
The friendly staff especially Kal Naim,Ani, Isebella and Clara at the Concierge and Front Office plus Antuanette in Housekeeping made sure we had another wonderful stay in the hotel.

title: Very Disappointing
text: We are both experienced travelers and very familiar with NYC. The Lotte Palace was a huge disappointment - the hotel is certainly not what it used to be when it was the Helmsley Palace. The rooms are very much in need of upgrading, beds and furnishings are old, and there are few amenities. They even charge for wifi! No coffee maker, no minibar, no restaurants open (except for a grab and go).

title: Nice hotel
text: My husband and I started in the towers during our recent stay in NYC. While the person who checked is in was professional he wasn't very friendly and said nothing to us, even when I tried (unsuccessfully) to make small talk. The rooms were nice with a feel of luxury (the carpet, bed and towels were great). Room service was a bit slow for simple things like drinks and a slice of cheesecake or a toothbrush. Most staff however were quite friendly, Ani in concierge recommended one of the best restaurants we dined at during our visit. The bellmen were friendly and helpful as well. Be advised that due to covid the car service is suspended, and restaurants are closed. There is a coffee shop and well appointed gift shop, as well as room service. The mini bar was empty however. This hotel was quiet, I didn't hear the usual hotel noise in the halls and location was pretty convenient to most things. Tower elevators were small, therefore sometimes we had to wait longer to find one that could take two more passengers

title: Fabulous Stay
text: Accommodations and service at the Lotte Palace makes any vacation or trip worthwhile. The helpful and professional staff, the gorgeous facilities and overall ambiance of this hotel is worthy of a 5 star rating. perfect place to host parties and or to relax for a weekend without the kids.

title: Love the Lotte NY Palace
text:
This hotel was a pleasure to stay at. The staff was magnificent, even with a number of events taking place, the staff gave us all the attention we could want.
Clara was especially accommodating, greeting us as if we were royalty, offering to take our shopping bags to the room, facilitating our check in as it was a busy time. Truly a good Customer Service story

title: The Best
text: Lotte is my favorite hotel in NYC. Sure there are a number of great places to stay in the city but few have the superior customer service one gets at Lotte. I needed a dinner reservation on short notice and asked the concierge, Ani Bedrossian, for assistance. She went out of her way to help me and secured a primo table at a great seafood restaurant. The bellmen are friendly, helpful, and know the surrounding area like the back of their hands. For me Lotte is the best.

title: Wonderful visit to NYC
text: Visited NYC to visit several art exhibits(Cezanne  drawings at MOMA) and Jasper John’s T Whitney. Wonderful location at attentive staff. Clara at the Towers was of exceptional service and help. Wonderful staff at exceptional hotel!

title: Wonderful Visit at the Palace with My Family
text: We just loved our stay at The Palace. We were there for my sister's wedding. The rooms are very spacious. The staff was very accommodating for our two year old and we felt safe and secure. John, The Bell Captain, was absolutely wonderful---made our daughter feel so delighted with a surprise gift here and there when he would see her running around the lobby. Thank you, John! We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Above and Beyond....
text:
The Palace has always been our choice in NY..
I send my Daughters and Granddaughters to NY on their 16th birthday...
The only place I know where safety, elegance, class and service are without question..But this latest experience exceeded all possible expectations with the assistance form a marvelous Concierge by the name of Ani......She went well beyond what anyone could expect to insure my Daughter and Granddaughter had a marvelous experience..
You service exemplifies a stay at the Palace..
Thanks You....

title: Birthday Celebration at the Palace
text: Favorite hotel in NYC!! I brought my daughter for her 16th birthday and the hotel was perfect - perfect location, amazing staff and decorated beautifully!  Our concierge Ani went out of her way to make sure our stay was perfect!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

title: An amazing weekend. At the towers.
text: Excellent service, amazing view at the heart of Manhattan. Our favourite hotel. Very clean and professional. Could stay there forever!!  The dinner and room service amazing. Having coffee with fresh baked croissants at the cafe of the hotel the best way to start our day !!

title: Favorite hotel
text: Favorite hotel Highly recommended. Luxury hotel. Great view. We have stayed here so many times. Convenient location. next to St Patrick's Cathedral. Very quiet location. Great housekeeping. Comfortable beds. Great service

title: One word…PROS!
text: I’ve always loved this hotel, but was concerned about staying during the 20th anniversary of 9/11. It’s a very large hotel and was nervous about the Covid protocols. Also, there is no room service or restaurants open. So, I opted for a smaller hotel, The Langham, where I thought I’d receive better service, a better room, and fewer people. The Langham was a total disappointment, but The Palace was superb! From the friendly valets who greet you at the door, everything about my experience was excellent! I wish I had stayed here instead of the Langham…when one doesn’t have to fuss around with the room, where there were very few guests in the hotel, it’s obviously an excellent location, too. My room was lovely and perfect, quiet with an amazing view. No BS, no problems, no hiccups. Just a great stay…I’ll be back!

title: The Towers was a great stay
text: The staff was all super friendly and accommodating.  The bellmen were all so nice, especially Raymond.  He remembered things I mentioned to him and made the stay more pleasant.  They treat their guests like friends and family.  The hotel was clean and so was the gym. I would defibrillator stay here again and recommend it to everyone else.

title: The Lotte Palace was our palace!
text: The 4 of us enjoyed an incredible ( 9/11 anniversary)weekend at the Lotte Palace. Our room in the Tower was well worth the price- huge, beautiful accommodations, stunning views! But it was the superb attention of every member of the Palace staff that sets the hotel apart. Kal Naim is the epitome of a first class concierge. He’s simply the best and is the main reason that I’ve stayed at the Lotte every time over the years - and tell my friends. Our bellman, George also added to our experience. The Lotte Palace is the perfect location, and is staffed with professionals who treat you like it is your palace! I can’t wait to return.

title: What A Magnificent Experience!
text: My stay at the Lotte New York Palace hotel far exceeded my expectations. I was aware beforehand of the storied history of elegance and aesthetic charm that the hotel boasted, but it was truly the personal and attentive service of the impeccable staff that stood out. I was particularly impressed and touched by CLARA, whose genuine warmth and sincere efforts to make me feel at home remained consistent throughout my stay. CLARA is definitely one of the reasons that I will be coming back to this magnificent property. She felt like an old friend who was always looking out for me :)

title: Long weekend in NYC made even better by this hotel
text:
We stayed three nights, Fri-Mon. Service was impressive. A few examples:
1.There was a mild mess-up on our breakfast order in the cafe Saturday morning. Not a big deal at all - they just gave us two breakfast croissant sandwiches and one breakfast burrito instead of the other way around as we ordered. Sunday morning we ordered the same things, and one of the managers recognized me and proactively didn't charge me for the breakfast burrito, saying "I remember the mix-up yesterday, so we won't charge you today." It was very busy at the time he did this and it was impressive for him to recognize me and remember.
2. We checked-in pretty late on a Friday night - maybe around 8:30pm. We asked the concierge where to go for a good, nice, but casual dinner. He suggested an italian place nearby, he made a phone call, and we were seated 2-3 minutes after we arrived. And they were busy.
3. I called room service Sunday late afternoon/early evening to see if I could order a couple of cocktails for my wife and I since the hotel lounge/bar was still closed from covid restrictions. Miles said room service doesn't have access to a bar to deliver drinks, but he said to give him 5-10 minutes and he'd send something up. He asked what my wife and I might want. He delivered a half-bottle of champagne and two small, pre-bottled gin martini drinks with a small bag of ice.  Thank you, Miles!

Room was very nice, clean, and quiet on the 37th floor. We had a nice view to the east and could even see parts of the East River.

Would definitely stay there next time in the city.

title: Horrible Experience!!!!
text:
DO NOT STAY at the Lotte New York Palace Hotel!!!
We checked in yesterday to find all of the restaurants closed.
No Room Service
One tiny elevator working (the other 2 were broken)
Toilet in room was not working.
Management would do nothing to address our concerns.
This place used to be very nice but has fallen into dis-repair.
I would urge you to find a different place to stay in New York.

title: Excellent Concierge Service!!!
text: I needed to buy tickets for my boss to see the Bruce Springsteen show on Broadway and I called Ani Bedrossian at the Lotte NY Palace. She was amazing!! Ani was not only professional, but she was a delight to speak with. She followed up with me multiple times to make sure we had all the details and were satisfied. My boss loved the show and his seats were excellent! I will never hesitate to use the Palace's concierge service again, and hopefully one day I will also have the opportunity to stay at the hotel.

title: Gret service experience
text: My stay in Lotte New York Palace was amazing. We were given a room with the Cathedral view (Thanks Greg!)  that allowed us to look into the city. Additionally, all the staffs were always friendly and personable especially Samir and Kal who gave us tickets to NYC's concert at Central Park.

title: Post Wedding brunch
text: If you are looking for a wedding, rehearsal, brunch, or event space, look no further.  Peter, the director of events, is phenomenal and an absolute pleasure to work with.  I got ready for my wedding and hosted a post wedding brunch open to all wedding guests at the palace.  Peter greeted my husband and I at 1 am and helped us store all of our essentials for brunch the next day.  He made everything so easy and his team set up a beautiful brunch that guests are still raving about. The front desk was also a pleasure - shout out to Miles for making my stay so wonderful.  Couldn't recommend the palace more - my husband and i are already discussing what event we would like to host there next :)

title: Worst five star hotel
text: Worst experience ever, girls getaway we had planned, and made reservations two months prior. When we got there, the room we reserved ( cathedral view) we never got. All the main elevators were broken, we had to use the service elevator. Even though there were signs next to the elevators to limit four people in the elevator at a time, however never enforced.  Sometimes there were up to eleven people crammed into the elevator. All the essential facilities were closed….No mini bars in the rooms, no working refrigerator. Bathtub was clogged, had to shut off the water 4-5 times in the middle of the shower so the water would drain.  The auto blind on the window were torn and frayed. At the time of the checkout I was charge double for valet parking. Initially a day before arriving I was told  there will be one time charge of $90. for valet parking since I will not be taking my car out again until checkout. I double checked with her, and she said it was positive. The day of checkout the valet person charged me $180.  I went back to front desk and asked what had happened, she said there was a rate change as of yesterday. The valet person told me only way to have access to my car is to pay the changed rate. Very disappointed in Lotte NY Palace, their dishonest business principles .  The front desk girl kept blaming on Covid, and said Lotte NY Palace is in still in progress? There are many other five star hotels in NYC that are operating in full capacity with better business ethics. Be aware of what Lotte NY  Palace promises and quotes over the phone.

title: Best hotel for me ever.
text: My family booked this hotel through Costco and we received a great value. The room and the service was outstanding, the best ever for me. The hotel is very convenient to mid-Manhattan, Central Park, and Rockefeller Center. Subway access is close. Our flight home was delayed a day due to weather. The manager and staff accommodated us nicely. Thank you Miles and Clara of this hotel.

title: Highly recommended
text: Clean. Excellent, Friendly Service. New York Mid-town at its Finest. The Palace sure will be our regular mid-town hotel.The comfort, the food and the service were all exceptional (thanks to Kal and the rest of the team). My friend  recommended The Palace to me. And I thank her so much. Strongly recommended for business or family travel. Summer

title: Great visit to NYC!
text: We had a wonderful weekend trip to NYC. Many parts of the city were not open yet so plan ahead. The concierge, Diego, at lotte was excellent, helped us plan sightseeing and dining options for our party of 6 and was super knowledgeable about the covid rules and options that were open.   Our room had a such a beautiful view of the cathedral.  Thank you Lotte team for a very pleasant stay!

title: Wedding Anniversary Perfection
text: Everything about our stay was absolutely  perfect ! The hotel is so classically beautiful, the location amazing, and our room overlooking St Patrick’s Cathedral was stunning. Nancy the hotel manager took care of every detail to make it perfect for our 34th wedding anniversary. Miles went out of his way to make us feel special. Ani and the concierge team arranged the perfect flowers and restaurant reservations and made our stay fabulous. All of staff are fabulous! We can’t wait to visit again.

title: Family and BFF Trip
text: Our recent stay at the Lotte New York Palace was truly amazing! Manager--Miles Gomez and Bellman--Charles Wang were instrumental in assuring our stay was unforgettable and it was just that--amazingly unforgettable. Our view of St. Patrick's Cathedral and the Manhatten skyline was just breathtaking!  We send our thanks and appreciation to Miles and Charles for their consummate customer service excellence.

title: Concierge Superstars
text: I thought perhaps arranging to have flowers sent to my wife’s room at the beginning of her Palace stay might be a nice touch but wondered aloud how to do this from across the country. I started with the concierge desk at the hotel and they literally handled everything for me - Including walking a few blocks to pick up the flower arrangement when the florist said it was too late to have it delivered. Truly exceptional service! #ImpressedAndGrateful

title: Perfectly comfortable at the heart of Manhattan
text: Staying at the Palace this summer is very special to us because last time we were here was exactly before pandemic in February 2020, and it feels so good to be back to this beautiful place now that everything is getting back to normal. Here again everything is perfectly managed, very clean and all the safety and hygiene measures are at the highest standard. Rooms are kept in an impeccable way, Pomme Palace provides very good variety of fresh daily food - sandwiches, fruit, juices, coffee, pastries - all to enjoy in the cozy lobby bar. It feels very welcoming here - a stunning place yet feeling like a home away from home due to everyone’s professional and very friendly approach. We are grateful to all staff and  in particular to our wonderful concierges Kal Naim and Mrs Maya for their friendly and efficient advice and perfect arrangement of our plans, Mrs Dalmasi and the whole team of the Mail office for keeping all our correspondence in a perfect order and timely delivery. The Palace became our first overseas destination after the reopening, and we couldn’t have chosen a better place where we felt very welcome, perfectly taken care of and safe. Thank you! We’ll be back again:)

title: Extremely bad
text: We’ve been staying ay the New York Palace since before it became a “Lotte”. It had always been a family favorite, until now. We will definitely not be coming back. To start the rooms at the towers are in desperate need of a revamp. The sheets on our pull out sofa were still dirty from previous guests. The A/C on one of our rooms wasn’t working and the answer was to put a towel or pillows on top of the vent, WHAT?? The concierge weren’t able to help us with anything, not a reservation, not information, nothing. This is a big hotel with ONE working elevator, it would be wrong during normal times, but during a pandemic it’s unacceptable. This is a hotel they should at least serve a proper breakfast. We understand that due to COVID there are a lot of restrictions, but the fact that they use that as an excuse is unacceptable. They are way understaffed, everyone is very very nice but not very helpful. Hopefully they are able to go back to the hotel they once where!

title: Maurice, The unofficial Gossip Girl Tour guide
text: We stayed at the hotel with our 16 year old daughter who loves Gossip Girl. We were taking photos of some public iconic places that were featured on the show when Maurice offered to take phots in the courtyard of our daughter. He then proceeded to take us to so many of the sites within the hotel we never would have found and regaled us with back stories of the scenes from the show. He knew the best shots for the photos and made our daughter feel so special. For the rest  of our stay, he always greeted us warmly and asked about our daily adventures. The entire staff was so gracious and helpful, but Maurice really made a lifetime impression of n our daughter and I think she's now a Place hotel patron for life!

title: Great service
text: We have stayed here the last four trips to NY and it was amazing!! The rooms are spacious and the staff is so friendly. We had an incredible housekeeper named Gladys Akwei who was exceptional with her service and her smile. I will definitely be requesting to stay on the 51st floor just so I can see her. I want to give a shout out to Raymond who went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. He greeted us with a friendly hello everyday and did everything he could to make our stay enjoyable. This hotel is definitely our new favorite place to stay!!!

title: Amazing staff
text: My wife and I got married at The Lotte Palace over the weekend and could not have dreamed of a better experience. The catering staff was outstanding. Special shout outs to Bebhinn, Kaan, and Rachel who were incredible to work with on our amazing wedding.   Truly dedicated professionals.  Even the security guards were fantastic, a very friendly guard named Maurice took my niece and her friends on a “Gossip Girl” tour of the facility.

title: Get an Exclusive Tour from Kevin!
text:
Shout out to Kevin, Kal and my friends in the Cafe! I truly felt like a Princess here. I got an amazing grand tour, with Grade A commentary from Kevin, the true knight of the Palace! (Thanks to the staff for not judging me for wandering around the soft robe that was provided.) A room issue and elevator maintenance slightly detracted from my experience. But otherwise, the staff went above and beyond in terms of service. I would definitely consider staying here again. I felt right at home. 

Picture this. Tasty morning coffee with a view of the most beautiful brides in NYC, posing along the grand staircase. What could be a better start to your day than joy?

title: Miles the assistant manager is amazing
text: Repeat guests at this hotel and stayed for a week. Even though the restaurant and in room dining is still shut, Miles went out of his way to help with any requests. Will definitely be going back again!

title: Creative solutions and braking the mold
text: Needed a thermos with hot water in my room.  Called room service they said they couldnt deliver to room ‘cause of the pandemic.  Went downstairs to pick up, they said no thermos… Frustrating….Until Miles Gomes the Asst Mgr came out and bought a thermal garaffe from their store and asked their pastry shop to fill it with hot water.  Thanks very caring staff overall

title: Incredible service
text:
I was supposed to have my wedding party in 2020 but it got postponed due to COVID to this past weekend in 2021. As early as January 2020 I had a contract signed with Lotte to book our room block, and it has been an excellent experience since. In brief:

- The rates were very competitive
- The rooms are very good
- The location is solid
- The service was incredible. I will mostly expound upon that below.

Throughout the past 1.5 years, each staff member we interacted with at the Palace treated us as though we were having our actual wedding there. A cadre of the Palace's employees ensured every detail was covered and they were all timely and friendly in responding. They adjusted our block, no questions asked. They provided a booking link. They adapted to changing circumstances. They had detailed forms for us to give them a sense of how to place wedding favors in our guests' rooms. Kaan, one of the managers, also showed us around some of the cooler rooms to take photos and elucidated some of the history of the hotel to us. He also saw to little details, finding misplaced items for us and assuring a bus we had arranged arrived in a timely fashion and was parked in an accessible place for our guests. They also brought some bar stools up to the bridal suite at 9am for a last minute request.

Other hotels and blocks we have dealt with in the past have not come close to as hospitable as the folks at the Palace.

title: Perfect NYC Experience
text: We stayed here for a girls weekend to celebrate my daughters graduation. The hotel is in a perfect location and full of NYC elegance and style. Of course we are big Gossip Girl fans so it was fun exploring some of the spots we’ve seen on the show. Rooms were very spacious and comfortable, especially for NYC. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely return (we are obsessed with NYC).

title: Great rooms, very expensive, weak service
text:
Recently, we stayed four nights at the Lotte Palace in a one bedroom suite. The room was exceptionally comfortable, and it had a fabulous view. There was plenty of living/  dressing space. Really an exceptionally nice room.

We knew that the bar in the hotel was not open, nor is any restaurant, only a breakfast/sandwich take-out place that closes at 13:00. My husband called the hotel to make sure that we would be able to obtain glasses and ice, happy to have our own happy hour in the room with the excellent view. We got the ice, but the glasses were the flimsy plastic glasses that you get in a Holiday Inn Motel. 

There are no bathrooms open on the ground floor ,and the staff do not know where to direct you. In general, we found an odd combination of competent staff and others who were either clueless or indifferent. 

Maybe it's the pandemic. At any rate, super expensive, well-located, good views, comfortable rooms. Can't vouch for bar or restaurants.

title: Mieles Gomez made my stay at The Palace the best
text:
We arrived on the hotel on May 30 , they are doing all the protocol for Covid.  Miles Gomez was extremely helpful and kind our whole stay.  all our stay he was the one that make it very special in every minimal detail. 
Our stay was wonderful we will be back very soon.
The hotel has the best location and services I can't wait when they open the dinner services to have a warm croissant  in my room 🤗.
Miles Gomez THANK YOU !

title: Best hotel in the city
text:
I  stay at Lotte New York Palace every time I visit NYC.  Up until Covid
this was at least three times a year. I was so happy to return last month after 
being away for over a year and the experience was every bit as wonderful
as pre-Covid.
As the hotel is closed except for the Towers I was treated to a Tower room overlooking
St. Patricks Cathedral on the 52nd floor for the same price a hotel Cathedral view
would have cost. Absolutely breathtaking. 
As the restaurants and bars are closed and there is no room service I was told about an Italian restaurant a few short blocks away.  Osteria del Bianco was an unexpected treat.  The food, the ambience and the service was top notch.
Miles, the hotel manager on duty at The Palace  during my stay, was welcoming, gracious and funny.  He personally escorted me to Pomme Palais in the hotel where I could find 
a close facsimile of the nuts I used to get in the bar!  They are the best!  He genuinely made me feel right at home.
Treat yourself to a stay at The Palace and hope Miles is the manager during your stay!

title: Luxurious stay as always
text: Any time and every time that we have stayed at the Palace, it has been nothing short of luxurious and wonderful! The staff is always extremely kind and treats you the absolute best. Even with COVID, everything was extremely sanitary and dependable. I did not feel the least bit unsafe with the protocols and how the staff had handled everything. Miles Gomez was outstanding for us and able to accommodate our stay in the best ways possible!! I would not stay at any other hotel in NYC after staying here. Along with Miles, Nancy and Luis also made our stay so wonderful and made us feel just at home at this mega star hotel!

title: Best Hotel in Ny!
text:
Great stay, with the best service and beautiful rooms. Anni Bedrodhan and Kal Naim at the concierge were great as well.

Even in the Covid context, the hotel staff made us feel great and assisted in organizing beautiful plans in NYC.

title: Stunning hotel, great location
text: Room was exceptional with views of the cathedral. The bars in the hotel are also great, made it easy to catch up with old friends just before  the trip was coming to an end. Cleanliness was also great.

title: A beautiful & special sightseeing tour
text:
This review is not as a hotel guest, but a visitor to the hotel while exploring sights in the city. 
My boyfriend and I were looking around the beautiful lobby on our own, when we were greeted by a staff member named Maurice who offered to chaperone us on a personal guided tour around key parts of the hotel! He walked us through several beautiful rooms, including a ballroom and a library, sharing facts with us about the hotel itself and famous Gossip Girl scenes that were shot there. He also recommended several photo spots and took pictures for us so we could remember our visit. He clearly enjoys his job, and the experience was very cool and special. Thank you, Maurice!

title: The best hotel in New York City
text:
The Lotte New York Palace is my favorite hotel in New York. I have been staying at the Palace for over 10 years.   I am a native New Yorker and know it very well.
This is my home away from home when I visit New York 3 to 4 times a year.
My favorite Reception assistant is Clara Law, she always greets you with her big smile and makes sure you have everything you need to make your stay perfect.
I was able to visit this October for 6 nights, Clare, all the Bellmen the servers at the cafe were so kind and happy to see me come back after they reopened.
Hopefully I will be able to return in April .
Marie G

title: Excellent
text:
Great hotel that makes us feel like family, starting with George at the door of the Hotel, the kindness of Alfred at the front desk and Ani who help us find directions, the lobby is so beautiful and elegant, we have been visiting this hotel every year for the las 15 years and is now a tradition. Best location . I also like the rooms.
The  staff of the hotel are  amazing 
thank you for everything, see you next year
Maria T Trapote Lopez

title: Superb hotel in perfect location
text: We celebrated a family milestone with a long weekend at the New York Palace. We purchased a package through American Express Travel and received a remarkable upgrade upon checking in: a 1000-square-foot suite on the 53rd floor, directly above the midpoint of St. Patrick’s Cathedral. I’ve worked in Manhattan for more than two decades and have rarely seen a better City view than this hotel room offered. While the restaurants and room service were shut down on account of the pandemic, Pomme Palais made a serviceable substitute. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and the service was world-class. As for the location, I do not see how it could have been better. For Christmas in Manhattan, this is the ne plus ultra.

title: Christmas Tree of Elegance and Grace- 2020
text: For all those who love Christmas decorations I am sharing my experience of visiting the New York Palace Hotel Christmas Tree.  Located on Madison Avenue between 50th and 51st Street behind Saint Patrick’s Cathedral, this tree is a short walk from the E and M trains from either the Lexington and 53rd or 5th Avenue stops.  Standing tall with its red and gold decorations and topped with a bright star, the tree is placed centrally in the courtyard allowing for socially distanced viewing and photo taking.  I was there on a Monday night and was comforted in that there were not too many viewers and plenty of options to take pictures from a safe distance.  Since shops located on Madison Avenue tend to be closed in the evening hours, the avenue was sparsely populated which also added to my own sense of comfort and safety.  I plan to make more visits to this elegant tree as often as I can.

title: Amazing staff!
text: I helped my boss plan his stay at Lotte palace this past weekend and the staff was so helpful! Ani at the concierge desk went above and beyond to help me make their stay unforgettable. My boss proposed to his girlfriend during the stay and Ani helped me arrange for a few gifts to be purchased and delivered to the room. She even went out of her way to pickup a gift that wouldn’t be delivered to the hotel! Samir the butler was also wonderful with helping arrange the gifts beautifully in the room! The staff here will go out of their way to exceed your expectations. We will be returning soon.

title: Home Away From Home
text:
This place is our home away from home whenever we visit the city, and we will never stay anywhere else. The staff has always gone above and beyond to make us feel welcome! They remember us by name and make us feel like we're part of the family. Thank you, Miles and Natsuko! 

If you're traveling with young children, we HIGHLY recommend. They treat our 1-year-old son like royalty when we visit - they always welcome him with a teddy bear and other surprises and have a crib ready for us in our room. Many of their rooms easily accommodate a crib in an area that can be closed off from the rest of the room so that Mom and Dad don't have to go to bed when baby does. 

We like to walk everywhere when we're in town, so the location of the hotel is easily walkable to most of the main attractions. If it rains, they have umbrellas for you to use in your room. Anything outside of walking distance is easy to call for an Uber or cab that will be able to meet you right outside the door.

Our most recent stay was during Christmas, and the hotel is absolutely MAGICAL! The decorations are BEAUTIFUL and they have a lot of really fun details, such as Letters to Santa. Each kiddo (or grown up!) who writes a letter to Santa will receive a personalized letter back! Straight from the North Pole! And as a special treat, you could see the Rockefeller Tree directly from our room which made our evenings overlooking the skyline extra memorable. 

Finally, the hotel and staff take every precaution necessary to make sure that the hotel is clean and sanitized and safe for all of their guests. Everyone is wearing masks and gloves, they have shields at all of the desks, there's hand sanitizer everywhere, and they go through and sanitize each room with UV lights prior to the next guest arriving. No stone left unturned. 

Could not recommend enough!

title: AMAZING!!!
text: You will not find a better experience than staying at Lotte. Everyone from the door greeters to the management staff are AMAZING. We love them like family and will be back many many more times. We especially loved George and Fran. Everyone makes us feel so welcomed every time we walk in, and when we leave for our excursions. The views and incredible. The lobby and outdoor courtyard are perfect for morning coffee or evening cocktails. It is right in the middle of anything you could want to do. Lovely walking distance or a short uber ride. I cannot recommend this place enough. We will not stay anywhere else when we visit New York. ONLY the Lotte.

title: Maurice is Amazing!
text: Maurice gave us the most wonderful tour of the Palace, Gossip Girl style of course! He is incredibly knowledgeable and professional. We feel so lucky to have been able to go on his tour. The Palace is such a beautiful place to stay. We will be back!

title: Dr Ramzi Muasher
text: I stayed at the hotel for one month today.It is a great hotel with remarkable staff that are fully aware that they are in the hospitality industry.You are as such truly treated as a special guest wih all the pfiviliges and perks.I particularly want to make a special mention of Kal and Ani the wonderful concierge staff who made a big difference to our stay with their attention and kind care of us.Professional seamless service.Ramzi

title: Intimate wedding- Perfect location for first look & bridal suite!
text:
My husband and I could not be happier with the choice to stay at Lotte NY Palace on our wedding weekend!  After being forced to cancel our destination wedding, we decided to do a small, intimate ceremony in Central Park with our immediate families.  The Lotte was the PERFECT location for our first look, and the corner suites gave us spacious & photo-friendly shared living space with powder room and kitchenette (completely secluded from a large bedroom and full bathroom).  As a bonus, we had beautiful views of St. Patrick’s Cathedral and NYC streets. 
Peter and Miles (among other staff) were an absolute pleasure to work with.  Both had excellent communication skills leading up to the big weekend and helped streamline day-of planning.  They are true professionals and both contributed immensely in our special day!  We will certainly be coming back (if even for a staycation).  We love this iconic hotel!

title: Excellent!
text: This hotel looks magnificent, dreamy and luxurious. I love every part of it. Maurice was really kind to show us the shooting locations of Gossip Girl inside the Palace Hotel. What a memorable experience!! Amazing and friendly staff. Highly recommended!!!!

title: AMAZING!!!!!!
text: My friend and I were just taking a photo outside because we were big fans of the show Gossip Girl then suddenly an employee of the hotel offered us a mini tour where specific scenes were shot. We were so surprised because we haven’t seen anyone do that and that says a lot because I actually work in the hotel industry. We weren’t guests of the hotel but Maurice treated us as such. The staff also greeted us and were all very polite and welcoming. Everything in this hotel was above and beyond and we would like to check in the next time we visit. MAURICE is superb!!! 5 STARS!

title: Fantastic Hotel with Kal's wonderful customer service
text: We came to NYC to visit our son and we stayed at the Palace hotel. The hotel is in a perfect spot in the middle of the City. We felt safe from COVID-19 due to the increased sanitation procedures and the overall cleanliness of the hotel, and we applaud management for their efforts. Kal was the best part of our stay with his amazing recommendation for restaurants and museums. He really cares about his guests enjoyment and safety. He has extra masks in case you forget one, and provides excellent customer service. I will definitely come back next time I am in NYC.

title: Very disappointed!!
text: We had stayed. before but this time we were terrible disappointed.  They could have given us a better room (in the back and in front of an air conditioner system) since the hotel was 90% empty during the pandemic.  We also expected to be less expensive to attract people to come.  Wi-fi was almost non existent, a few times the water came dirty and had to wait a lot for the hot water to come.  Service was through text and once we requested ice and took another call after waiting for more than 1/2 hour for them to respond.

title: CONCIERGE KAL AT LOTTE NY PALACE WENT ABOVE AND BEYOND!!
text: CONCIERGE KAL AT LOTTE NY PALACE WENT ABOVE AND BEYOND!! I asked Kal if there was an optometrist nearby, and he recommended his and immediately called and got me an appointment even though they were closing soon! Initially, I was debating whether or not to go and he kindly encouraged me to and I'm so glad I did!! My eye feels much better after the treatment!! Top 1% of all concierges and I've travelled a lot! he really cares about the health and welfare of his customers!

title: Lovely hotel
text: Fantastic hotel close to all in New York...Fabulous corner suite with great views of the Rivers around New York...Room service was as you expect from quality hotel and all the services were first class... Looking forward to returning

title: Misrepresentation and Poor Service
text: I booked the biggest suite available for our anniversary at Lotte New York Palace and upon arrival was told I was being put in a room 1/5th the size and would be required to pay the same price.  The room I booked was "not available".  No apology was given  by any manager we spoke to and no attempt was made to remedy the situation.  We opted not to stay here and recommend other's do the same.

title: Carnaval
text:
Hotel antigo com quartos mais velhos, nao esta reformulado, camas velhas e decoração antiga. Ficamos num quarto com vista para a St. Patrick e para a cidade.
Lojinha de café muito boa, com excelentes chas e docinhos. Hotel bem localizado.

title: Picture Perfect Christmas
text:
We visited New York for Christmas with our two children and decided to stay at the Lotte Palace. The exterior and interiors were beyond amazing, the staff were so friendly and all in all, I would say it was one of the nicest hotels I’ve ever stayed at. 
Positioned in a perfect location for shopping on 5th Avenue and only a ten minute walk to Central Park. 
We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Manhattan.

title: Trip of a lifetime!
text:
Honestly don't know where to start as it was the most magical time in New York. The entrance was breath taking, especially with all the Christmas decorations adorning the hotel. The front of house staff were nothing short of polite, courteous & welcoming. The room was huge with a beautiful ensuite bathroom. Everything was catered for and the whole stay was home from home. True comfort.
The hotel is situated perfectly to explore the city with most tourist spots within a few blocks or a short bus ride away. This was my first time on a plane & my first real holiday in 20 years - everything was absolutely perfect from start to finish.
On the last day when checking out, one of our suitcases decided to break & John (who had been looking after our bags) went above and beyond to ensure the last few moments of our time in New York were not ruined. He went out back and returned with a suitcase for us to use, completely for free, and after repacking our bags we were given a complimentary glass of champagne before being helped to our taxi. John honestly deserves a massive compliment for his hospitality, kindness & for just being a really nice guy. Can't thank him enough! (There is a blurred picture of John in the photos - top bloke!) You really couldn't pick a better hotel to stay in.

title: Ottimo in tutto ma le camere sono vecchie
text: Personale gentile e molto disponibile alcuni parlano italiano, posizione eccezionale, le camere sono pulite, letti comodi tutto quasi perfetto  uniche note dolenti che non mi fa dare il massimo delle stelle sono le lenzuola che in alcuni punti si presentavano con piccoli fori, in generale le camere e le porte sono vecchie da un hotel del genere sicuramente non ci si aspetta una mancanza del genere, resta comunque un ottimo hotel quasi perfetto.

title: Amazing!!!
text: Had such a brilliant time at the Lotte New York Palace for our honeymoon. We stayed over Christmas and it was wonderful. The staff were all so helpful & the hotel was beautiful. The room was huge & great views of Manhattan! Everything was just perfect - and the location was superb - right in the middle of Mid Town!! Can’t wait to go back. Thank you to all the staff at the Lotte New York Palace - we will be back soon!!!

title: towers are great; rooms are huge
text: first time stay in the hotel.  what a nice surprise.  it was even better than expected.  the tower are great.  the room (house?) was ridiculously expansive!  everything from champagne waiting before going out to dinner to the attentiveness at all levels were awesome.  stay here!

title: The Lotte Palace is amazing simply because of its staff!
text: We've stayed here before and it's absolutely gorgeous! The rooms have been very comfortable and cleaned every day. The staff which is always available everywhere you turn is always knowledgable and helpful. Hailing a taxi os no problem with the doormen assisting you. In particular, their Guest Experience Coordinator, Bella Estrella is a dream. She made our previous stay magical for my daughters and when we booked our stay for this past February I made sure to contact her again! I HIGHLY recommend to anyone staying at the Palace to get in touch with her asap to plan their perfect vacation.

title: Local Perfeito e localização maravilhosa.
text: Hotel 5 estrelas, acomodação perfeita, atendimento de acordo, localização estratégica, arquitetura maravilhosa, ambiente corporativo e familiar ao mesmo tempo, ótima opção para passeios em família e lazer.

title: devine
text: I had the best room ever on the 33rd floor facing Saint Patricks for 4 nights starting March 11. I was welcomed by George at the entry and already felt pampered. I attended a wonderful show at Feinsteins with Andy Cohen and John Hill. And then Covid-19. It took away my reservations for Chicago and Diana. My daughters who live in the city, said we were flying home to Fort Lauderdale March 12 at 8:30 pm. I left my beautiful room unattended and went home without seeing the shows or eating at all the restaurants we had made dinner plans for. But my biggest regret is that I didn't tip every single person who works there. This is a beautiful family of devoted and loving people. I wish you all well and can't wait to make another week long reservation and leave lots of generous tips.

title: NYC Visit
text: the service provided by all staff members was outstanding -- unfortunately our trip was cut short due to the corvid-19 pandemic and Lotte management and staff were extremely helpful in adjusting our plans

title: A great place to stay
text:
We had a super stay from start to finish.
All the staff are superb & go out of there way to help you.
Also our room was upgraded to a cathedral view.
The ambience & character of the hotel is first class.
Overall a wonderful stay.

title: A Wonderful Weekend Before.........
text:
Stayed at the Palace the first weekend in March.  A really great hotel in all aspects.  Will definitely stay there again.
The personnel was always helpful and available.  Had an unfortunate event with a taxi driver and the personnel came rushing out to help.  Very grateful for that.

title: Fantastic trip!  Fantastic Hotel!
text: Company Presidents Club Trip with 16 of us.  Loved hotel, location, & staff.  Second time to stay at the Lotte Palace Hotel and will stay again.  Hotel never disappoints!   Trouble’s Trust has a nice atmosphere and drinks as well.

title: Great Location
text:
Comfortable hotel and very helpful staff. Superb location overlooking St Patrick's Cathedral and 5th Avenue. Very nice coffee shop downstairs with lovely treats and coffee. However there were no USB sockets in either of our two rooms which is not acceptable in any hotel anymore and the cost of breakfast for 2 adults and 2 children in Villard was truly shocking and only really struck me at check out.

I would like to complement the hotel on having well placed hand sanitation around the ground floor area which was reassuring at this difficult time.

title: Food Allergies
text:
