This is an excellent hotel. The surroundings are magnificent, always clean and tidy. However if you have a food allergy beware1
I am coeliac and was only offered a salad or maybe some pasta fro an in room dining experience. Surely a chef would be able to rustle up a meal for me that was gluten free. Very disappointed.

title: Amazing stay, even better customer service
text: I've been staying at the Palace for years, but this trip was particularly special. The Hotel Manager Miles greeted me during check in and offered me a complimentary upgrade. He was GREAT! All the staff were very friendly and greet you with a smile. The hotel is such a staple for a true vintage NY experience and I would recommend it to anyone!

title: Amazing, Fantastic service and great room and amenities
text:
Great room and great service extremely clean, fabulous amenities
Easy check-in and check out process. Perfect location
The staff at the New York Palace is so nice, friendly and accomodating. The housekeeping service is very helpful as well as the front door staff and concierge.

title: Fabulous Rooms ,Incredible views
text:
This was our second visit to Lotte Palace.
When we booked our airfare,Lotte Palace was on the top of our list. 
We were in a room with cathedral views, this time on the 27th floor.
To say it was magnificent and I believe gives  you the real New York experience  would be an understatement
The room was huge. Plenty of room to roam around and really enjoy the view.With the Corona virus scare, we looked forward to spending time in our home away from home.
The only negative is not being able to make coffee in the morning without it being charged for a coffee maker  ($20 a day)as an amenity. It would make it so much more special. Also their Room Service charges and food is off the charts.
The staff could not be nicer. 
All in all it's really a wonderful place to stay.

title: Excellent experience
text: I have been staying in this hotel the last trips I have been there, and my family and I love it! I do not imagine myself going to another hotel. we love the people that work there and the views are incredible.

title: excellent location and service at Lotte New York Palace
text: We traveled to NYC with another couple for a 5 day break in March 2020.  The check-in lady selected rooms with views facing St Patrick's Cathedral and The Rockefeller Tower, and so we have fantastic views over this part of the city (thank you).  The rooms were very large., well appointed and clean.  The location is excellent for central NYC.  We walked to the Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park,  Times Square, and the Highline (which is a little bit further way).  We also walked to the 9/11 Memorial but it was a stroll!.  Take the open top bus tour (upper and lower NYC), see the Brooklyn Bridge and lower Manhattan  from 1 World Observatory and see NYC at night from Rockerfeller Tower.  9/11 Memorial very sad but a must visit, The USS Intrepid is good if you like military kit.  Boat trip on the Hudson River  really good way to see the Statue of Liberty and NYC from the river (boat guide funny and knowledgeable but "Americans bigger better faster, taller" etc. - to be expected)  Eat in deli's rather than chain restaurants - food is great there, Virgils restaurant: excellent food and service, Superb city, fantastic hotel, will come back, will eat more food, will visit museums (missed them all!)

title: NYC Trip
text: We were met at the door by courteous helpful door persons!  Check in was smooth, friendly & quick.  We had 1 breakfast in the hotel that was satisfactory & attended a cocktail reception that was very nice. Our only disappointment was the housecleaning team.  Cleanliness was fair, but replacement of glasses & some other minor details were over looked.

title: Lottie palace hotel
text:
My two disappointments with this hotel were:-
Bar too dark
Breakfast and service disappointing eg bacon over cooked / friend was asked if water was required, yes was the response, water never arrived! Expensive for what was supplied, limited options, no refills of juice or coffee!

title: Fantastic hotel
text: The Lotte Hotel was an amazing experience. All staff were super helpful and very courteous. The concierge desk was very informative and gave great recommendations for which restaurants to try. The rooms and the entire hotel was very clean. Felt very safe and comfortable. The location was just right for our needs of entertainment and shopping. Overall was a pleasure.

title: Beautiful NYC Hotel
text: Fantastic three night stay at this beautiful hotel, so lovely I didn’t want to leave! First impressions take your breath away when you walk through the door as this is such a stunning building, the rooms are very comfortable with the most comfortable beds ever but breakfast   in the ‘Gold Room’ is definitely worth getting up for!! Fantastic staff in all areas of the hotel too 🙂 Definitely the best place to stay in NYC!!

title: Mooi hotel, prima ligging, karig duur ontbijt
text:
Het hotel was mooi en luxe, de ligging handig. Maar ontbijt erg karig en niet inclusief.
Wij hebben na 1 x ontbijten afgezien van het restaurant. Voor 45 dollar p.p. kregen we gebakken ei, gebakken aardappelen, glaasje jus, gloeiend hete slappe koffie en 2 halve toastjes + jam e.d. Extra brood werd extra in rekening gebracht. Dat zijn wij in luxe hotels toch wel anders gewend. En iedereen wil overal een fooi voor.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
We visited New York for the first time and were lucky to stay in this hotel. Our view overlooked St Patrick's cathedral and the NY 
skyline, stunning. The hotel is located in a great area, easy to get to various iconic sites.
The hotel is sumptuous, so comfortable, beautiful rooms. The beds and pillows are so comfortable, everywhere sparkling clean. The staff were efficient, helpful and really friendly. I would thoroughly recommend this top class hotel if you want a luxurious stay in the Big Apple.

title: Excellent service!
text: Loved, loved, loved this hotel - the room was perfect as was the service!  Looking forward to my next stay here!  I highly recommend the Villard Room for breakfast!  I appreciated all the extra help from the front desk!!

title: Mid-town at its Finest
text: Elegant feel. Excellent, Friendly Service. New York Mid-town at its Finest. Will make The Palace my regular mid-town hotel. The ambiance, the comfort, the food and the service were all exceptional. My wife and daughter recommended The Palace to me. And I thank them. Strongly recommended for business or family travel. M

title: Great location.  Great Bones.  Good Experience
text:
I was in NY unexpectedly, and tried the Lotte Palace.  I had stayed at the Palace Towers many times, until I thought it got a bit pricey, but had not stayed in the 'main' hotel.

The public spaces are just plain gorgeous, my standard room large and well lit, the bed and high thread count sheets no less than amazing.  The rebranded Gold Room, where breakfast is served, might be the prettiest room in New York.  It makes it a little less painful to have yogurt, fresh fruit and an English muffin for only $56.

The gym is large with top notch equipment and great lighting, complete with a picture window view of St. Patrick's Cathedral from the treadmills.

A niggling complaint -- I was not provided bottled water in my room, forcing me to the minibar's $9.00 bottle.  A little cheesy for a luxury hotel and otherwise 1st rate experience.

title: "Not worth it"
text: The Palace is just at the perfect location to stay in NYC but it does not offer the luxury it's charged for . So, I was staying there 2nd Feb through 7th Feb and there was constant drill machine noise in the adjacent room . Even after complaining several times the hotel staff just obliged my complaint by waiving off the room service which was a petty 50$ against the room tariff I paid for which was 500$ .  I mean what is that !! I was really excited about my stay here but it ended up being a disaster . I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND EVERYONE TO CONSIDER OTHER HOTELS IF YOU WANT TO SPEND SO MUCH MONEY BECAUSE THIS HOTEL IS JUST NOT WORTH IT !!!

title: Great experience - quick sightseeing trip to NYC
text: LOVED our room! Traveling with a friend so we had requested two beds -the room was generously sized, there were two luggage racks, and a large closet with plenty of hangers. Our view from the 29th floor looked out over St Patricks, and was quite lovely. The room was quiet, the temperature comfortable. The lights have some sophisticated controls, but once you get the hang of it, it is quite handy. The concierge was very nice, giving us some good suggestions for dinner, and the doormen  were very helpful in deciding how to get to different places.. My ONLY complaint was the bathroom - the toilet was quite low, which is no fun for old knees. Oh, and a coffeepot would have been a nice touch. Yes, they have a very nice coffee shop downstairs, but I like my first cup before I dress!

title: Girls Weekend
text: We stayed in the Premium Corner Suite - the room was so spacious and comfortable.  I wish the shower was a standing shower and not a bathtub, however it was very clean and overall nice.  The staff was very accommodating, providing us a mini-fridge upon request.  Hotel Staff always greeted us upon our return and was there to help get a taxi when we were leaving.  Will definitely be staying here again.

title: The service was incredible!
text: My friends and I were in town for the Westminster dog show and we stayed on the 17th floor, Jacqui Calderon was in charge of our rooms and let me tell you, she was fantastic!! She went above and beyond to make our stay so special and memorable! The hotel is also very beautiful and our room was spacious and nice but Jacqui made our trip.

title: A Return to the New York Palace Makes for an Incredible Weekend
text:
Everything at this hotel is beautiful and immaculate.  My mom stayed here years ago and she would rave about how amazing the service is and how wonderful the stay was made by the hotel staff.  Returning years late, our stay was nothing short of magical.  The employees of the Lotte New York Palace, including the Assistant Front Office Manager Miles Gomez as well as Michael Frick and Peter Lowery, were so nice and accommodating.   All of our needs were addressed during our stay at this property with a view and we cannot wait to stay here again some day soon.

Our only suggestion would be to upgrade the paper goods in the bathroom.  Otherwise, everything was luxurious.

title: Lotte New York Palace
text: Fantastic hotel in a brilliant location for visiting many if the tourist attractions. Staff were all very friendly and helpful and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. I would recommend staying at this hotel

title: Too expensive for what was offered
text:
Based on high price and poor service, better value at other hotels in NYC.  
Food was good but extremely expensive. Room had numerous problems such as one bulb burned out and one lamp had no bulb. Wall had holes. On check in, service was gruff and inaccurate. Do not recommend.

title: Fabulous palace hotel in Manhattan
text: From the moment I entered until I left I felt that this was a special place that truly justified its 5 star reviews on Trip-advisor. It’s a five star hotel in Manhattan ideally placed 500 yards from 5th Avenue and just behind St Patrick’s Cathedral. I felt special throughput starting with an upgrade of my room because of a wait to find my reservation continuing with the concierge and the doormen. I didn’t use the bars, restaurants or the gym but was very impressed with the facilities. The rooms are luxurious and fairly spacious for Manhattan with a bath and a shower. The WiFi works well.

title: Amazing property!
text: We had the best vacation in New York City staying at the Lotte Palace! The rooms were spacious and clean and the view of the cathedral was very beautiful! We look forward to coming back to stay very soon!

title: NYC Valentine's Day 2020
text: Great service, room, and location. Great value. Friendly bartenders. Loved Pomme. Concierge very helpful. Great recommendation for Italian restaurant. Will recommend to others and stay again. Thank you! See you again soon.

title: Hotel bem localizado e confortável
text: Recomendo esse hotel. Excelentes quartos, com bom espaço, cama muito confortável é ótima localização. Muito perto do melhor trecho da Quinta Avenida. Bom serviço e luxuoso. Possui saídas para 3 ruas distintas, o que no inverno é muito conveniente.

title: Excellent location and service
text: We stayed for my daughter’s 16th birthday. Even before we arrived the hotel staff was so helpful! I emailed to get ideas on what to do while we were there and to see if they could do something special for her birthday. They sent a ton of great ideas and had balloons and a cake waiting for her. Great location too - walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller center, and shops.

title: winter weekend
text: Fantastic hotel.  Historic building, great location, high quality rooms, incredible views.  Service was friendly.  Will stay here again in the future.  With a discounted rate the room was well worth the experience.  Highly recommend.

title: Poor customer service.
text: Not pleased. My wife slipped and fell in the tub on the last morning of our stay.  Thankfully she was ok, just bruised but overall ok. I informed the staff when checking out. No one offered to go to the room and check the tub. No one offer a discount t it free night,s credit.

title: 50th Birthday celebration
text: A wonderful hotel in a superb location. The staff were extremely welcoming  and helpful. I don't believe there would be a better view from a bedroom window in the whole of NYC. The only problem was our toilet flooded on day 2 of our stay meaning we had to pack up all our clothes and move ourselves to another room and the 30 minute check in at 1am on arrival seemed a bit long bearing in mind there was no one else checking in at this time of the day.

title: Nos volvemos a ver !!
text:
El hotel está situado en un lugar privilegiado. A destacar su personal, su atención, la amplitud de las habitaciones, y una relación calidad- precio muy buena.
Las habitaciones orientadas a Madison Ave. tienen unas vistas privilegiadas: San Patricio, Rokefeller Center, .... Hasta los luminosos del Radio City !!
Muy bueno el Tartar de atún del Gold Room Bar.; y el Rarities.... para disfrutar de una copa de cognac, o un buen whisky.

title: Hotel review
text: Everything was terrific other than the athletic center. The athletic center needs to be completed and TV’s on the machines should work. I also think bottles of water should be offered to guests while working out.

title: Beautiful and wonderful stay. Highly recommended.
text:
From booking to arrival perfect.  Lovely reception and taken you our room. Wow did I say wow ?   Beautiful and what a view .  Great staff and doormen lovely and so helpful x 
Nothing too much for anyone .   Our room we booked cathedral view and it was wow . Clean room. Bathroom dated but hey ho ! .  Great bars. And snacks.   Coffee was $10 a cup for bed ouch .   
  I do find staff so nice once you order they don’t care as they getting a tip anyway . Most of nyc the same . 

Would recommend this hotel to anyone.  Pure class . 

Room service excellent .  Would definitely return .

title: Amazing stay
text: We stayed here 2/6-2/9. We were visiting for fashion week and celebrating my daughters sweet 16. Upon checkin, the front desk attendant asked if we were in town for anything special and I mentioned it was my daughters birthday. He upgraded our room and gave my daughter a box of chocolates. He was so kind and really made her day. Our room was beautiful and clean. I just stayed here in December and this becoming my go to hotel when in the city. Our only minor issue was I called down to have mini bar restocked twice but it was never restocked but it was no big deal there were plenty of choices or room service available. Thank you Lotte NY palace for another wonderful stay!!!

title: Half Term in NYC
text:
Fabulous is almost every way.

Having been a reasonably regular visitor to NYC on business this was the first trip as a family. The city was perfect- kind weather, great food, lots to do and experience but the cream on the cake was this hotel. Perfect location, really helpful staff and, courtesy of the Pomme Palais, marvellous breakfasts.

Two niggles that others have touched on- lack of free WiFi  and the fact if you want a kettle for your room the hotel will essentially rent you one. After three decades travelling the world, being lucky to stay in very nice hotels, the kettle wheeze was new to me. Strange penny pinching when the hotel provided a courtesy car to take the four of us to our Broadway show on our last night!

This hotel has the “wow” factor backed up really friendly staff. I have no doubt my kids will remember the Palace as a highlight of their first NYC trip. Can be expensive but well worth it. 

TIP- the Duke Eatery is on Park Avenue, just around the corner from the Palace with bottled water 1/3 of the price of that in your room with fantastic and affordable sushi and other take away to keep costs down.

title: Excellent
text: Wonderful service, friendly staff, especially Bibi Rahim our housekeeper, Kasja for organising the balloons and cake for our daughters 18th, breakfast was amazing in the Gold room, New York a wonderful experience and coming back in the evenings to the comfortable bed was a godsend

title: Perfect for Wedding Blocks/Work with Dan Nelson!
text:
The Lotte Palace is simply a gem in the heart of New York City.  My daughter and I worked with Dan Nelson on getting her Wedding Block, as most of our guests would be attending from out of state.  
Dan gave us a tour of every type of room, and view available, and even had to do it 2 separate times!! The Cathedral View is our favorite!  He had our reservation Block ready fast, and great instructions for the guests on how to reserve.  Dan made the link work straight from their wedding site, making it easy for our guests.  He keeps up with the reservations and updates us as to who has booked a room.  He has also handled every special request we have had regarding rooms with views, getting family suites for those traveling and needing cribs, etc.  Dan has helped me personally with reservations when i traveled to NYC for advance wedding planning.  
The Lotte Palace is iconic, the rooms are spacious, staff is efficient and friendly.  I have stayed at Lotte Palace about 6 times in the last year.  
It's great for any NYC visit.  
If you are planning a wedding in NYC, I highly recommend Dan Nelson as your Group Room Block Manager at the Lotte New York Palace, he is the best!

title: 10 Stars⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text: This is our second time staying at the Lotte New York Palace and it is now my favorite place to stay. Everyone is so accommodating and helpful and the rooms are immaculate with comfortable beds and pillows. Miles, the manager, was very kind as we got stuck at a wedding dress shop and he relieved our stress when I had to call back a second time to extend our check-out time.  Very grateful for his kindness—Much appreciated!

title: Stay
text: My stay was wonderful the staff was great as far as the bell men and front desk the only thing was the concierge was a smart ass but that was towards the end of the trip the hotel was in walking distance from everything we wanted to see!

title: Always a GREAT stay
text: We love staying at the Palace - everyone really go out of their way to help and make sure your needs are met, even though it was a busy weekend!  When we arrived to check in on Friday (2/14), the line was long but staff were there mingling with guests, handing out water and apologizing for the slight delay.  Check in process was quick and we went to our room to be surprised with a personal note of well wishes for our recent anniversary (25!) as well as a plate of macarons!  Later in the early evening a bottle of bubbly was also delivered to our room. The room in itself was a tad older than others I've been in the past but it is meticulously clean and well kept.  The bed was very comfy - I had such a good night sleep.  Upon check out, Danielle was kind enough to ask how I was feeling.  It is great to see how she used the information on hand (she saw my giftshop charge for tylenol) to make her guest engagement personal.  She even offered me some water to take in case I get a case of headache again.  Staff like her truly make a difference.  Thank you!

title: Great stay!
text: Room was extremely comfortable. The restaurants are also good, just pricey. Definitely will comeback. All staff were extremely helpful & pleasant.  Loved our view, lucked out with free parking on Park Ave., was a  win  stay!!

title: Best place to stay in NYC!
text: We go to NYC each year and always stay somewhere new. But we will ALWAYS be staying at the Palace from now on!! Excellent staff and accommodations!! Daniel at the front desk went above and beyond for us. We love the Palace!

title: Excellent
text: This was our second time at this hotel.  We were not disappointed.  Great location, great room and great view.  Everyone was very friendly and accommodating.  The rooms are generous in size and well appointed.  The bed was comfortable and the linens were nice.  We will be back again.

title: Classic hotel in great location
text: Spacious room in a traditional hotel. Midtown location is superb with taxis, buses and subway readily accessible. Across from St Patrick’s and Sak’s and a block away from Rockefeller Center and Radio City. Plenty of restaurants, coffee shops and convenience stores within very short walking distance as well as within the hotel . Services and cleanliness of hotel are excellent. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: A beautiful old style hotel . Greeted by George our welcome couldn’t have been warmer . Staff all friendly , polite & helpful . Room comfortable , spacious , clean & warm . My only criticism would be it had no restaurant to dine at night although room service was excellent just not quite as nice as eating in a restaurant

title: Midtown elegance
text: You feel special just walking through the lobby level. Great location within easy walking distance of many attractions. Large quiet rooms with comfortable beds and pillows. This property has become a favorite.

title: Always enjoy my stay here but...
text: Third time staying at the Lotte NY Palace. Can’t beat the location and room size. Only issue is the room heating system is very loud making it difficult to sleep. Also, on my second night my room was not cleaned (no I didn’t leave the do not disturb on). Despite these two points I’d still return.

title: Incredible Visit to NYC
text:
Just returned from a Girl's Getaway with my two adult daughters at the Lotte New York Palace.  We booked a car service through the hotel to pick us up at the airport and for our shopping excursion the next day! Prompt, courteous, and friendly!
Greeted, luggage whisked away and early check-in - all complete! Corner Family Suite on the 20th floor with breathtaking views of St Patrick's Cathedral, Madison Ave, and city lights!!! Rooms were perfect, cleanned, and stocked. Everyone was so helpful, making sure we were all good. Room service on our last night was delicious and prompt, accompanied by flowers for our table! Perfection!!
This hotel is one of the best and I thank you for making our trip so special and for the memories we will share forever!

title: Excellent Excellent One of the best
text:
We stayed here as a couple from 7th to the 11th February on 27th floor.

Booked the room directly with the hotel via email and staff were very helpful with advice etc in advance of our stay.
On arrival at hotel met by a porter who took our bags and also left them in our room.

The hotel is where you want to be which is in walking distance every of everyone of the Mahon attractions and the hotel itself is very clean and very Hugh end.
Views from room were unreal and hard to get better anywhere.

Can’t say much more but thank you to all the staff in particular Brian Becker.

Well done to everyone.

title: Brown Water, Rude and Unhelpful Staff
text:
After reading all the reviews of the Palace I thought it would be a great place to stay with my family. I booked through Amex Hotel Collection. Usually they do a good job. The entrance was beautiful. However at check-in the woman was a little rude, forgot to give me a key and other little things that I just let go. Supposedly we got an upgrade. It was obvious the room was not properly cleaned (dirty napkins and towels near the wet bar and on the desk). This was a bad first impression. We had plans though and needed to hit the town. 

The next morning upon turning on the bathroom shower/tub faucets the water was brown. This was really disturbing considering the price and the star rating at this hotel. I went downstairs and was not greeted by anyone but went to talk to one of the check-in people. Unfortunately I got Olga who told me that there was nothing she could do and to run the water for 20 minutes. She was quite rude, abreughinf her shoulders. I was shocked. I said I had already run the water and this was a nice hotel and I expected clean water to bathe. Gross. She rolled her eyes and said she could talk to her manager. Ten minutes later she said she would send an engineer. (Just how I want to spend my morning in a “nice” hotel). The guy came up, complained, said everything was fixed and left. This has taken an hour by now. I turned on the water. It was still brown. Dirty as can be. I called back. Still no apology from staff. They will send the guy back. He hasn’t shown up ten-15 minutes later. I called back and finally got a manager (third time asking). I was polite until this point. She said we could move rooms. TWO HOURS LATER. So we packed up and had to move. The repair guy showed up as we were leaving and made some rude comments while yelling in front of my child asking why he had to be there. It was a bit ridiculous. The only helpful person was the bellhop who helped us move. The manager offered us a $50 credit not to be applied to our bill of the room but for the bar. Really? That is a slap in the face. Nothing was comped, no one cared, the entire staff was rude and apathetic. Why wasn’t the first solution to move us rather than have your guests wait for your dirtiness to be cleaned up? My time is valuable and not only was the Palace a bad experience it was amplified by the poor and rude staff and the lack of doing anything about it. This was disgusting. I’m also disappointed in Amex. I expect more from their collection.  

Spacious rooms. The rest was a bad experience. Stay elsewhere.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: Our cathedral view room was outstanding.  Best view in the city!  Amazing breakfast in Villard also!  I highly recommend eating there.  The service was outstanding as well.  So many things to do and see within a short walk.

title: Luxury stay in the heart of New York City
text:
This is a luxury hotel with free upgrade to a room on the 28 floor with amazing view of St Patrick Cathedral and New York Skyline.
The location is excellent in the center of Midtown Manhattan with lots of restaurant and shops around.
Luxury in New York at it Best.
If i return to New York, it will be my first choice hotel for sure.

title: A quality hotel with an amazing view!
text:
This was our first stay at The Lotte Palace but we now won't stay anywhere else!
The skyline room had an astounding view, one of the finest in the whole of Manhattan.
All the staff were friendly and welcoming and the bars served quality cocktails and beers.

title: Beautiful hotel with extraordinary location
text: Immaculate beautiful hotel but it’s greatest selling point is that it is centrally located to so many great things in NYC. Walk to Radio City, Grand Central, MOMA....We had a standard room and it was  spacious and very clean. High end hotel. The food and drink there was extremely expensive although I am sure it was very good. It’s easy to dine elsewhere in the area.

title: Lotte NY Palace, Perfect in Every Way
text: Aside from the gorgeous accommodations including HUGE rooms, plush robes and slippers, perfect location, and glorious views, the outstanding staff made our stay absolutely perfect.  Every team member had a smile, a can do attitude, and stood ready to fulfill every need.  The fitness center was an added plus as was the little takeaway cafe with reasonably priced items to grab and go.  This was our third stay at the Lotte and each time was perfect.  This Lotte NY Palace is the only hotel we will ever stay at again in NYC.

title: THE BEST!!!!
text: Just want to say manager MILES GOMEZ took care of my family during a very difficult time. Made my stay at this beautiful hotel even more special.   I can't wait to go back.   The hotel is exquisite and the rooms are very big and clean.  Loved every minute.

title: Amazing stay at a great Hotel!
text: Normally don’t write reviews but created an account here just because I think this hotel really is something extra. I have been staying at a lot of NYC hotels and was amazed by the service this hotel provides.  So hoping more people will have the opportunity to stay at the Lotte New York Palace.  Already  after stepping out from my taxi i got greeted well. Did my check in by a lovely lady (Rebecca V.) who got me the most incredible room with a Cathedral view. The way she greeted me, really made me feel welcome!  The hotel has a very nice lobby area and grand staircase. Feels like its from a movie. Rooms were great and service were amazing! The beds are among the best I ever tried. The hotel has a great Location! Will definitley stay here again!

title: Overlooked gem
text: Great business location. Nice amenities. While decor is a bit dated, it's always spotlessly clean. Outstanding service by attentive staff in every area. Breakfast is pricey with $100 for two not unusual. Probably a bit overlooked due to lack of brand recognition, but a clean, well-located hotel with outstanding staff is ideal for a business traveler.

title: James Klawitter - desk manager
text: My family and I had plans to come to New York and stay at the Lotte New York Palace this past weekend. My husband booked the reservation and by accident booked a non refundable room. Unfortunately, the room that he booked was not able to accommodate all 4 of us. James the manager was able to accommodate us and he took care of us in such a nice way. I just want to say that I would definitely return just because of him!!! He made our stay so much comfortable and just want to say thank you again for everything!!!

title: Great experience
text: For 8 years now we get away for 3-4 days on the week of Thanksgiving. We combine shopping along with trying out new Italian Restaurants in the city. In the hospitality business for 30 plus years my self, when my wife and I are happy with a hotel we rarely change. Lotte Palace always does an amazing job offering a luxurious ambience, very professional staff and breathtaking view from the rooms, each room has its own character and feel. Among the staff we always appreciate the service of Rebecca V. at the front desk. Helpful, very polite and always makes us feel like returning to our second home.

title: Birthday getaway
text: We checked in on wife’s birthday and they immediately upgraded our room, without us even mentioning the occasion. The clerked simply noticed my wife’s birthday from her Id. The entire staff was fantastic! Friendly bartenders and waitstaff. Front desk and doormen were very accommodating. Room was spacious and spotless. Great location for Broadway shows. We will definitely be back next year. Maybe sooner for my birthday!

title: Very poor quality-price ratio: avoid it
text: I went to the Lotte for a week of conference. The room rate was at $299 per night, excluding taxes and breakfast. Quite expensive but, well, that’s a « palace » after all. In fact, beyond the name, the location, the lobby and the prices, it is more a 3- or 4-star hotel than a palace. The bedrooms are definitively not of the palace standard; I have been several times to palaces, but the bedrooms were way nicer and more comfortable. I live in France and, obviously, I woke up at 3am on the first day. First reflex: preparing a coffee before checking e-mails, but... there was no coffee machine in the room! I complained at the reception, and was told that palaces had no more coffee machines in bedrooms (which is wrong of course). The problem is that their breakfast room and coffee shop don’t open before 6:30. I find it shocking for an hotel with international customers, who are jetlagged. Their breakfast room is wonderful but the bill was even greater. There is no buffet. Coffee at $8, orange juice at the same price... I went there with a group of 8 and was charged $570, ie $70 per person on average. The most interesting story is the fridge in the bedroom. If you purchase drinks or fruits outside the hotel and put them inside the fridge, you get charged $35, even if you don’t consume anything in the fridge. On top of that, the staff is not friendly, not smiling. In short, I don’t recommend this hotel at all.

title: Beautiful Iconic
text: Lotte Palace is such a beautiful place to stay.  The location cannot be beat, walking distance to so many sites, Central Park and 5th Ave shopping. Wonderful friendly front desk and staff.  We will be back.

title: rating
text: the hotel was quite good, the only thing that bother us was that one day we wanted to have lunch at the hotel, and they told us that we had to go out, and we had already packed all the coats .  we had to unpack and get everything out and then pack again

title: OVERALL RATING
text: the hotel is very well located in mid town. fast check in and check out. very good breakfast in a very nice restaurant. Good coffee shop. The room has fantastic views over Saint Patrick church having very good size. Additionally, thanks to the concierge I got tickets to attend to Broadway

title: Nice size room and excellent service
text:
For New York, this is a very large room.  The concierge was fantastic and arranged for a private stylist to come to the room before an event.  

The coffee service in the lobby is a quick place for a morning snack and the line moves quickly.   

At Christmas the decorations are spectacular and the lobby is bustling.  I can’t wait to go back!

title: The Lotte Palace at Christmastime in NYC...perfection.
text: I stayed with my family for three days at this beautiful hotel to take in NYC the week before Christmas.  What a wonderful stay. The rooms were perfect, the added activities for children in the lobby area, and the helpfulness of everyone at the hotel made our stay magical. Special thanks to out maid service with Jackie on the 17th floor (my kids really know how to make a mess sometimes).  I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants their family to have a real "NYC Experience."  We will be back, hopefully in the late Spring.

title: Beware Construction
text:
I’ve stayed at the New York Palace many times. First, let me say, compliments to the front desk staff here - my checkin with Stacy was awesome. When there was overnight construction outside my room, she arranged a switch and an upgrade. I was so grateful after a long day of travel. 

The rooms on the Tower side are notably nicer than the Palace side.  They are more spacious and have a bit more tech and just feel cleaner in general. I would say this is a four and a half star hotel room. 

So why Two stars? Because there is a lot of construction in and around the hotel and it affects whole floors, and there is nothing the hotel can do about it because it’s an outside company contracted to do the work.  Also, the spa is under renovation until May, and the small lobby lounge was full, and the restaurants are closed. So, basically, if you need a place to rest or work during the afternoon, you’re SOOL.

If you’re considering staying at the Palace, I would highly recommend getting a sense of whether there is going to be construction during your stay. Otherwise, you’re going to be stuck just wandering around the lobby trying to find an open seat to sit in.

title: SOLID EXPERIENCE
text:
I would highly recommend Lotte New York Palace, I only stay at 5 star Hotels and this was one of the best. Clean, well appointed and a very professional staff.
I will return to this hotel in the future and I look forward to that.

title: Very good hotel, excellent location
text: I had stayed at this hotel before. This time, I found the room was whiter and better illuminated. The bed is really comfortable, location is excellent, and people at the reception are very kind. Overall, a very good option for a short stay in NY.

title: Lage super, Hotel altbacken, Personal unfreundlich
text:
Wir waren Ende Januar 2020 für insgesamt 4 Nächte im Lotte New York Palace. Die Lage ist echt super. Alles andere ist eher unterdurchschnittlich. 
WLAN nur gegen Aufpreis. 
Meine Jeans wurde am 2. Tag aus dem Hotelzimmer gestohlen. Könnte aber auch ein Versehen der Putzfrau gewesen sein. Wir müssten einen Zettel ausfüllen und man hat uns nach mehrmaligem Nachfragen versprochen die Angelegenheit schnell zu klären. Heute, eine Woche danach, warte ich vergeblich auf einen Anruf. Das ist eine echte Sauerei finde ich. Wir würden bei unserem nächsten New York Besuch definitiv in ein anderes Hotel gehen.

title: Beautiful place to stay for Christmas season
text: The decorations inside and outside were amazing.  The room was standard, nothing to be excited about.  The coffee and pastry place near the lobby was way too overpriced.  The hotel was in a great location, near everything.  Ask for a room with a view, ours was looking at what looked like a giant air conditioning unit.

title: Room Size & View - PERFECTION
text: The rooms were incredibly large for NYC. I had more than enough room in my standard king. The only thing missing was a coffee maker! Bring your own! But the coffee in the lobby was delicious and worth the wait each morning. I was very impressed by the concierge. As an avid gym goer, it is exactly what someone like me needs. Great equipment, free weights, smith machine and functional training equipment.

title: Great Place for a Group Event Booking
text: I needed a block of rooms for my daughter's bat mitzvah. The team here was excellent. They had everything in order, helped deliver gift bags, were generous with their allowing of photos, and were just professional and very nice all the way through!

title: Fabulous stay in a room with a view
text: We stayed for 5 nights in a corner room on the 37th floor.  The views were stunning and the sunrises were beautiful.  Very good service and all round extremely comfortable and pleasant stay.  Delicious hot chocolate and cookies in our room one night, wheeled in on a white linen trolley table.  Proper New York stay.  Brilliant location.  The bed was delicious.  We would definitely like to stay here again next time we visit.

title: Fabulous hotel
text:
Great staff! 
Beyond professional
Great location 
Beautiful hotel 
So convenient to public transportation
Fun people watching 
Great bar 
Wonderful lounge right near their coffee shop 

A special treat to spend time here!!!

title: Excellent birthday vacation
text: This hotel is in a fabulous location in the heart of Manhattan. One side overlooks St Patrick’s cathedral and whether by day or night it’s beautiful.  The welcome was very traditional with a warm friendly greeting by the hotels door staff. The check in at reception was very quick and we were assisted to our room along with baggage by one of the hotel porters.  The room was very spacious and we overlooked the cathedral up on the 27th floor which was amazing outlook.  The bathroom was great with a bath and powerful shower.  Everywhere was clean and fresh. The only thing we could comment on was not to have tea/ coffee making facilities in our room which was surprising for a 5 star hotel.  Maybe this is normal in New York?  We had cocktails in the Gold Room bar which was an amazing place.  The cocktails were good too although at $22 per drink was pricey even compared to London prices.  All the staff in the hotel were great, nothing too much trouble and always there to make sure you had the most pleasurable stay. Some might say the decor is a little old fashioned but we loved it. A fabulous building, great location, pleasant staff and definitely worth a visit even if you don’t stay there is is open to the public to take a look inside and perhaps go to one of the many bars.

title: Annual mother/daughter trip
text:
Every year my mother and I take a 10 day - 2 week trip to a city in the US, oftentimes changing hotels 3-4x. For this trip I actually flew out 5 days early to spend time with my daughter who wanted to do NYC with me prior to a work trip in NJ the following week. My normal 10 day trip was now 15 days and I was a little nervous...how would I feel about being “stuck” in the same hotel for more than 2 weeks. 

Let me just say this, if you’re going to be “stuck” in a hotel in NYC the Lotte is where you want to be!! It’s gorgeous. The location is fantastic. The amenities are first class. The property is simply a gem and I can’t say enough about it. That said, there are beautiful properties in great locations with outstanding amenities all over NYC. What really made the Lotte stand out was the staff. The bellmen, the desk clerks, bartenders, room service attendants...they were all wonderful, simply wonderful. There was one person in particular, however that deserves a very, very special mention and that was our housekeeper, Jacqui. Jacqui is special. She is kind and caring, attentive beyond words and has the heart of an angel. My 15 day trip turned into 3 weeks when I got sick towed the end of my 2nd week. 

After a trip to a local urgent care I was advised to avoid flying for at least 4-5 days. Jacqui made a point to stop in before she began her shift, after she finished her shift and of course during her shift she was there to clean the room for us each day. She went above and beyond the call of duty, ensuring I had everything I needed and if she couldn’t be there she sent a colleague to check in on me. There’s nothing worse than being sick away from home but quite honestly, I felt so well taken care of that as much as I wanted to get home I actually hated to leave when the time came to go. As I said, the entire staff was AMAZING (the manager even extended the special rate I had secured when I booked the trip 9 months prior when I got stuck those extra 5 days), but Jacqui is one of a kind. When you book your room at the Lotte, ask for a room oh the 17th floor - this is Jacqui’s floor - and maybe even ask to be taken care of by her specifically. I can assure you she will make your stay at the Lotte even more special than it will be already. If nothing else, ask to meet her. She should truly be the hotel’s ambassador - she would be PERFECT for the job 😊

Enjoy your stay at the Lotte and be sure to grab breakfast at Ess-a-Bagel on Third Ave. Prepare to wait in line but boy oh boy is it going to be worth the wait!! Best bagels in the city!

title: Excellent stay
text: Excellent hotel in a great location with a view overlooking St PatricksCathederal.  Help was extremely efficient and the pastry shop, although crowded, was very efficient in handling the breakfast crowd.  Room service was timely .  We willdefinately stay here again on our next trip to NYC>

title: Not as good as it should be.
text: This hotel is in a great location but always seems to disappoint. The rooms are old fashioned - you still take a shower standing in the tub. The lighting is poor - you eat breakfast in the dark, making it hard to read papers. They still charge for the Wi-Fi which is a disgrace and the cost exceeds $15 per day.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: Amazing property great location friendly staff and spacious bedrooms with amazing views. During our stay we were lucky enough to have a private brunch in the Jewel suite which was truly amazing! Would recommend this hotel to friends and clients as truly a lovely property.

title: First class hotel
text: I cannot overstate what a perfect stay we had at the Lotte Palace Hotel. The staff is exceptional and made every effort to accommodate us with a refund when we had to cancel, on the day of arrival, our first night due to weather. Nancy Liang and Manny were most welcoming and provided outstanding service - their kindness and understanding will not be forgotten. We had a beautiful spacious room and bathroom - lovely decor throughout the hotel. Enjoyed a delicious meal at the Villard and loved our hot chocolates and sweets at the Pomme Palais. Perfect location for getting around the city. The Palace is a real gem, and I would rate it more than 5 stars if permitted. We truly felt like valued guests - we will be back!

title: Great stay for girls weekend!!
text: Stayed here over MLK weekend with a couple of girlfriends and we had the absolute best time! This hotel is where they shot the show "Gossip Girl" and if you find Maurice at the hotel, he'll be sure to show you around the iconic spots on the hotel grounds. He made our stay so special and was the sweetest! Location of hotel was perfect, quick walk to times square, Empire State, Rockefeller, Bryant park, and the plaza hotel/Central Park. Would definitely stay again!

title: FABULOUS!
text: The hotel was gorgeous, my room overlooked St. Patrick's Cathedral and was VERY large, the service was outstanding, and every part of the experience was perfection!  We will return for sure!  The breakfast (included in my room rate) was delicious and plentiful.  I have no criticism.

title: Love the Lotte!
text: This hotel is a perfect destination for us each January.  Located at Madison and 50th, the hotel is within walking distance to the theaters, just two blocks from the Lexington subway station at 51st, and right next to St. Patrick's Cathedral and St. Bart's Episcopal.  The room is always topnotch, as is the service and I'm able to get a great rate by booking airfare and hotel together.  Our favorite NY stay!

title: Birthday weekend
text: From the first moment we walked in we felt like we were treated like royalty!! Norma at the front desk was a beyond pleasure! Our room had a magnificent view of St Patrick’s Cathedral corner suite amazing !!

title: Lotte Palace
text: Great location, great service...New York Prices. Lovely hotel, great staff, terrific location and the price you would expect (High). Nice place to stay on a business trip, shopping, restaurants, Grand Central all walking distance.

title: Excellent
text:
Excellent Hotel
In a perfect location,friendly and helpful staff, large well equipped rooms.  We had stunning view over St Patrick’s Church and beyond.
Good bars very lively early bar.
Historical with a modern feel,
Highly recombined

title: Amazing as always
text: This iconic hotel will never disappoint you. Nice, elegant, fancy, comfortable. Havent used the gym so cant asses. Everything else worked perfect. Good service. Nice clean rooms.  Location is excelent if you need to stay in midtown

title: A FA blous Weekend
text: Outstanding hotel.  Incredible service and attention to detail.  The rooms are spacious for New York City.  I highly recommend this hotel.  The midtown location is convenient to everything.  I would stay here again for sure!

title: All 5* except charging for WiFi. So 2010!
text:
Great location on Madison between 50th and 51st streets. Friendly staff throughout especially the concierge and porterage teams. 
Lovely room with amazing views over St Patrick’s Cathedral. Comfortable bed and lovely linen. 
But why do you charge $15.99 per day (plus taxes I bet) for WiFi? It seems so 2010 to do so. I have never encounter charging for WiFi in recent years.

title: A hotel you can grow into
text:
didn't expect to say this about a hotel, but over the years I grew into the hotel. Another way to sum up my impression is that it's an excellent hotel to bring your parents with but not your hipster siblings. 

The hotel doesn't try to follow the trend and marches to its own beat, and it may come off as backward/inconvenient especially if you are accustomed to tech amenities from other hotel. But if you don't care about modern convenience and care about basics that were no longer basics (large room, intuitive control panel, staffs with personal touch) then I think you may find this hotel a keeper. I'm not necessarily saying this to dismiss other hotels (nothing wrong with having a TV that connects to netflix).   It's just that this hotel appeals to different crowd. Now that I am married with a child of our own, I started to see the attraction in Lotte Palace that I didn't see before and I will definitely come back to this hotel.. more than ever. 

Having said that, I will outline some bad/good things so you can make more informed decisions. 

Bad:
location- not the best locations if you are seeking good restaurant scene
technology- as i said above, one of the oldest TVs I've seen around lately. 
cleanliness- not that the room was dirty but some amenities weren't replaced from the prior stay
shower robe- only had one robe even though it appears I should've had two

Good:
space- one of the larger rooms in NYC even at the lowest category
service- most staffs were very professional and willing to help without being asked. 
lack of technology- how liberating life without smart TV can often be!
simplicity- not many buttons in control panel by night stand but have everything essential. My parents would love this
hot water- I don't know why but newer hotels often have lukewarm water. not this one
gym- one of the best gyms I've been in terms of the view. 
guests- another pro for my parents. My overall impression of the guests was that they are fairly classy folks
cost-I think they appear more expensive than they really were

title: Amazing romantic weekend
text: I could not be more pleased with my recent weekend at the Lotte. The hotel and the rooms are simply beautiful - we had a larger suite with a sitting area and a great view. Because it was an anniversary weekend I had several special requests for the spa, concierge, food service staff. They managed my requests beautifully and made sure the weekend was everything I hoped. Look forward to going back!

title: Solid across the board
text: I hadn't stayed at the NY Palace for about 5 years and I had forgotten how convenient the location was and that they offer good sized rooms at a reasonable price. Staff were friendly and I will definitely be back soon.

title: Great Hotel!
text: I was very pleased with my recent stay at the Lotte New York Palace. The view from the 39th floor overlooking St. Patrick Cathedral is amazing. Will definitely make a return trip to this hotel on my next visit to NYC.

title: Great value
text:
Great hotel, tremendous location and terrific winter rates. 

Whatever issues there may have been regarding check-in problems have been completely resolved.  (See December reviews) No issues.  Staff was very helpful and attentive.  

Highly recommend

title: Value for money/best location
text: I always choose Lotte when I visit NYC. I get the best prices comparing to the rest hotels of its category, spacious rooms and great service 24 hours a day. In addition the location is great, walking distance from Broadway area, shopping area and Central Park.

title: Lovely hotel in a great location
text: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Lotte Palace Hotel. We were blessed with unexpectedly beautiful January weather and the proximity of the hotel to restaurants, Times Square, and shopping was fantastic. Everyone from the check-in staff, to the housekeeping staff, and especially the bell desk and the concierge were really great - friendly, helpful and so polite. The rooms were enormous by New York City standards, and were very clean and nicely furnished. My only tiny complaint is that there is a very old-fashioned lighting system in each of the rooms that I found difficult to use and clearly out of date.

title: Lotte New York palace
text:
Had a great stay last week, we were lucky enough when we checked In to be upgraded to a cathedral view room which had an amazing view .
We had 2 Rooms they were both a great size and spotlessly clean 
All the staff we spoke to were really helpful.

title: Home away from Home !!!!
text:
Our Family has enjoyed another memorable stay at Lotte New York Palace. We always anticipate our stay with great excitement and some sorrow when it is time to leave, yet always storing up more wonderful memories of our home away from home in NYC. The accommodations are always EXTREMELY clean and comfortable and the staff are kind, friendly and proud to provide our every request. The location is ideal and we very rarely need to travel very far from the property wherever our plans have taken us over the years. We are looking forward to returning very soon!
The Scardino Family

title: Lived up to my expectations.
text: So it’s the Lotte New York Palace and you expect it to be good and it was. We stayed in a Cathedral View Room which was nicely spaced for a couple on a short stay. It takes my personal award for Best Pillows and bed of my whole 3& 1/2 week trip as I am short and can’t stand those huge neck cracking pillows, plus the sheets were lovely and soft. 🏆🤗

title: 3rd time at the Lotte New York- I keep coming back
text: My 3rd time at the Lotte New York palace and I just can't believe how amazing the room, the service and the location is. Do not think twice about it. And if you are as lucky as I am you'll have cathedral views to wake up to too. It's  best NYC hotel in my book so I let everyone know.

title: Un palace digne de ce nom
text: Nous avons passé une semaine dans cet hôtel pour le nouvel an.Tout était parfait,la chambre avec vue sur la cathédrale,les petits déjeuners au prix d’un palace mais vous pouvez aller acheter de quoi se faire un petit déjeuner continental à Pomme plaisir qui se trouve au rez-de-chaussée.Le personnel est poli et accueillant,rien à redire.

title: You make it easy to travel with children
text: As a traveling family, the New York Palace continues to set the standard for traveling with children.  You are courteous, understanding and patient.  We love the staff and the hotel.  We will certainly be back and can't wait to stay with you once again.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: We have stayed at the Lotte Palace several times. The location is perfect and the customer service is amazing. The rooms are big and well decorated. I would highly recommend this hotel. We love it here!!!

title: Midtown Hotel
text: The location was close to the places we want to visit. Conveniently close to the train station. Great value for location and size of room. The hotel has four bars inside. We tried the gold room and they have good cocktails. We saw the gym but was not able to use it due to lack of time.

title: Amazing - Elegant - Sophisticated - Welcoming. Wonderful.
text: NYC is lush, rich, multicultural, musical,. Staying at the Lotte NY Palace is an experience entirely harmonious with the spirit of the city. I recommend to everyone who does not know the hotel that can enjoy this wonderful experience. Enjoy NYC with what the city has most sophisticated and elegant

title: Business Trip
text:
Room was lovely - view of the cathedral was appreciated. Close to our office and subway stations so quite convenient.  Work out facility was adequate but staff was very helpful.
Work station desk was fine but chairs not really designed for working at a desk and computer.

title: First rate
text: Beautiful hotel : have stayed there for many years with my parents . My fiancé and I stayed there after getting engaged. It is walking distance to everything. Great service , wonderful large room. Perfect place to stay. Everyone very friendly and helpful

title: The place to stay in NYC
text: If you want to stay at a hotel with spacious rooms, a friendly, helpful and excellent staff who pays attention to every detail of your stay with a management team that is first rate, then the Lotte New York Palace is your kind of place.

title: A Christmas We Will Always Remember!
text: We first visited this hotel in September 2015 and have always wanted to return.  We decided to visit New York for a family Christmas to experience the amazing atmosphere we have heard about and we were not disappointed.  Our stay at the hotel was every bit as memorable as the first time.  The fantastic location, beautiful building, extra comfortable room, with fantastic views of Manhatton make this hotel special, and then the Christmas trees and decorations added to the wonderful experience.  The coffee shop in the lobby is great and there is so many restaurants close by to chose from, and also it is not far to walk to Central Park/Times Square and Broadway.  All the staff are wonderful, special mention to Nancy and Mary who kept our room spotless and always greeted us warmly.  All the doormen are helpful and friendly.  Peter on reception is a real asset to the hotel, he went out of his way to ensure we enjoyed our stay.  Highly recommend this hotel and I do hope we can return once again for another magical stay.

title: Absolutely Fabulous!
text: I will look forward to booking with the Palace again, especially at Christmas time. We went for New Years and stayed 3 nights. The staff at reception are so lovely and kind. We arrived early and received a phone call very quickly that our room was ready. Stunning view of St. Patrick's Cathedral from our room. Plush and comfortable beds. Exceptionally clean room. A kind gentleman gave my older daughters their own private Gossip Girl tour which absolutely made their trip! The Gold Room is spectacular. So swanky with craft cocktails. My husband and I explored the historic library inside the Palace while visiting the Gold Room which was really special. Location is central and close to Rockefeller Center and Times Square. The Lotte Palace is THE PLACE to stay when visiting New York. I would highly recommend the Palace to everyone.

title: Palace for a Princess.
text:
I’m a frequent traveler, especially to NYC. 
This trip was to celebrate my daughter’s birthday. She lives and works in the city so I wanted to select a hotel that would feel like a vacation. We have stayed in many hotels in NYC but this was absolutely incredible from start to finish. My daughter felt like a Princess and I would highly recommend The Palace for any event. 
The service was impeccable, the ambiance was royal, and the food was delicious.

title: The only palace in New York is The New York Palace
text: I have reviewed this hotel in the past, and my opinion has not changed. I just left after 5 nights, and returning for 8 nights next month.  This is the best of the best of Upper East Side hotels in New York City... after 20+ years at the Waldorf Astoria, we are happy to call this wonderful destination our home away from home.

title: Wonderful hotel in great location
text: I am a discriminating world traveler who values service, cleanliness, and beautiful surroundings inside and out at a hotel. This hotel had it all---the architecture is stunning, the decor modern and pleasing to the eye, the bellman/doorman/concierge/ and check in were all very pleasant and helpful, the room was spotless, well-maintained, and had a lovely bath. Our beds and pillows were so nice we did not want to rise until absolutely necessary. We only dined once at the Gold room which had nice small plates and was a great place for cocktails---again, lovely stained glass and gorgeous gilt high ceilings enhanced the space. And you can't beat the location which is perfect for Uptown jaunts/shopping on a relatively quiet street. I would return again and again.

title: Great overall experience
text: Great price to value. Unbeatable location - short walking distance to all major NYC attractions. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean spacious room with an awesome view. Lobby/staircase is where you'd want to pose for great photos.

title: Ms. Simmons
text: Peter was absolutely fantastic. I called prior to our visit about some concerns and he was incredibly helpful both then and upon arrival. His friendly demeanor truly made the trip for us in such an upscale environment, and we felt comfortable approaching him with any concerns we had with the hotel. The property is beautiful and centrally located, could not have asked for a better or more personally tailored experience.

title: Old world elegance in NYC
text: I've lived and stayed in NYC for many years.  This was the first time I've stayed at the Palace.  The building is beautiful and the room was very well appointed.  The restaurant breakfast menu was great, much better than the standard buffet (they do not have a breakfast buffet).  The only disappointment was they do not serve dinner.  I arrived late and wanted to eat at the restaurant.  I had to walk next door for dinner, which was okay but that restaurant was big and noisy.

title: Winter NYC visit
text: Nice place to stay in NYC. great location. Wonderful and helpful concierge. Quiet. All you need for a great winter getaway. Easy walk to the theatre district , and to Central Park. Really nice exercise facility. Bar downstairs is awesome.

title: Excellent
text: We were there last week and we really liked it, its an amazing Hotel. Everyone, especially the manager Mr Miles Gomez, is really kind and you just get the support no matter what you need. The Lotte Palace NY left us a really good impression, therefor we would like to recommend it to everyone who plans on visiting NYC.

title: Stunning hotel
text: Absolutely beautiful hotel with a stunning outdoor Christmas display. Such a beautiful tree and beautiful wreaths. Right across the street from the St Patrick’s Cathedral as well. Interior of the hotel was just as beautiful, although I never took any photos of the interior.

title: Quality
text:
This is a stunning hotel in a fabulous location.  Our room was clean, spacious and tastefully decorated.
The staff were friendly, helpful and attentive and accommodated all our needs.
This was the holiday period and the decorations in and around the hotel were outstanding.
The addition of coffee/tea making facilities in our room along with a small refrigerator would have been perfect.
I would certainly stay here again.

title: Great Find
text: I recently traveled to NYC for a meeting in the Rockefeller Center area.  I found the Lotte Hotel online and decided to give it a try.  Now, I can't wait to go back!  It was great.  The room was so comfortable and the views of Rockefeller Center were great (it's just two blocks away).  The location was so convenient.  The food was great and the hotel bars and restaurants have a warm and cozy, yet sophisticated feel.  Everyone I came in contact with was wonderfully accommodating and the price was a great value for the quality.  We will absolutely be staying there again on our next visit!

title: Fantastic Experience!
text: Being a huge gossip girl fan my mom planned  a trip for her my sister and I, I couldn’t have dreamed of a better stay. The staff was fantastic we were treated so well. Our gossip girl tour was phenomenal and definitely  a highlight of our trip. Maurice and Bella really did everything to ensure we had the best experience! I can’t wait to go back!

title: Overall good
text:
Large hotel, rooms are big for NYC, location excellent, is how it is described no disappointments here a big busy hotel that runs fairly well. 
Villard restaurant is lovely but very very expensive even on NYC prices, careful of them filling up your orange juice glass without you asking at $8 a pop bit cheeky.

title: Best wedding and experience ever!
text: I got married here one month ago and it was the best weekend of our lives! On top of the hotel being stunningly beautiful, every single person from the catering and events department, to the room block and concierge departments, were extremely helpful and accommodating, especially Megan, Elaina, Kristen and Dan, who we worked very closely with. They made sure every request we had was seamlessly taken care of, every question we had answered, and every problem we had solved! I could not say more amazing things about them! They made me feel like a princess by upgrading me to an amazing triplex suite that I had for the entire weekend (including the Sunday after the wedding!) and my husband and I really enjoyed staying there the day after our wedding. They made the entire  wedding planning process so relaxed and calm and I could not have appreciated that more! I will never ever forget the most amazing customer service I experienced from the most amazing weekend of our lives! We truly felt like royalty! If you are thinking about having your wedding here, or just staying here for vacation or just a night, DO IT!!! You will not regret it one bit! I truly wish I could relive everything! ❤️❤️❤️

title: Great Stay!
text:
Great hotel with nice rooms.  Overall, this was a great stay and the Palace remains one of my top 5 preferred mid town hotels.  The location cannot be beat and overall, the employees are very helpful.
One negative is the check in process.  The reception looked like we were going on a carnival cruise when we arrived (long lines and long waits).  I would suggest to the hotel that they figure out this situation as it is really frustrating to arriving customers.

But again, overall a great stay and we will most likely return.

title: Disappointed about service But beautiful Hotel!
text:
We spent a week @ this location from Dec 29, 2019 to January 4,2020. Lets start with the Hotel. The Hotel it is a beautiful property. Decorated beautiful for the holidays. The decor is beautiful and the location very close to everything. 5th. Avenue is about one block away and easy to walk everywhere. Close to the subways station and to Central Park. The rooms ave perfect size and they are kept clean. Now, lets talk about the problems we encountered. 
Not coffee maker in the rooms. If I wanted a Coffee maker, a one time fee of $30.00 dollars will be charge to our room plus $15.00 per day to service the coffee. I had never heard such a thing charging for a coffee maker. second problem was my room was not clean Dec 31th. I had to call twice to Housekeeping to report the problem. Finally the housekeeper showed up and was a bit rude because she had to clean the room. I realized many of the rooms in our floor were not clean that day. Guests were upset and waiting for the housekeeper to ask what is going on. third problem, may room was  charged $121.00 dollars for a breakfast we never had. My husband requested to see the receipt signed and it was someone else on the bill not us. They suppose to credit and issue a refund to our credit card, which still showing as pending. . I wish I can give you 5 starts because it is a beautiful Hotel. However, I fell that duke to so many issues encountered I had to rate this hotel and give 4 stars for the issues encountered. I wish they can include Coffee makers in the room and not charge the guests that ridiculous fee.

title: Not was it used to be
text:
I know december is a busy month in NYC but this hotel was one of the worst stays we have had in the last years.  

We have stayed there a couple times before some years ago and my husband and I decided to stay there for our 9 night break pre christmas.  

We arrived early and had to wait some hours before going to the room,  check in quickly and told us they would call as soon as the room was ready (we didnt expect or request an earlt check in), they never called or texted.

We got to our room 3915 and there were some initial issues that should have been addressed before we arrived like lights not working in the bathroom, bad drain in the shower and only 2 pillows for a king bed.

Called Guest services and took ages to answer plus ages to come and check.  Asked for some pillows and a guy came with the pillows under his arm (not the mos hygienc way to deliver).

We asked the hotel before hand about receiving packages and they told us they dont charge and to address them to the hotel with the name of the guest.  

Some packages were taken up to the room but we noticed some where missing but thought they would be delivered later.  After that a never ending sequence of issues started :

1. We booked the hotel through our travel agency who is a Virtuoso agency.  So we told them we were not impressed at all with the service of the hotel and how bad was the maintenance of the room and little pillows.  The breakfast in the dining room took an eternity to be served too and everytime we called guest services for anything or room service, either they didnt answer or the service was really slow.  The following day there were 6 additional pillows (a bit too much that we thought it was like “you complain about not many pillows ...well, there you are...have lots of pillows”.  Didnt like that but there was also a bottle of wine with an apology of Mr Renee who is the front desk manager.  Nice touch but, to be honest, we dont drink and didnt want any gift, we just wanted a good service.  

2. The delivery of packages was veerrryyy slow.  Some took more than 24 hours to be delivered and some never arrived.  I made a list and asked the lady in the mail counter.  She was not really nice but I left her with the tracking numbers of packages that were delivered even 10 days before.  She made some excuses like the guy who signed didnt work in the hotel, so I left her.  

Aprox 45 minutes after we heard a knock on the door and a guy (whose name I can remember now .... something like Kwaen) entered the room with 4 or 5 packages and threw them on the floor.  He was furious and started complaining to my husband and me how bad we placed our orders...he was out of control, left the boxes and left the room complaining about us.  I went to the front desk and asked for the manager who, after some tries of the lady in front desk to avoid calling, appeared.  A very nice Mr Gomez listened carefully and very professionally to all my comments.  The amazing thing is that while I was talking to him in the lobby the impertinent guy who threw the boxes on us some minutes ago showed and tried to interrupt the conversation I was having to Mr Gomez.  He knew I was complaining about him and was trying to avoid that.  I didnt allow him to talk and demand him to go.  Mr Gomez assured me he was goint to look over our several issues and I left content.

Before arriving in the hotel we asked how to address to packages and the answer was to the hotel and the name of the guest.  Apparently the labels are not big enough sometimes so the name isnt printed so we understood those things happen but the way it was handled by Joan in the mail desk and this guy who threw the boxes was totally un profesional and VERY RUDE.  

3. To avoid the eternal waiting in the dining room we decided to have breakfast in the room.  TERRIBLE wait the 1st morning because we called when we woke up so after that we ordered with the order hanging in the door the previous night.  They arrived on time but the order was never right.  Either things came incomplete, wrong or cold.  The worst was when I ordered pancakes, I was about to eat them and then realised they didnt leave cutlery so I called and asked for cutlery...30 minutes and nobody showed.  Called back again and told them it was too late and my food was cold so I wanted the order to go back and to be cancelled.  They said yes.  After 10 minutes the waiter arrived with the cutlery, told him we didnt want it and he got angry !! This never ended.  Called to ask for ice (no ice machines) and they took more than 1 hour !!! The worst service 

4.  Very busy everything.  There is not a moment of peace in the hotel.  I know it was pre christmas but staying in a hotel that you have to wait for everything is exhausting.  Wait for somebody to answer the phone, for breakfast, for room service, for someone in front desk, for a drink in the bar, for everything.  Too much.

5. There was another bottle of wine sent but we sent it back.  Thank you very much but we dont want wine...we just want good and respectful service, we were paying more than USD 1000,00 per night and we expected a totally different experience.

I have to acknowledge Mr Gomez and Ms Renne’s effort but that is not enough.  Everything was an issue but the guy who threw the boxes at us....he was the worst and 100% unacceptable for a hotel of this level.

We are going back to NYC next week and we didnt even consider going back to this hotel....we wont be back and we dont recommend anybody to stay there.  Good effort of Mr Gomez and Ms Renne but it needs more....

A pity because the location is amazing...never more.

title: Beautiful, Historical and Awesome/ a NYC MUST!!!
text: We ate at the bar in the Gold Room to kick off 2020.  We shared the bacon pizza and the fish and chips.  They were both perfect to share and very tasty!  I had a dirty martini and my daughter had the espresso martini.  Both flawless.  The room is so incredibly cool and gorgeous; so we started to talk to the bartender, Jose, about the history of the Palace. He was very knowledgeable about the hotel (mansion) and its history.  He really loves it there and you can tell as he has researched and even met one of the relatives of the original owner/creator of this magnificent landmark.  He showed us and 2 other couples the original dining room and sitting room as well.  They were amazing!!!!   My daughter was blown away and said it was one of the best things she did during her visit to NYC.  I highly recommend a visit to the Gold Room if only for a cocktail, but the food is small plates (and just what I love).  It’s so special.  And, if you meet Jose while there, ask him to fill you in on the history.  You will be so happy you went!!!!

title: Magical Wedding Stay Experience
text: Let me start off by saying WOW!  This hotel exceeded all of our expectations.  For our daughter's wedding, we researched dozens of hotels on the east side and chose the Lotte NY Palace who gave us the best rates for our 50+ out-of-town guests and delivered on a beautiful bridal suite for the bride and her bridesmaids to get ready in.  Our representative was Kristen and she was magnificent with every detail.  Friendly accommodating, organized and professional, Kristen made our experience six-star.  No issue was too minor and she was on top of it all.  The hotel is gorgeous and the rooms are large for Manhattan standards.  Every one of our guests commented on how great the Palace was and I couldn't agree more!

title: Simply wonderful
text: Couldn’t speak highly enough about this hotel . Stayed over the Christmas period and the festive decorations didn’t disappoint.our room was large for New York a little dated but was clean and beds and pillows were very comfortable. Night room service for food and drinks were good but a bit on pricey side but after arriving late from uk was worth it . Good size shower room with good shower pressure. Staff were friendly ,there was a problem booking in with our room but this was resolved quickly. Your in walking distance of most attractions and not to far from subway. I would highly recommend and would book in a heartbeat to return to this hotel .

title: Fantastic Stay and Location
text: Loved this hotel. Loved the location. Large rooms for under $200/night with St Patrick Cathedral view. Was on 37th floor and could see the cathedral, Radio City sign and Christmas Tree at Rockefeller Center. Check in and check out was seamless. Pleasant walk to Times Square for shows. Short walk to Grand Central Station. Only downside:  Bakery on site closes by 6 pm so cannot grab something after show. Also, bakery staff was grumpy as in hurry to get home so not helpful. They do have 24 hr room service but pricey. Also toilet paper a bit thin and rough for such a nice hotel. All other Staff was wonderful!  I will definitely be back.

title: Simply the Best!
text: Rebecca made our stay the most memorable time we have spent in NY. The hotel accommodations were over the top and the staff was excellent. My family was treated as if we were the most important guests there. We will definitely be returning!

title: FANTASTIC HOTEL
text:
Fantastic Hotel 
 "Located on a prime location, just off 5th Avenue. 
Our spacious room had a view of St. Patricks Cathedral, top. (10th floor, front) 
Staff very friendly and helpful; restaurant very good. Absolute must.

title: Great hotel
text:
Myself and my family have just arrived back from a fantastic trip to NYC! After an 8 hr flight and 2 hrs in a que for customs with a 2yr old we finally arrived at Lotte Palace. 1st impressions were stunning, the Christmas tree and decorations were magical, the lobby even smelled of real Christmas trees with festive music playing. All the door staff, reception staff and bell boys were so friendly and helpful paying extra attention to my little girl, she loved it,offering advise (And directions) every morning before we left. After our 1st night my partner had an unsettled sleep due to an outside air conditioning unit so we asked to change rooms, after ringing reception we were quickly told it wouldn't be a problem and could change that afternoon. Myles the assistant manager couldn't be more helpful and attentive, he personally helped us collect our cases and toddler cot to our new room. He was so polite and friendly we really appreciated him going that extra length to make sure our stay was as comfortable as possible. I would also recommended a drink in the lounge bar, so cosy with yummy cocktails and happy to make cocktails not on the menu.
We will definitely return to this hotel in the future when we next visit Manhattan.
Also- must try Park Cafe 57th on 7th for an authentic American breakfast. 
Missing NYC already.

title: Perfect Hotel in Midtown
text:
The location of the hotel is perfect. Many sights can be reached in a few minutes on foot.

The rooms are in a very good condition and very clean.

Air conditioning or heating was a bit loud. But one soon got used to it.

Very friendly staff and always kind and helpful.

title: Perfetto!
text:
Struttura perfetta, centrale ma leggermente defilata dall'assordante Midtown. Accolti da un cortile meraviglioso e riccamente addobbato.
La camera al 28esimo piano con vista mozzafiato sulla cattedrale e sul Rockfeller Center e' ampia, curata, ben arredata.
Servizio eccellente, personale disponibile e soddisfare ogni richiesta in brevissimo tempo.
Ristorante per la colazione (Villard) curatissimo e con ottimo menu ma con prezzi decisamente spropositati. In alternativa c'e' una bakery interna molto buona.
Nel complesso promosso a pieni voti, non delude assolutamente anche le piu' alte aspettative.

title: Exceptional
text:
This hotel is excellent set in the heart of New York, a fantastic location, 2  minute walk from 5th Avenue and Top Of The Rock. 10 minutes from Central Park. 
The young manager Miles was fabulous and nothing was to much trouble he is an absolute gem.

title: Dads special birthday
