text: From the moment we arrived we were thrilled,every picture we could imagine of NYC at Christmas was here at the lotte palace,the tree outside,the trees and decor inside,the music and the lovely buzz of people checking in at Christmas was fantastic. Then we went to our beautiful room with the most amazing view of st Patricks and surrounding skyscrapers,we had to pinch ourselves!bar was beautiful, lounge gorgeous, staff lovely ,a super experience made all the better by spending with family,we hope to be back and thanks to alice and rob for an amazing time.

title: Belated honeymoon
text: Beautiful hotel with gorgeous rooms.immaculate throughout.perfect for times square and broadway. Christmas trees are fantastic inside and outside.all staff were lovely and helpful.view of cathedral was a real wow from our room window.just perfect!

title: Amazing Hotel will definitely return
text:
We arrived on Boxing Day as a treat for our daughters 21st birthday.  There was an issue with our room, which technically wasn't down to the hotel.  However, as we had paid for a Cathedral View room we expected a little more.  Nancy, one of the managers was more than accommodating and couldn't apologise enough.  To this end, she ensured that when our room was ready we weren't waiting around for our luggage and made sure that our luggage was in our room the next day by bringing this up herself.
For our daughters 21st Julia in Guest Experience made sure that the room was perfect by delivering a cake, bottle of champagne and decorating the room above what we expected.
Maurice, such a lovely guy gave our daughter a Gossip Girl Tour and was always there with a welcoming smile, as was Nana one of the doormen.
Definitely book a cathedral view room - ours had the Cathedral and the Rockefeller Center.  The hotel is in a great location in Midtown.
Lotte Palace we will definitely return.

title: Christmas at Lotte New York Palace
text:
20th to 27th December 2019
Fantastic place for my family to spend Christmas, the hotel was as described in our brochure. Service was excellent we were even supplied with a complimentary small fridge for the room during our stay. Our room 1825 with 2 double beds had excellent  views overlooking St Patricks cathedral and the famous Lotte Palace Christmas tree!
Perfect location for visiting all the sights, Rockefeller centre 3 minutes walk, Empire State 5 minutes walk and central Park 11 minutes walk. Eateries on every corner.
If you are contemplating a visit to New York at any time I would thoroughly recommend the Lotte New York Palace. A beautiful hotel perfectly situated for exploring New York!

title: Lost in New York
text:
Myself and my husbands favourite time of the year is Christmas, so we decided to see in the new decade in a city that we got engaged in and that is very close to our hearts ‘New York’. 

We looked at all the possible hotels and came across the Lotte New York Palace. Known for its magical Christmas decorations we had to book here. 

Travelling on the 27 December from Heathrow right up until the point we saw the amazing Christmas Tree in the court yard of the Lotte we were on cloud 9 and extremely excited to begin an amazing week in the Big Apple. After taking a few photos of the tree we made our way to the reception to check in. 

Pop... our bubble was quickly burst. Our reservation had been cancelled by the company Amoma who we booked our stay with. We booked late June and paid for a 5 nights in stay in full. Amoma went bust in September when they kindly cancelled our reservation with the hotel but did not have the common courtesy to inform us, the paying customer, that they could not honour our reservation. We found at after a very long day of travelling when we tried to check in.

This apparently was not the first experience the Lotte had encountered but this did not help us at 11pm on the 27 December in what is the busiest time in the city. 

This is where a little Christmas spirit happened. The reception staff at the Lotte offered us a room with a view of the cathedral for a discounted rate for the night and promised that although they were more than fully booked they would do their upmost to try and accommodate us for the rest of the stay. Whilst this was not ideal not knowing if we would have a room for the rest of our stay at least we had a room for the night. 

Before going to bed that evening my husband and I decided to go and view the Rockefeller Christmas tree to try and cheer us up before a very tearful and sleepless night on my part. 

We woke on 28 December not knowing if a room would be available to us so my husband went down to reception and the reception staff and manager could not have been more helpful. They had managed to secure a room for us for the remainder of our stay and whilst it was not with the view of the cathedral it was very cosy and comfortable. 

I love New York and it could have so quickly become a place that would have left a bad taste in my mouth due to the selfish and inconsiderate company Amoma. They are a disgrace and should be ashamed that they have no doubt ruined many holidays.

They however did not succeed in spoiling this magical adventure we went on, but this certainly wouldn’t have happened without the excellent staff at the Lotte. 

My husband and I have enjoyed the most amazing Christmas and new year in New York and it was great to know that the Lotte hotel had helped to make what could have been the worst vacation ever the best and we have nothing but good things to say about the Lotte team. The General Manger Becky Hubbard  heard of our bad start to our holiday so arranged for some nice treats to be sent to the room which were very well received. 

The staff have certainly restored my faith in humanity and I can say that we will certainly be back. Happy New Year to all at the Lotte New York Palace.

title: The Greatest
text: We enjoyed everything about the hotel. It was full of Christmas, from the sights and sounds to the scents. Perfect place to stay to expensive NYC at Christmas. We will definitely stay there again, can’t wait to return.

title: Still A Great ‘Home away from Home’!
text: Have stayed here on several occasions when the hotel was The New York Palace, and this was my first time staying since being The Lotte New York Palace, and it is still a great place to stay when in Manhattan. Service has always been a strong point here, and am pleased to say it still is, first and foremost.  From the bell person, reception, concierge, housekeeping, you are always greeted with a smile, eye contact, and general courtesies. Rooms are spacious (this stay was in a corner room overlooking St. Patrick’s Cathedral and 51st St.), very quiet, sparkling clean, and have windows that open for fresh air. Room service is efficient and the food is great (had breakfast a few days), and I do not know how they manage to do it, but the food is hot, including the toast! Location is ideal to walk just about anywhere, and the front desk team are quick to hand out umbrellas when it is raining; subways, buses, Grand Central, Times Square, St. Pat’s, Rockefeller Center, Fifth Ave. Shops, Central Park, Time Warner Center, Museum Mile, is all within walking distance of the hotel. What else can I say, except, I’ll be back, yet again, and looking forward to it!,

title: Excellent Service
text: Had such an amazing experience as always! Special thanks to Clara Law, member of the Palace Towers Concierge, for always ensuring that we have everything we need from complimentary chocolates and plenty of water in order to have the most enjoyable stay!! Thank you so much Clara!

title: Tour with Maurice
text: We stopped at Lotte New York Palace to check it out as a possible venue, and had the great pleasure of touring the facility with Maurice. He was an excellent tour guide, and we are very excited at the prospect of having our event at the Lotte New York Palace.

title: Best trip to NY ever!
text: Excellent room on the 33rd fl with Cathedral view and NY skyline. Elegant and clean. Breakfast at the Villard is a must. Best place to stay for winter holidays. Staff extremely friendly. Many thanks to Denise, the front desk receptionist for giving us this awesome room!

title: Até sangue no lençol
text:
O pior atendimento ! 
O check in foi a maior confusão. O atendente não sabia a diferença entre as pessoas...
Depois veio o serviço de quarto.
Fora a falta de toalha - que vc só percebe quando sai do banho, aconteceu um fato que demonstra a falta de cuidados.
Por causa da climatização do quarto, a famosa calefação, meu nariz fica muito seco e machucado, o que ocasiona sangramento.
Pois durante a noite eu espirrei e meu nariz sangrou no lençol da cama... 
Para minha surpresa, 02 dias depois o lençol da cama continuava lá , com o meu sangue no lençol que não foi trocado.
O que não eles não fazem? Fica o questionamento. #lotte #nuncamais

title: amazing Christmas experience
text:
Arrived on the 22nd December for the week over Christmas.  Despite a lengthy wait in reception our room wasn't ready (it was now 4pm and we had flown over from Edinburgh so feeling a bit tired)  I didn't need to say anything Caroline fully understood my frustration.  Off she went and came back with the words i like to hear "I have got you a fantastic room overlooking St Patricks". Boy was it a great room with an amazing views.
We tried to book breakfast for Christmas day but unfortunately despite attempts online and by the concierge we couldn't so went on Xmas eve instead.
Atmosphere and service are great but be prepared for a mighty bill if you get carried away like we did!

Only downside from the whole trip for us was the lack of something or somewhere special to go on Xmas day itself for dinner etc but we found a great Italian a short walk away which made us very welcome.

The reception team put up with some difficult customers, What i have noticed after many years of staying in the best hotels is that those that shout dont actually get. Be patient, enjoy the hotel and its staff and those inline with you. You never know you may find some new lifelong friends as a result.

title: Clara  Law
text: We visit the New York Palace every year.  It has become our home away from home at Christmas time.  Decorated  beautifully, and located conveniently to just about everything, we continue to return year after year and are never disappointed.  Clara Law makes our trip extra special every time we visit.  She is so welcoming and accommodating    We are grateful for her taking such good care of us every single year.  She is very much a part of the reason that we return to the palace.   Thank you Clara!

title: Perfect Christmas Getaway
text: We had an amazing stay the week of December 15th. Everything was excellent from check in to check out. The staff went above and beyond and were very responsive to requests. Maurice was amazing and we will never forget his helpfulness and ready smile from the first moment we arrived and Bella was so helpful in arranging a surprise for my daughters.The hotel was so beautifully decorated, simply stunning and our room was beautiful and very spacious. The cathedral view was gorgeous. We had drinks in Troubles Trust and the Gold Room and both were excellent. Pomme Palais had excellent coffee and pastries as well. I cannot wait to return to this beautiful hotel, it was perfect in every way!

title: Wonderful stay, cathedral View
text:
We stayed here over Christmas, the Catherdral view room was outstanding!  Our room was very large and decorated beaufifully.  The courtyard and lobby are decorated so pretty. Great spot for picture taking.
The hotel is located a block from Radio City and Rockefellar Center and accross from St. Patrick's Cathedral.
Great location.

title: Festive Holiday
text: Service and personnel were stellar. Holiday decorations were lovely and the room was large and comfortable. We loved the location. The staff were always promptly responsive to any of our needs (a roll away bed, extra shampoos, etc.) Even during a very busy week, the service was on point!

title: Beautiful hotel, very Christmassy
text:
We visited the Lotte New York Palace for 4 nights mid December, in a Cathedral View Room. The room was very spacious for New York and well equipped. The staff were all very friendly and check in was a breeze as it was very quiet. The beds are huge and very comfortable, shower pressure is great. The hotel itself is geared up for Christmas with trees and decorations in abundance!!
The only negative, and that’s only a slight negative, is that the WiFi does not keep you logged in so every time you want to use it, you need to log in. 
All in all, a great place to stay!

title: Wouldn't stay here again.
text:
First, the check in.   They knew how many people were expected on the Sunday before Christmas. but instead of staffing up for the mass of people - the lobby had about 500 people in line -  there were exactly 2 reservation agents at the desk.   It took forever.  Our complaint brought us a $200 credit to be used in the hotel....that's not really compensating us for the major inconvenience, is it!    
Second, the room.   It was a very nice room, spacious, fine.   But, there was no coffee service - so you have to get dressed to go get your coffee.  The extra "blanket" there was was good for nothing.  And no ice machine on the floor, you have to call room service.  It's free, but it's annoying to have to do that. 
Third, the restaurants.   There are about 5 of them.   But not one serves a dinner menu....one is sweets, one is "rare wine" tasting.  The only place to use the $200 we got was the restaurant that had "small plates."    Night one, it was fine (charcuterie & cheese plates.).   Night two, not so much.   The cod was supposed to come with a fish roe.  It was not in sight.  When asked, the waiter said it was "sprinkled on top."   No, it wasn't.   So they charge you $30 or so for a dish in which they do not include all of the stated ingredients.   Does that make you feel like you're being cheated a little?   Of course you are....roe is expensive, put it on the menu, don't serve it, nobody will notice.  It happens a lot, not just here.   I would not return to this hotel again ....there are too many other places in NY that might do a better job of remembering they supposed to be serving clients, not just making money.  They deserve a chance!

title: Sad to say never again
text: I have been a travel agent for 20+ years. I have booked this hotel and stayed at this hotel myself many many times and have loved it. I booked my father- in -law through AA Vacations for a tower room. Booked and paid for in full. My father in law and his wife show up today and there is no tower room for him even with documentation and a confo number. They were  there trying to check in for 2 hours. No rooms in the tower. Finally put in a cathedral room . They were treated poorly and would not help at all at check in.When staying at a luxury hotel and having paid in full you would expect the hotel to bend over backwards to try to help. No the hotel check in was more aggravated that anything that they were there at 1pm trying to check in and were told so. There is 2 hours of info I could write about this but in short I will not be staying or booking others here again. I will  also be following up on this. I hate this because it was a good hotel but it is hard to get through what has gone on today. I will be spreading the word and from what I have read this has happened a lot to others. What a shame.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
We stayed for a long weekend week before Christmas, hotel is lovely have stayed there 4 times now, excellent location. 
Beautiful Christmas decorations. Standard room can be small for 4 people beds are a bit small.  Hotel is really busy this time of year. Would recommend this hotel as it is in a good location.

title: Simply amazing!
text: Stayed here for the third time before Christmas and would not want to stay anywhere else, it is so impressive. The hotel is stunning, especially at Christmas time as it is decorated so beautifully. We felt so privileged to be staying in such an amazing place. The location could not be better. The Bell Desk staff are fantastic, especially ?Mike (from Long Island) who we see each year, he’s a gem. The staff had made it so special and unforgettable for one of our party for her 50th birthday. I cannot wait to return -Christmas is the Lotte New York Palace.

title: Εξαιρετική επιλογή στο κέντρο του Μανχάτταν
text: Μείναμε 6 βραδιές με τα παιδιά μας και ήταν όλα καταπληκτικά. Πολύ καλό σημείο όπου μπορείς με τα πόδια να κινηθείς σε όλη την περιοχή. Έχει πολύ κοντά καταστήματα καφέ εστιατόρια. Και μέσα στο ξενοδοχείο έχει πράγματα που μπορείς να κάνεις.

title: Christmas Perfection
text: Loved our stay. Perfect location for seeing Holiday windows, Rockefeller Christmas Tree, Radio City Music Hall and Central Park. Getting taxis and Uber are a struggle in the evening since the roads are closed so plan ahead. The staff here was always helpful and pleasant.

title: Employees that Care
text: We can’t say enough about the special people working at this hotel. Juliete is the best concierge I have ever met!!  We travel so much, and she took more time and had so much patience with me as she developed a plan for my family to see all the sights we wanted to hit. She wrote all the subway info, places to eat, made the reservations, recommended best activities for my kids and so much more. She was absolutely lovely!!  We also adored Danny, from security, who helped us when our 9 year got sick late one night. Truly a good man. And our amazing waiter Nicola!!  We would like to take him home with us!  He treated our family like part of his family. It’s wonderful to find such caring people right here in our “home” for the week. Thank you. ❤️

title: Another celebratory trip to the Lotte Palace
text: We must commend several employees of the Lotte Palace family.  Kal, Concierge, is such a warm, smart, gentle man.  He is always so willing to assist guests with anything they need and any reservations.  Madeleine Davis is so accommodating and professional and then there's George the Doorman who is the happiest,best cab caller the Lotte has.  He is ALWAYS right there ready to help all guests.  He makes sure the cab drivers or car service drivers know exactly where the guests are going and he's always happy and gracious.  These people help make our by-yearly trip to the Lotte Palace nice every year.

title: Especially magical in December
text: I've stayed at the Palace several time and have always had positive experiences.  I love the location, the views, and just the feel of this hotel.  In December, I brought my 7 year old for his first trip to NYC.  We couldn't have stayed in a better, more magical location.  There were beautiful decorations everywhere and even a hot coco bar.   They have a  mailbox for Santa which we loved using and the courtyard tree is stunning.   Every person woking there seemed to go out of their way to make sure our visit was perfect.  When it was time to leave, my little guy became tearful and the man handling our bags magically made an apple appear for him and then brought him a cookie!   We left on cloud 9 and I look forward to many return visits.

title: 5th Christmas at the hotel
text: Wonderful stay for Christmas. Paul in reception was very friendly and very welcoming. Staff in lobby also welcoming especially George.The room was spotless and beds comfortable. The Pomme Palais has fantastic pastries for in-between noshing ( especially the strawberry tart).We look forward to coming back next Christmas.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Poor Customer Service
text:
We made reservations for this location back in March and made our final payment on 10/18/19.  I have all of the documentation for this as I was also the agent that booked everything through Apple Leisure Group/Funjet Vacations.  I also received notification on 11/19/2019 that this location was undergoing some construction that would be occurring during our stay.  I will be attaching photos of all of this.  
We arrived around 5 pm on 12/20 to be informed that they did not have our reservation.  I presented them with all of this documentation and was informed there was no reservation but we could book a room for $495 a night until it was resolved.  When we booked the room we paid $300 a night.  I stood in the lobby of this hotel for an hour and a half with 3 kids while getting this resolved, with no help from the hotel that had already taken my money.  Once I was able to get someone on the phone with Apple Leisure Group it was resolved within 10 minutes.  I was later informed that the gentleman that I spoke with, spoke with the manager Louis, and he was supposed to speak with me about compensation for my troubles.  This never happened.  
I later heard from people that live in the city that this is a common problem with “losing” reservations during the holidays so they can make more money on their rooms.  I don’t know if this was the case but it sure seemed like it.  I never felt welcomed at all by the staff in this hotel, except for one person named George, every other person appeared fake and uninterested in their job.  The building itself is beautiful and breathtaking, but the staff is not up to par with the building.

title: Not a great start
text:
Arrived yesterday and seemed to get the most miserable lady on reception, very unfriendly, never cracked a smile and when I asked her if our room had a view of St Patrick’s Cathedral she said “no, if you go outside you’ll see it!”.  We have a room which faces a wall, very disappointing. 
In complete contrast a lovely friendly man called Henry took our bags to our room and gave our daughters a teddy bear each. He couldn’t have been more friendly and helpful, we will definitely seek him out for local area advice. 
It’s our 20th wedding anniversary holiday which I had emailed the hotel about so was hoping we may have been given a nicer room or given the option to upgrade for a cost which I would have paid but miss frosty reception lady didn’t mention it and she was too unapproachable for me to ask. 
On the whole a very disappointing start, i shall do a full review at the end of our stay.

title: Wonderful Experience
text:
What a special experience at The Lotte New York Palace - we will be back x  The Christmas decorations were magical - we loved the MB
advent calendar too.  Staff were incredibly helpful. Highly recommend this hotel !

title: AMAZING!!!!!!!!!
text: As soon as I drove into the valet, I was greeted with beautiful smiles!  As I walked from the valet to the lobby, this place was amazing!!!!  I was so surprised at how everyone was so happy to help me!  The hotel has a feel of excellence.  We had a gorgeous room with a magnificent view of New York city!  We also had a chance to visit the bar for drinks and good conversation with other parties that were staying there.  We enjoyed our weekend stay and will definitely come back!!

title: Christmas in New York
text: Lotte New York Palace is beautifully decorated for Christmas, but was very busy with it being used for Christmas parties.  We had a suite on the 33rd floor and also a king room.  The king was a good size with a huge bed.  The suite for 4 had 2 very small double beds, the room was quite dated.  No coffee/tea making facilities, the bathroom was tiny and the bath with a shower over it had a shower curtain allowing water to go everywhere when showering.  Not ideal in what was suppose to be a 5* hotel.  The food was very expensive and average.  But the staff were helpful and welcoming.  Unfortunately we had items go missing from our room which still hasn't been remedied, which left a bad taste.  But aside from that, the hotel was beautifully decorated for christmas, just a shame the bedroom decor was very dated, but having a view over towards Rockefeller and overlooking St Patricks Cathedral was stunning.  The hotel is also very central to all the sights and shops.

title: INCREDIBLE stay at the Towers
text: The best hotel in NY. Our maid Jenny B. was top of the line, kind, and meticulous. The staff here was so warm and welcoming, it was the perfect holiday stay. Close to everything! The food, the rooms the views were impeccable. I would definitely recommend to anyone needing to stay in the area. A new holiday tradition for our family!

title: New York
text: Fabulous as always.  Super comfy bed, wonderful service, beautiful decorations.  Have stated about 5 times now and have enjoyed each as much.  Great location!  Best spot to stay in nyc.  Concierge very helpful and great service all around

title: Not up to scratch
text:
Booked through Expedia as the hotel
Has lots of good reviews. 

On the positives, it’s in a great position and the tree is nice.

However.

Queued for the best part of an hour to check in, got to the room which more three star. The bathroom is antique and the air con sounds like a 1930s car.

Asked to move and have been quoted $170 to move to the towers which “is our luxury hotel”. No tea or coffee making stuff, worst WiFi in the world and am looking at another $700 to make our stay what we expected from the Expedia photos.

More to
Follow.

title: One of NY City's Finiest!!
text: When visiting NY City we ALWAYS try to book this hotel exclusively, especially since the Waldorf closed.  It has become our favorite.  The staff is very accomodating, the room views showcase the city very well !  The hotel is first class;  from the arrival and working with valet parking to the front desk check in procedure and it carry's all the way to the superb house keeping staff! You will never be disappointed with the location and these accomodations!  It is, HOWEVER, quite expensive around Christmas.  Better time to travel AFTER the holidays!

title: Perfect Location
text: When you're a 60 second walk to Saks and about the same amount of time to 5th avenue, you can't go wrong. The Lotte Palace is big, busy, and perfectly located. It was a visit right before Christmas so the place was decked out and the staff were very good. My room overlooking St Patrick's Cathedral was big and clean, although the mini-bar never got re-filled in the 5 days I was there. Definitely a central location.

title: Average
text:
Well let’s start with the positives! Fab location and beautiful Christmas decorations and the room was clean and spacious. Lovely cake lady in the room for my birthday!
Negatives $16 for WiFi. No tea or coffee making facilities in room so for $20 I ordered a kettle to make tea and asked for 4 cups I got 2 and 3 teabags and no milk! As reception was always busy I bought my own milk and we paid the extortionate price for the coke in the mini bar to make space for my milk! So imagine my horror when I got back the following day to find the maid had left my bottle of milk on the side to go off and had filled the mini bar and also took away the cups so I could have no tea! Wouldn’t common sense prevail that the milk was in the min bar fridge for a reason?
Another thing that annoyed me is that the WiFi was free in reception so for all the people just coming in off the streets to view the Xmas trees they could use free WiFi to upload there pics to instagram FB etc and us fee paying guests have to pay $16 a day!!!! Unfortunately I really don’t think there are enough staff to accommodate how busy this hotel is at this time of year and it was busy! There was no real personal service and that was because there were very few staff around to offer that!

title: What a great hotel.
text:
Brilliant location in the heart of New York. Cathedral room view is a must as it affords a city view which I suspect is unparalleled in the town. Great staff .. very attentive 
We cannot fault the Lotte palace. Don’t hesitate book it up you’ll be happy.

title: Perfect NYC Christmas Stay!
text: The stay at the Lotte was the icing on the cake to our Christmas vacation in NYC. All staff was friendly and helpful, everything was beautifully decorated and the room was much more spacious than I expected!

title: Arrival Day for Seven Day Stay
text: Hour plus check in. Recommended we should get something to eat and return. Hour plus check-in two hours later. Six check-in stations, two or three manned with staff walking off regularly with a long line of customers.. Explanation? We're completely booked. Well I guess they might have known that ahead of time. Asked for compensation and was offered free internet. We'll see. More later

title: Perfect Location, Beautiful Hotel
text: I stayed her for four nights with my family. The hotel is in a perfect location, which makes it so easy to walk all around Manhattan.  The lobby was extremely festive, and Christmas decorations were beautiful. The service was very friendly and attentive.  The rooms were a decent size for a New York hotel, although the decor is a little bit dated.  The WiFi was abyssal though, and very frustrating, given what we were paying.  Other than that, we loved this hotel, and we will likely come back.

title: A five star hotel with one star service
text: Booked online.  Given a room where the external air conditioning was so loud that we couldn’t sleep.  Phoned and then visited reception and told to come back the next afternoon to change rooms at which point I was greeted with a one hour check in queue.  Totally unprofessional and absolutely not what anyone would expect from a 5 star hotel

title: Personal
text:
Awful personal service. You pay more for the Towers and expect more. No service at the desk when you comeback late at night and want to ask for late checkout. Then when you call in the morning they deny request for a one hour delay in checkout!  Really!  Not trying to make you feel welcome or special. Takes for ever to get car into valet parking. And they charge $85 each night!

Never staying here again!!

title: Excellent
text: The room was great and the staff overall was excellent. The concierge referred us to a less than stellar Thai restaurant but maybe he didn’t know their health rating was “pending”. This is the perfect place to stay if you don’t want to spend a fortune on taxis. Everything was within walking distance....Broadway, Times Square, Grand Central, 5th Avenue all within walking distance!

title: Best experience ever
text: If you have the chance you MUST stay in this hotel. Absolutely excellent. It’s a stunning hotel with amazing staff and service, I have not seen or experienced anything like it before. Located across the street from the beautiful St. Patrick’s Cathedral, I recommend a cathedral view room, it was perfect. I could not have asked for anything more. If you have a chance check out Troubles Trust, The Gold Room & Pomme Palais in the hotel, you won’t regret it.

title: Great place to stay for the family
text: Great place, staff was friendly. Room was very clean. Convenient location close enough to Times Square and Rockefeller Center but a bit off the path therefore you didn’t seem in the middle of all the hustle and bustle.

title: Christmas 2019
text: First night the shower was clogged and the toilet didn’t flush well. When reported the next day, it was fixed. The food in the restaurant wasn’t worth the money we paid: burnt toast, small omelettes, and had to pour our own “to go” coffee. And the tip was added to the bill without our consent

title: Great location, huge rooms, a little tired...
text:
The location of this hotel is really outstanding. If you need to be in midtown and at a distance from the madness of Times Square, this is a great option. 

I think the rooms are a little tired, but they are so large that it makes up for the look. I’d love to see what the hotel will look like when the rooms get an upgrade.

Good gym, even while it was all under construction.

But time for new mattresses, modern bathrooms, and a chic update of the rooms. When that occurs, you will get a 5 Star!!

title: Nice hotel
text: The hotel was beautifully decorated and crowded with people, most likely because the visit was before Christmas.  Everything was positive EXCEPT for the price of the room, I would have expected soft, not starchy, towels.

title: All good but room service on night
text: All good but room service took 70 minutes and was overcooked one night.  I’ll be back.  It’s a great hotel always hope to give them 5 stars but at the price the meal should be on time and cooked right..

title: Recent stay
text: Hotel is beautiful and great location only issue was the mattress was old and sunk in and only two pillows.  Would have expected a better quality mattress and more pillows for an upscale hotel like this.

title: Christmas holiday
text:
I was hoping to make visiting the Lotte palace a family tradition but unfortunately I don't think we will be returning. We will start with reservations,  I specifically asked about joining rooms throughout the booking process and was told the hotel does not offer joining rooms!!
Last year we stayed in the towers overlooking the Cathedral and for some reason during my booking we ended up overlooking the Cathedral but not in the towers,  I tried discussing this while checking in but I guess they were to busy to care what I had to say!!

Reading reviews about families that were lucky enough to have this option I was somewhat confused. Do they or don't they? Next were the letters from Santa, we specifically put our little envelopes in the mailbox as we did last year but never responded 😢
We were all so excited to make this an amazing holiday and couldn't wait to walk back into the room and to see the response on everyone's face that Santa wrote to them.  I mentioned this to the front desk through a phone call and my response was...they must have had to many!!! Really ?If this is the case don't bother!! How do you pick and choose?
